description: To the Editor:

title: Amazon Absorbing Price Fight Punches
description: Books, we are told, are relics that have reached their sell-by date, put out by an industry that is a desiccated shell of its former self.

title: Amazon and a Mattel Unit Plan a Content Hub Focusing on Children
description: LOS ANGELES  Fireman Sam, a cartoon aimed at preschoolers, has long been a hit overseas. Now Mattel and Amazon are teaming up to sell the yellow-hatted hero to American children  a potentially controversial experiment that, if successful, could create a new model for marrying television shows with related merchandise.

title: Lee Chamberlin, Electric Company Actress, Dies at 76
description: Lee Chamberlin, an actress whose career took off when she joined Bill Cosby and Rita Moreno on the funky 1970s childrens show The Electric Company, died on May 25 in Chapel Hill, N.C. She was 76.

title: A Verdict on Budgets in Europe and Jobs Data in U.S.
description: EUROPEAN COMMISSION TO RULE ON STATE BUDGETS

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of June 2
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: The Vanishing Cry of Repeal It
description: It was supposed to be so easy this election year for Republican congressional candidates. All they would have to do was shout repeal Obamacare! and make a crack about government doctors and broken websites, and they could coast into office on a wave of public fury. The failure of the Affordable Care Act was simply assumed.

title: Emerging From the Shadows Cast Across a River
description: WEST MEMPHIS, Ark.  It takes little prodding to draw stories from Larry Manuel about how, before they were the subjects of films and supernatural sightings, Johnny Cash and Elvis Presley were just two musicians trying to make it along the Mississippi River.

title: Israel Warns Against Embracing Newly Reconciled Palestinian Government
description: JERUSALEM  Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel called on the international community on Sunday not to run to recognize the new Palestinian government scheduled to be sworn in Monday, saying it rests on Hamas, the militant Islamic faction that Israel and much of the West deem a terrorist organization.

title: With South Bronx Trail, a History and a Culture Will Be Clearly Marked
description: Casa Amadeo on Prospect Avenue, a Latin record store on the National Register of Historic Places, is perhaps the only place in the city where one can worship at a shrine dedicated to the Puerto Rican composer Rafael Hernndez.

title: Popular Demand
description: June arrives with a different Final Four, as the Miami Heat take on the San Antonio Spurs in the N.B.A. Finals  a rematch of 2013.

title: In GPS Battle, Russia Sets Restrictions of Its Own
description: MOSCOW  The deputy prime minister in charge of Russias space programs said Sunday that he had started to impose restrictions on Global Positioning System base stations here, as retribution for the refusal of the United States to allow similar base stations on American territory that would improve the accuracy of Russias navigation system.

title: On Inequality Denial
description: A while back I published an article titled The Rich, the Right, and the Facts, in which I described politically motivated efforts to deny the obvious  the sharp rise in U.S. inequality, especially at the very top of the income scale. It probably wont surprise you to hear that I found a lot of statistical malpractice in high places.

title: Ann B. Davis, 88, Dies; Comic Actress Played Maid on Brady Bunch
description: Ann B. Davis, the comic actress best known as the wistful, wisecracking live-in maid on the long-running ABC sitcom The Brady Bunch, died on Sunday in San Antonio. She was 88.

title: Lewis Katzs Vision for the New Jersey Nets Went Unrealized
description: In November 1999, Lewis Katz stood on a high school stage in New Jerseys largest city and told an audience of students, local politicians and a smiling President Bill Clinton, The New Jersey Nets are coming to Newark  remember that.

title: Bad Food in School Cafeterias
description: Republicans on a powerful House committee have balked at requiring all schools to serve healthy lunches in the coming school year. The action drew a well-deserved rebuke from the first lady, Michelle Obama, who has focused public attention on combating obesity among young people through exercise and better nutrition. Lets hope the Senate holds out against such inanity.

title: A Vote on Medical Marijuana
description: The New York State Assembly easily approved a law legalizing medical marijuana last Tuesday, and there appear to be enough votes to pass similar legislation in the State Senate if that chambers leaders agree to allow a vote. They ought to do so before the legislative session ends on June 19. The bills would make the drug available, under tight regulation, to patients who, in many cases, do not get relief from other medications.

title: As Antics Subside, Both Cuomo and the Left Claim the Last Hurrah
description: COLONIE, N.Y.  Weeks of intense negotiations between Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and an impatient, insurgent left resolved themselves shortly before midnight on Saturday in a stormy night of brinkmanship and shuttle diplomacy.

title: Encouragement (Sort of) About Press Freedom
description: UPDATE June 2, 2014: The Supreme Courton Mondaydeclined to hear the appealfrom James Risen, a reporter for The Times who has been ordered to testify in the criminal trial of aformer Central Intelligence Agency official.

title: Yes, All Men
description: As I drove my son back to college last week, where hell take a summer chemistry course, he said something that struck me: I believe its very important for everyone to be a feminist.

title: Insider-Trading Inquiry Could Rattle Icahns Efforts to Shape His Legacy
description: For decades, Carl C. Icahn has enjoyed the spotlight.

title: Scots Are Divided Over Independence, and Its Economic Costs
description: BEITH, Scotland  The case for tearing apart the United Kingdom was made on a recent evening at a community center in this small town near Glasgow. More than 200 people were packed into folding chairs and standing along walls lined with posters promoting an independent Scotland, like the one with the word Aye emblazoned on a Scottish flag. A disco ball hung overhead.

title: Pitching for Fun, and for a Future
description: EL PASO  It is early on a Wednesday afternoon, and most of the schoolchildren have been called to their buses. From his spot in right field  beneath the Woofdeck, close to the stand that sells nachos in a dog dish for $10  Jeff Francoeur has been roasting in the blistering desert heat.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for June 1, 2014
description: June 1, 2014

title: Trying to Reclaim Leadership on Climate Change
description: At the end of his first year in office, President Obama flew to Copenhagen and made a big promise: that the United States would cut its greenhouse gas emissions substantially by 2020  a bold and risky pledge that hinged on a balky Congress to make it possible. His efforts became bogged down within months, and Mr. Obamas pledge to the rest of the world soon looked like a pipe dream.

title: At Ukraines Perilous Border, Law Is Dispensed by Men in Masks
description: KRASNYY LUCH, Ukraine  Just over the bridge here, near a crumbling blue electric station, a white sign with plain blue letters informs travelers that they are about to enter foreign territory: Luhansk Peoples Republic, Independent State.

title: With Mixed Showing, U.S. Gives Its Coach a Win to Study
description: HARRISON, N.J.  Jurgen Klinsmann has been preparing for World Cups long enough to know not to show his hand two weeks before the opening game. Not to reporters, certainly. But not to his players, either. So he tinkers with his lineups and his tactics, and he generally keeps his opinions to himself.

title: Visitors Fault Sept. 11 Museums Portrayal of Islam
description: After the vivid audio recordings, diagrams and personal artifacts that take visitors minute by minute through the Sept. 11 attacks, and before the images of recovery workers combing through rubble, a small section of the National September 11 Memorial Museum is devoted to explaining Al Qaeda and terrorism.

title: Experience at Muirfield Helps a 22-Year-Old Win in a Playoff for His First PGA Title
description: DUBLIN, Ohio  It felt like October all over for Japans Hideki Matsuyama, who played the final round of the Memorial Tournament with Australias Adam Scott, his International team partner at last years Presidents Cup.

title: Census Records Shed a New Light on Some of the Mayors Forebears
description: Bill de Blasios mother was born in the house on East 17th Street in Manhattan. His grandmother, great-grandmother and other relatives lived there, too, at the start of the 20th century. Now, newly-digitized records from a 1905 New York State census have filled in some of the gaps in the congenial Italian heritage that he says grounded him, while his German-American father struggled with alcoholism and ultimately killed himself.

title: At Least 13 Are Wounded by Gunfire Across New York City
description: The victims were at outdoor celebrations or cookouts with friends. In one case, a teenager was wounded on a basketball court; two others were struck while walking together in memory of a 15-year-old killed by gunfire four years before.

title: Will the Kingdom Stay United?
description: In September, Scots will vote on whether Scotland will remain in Britain or become an independent nation.

title: Underdog Seeks Jump From Second to Spoiler
description: The horse does not look the part of one of the top 3-year-olds in the country. The trainer oversees only four horses, and his fortunes took such a horrible turn two winters ago that he had none to work with. The owner has a passion for racing but lacks a budget to match.

title: Rangers, Despite Odds, Have a Lot in Their Favor
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  The Rangers and the Los Angeles Kings have met twice in the playoffs since the Kings entered the N.H.L. in 1967, but they have never met in the Stanley Cup finals. That will change Wednesday when the finals begin in Los Angeles.

title: Before Brief, Deadly Spree, Trouble Since Age 8
description: LOS ANGELES  It was the summer of 1999, and the parents of Elliot O. Rodger were battling over the boys deep and puzzling psychological problems as they struggled through a divorce.

title: Etihad Nears Deal for a Stake in Alitalia
description: PARIS  After more than five months of negotiations, Etihad Airways of Abu Dhabi confirmed on Sunday that it was nearing an agreement that could lead to a sizable investment in Alitalia.

title: An Ideal Place, Except for All the Dead Bodies
description: There are little-known plays by well-known writers that, when once viewed, strike you as being unjustly, even criminally neglected. Eugene Ionescos The Killer is not one of them. Au contraire! This is the kind of rarity that theater aficionados may be eager to see until they have the misfortune of seeing it.

title: Womens Hats on a Harlem Bus
description: Dear Diary,

title: Countdown to 2014 World Cup in Brazil: Day 11
description: The 2014 World Cup begins on June 12, when Brazil plays Croatia in the opening match. Reporters and editors for The Times will count down to the start of the tournament each day with a short capsule of news and interesting tidbits.

title: Prisoner Trade Yields Rare View Into the Taliban
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The freeing of five senior Taliban figures in exchange for the American soldier, Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl, has offered both a rare insight into the insurgent groups inner workings and a diplomatic first in the long Afghan war: a negotiated agreement between the highest levels of the American government and the pinnacle of the Taliban command.

title: Trial Begins for Queens Democrat Charged With Bribery, Extortion and Fraud
description: Malcolm A. Smith wanted to be the mayor of New York City so badly that he, a Democratic Queens state senator and onetime Senate majority and minority leader, was willing to run as a Republican in a city where Democrats hold a 6-1 edge.

title: Next Move for Fisher: Coaching, or Maybe Politics
description: OKLAHOMA CITY  The first time Derek Fisher arrived in New York, in 1996, a wide-eyed rookie with the Los Angeles Lakers, he did not enjoy any of the citys restaurants, visit Central Park, take in any theater or hop to any clubs.

title: Planned Celebration for Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl Just Got a Whole Lot Bigger
description: HAILEY, Idaho  It looked as if it was going to be a big weekend here in the Wood River Valley in Central Idaho.

title: Panel to Create Plan to Reduce Number of Mentally Ill People in New York City Jails
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio has asked several of his commissioners and aides to provide him with a plan by September to reduce the rate of incarceration among New Yorkers with mental illness.

title: Drama Desk Embraces A Gentlemans Guide
description: The Broadway musical A Gentlemans Guide to Love & Murder led the trophy tally with seven on Sunday night at the Drama Desk Awards, which honor Broadway and Off Broadway productions. Gentlemans Guide, a strong contender in next weekends Tonys competition, won for outstanding musical, outstanding actor (Jefferson Mays), featured actress (Lauren Worsham), director (Darko Tresnjak), lyrics, book and projection design. Beautiful: The Carole King Musical followed with three awards, including for actress in a musical (Jessie Mueller as Carole King), sound design and featured actress (Anika Larsen, who tied with Ms. Worsham). Robert Schenkkans All the Way won for outstanding play and actor (Bryan Cranston as Lyndon B. Johnson), with other top awards for plays going to Audra McDonald (Lady Day at Emersons Bar & Grill) for best actress and Twelfth Night for outstanding revival and director (Tim Carroll). In the musical category, Hedwig and the Angry Inch took honors for outstanding revival and actor (Neil Patrick Harris as Hedwig, who shared the award with Mr. Mays). Featured acting awards went to Reed Birney (Casa Valentina), Celia Keenan-Bolger (The Glass Menagerie) and James Monroe Iglehart (Aladdin).

title: K.K.R. Shuts Stock Hedge Fund
description: Kohlberg Kravis Roberts made waves in the fall of 2010 when the investment giant poached a trading team from Goldman Sachs to set up a hedge fund focused on stock trading.

title: Is Global Warming Real? Most Americans Say Yes
description: The Obama administration announced new regulations Monday meant to reduce carbon emissions and combat climate change.

title: Major Malfunction: Revisiting Challenger
description: Thirty years ago, on Jan. 28, 1986, seven astronauts slipped the surly bonds of earth to touch the face of God. Americas space program was never the same.

title: Challenger, Columbia and the Nature of Calamity
description: They died as they slipped the surly bonds of Earth. The last words of that sentence, haunting words, were written by John Gillespie Magee Jr., an American airman and poet who enlisted in the Royal Canadian Air Force in 1940, before the United States entered World War II. He was killed the following year in a midair collision over England. He was all of 19.

title: Boy, 6, Dies After a Stabbing in Brooklyn
description: Mikayla Capers and her best friend, Prince Joshua Avitto, wanted to get Icees. The two hopped in an elevator on Sunday at the Brooklyn housing project where they lived. A man got on after them, pulled out a knife and stabbed the children, the police said, in an attack that left residents stunned.

title: With Ukraine Still Unsettled, Obama Sets Off to Soothe European Friends
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama leaves for Europe on Monday night cautiously optimistic that the crisis in Ukraine has turned a corner, but he will find himself face to face with President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia for the first time since the two squared off in a Cold-War-style showdown in Eastern Europe.

title: Halt and Catch Fire Recap: Can Geekiness Be Entertaining?
description: Season 1, Episode 1: The premiere of Halt and Catch Fire, which aired on Sunday on AMC, owes much to that long-ago first episode of Breaking Bad. A couple of mysterious, broody guys are drawn together against their better judgment. Together they set off on a scheme both hyper-technical and legally dubious, one that seems certain to tear apart everything else in their lives. And we get to witness their tricks through a parade of luscious, barely comprehensible montages.

title: Penny Dreadful Recap:  Blood and Gore Are so Entertaining
description: Season 1, Episode 4: Up until now, the Penny Dreadful recaps have focused on what just happened, not what may be around the fog-shrouded corner. But one plot point that has been hovering around the edges comes just shy of bursting to the surface in this episode, Demimonde, to the point where it cant really be ignored anymore. (As before, here lie spoilers galore.)

title: Kings Go the Distance, and Then Some, to Reach the Finals
description: CHICAGO  The Chicago Blackhawks, the defending Stanley Cup champions, won two straight games to force Sundays Game 7 on their home ice. A year ago, they sliced through the Los Angeles Kings in five games on this very stage, the Western Conference finals.

title: Player Ratings: U.S. 2, Turkey 1
description: The United States national team defeated Turkey on a sunny spring day at Red Bull Arena in Harrison, N.J., in its second exhibition game ahead of the 2014 World Cup in Brazil.

title: With New Palestinian Government Come Many Questions, and Some Answers
description: The new Palestinian government sworn in on Monday in the West Bank city of Ramallah, will be led by Prime Minister Rami Hamdallah and is to consist of 16 other ministers, some handling more than one portfolio. Four are from the Gaza Strip and were barred by Israel from attending the ceremony. The government grew out of a reconciliation pact signed between the Palestine Liberation Organization, dominated by the secular Fatah faction, and Hamas, the militant Islamic movement that has ruled Gaza since 2007.

title: New Therapies for Bowel Diseases
description: Decades ago, I met a surprisingly quiet, withdrawn young man. Surprising because I knew his bright, vibrant wife and wondered what had attracted her to him. He barely participated in conversations even at friendly family gatherings.

title: After Interruption, No Stopping Sharapova at French Open
description: PARIS  Maria Sharapova looked as if she might be bowing out of the French Open in the fourth round to Samantha Stosur  until she heard a call.

title: Study Examines Efficacy of Taxes on Sugary Drinks
description: A new study of how taxes might be used to curb consumption of sugary drinks suggests that applying a tax based on the amount of calories contained in a serving rather than its size would be more effective.

title: Word of the Day | annotate
description: annotate \a-n-tat\ verb

title: Quotation of the Day for Monday, June 2, 2014
description: I tell people its like a funnel. Youre at the small end of the funnel for so long, and then suddenly the world opens up. It takes time to get used to it.

title: Tales of Army Discord Show Tiananmen Square in a New Light
description: BEIJING  On a spring evening in 1989, with the student occupation of Tiananmen Square entering its second month and the Chinese leadership unnerved and divided, top army commanders were summoned to headquarters to pledge their support for the use of military force to quash the protests.

title: Whats On Monday
description: 8 P.M. (TCM) A HARD DAYS NIGHT (1964) When this film from the director Richard Lester had its debut, Bosley Crowther of The New York Times was astounded. I wouldnt believe it either, if I hadnt seen it with my own astonished eyes, he wrote of this first fiction film of the Beatles, adding that it has so much good humor going for it that it is awfully hard to resist. The film stars the Fab Four poking fun at Beatlemania in a plotline that takes viewers through the misadventures before a big show. And all the way through the picture, there are frenzied episodes of the Beatles encounters with squealing fans and with reporters who ask silly questions, all in a facile, witty vein, Mr. Crowther wrote. But more than this, its a fine conglomeration of madcap clowning in the old Marx Brothers style, and it is done with such a dazzling use of camera that it tickles the intellect and electrifies the nerves. Above, Mr. Lester at the train window with the Beatles.

title: Corrections: June 2, 2014
description: NEW YORK

title: Anger in China After McDonalds Patron Beaten to Death
description: The beating death of a woman in a McDonalds restaurant in eastern China has triggered widespread anger over the slow response of witnesses and condemnation of a fringe religious group that the police say influenced the attackers.

title: Chinas Solar Panel Production Comes at a Dirty Cost
description: Updated, 7:23 a.m. ET| Although China may be a cheaper place than Europe for producing solar panels, the savings come at a higher cost to the environment, a new study says.

title: Marathon Oil Sells Norwegian Unit for $2.1 Billion
description: LONDON  The exploration and production company Marathon Oil said on Monday that it would sell its North Sea oil business in Norway to a Norwegian oil producer for $2.1 billion in cash.

title: As Poles Focus on Belonging to Europe, Their Love for the U.S. Has Cooled a Bit
description: WARSAW  Poland is the most pro-American country in the world  including the United States, goes a quip, well known here, from an American foreign policy expert more than a decade ago.

title: Roche to Pay Up to $350 Million for DNA Sequencing Business
description: LONDON  Roche, the Swiss drug and health care diagnostics maker, said on Monday that it would pay as much as $350 million for Genia Technologies, a privately held DNA sequencing company.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Bowe Bergdahl, American Soldier, Freed by Taliban in Prisoner Trade
description: In Bowe Bergdahl, American Soldier, Freed by Taliban in Prisoner Trade, Eric Schmitt and Charlie Savage report on the release of the lone American prisoner of war from the Afghan conflict.

title: A River Changes Young Womens Photography, and Their Lives
description: Inge Morath grew overwhelmed with panic one day in 1958, as she was on the road to the source of one of Europes largest rivers, the Danube.

title: Are Your Parents Too Overprotective?
description: Do you feel your parents are always watching over you  worried you will get hurt or in trouble? When you were younger, did your parents give you free reign to explore the neighborhood or woods with your buddies  or did you always feel that you were on a short leash?

title: GlaxoSmithKline in $350 Million Cancer Drug Venture
description: LONDON  Adaptimmune, a biotechnology company, said on Monday that it had reached a deal that could be worth more than $350 million to develop an early stage cancer drug with the pharmaceutical maker GlaxoSmithKline.

title: A King Makes a Powerful Change, for Stability
description: MADRID  King Juan Carlos of Spain said Monday that he was abdicating in favor of Crown Prince Felipe, his 46-year-old son, explaining in an address to the nation that it was time for a new generation to move to the front line and face the countrys challenges.

title: Coal Comfort
description: I recently had a discussion with someone who felt disappointed in Obama; he had not, this person complained, lived up to the high hopes of his supporters. My response apparently came as a surprise: Im liking Obama more and more as he slogs through his second term.

title: Behind the Cover Story: Scott Anderson on the Lasting Pain of Conflict in Srebrenica
description: Scott Anderson, a war correspondent and novelist, wrote the June 1 cover story about life in Srebrenica, where genocide occurred during the breakup of Yugoslavia. Anderson is the author of the novel Moonlight Hotel and is working on a book about World War I. His last article for the magazine was about a man who killed his parents when he was 14.

title: For Bonds, This Time is Different
description: Bloomberg has an interesting piece on how high bond prices and low yields have been shocking investors who relied on old models. Some of this, I suspect, is because many people still  after all these years  havent wrapped their minds around the implications of a zero-lower=bound economy and the risks of a low-inflation trap.

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: Welcome to the Morning Briefing on NYT Now. (Download us for iPhone.)

title: New York Today: June Is for Hockey Heroes
description: Good morning on this fair Monday.

title: Separatists Attack a Border Guard Headquarters in Eastern Ukraine
description: DONETSK, Ukraine  Several hundred separatist fighters mounted a coordinated assault against a border guard headquarters in the eastern city of Luhansk on Monday, holding it under siege for more than 12 hours in what appeared to be an attempt to eliminate the strategic control center for the regions long and porous border with Russia.

title: Q. and A.: Chen Guang on the Soldiers Who Retook Tiananmen Square
description: In the spring of 1989, Chen Guang was a 17-year-old soldier with the 65th Group Army, which was instructed to clear student protesters from Tiananmen Square. The 65th Group Army, based north of Beijing in Hebei Province, made two attempts to enter the capital, the first on May 20 after the declaration of martial law. That attempt failed, after thousands of Beijing residents swarmed the streets and halted their convoy. The second, successful, attempt was on June 3, and Mr. Chen was among the first soldiers to make it past the blockades of protesters and enter the Great Hall of the People with thousands of weapons he had secretly transported on a public bus.

title: Celebration, and Lingering Tensions, as Indias 29th State Is Born
description: HYDERABAD, India  On Monday, the southern Indian state of Andhra Pradesh officially split in two, and Indias 29th state, Telangana, was born. Presidents rule  the interim government of united Andhra Pradesh  lifted in the new state, and the first popular government of Telangana came into power.

title: Pinpointing Another Reason That More Hispanics Are Identifying as White
description: Recently, I wrote about new research that showed that a net 1.2 million Hispanics changed their racial identification from some other race to white between the 2000 and 2010 censuses.

title: Calling an Ordinary Health Problem a Disease Leads to Bigger Problems
description: As any parent knows, babies spit up. Its gastroesophageal reflux, a pediatrician will explain  milk leaking backward from the stomach. When I was a pediatrics resident, my hospital constructed foam wedges for infants to sleep on. The thinking was that infants who were sleeping at an angle would be less likely to have milk come back up.

title: Japans Dai-ichi Life to Consider Investments in United States
description: LONDON  The Japanese insurer Dai-ichi Life said on Monday that it was considering investments in life insurance companies in the United States, but it declined to confirm media reports that it was weighing an acquisition of Protective Life of Alabama.

title: A Question of Family Ties Between G.E. and Alstom Law Firm
description: General Electric has faced a number of questions over its proposed takeover of most of the French energy giant Alstom.

title: What Were Reading
description: Recommended reads from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading is an exclusive benefit for home delivery and digital subscribers that is sent twice a week as an e-mail. Sign up

title: Gay Travel: Normalcy Becomes the Story
description: Monica Drake is the editor of the Travel section.

title: A Chief Executive Who Programs Turns in His Keyboard
description: As a first-time chief executive, I have come to realize that the best use of my time will always be a moving target. There is no such thing as an average day, and if my days are repetitive, Im probably not doing my job well.

title: Whats Going On in This Picture? | June 2, 2014
description: Updated: June 3

title: Brazilian Bank Predicts World Cup Winner
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  With soccers World Cup tournament fast approaching in Brazil, some big global investment banks have run analyses and made predictions on who will win.

title: Daily Report: At WWDC, Apple Expected to Expand Into Health and Home Monitoring
description: Apple is unlikely to introduce new devices this week, the things that most excite customers and investors these days. But the company is expected to dive deeper into two new areas: connected health and the so-called smart home, Brian X. Chen reports.

title: Ventas to Buy American Realty Capital Healthcare for $2.6 Billion
description: Ventas, the nations biggest health care real estate investment trust, said on Monday that it had agreed to acquire the American Realty Capital Healthcare Trust for $2.6 billion in stock and cash.

title: New System for Treating Cancer Seen as Hopeful
description: CHICAGO  Drugs that unleash the bodys immune system to combat tumors could allow patients with advanced melanoma to live far longer than ever before, researchers gathered at the nations largest cancer conference say.

title: In Our Pages: June 3
description: 1939: Roumanian Poll Brings Success

title: Morning Agenda: Big Names in Insider Trading Case
description: Federal authorities are said to be looking into a series of well-timed trades made by the golfer Phil Mickelson and the gambler William T. Walters, focusing on trading in Clorox and Dean Foods, DealBooks Matthew Goldstein and Ben Protess write. The authorities are also questioning what role, if any, the billionaire investor Carl C. Icahn might have had in sharing information about Clorox.

title: Starboard Urges Changes at MeadWestvaco
description: Updated, 12:14 p.m. |

title: Answers to Questions About the New Palestinian Government
description: As a new Palestinian government was sworn in on Monday, The Timess Jerusalem Bureau chief, Jodi Rudoren, answered readers questions. The transitional government of 17 ministers grew out of a unity pact reached in April between the Palestine Liberation Organization, which is dominated by the mainstream Fatah faction, and its rival Hamas, the Islamic militant group that has controlled the Gaza Strip since 2007. As Ms. Rudoren reported, the development has alarmed Israel and could prompt reactions from the European Union and the United States.

title: The News in Washington: Critics Respond to Carbon Emissions Plan
description: GoodMondaymorning from sunny Washington on what will be a big day on the environmental-policy front.

title: With Hope for Unity, Abbas Swears In a New Palestinian Government
description: RAMALLAH, West Bank  Declaring that a black page in history has been turned forever, President Mahmoud Abbas of the Palestinian Authority swore in a new government on Monday intended to reunite the West Bank and Gaza Strip after seven years of harsh political and social division.

title: Endurance Raises Bid for Aspen Insurance and Vows Proxy Fight
description: Updated, 5:01 p.m. |

title: The Find | Fit for a King
description: A new shopping site brings artisans with royal stamps of approval to the masses.

title: Mississippi Primary Fight Is One of Geography as Well as Ideology
description: For all of the Tea Partys struggles this year, it has a real chance to unseat an incumbent Republican in the Mississippi Republican primary Tuesday. Thad Cochran, the first Republican senator from Mississippi since Reconstruction, is facing a strong challenge from Chris McDaniel, a Tea Party-backed state senator.

title: Reflections on Lewis Katz, a Believer in Journalism
description: Lewis Katz, who died in a plane crash on Saturday night, was a reluctant newspaper owner  he came to the role late in life  but he was interested enough and dedicated enough to fight hard once he got involved.

title: Game of Thrones Recap: Mountain Meets Viper
description: Here be spoilers, like, immediately.

title: Taking Page From Health Care Act, Obama Climate Plan Relies on States
description: WASHINGTON  President Obamas new plan to fight climate change depends heavily on states devising individual approaches to meeting goals set in the nations capital, a strategy similar to the one he used to expand health care, often with rocky results.

title: 2 Private Equity Firms in Talks for Medical Device Maker
description: LONDON  Two private equity firms, Astorg Partners and Montagu Private Equity, have entered into exclusive talks to acquire the French medical device company Sebia, the companies said Monday.

title: Broadcom Explores Options for Its Baseband Business
description: Updated, 5:54 p.m. |

title: Supreme Court Rejects Appeal From Times Reporter Over Refusal to Identify Source
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Monday turned down an appeal from James Risen, a reporter for The New York Times facing jail for refusing to identify a confidential source.

title: Time to Bid for Lunch With Buffett
description: Warren E. Buffett is known for his generally modest lifestyle back home in Omaha. But it is that time of year when he asks for one of the most expensive lunches in the world.

title: New Goal for Emissions
description: Carbon emissions by country and a proposal to significantly cut U.S. levels by 2030.

title: E.U. Officials Urge France and Italy to Accelerate Economic Reforms
description: BRUSSELS  Top European Union officials on Monday warned France and Italy to do more to reform their economies to prevent a rerun of problems that fueled the regions debt crisis and nearly destroyed the euro currency union.

title: CFDA Show Spotlights Familiar Faces
description: What does it mean to be an American designer?

title: After Boy and Girl Are Stabbed, Anger Over a Lack of Cameras
description: The 7-year-old girl is hospitalized in critical condition, the only witness to a crime that so far defies explanation: A man stabbed two young children in the elevator of a public-housing project and escaped into the late-spring evening. Her best friend, a 6-year-old boy, is dead.

title: Podcast: Google Glass Operation
description: Googles new hands-free computer is finding its way into operating rooms.

title: Romanian Keeps Elevating Her Game and Her Confidence
description: PARIS  A year ago at the French Open, Simona Halep was ranked 57th and lost in the first round.

title: No Easy Way to Be Fair on Media Credentials
description: WASHINGTON  Scotusblog has covered the Supreme Court in depth and with distinction since 2002. It wins journalism awards at a steady clip. Its main reporter, Lyle Denniston, is an old-school journalist of fearsome integrity and independence.

title: Pakistani Premier in Delicate Dance With India
description: Pakistans prime minister, Nawaz Sharif, returned home from New Delhi tofaint praiseandconsiderablecriticism, the latter suggesting that his 30-hour sojourn in Delhi to attend the swearing-in ceremony of Prime Minister Narendra Modi last week had been his riskiest gamble yet in improving his countrys relations with India.

title: On the Verge | The Swedish Takeover of L.A.
description: Throngs of Swedes eager to escape the land of the midnight sun are traveling to the land of eternal sunshine. Blame the obvious (weather), the logistical (Norwegian Air Shuttles new direct flight from Stockholm) or the sartorial (Acne Studios opening of a West Coast outpost); whatever the reason, Los Angeles has become a new home away from Holm for many Swedish creatives. Without fail, every single day theres a bunch of Swedes in the lobby, says Fredrik Carlstrom, who ensconced himself at the newish Ace Hotel while overseeing the recent launch of Austere, a nearby Scandi-centric retail showroom and event space. Come late next year, downtown L.A. will also house AYD (short for All Your Dreams), a Nordic-influenced members club designed by Andreas Fornell (formerly Acnes in-house architect). AYD will boast Swedish chefs (Adam & Albin of Matstudio in Stockholm) and club ambassadors like the pop icon Robyn. A lot of people are skipping New York and going straight to L.A., says Patrik Berger, who co-produced the Swedish duo Icona Pops massive 2012 hit I Love It. Its all in L.A. when it comes to pop music.

title: Today in Small Business: The Best Restaurant Location in the World?
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: Reaction to Obama Administration Carbon Emissions Proposal
Allman Brothers Band Announces Final Concerts
description: When the Allman Brothers Band pulled into the Beacon Theater in March, it was set to play what it said was the last of its annual New York residencies at the hall. But when Gregg Allman, the bands singer and keyboardist, fell ill toward the end of the run, the final week of sold-out concerts were canceled, with a promise that the band would make them up. The question was whether that would happen before the end of the year, when, word from around the group had it, the Allmans were planning to disband (something Mr. Allman denied in interviews).

title: Food Curated: Ricos Lechon
description: Ask people in the Philippines where to find the best lechon and theyll send you to Cebu, the countrys lechon capital.

title: Rhetoric and Realities Around Obamas Carbon Pollution Power Plant Rules
description: With the release this morning of the Obama administrations proposed regulations curbing emissions of heat-trapping gases from existing power plants, the battle to shape public attitudes is already in high gear.

title: New York F.C. And Villa Agree to 3-Year Deal
description: David Villa, a veteran Spanish striker who has lifted the Champions League and World Cup trophies in a title-filled career, joined New York City F.C. on Monday as the Major League Soccer clubs first player.

title: Burying the Hatchet in a Bid for Relevance
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  The last time 50 Cent appeared at Hot 97 Summer Jam, in 2004, he was the most popular rapper of the day, the most feared, and in some circles, the most hated. But what could have been a coronation was instead a fiasco: Some old enemies started trouble in the crowd, sending chairs flying toward the stage, which 50 Cent and his crew sent flying right back before walking off with a harrumph and a ban from future Summer Jams.

title: Video: Ricos Lechon, a Filipino Tradition
description: Liza de Guia is a video journalist whose blog, Food. Curated., profiles people who produce interesting food in New York and beyond.

title: Clip From HBOs 112 Weddings
description: A clip from the HBO documentary, 112 Weddings, in which a longtime wedding videographer explores the challenges couples face in their marriages years after the wedding day.

title: Secret Global Strike Kills 2 Malicious Web Viruses
description: WASHINGTON  Federal agents over the weekend secretly seized control of two computer networks that hackers used to steal millions of dollars from unsuspecting victims. In doing so, the Justice Department disrupted the circulation of two of the worlds most pernicious viruses and turned a 30-year-old Russian computer hacker into a most-wanted fugitive.

title: Asparagus, Green Beans and Potatoes With Green Mole Sauce
description: Mole sauce, which is thickened with nuts or seeds, is as wonderful with vegetables as it is with meat or fish, something I was reminded of recently when I had a main dish of mole with vegetables at El Naranjo, the chef Iliana de la Vegas restaurant in Austin, Tex. Green mole especially lends itself to vegetables. At this time of year Im buying asparagus and green beans. They should not be too crunchy  five minutes was just the right amount of cooking time.

title: Whole-Wheat Seeded Loaves
description: This is a whole-wheat adaptation of Jacquy Pfeiffers seeded bread from The Art of French Pastry. The seeds and the flaked oats are soaked overnight before theyre mixed into the dough. This allows them to absorb moisture and softens them, so that the bread is wonderfully moist, and the seeds wont be hard on your teeth when you bite. Soaking the seeds also breaks down phytic acid and protease inhibitors, which allows the nutrients to be more readily absorbed by the body. This is a two-day recipe, as you must allow time for soaking the seeds overnight.

title: Rice Pilaf With Pistachios, Almonds and Spices
description: There are sweet and tart flavors at play here, especially if you use barberries, but apricots also have a tart edge to them. Rose water makes the pilaf wonderfully fragrant. The dish is inspired by a number of Persian rice pilafs, but its simpler, and calls for much less butter than an authentic Persian pilaf. Ive made it with plain basmati rice, but I also like to use a purple jasmine rice mix that Alter Eco packages.

title: Seeded Chocolate-Chip Oatmeal Cookies
description: If you want to indulge in chocolate-chip cookies that taste like chocolate-chip cookies but have some wholesome ingredients thrown in, heres your recipe. I use as much chocolate in these as I use in Sherry Yards Quintessential Chocolate Chip-Cookies (isnt it great that chocolate offers us healthful phytonutrients?) but Ive reduced the sugar by 25 percent and added a good measure of rolled oats and sunflower, chia and pumpkin seeds. Ive made the cookies using half whole-wheat flour and using all unbleached all-purpose flour, and I prefer the whole-wheat version  and not just because its healthier:The nutty flavor of the flour complements the nutty flavor of the seeds. You could soak the seeds, but youll have to take the time to dry them completely in a low oven; otherwise they will contribute too much moisture and the cookies wont brown properly.

title: Yogurt With Mixed Seeds, Toasted Oatmeal and Ginger Syrup
description: The inspiration for this breakfast yogurt comes mainly from an amazing breakfast yogurt and fruit bowl I had at the Elizabeth Street Caf, a Vietnamese-French bakery and restaurant in Austin, Tex. Its baker, Jennifer Tucker, is exceptionally talented: Anyone who can pull off croissants that incorporate whole-wheat flour and seeds while remaining flaky, light, and small has my immediate attention.

title: Chemical Weapons Treaty Does Not Apply to Petty Crime, Justices Rule
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court ruled on Monday that Congress had not meant to authorize prosecutions of minor crimes under a chemical weapons treaty.

title: Paulo Ferros Math Challenges
description: Our challenges this week were suggested by Paulo Ferro, who teaches math in Portugal and has written secondary math textbooks used in Spain. Each of the puzzles requires breaking and reassembling in some way. Lets give them a try.

title: A Woman I Regarded as a Hero, and New Doubts
description: While I was traveling in Vietnam and Burma, a story at Newsweek hit home. It charged that Somaly Mam, an activist against human trafficking in Cambodia, had fabricated elements of her background. Somaly has been a hero of mine, and Ive written about her in my column, first in 2008 and most recently in 2011.

title: A Magazine Leads a Trip to Cuba
description: Readers of The Nation are getting the chance to travel like (and with) the journalists whose work they admire.

title: China Escalating Attack on Google
description: BEIJING  The authorities in China have made Googles services largely inaccessible in recent days, a move most likely related to the governments broad efforts to stifle discussion of the 25th anniversary of the crackdown on pro-democracy demonstrators in Tiananmen Square on June 3 and 4, 1989.

title: Nicholas Kristof Should Give Readers a Full Explanation About Somaly Mam
description: A recent Newsweek cover story calls Somaly Mam the Holy Saint (and Sinner) of Sex Trafficking. It details the ways in which the Cambodian activist against sex trafficking fabricated at least some parts of her own story and the dramatic, heartrending stories of girls she said were sold into sex slavery.

title: Its Easy to Forget About Risk in a Stable Market
description: Stability itself is destabilizing.

title: Feeling For | Sheer Spectacles
description: Translucent candy-colored frames for men whove grown weary of Wayfarers.

title: Where the Father of the Ponzi Scheme Once Slept
description: LEXINGTON, Mass.  This postcard-perfect town near Boston was where the first patriots died in the Revolutionary War.

title: Russia Gives Ukraine More Time to Pay for Natural Gas
description: MOSCOW  Russias state-controlled energy giant, Gazprom, on Monday pushed back by a week its ultimatum to Ukraine to pay in advance for natural gas or face a shutoff. It also lowered its asking price, signaling a softening of its stance in the two countries pipeline politics.

title: Democrats in Coal Country Run From E.P.A.
description: LEXINGTON, Ky.  It took little time for Alison Lundergan Grimes, the Democrat who is challenging Senator Mitch McConnell of Kentucky, the Republican minority leader, in the most high-profile Senate race this year, to distance herself from the Obama administrations proposal for sharp cuts to emissions from power plants.

title: Q. and A. With Stuart Elliott
description: Stuart Elliott, the advertising columnist, answers questions from readers each week. Questions can be sent to stuarte@nytimes.com.

title: Accounts and People of Note in the Advertising Industry
description: The government of Albania named StrawberryFrog and its parent, APCO Worldwide, to lead the creation of an advertising campaign aimed at encouraging tourists to visit the country. Billings were not disclosed. The campaign, the first such effort for Albania, will carry the theme Go your own way.

title: Measuring the Apology of Network Rail in Britain
description: This is the second apology in our Apology Metrics series in which we present apologies for readers to assess. Our goal is not to evaluate apologies as theatrical performances but to evaluate the apologizers behavior over time to see whether there has been genuine change.

title: Hospital Charges Surge for Common Ailments, Data Shows
description: Charges for some of the most common inpatient procedures surged at hospitals across the country in 2012 from a year earlier, some at more than four times the national rate of inflation, according to data released by Medicare officials on Monday.

title: Image of the Day: June 2
Morning Views
description: Republican candidates are continuing to run against Obamacare, but will it work? The vast majority of Americans want the law improved, but not repealed, The New York Times editorial board says: That sentiment conflicts with the Republican playbook, which party leaders are suddenly trying to rewrite. The result has been an incoherent mishmash of positions, as candidates try to straddle a widening gap between blind hatred of health reform and the publics growing recognition that much of it is working.

title: The Perils of a Circumstantial Insider Trading Case
description: Insider trading is all about propitious timing. And trades by the golfer Phil Mickelson and William T. Walters, a high-rolling gambler, just before the billionaire investor Carl C. Icahn made an unsolicited offer to buy Clorox in 2011 have all the signs of a potential violation: a quick increase in the stock price that made their risky call options worth millions of dollars. But timing alone is not enough to establish insider trading. So moving from suspicion to proving a violation requires much more than just timely trading and vague connections between a potential source and profitable trades.

title: The Computer Code for Parental Feelings of Inadequacy
description: Im starting to feel really guilty about coding.

title: ScienceTake | The Longest Migration
description: Point to point, a zebra herd in Botswana and Namibia travels farther than any other African mammals, researchers say.

title: Goldman Names New Chief Strategy Officer
description: Updated, 2:52 p.m. |

title: Cause Marketing Effort Is Centered on the Negroni
description: The designation of weeks or months for cause-related marketing purposes has become so familiar that they now seem, in most instances, to fade into the woodwork. When almost every week or month is a Week or Month, they can lose their power to motivate consumers to become donors or lend a helping hand.

title: Whats Black and White and Travels 310 Miles?
description: Given all the attention that has been paid to migrations of wildlife in Africa its a surprise to find a new one, not to mention one that is the longest of any on that continent.

title: The Right and Misogyny
description: My column yesterday joined the crowded debate over the cultural significance (if any) of the Santa Barbara killers radioactive, misogynistic, sexually-frustrated rage. That debate has gone in any number of directions, but its often slipped into some well-worn right-left grooves, with writers on the feminist left tilting at capital-p Patriarchy and traditional masculinityand conservative commentators dismissing their argumentsas victimologyand ideological overreach.And as in another recent controversy, on rape and campus life, Im a little dissatisfied with my own sides approach: Intheir haste to critique too-sweeping indictments of masculinity/male privilege/rape culture/etc., it seems to me, some conservatives risk foreclosing the possibility that misogyny might be a real cultural problem, to which a certain amount of moral outrage and a certain kind of structural critique might both be healthy, legitimate responses.

title: Spains King Juan Carlos Abdicates
description: King Juan Carlos of Spain said that he would abdicate the throne after nearly 40 years, and that his son, Crown Prince Felipe, would succeed him.

title: Apple Unveils iOS 8 and OS X Yosemite at Developer Conference
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Apple on Monday introduced new operating systems for its Mac computers and mobile devices, including a series of changes intended to help Macs work more seamlessly with iPhones and iPads.

title: Key Details of E.P.A. Carbon Emissions Proposal
description: WASHINGTON  A rule proposed by the Enivironmental Protection Agency would cut carbon pollution from power plants 30 percent from 2005 levels by 2030  the equivalent, according to the agency, of taking two-thirds of all cars and trucks in America off the road. Here are some things to know about the rule:

title: A Luxe Update on a Classic Pilots Timepiece
description: In this weekly series, the mens fashion editors of T invite creative personalities to put their own aesthetic spin on a new watch. Here, the photographer Rob Kulisek captures a timepiece from Breitling.

title: Blair Urges E.U. Leaders to Heed Lessons of Elections
description: LONDON  Entering Europes debate over the rise of populist parties, former Prime Minister Tony Blair of Britain on Monday called on European Union leaders to heed a wake-up call by delivering better living standards, but he insisted that immigration from Eastern Europe had benefited Britain.

title: Chris Brown Released From Jail
description: The singerChris Brown, who had been in a Los Angeles jail since the middle of March, was released just after midnight on Monday, The Associated Press reported.

title: The Sexy Golf Angle to the Latest Insider Trading Scandal
description: Last week was an eventful one for the Las Vegas gambler William T. Walters.

title: Lupita Nyongo to Join Star Wars: Episode VII
description: LOS ANGELES  Lupita Nyongo just added another broadly commercial film to her post-Oscar dance card. As in, the broadest: Star Wars: Episode VII.

title: Dorchester Cancels Fashion Prize In Wake of Protests
description: The Dorchester Collection has canceled its fashion prize for emerging designers this year in the wake of protests against its luxury hotels from leading figures in the fashion industry and Hollywood.

title: Podcast: Your Brain on Cursive, Google Glass Operation, Tattoos for Healing
description:
Handwriting is being dropped in public schools that could be bad for young minds. Googles new hands-free computer is finding its way into operating rooms. Breast cancer survivors find the start of their new lives in a tattoo artists work.
Subscribe to the Podcast

title: Too Extreme for the N.R.A.
description: The National Rifle Associations lobbying wing, the Institute for Legislative Action, has officially recognized that guns, whether theyre toted by good guys or bad guys, are frighteningat least if theyre long guns and theyre in public places.

title: Valeant and Ackman Departing From Usual Playbook in Pursuit of Allergan
description: From the moment it was announced, the $53 billion joint bid for Allergan, the maker of Botox, made by Valeant Pharmaceuticals and the hedge fund manager William A. Ackman, was highly unconventional.

title: Neighbors Protest 33-Foot Statue
description: Residents of wealthy Old Westbury, N.Y., do not have to worry about living downwind of a pig farm or next to a fraternity house.

title: Valeants Achilles Heel
description: Valeant Pharmaceuticals is pushing its $54 billion deal with the help of a carrot and two sticks.

title: Weekly News Quiz | May 27-June 2, 2014
description: Apple plays catch-up, a plan to cut carbon emissions, the death of an icon and more: How many of the topics in this weeks news quiz have you been following?

title: Whats Lost as Handwriting Fades
description: Does handwriting matter?

title: Barbro Lindgren Wins Childrens Literature Prize
description: The Swedish author Barbro Lindgren was awarded the 2014 Astrid Lindgren Memorial Prize, the literary worlds largest award for childrens literature, at a ceremony at the Stockholm Concert Hall on Monday. The prize, which is named for the Swedish author and editor, who died in 2002, has been given annually since 2003, and is meant to honor a writer, illustrator or storyteller for a lifetimes work. It includes a cash award of five million Swedish krona (about $748,000).

title: Oliver Stone Plans a Film About Edward Snowden
description: LOS ANGELES  Oliver Stone, one of Hollywoods most provocative directors, will make a movie about one of the worlds most divisive figures: Edward Snowden.

title: The Scene | Hollands Opus
description: Thanks to its quaint streets and picturesque canals, The Hague, a jewel of a city in South Holland, has long attracted a discerning international crowd. And with this months reopening of the renovated Royal Picture Gallery Mauritshuis, home to Vermeers Girl With a Pearl Earring, theres more reason than ever to go. At the exuberantly packed antique store Il Mondo Stijl, tulipieres are transformed into lamps with oversize red shades, next to an Italian cachepot in the style of a Persian warrior and Capodimonte porcelain parrots. Rich with jewels of a different sort, Herman Romberg makes Tahitian pearl necklaces and turquoise drop earrings for a clientele that includes Queen Maxima and other members of the Dutch royal family. For those in search of culinary indulgence, theres South of Houston, a French-American restaurant that serves dry-aged beef and elegant desserts. But perhaps The Hagues grandest attraction is the Hotel Des Indes. Built as a palace in 1858, it has retained its Old World glamour  mirrored walls and marble columns  and its an ideal place to savor the citys Dutch strawberries and Austrian sacher tortes.

title: Monday Motorsports: Milestones Fall at Englishtown Drag Races
description: Weather conditions were perfect for record high speeds and close racing at the National Hot Rod Associations Summernationals drag races at Englishtown, N.J., on Sunday. Richie Crampton achieved a milestone for himself and the sport with his Top Fuel victory. Crampton, an Australian competing in his ninth N.H.R.A. event, defeated the points leader, Doug Kalitta, in the final. In the process, he scored his first career Top Fuel victory. The N.H.R.A. said he became the 100th different driver to win in the Top Fuel category, in an official history that dates to 1963.

title: The Sweet Surprise of Dry Riesling
description: Updated | July 8, 2014

title: Book Covers: Before and After
description: Designers discuss their work on recent book covers.

title: No Nation Has Lowered Obesity Rate in 33 Years
description: Nearly 30 percent of the worlds population is overweight or obese, and not one country has reduced its obesity rate in 33 years, according to a new study combining three decades of data from 188 countries, published in The Lancet last month.

title: On the Move Because of Global Warming
description: Light-colored species of butterflies and dragonflies in Europe like the heat, while dark-colored ones retreat northward to cooler areas. Because of climate change, lighter species are taking over areas once dominated by their darker counterparts, researchers report in the journal Nature Communications. Lighter insects can reflect sunlight more easily and prevent their bodies from overheating.

title: Weekend Gun Report: May 30-June 1, 2014
description: Elliot Rodgers parents struggled for years to engage their troubled son with the world, the Times reported yesterday. The perpetrator of the May 23 rampage in Isla Vista, Calif., was described as a high-functioning autistic child prone to depression and anxiety who once had a panic attack so severe he had to be permanently withdrawn from school. He wasnt just a little withdrawn, a family friend and spokesman said. He was as withdrawn as any person I ever met in my life.

title: Podcast: Tattoos for Healing
description: Breast cancer survivors find the start of their new lives in a tattoo artists work.

title: A Way With Words and a Spice Rack
description: I remember the first time I was in the kitchen with Maya Angelou. It happened in Sonoma, Calif., some 40 years ago. A mutual friend had been invited to spend a week, and I trailed along. Ms. Angelou maintained a home in that Mediterranean-looking town of red tile roofs in the wine country, complete with a guest suite in which we were comfortably ensconced. At dinnertime we walked up to the main house.

title: Businesses May Have to Wait to Offer Employees a Choice of Health Plans
description: For small businesses that want to offer employees health insurance, there arent a lot of reasons to buy that coverage on the new Small Business Health Options, or SHOP, exchanges created by the Affordable Care Act. In fact, there are only two.

title: After Nadal and Ferrer, Spanish Tennis Talent Pool Looks Thin
description: PARIS  The future of Spanish tennis may not be Spanish in the future.

title: Growing Up on Raw Foods
description: Meals for Levi Bowland are pretty much the same every day. For breakfast, its melon. For lunch, a heaping bowl of coleslaw and three bananas. Dinner involves more fruit, and a salad.

title: Hopes for Impact of Carbon Rules in U.S. Are Modest
description: The new carbon pollution rules the Obama administration announced on Monday will help spur the natural gas industry and renewable energy like wind and solar power, but executives and analysts said they did not see the nations reliance on coal disappearing anytime soon.

title: Music Camp for Kids, Vacation for Parents
description: For parents potentially worried about sending their kids away to camp, one newcomer is simultaneous vacations  in Jamaica.

title: A Favor for Grandpa? But This Is America
description: Now that he has landed a junior position at the prestigious Century magazine in New York, Slava Gelman, the restless, thwarted hero of Boris Fishmans A Replacement Life, decides it is time to become an American.

title: The Forests of the Ocean
description: The secret to finding unsuspected beauty, artists and naturalists will tell you, is in knowing how to slow down and really look. The writer and photographer Josie Iselin certainly knows how to do that, as she shows in her beguiling new book, An Ocean Garden.

title: On Separate Islands, Crickets Go Silent
description: In 2003, a number of male field crickets on the Hawaiian island of Kauai were born without the ability to chirp.  Two years later, the same thing happened on Oahu.

title: Justices Enter Into Dispute Over Districts Alabama Set
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Monday agreed to consider challenges from Democratic lawmakers who say the Alabama Legislature packed minority voters into a few districts, diluting their voting power.

title: The Winners of Our Fifth Annual Found Poetry Contest
description: The bar for winning our annual found poetry contest just keeps getting higher.

title: Lurking Just Beneath This Surface ...
description: Next Time on Lonny is a Web series  a first season of six episodes appeared in 2011, and a second season begins on Tuesday. There was every reason for Lonny to be lost in the slush pile of short comedy videos online, but for one thing: Ben Stiller liked it. So if you want to know what Mr. Stiller thinks is funny, you can see for yourself over the next four weeks at maker.tv and on YouTube.

title: Gallery | Julian Wassers Photographs of the California Dream, and its Underbelly
description: On the cover of The Way We Were (Damiani Books, $60)  the first monograph by the legendary lensman Julian Wasser  a vast cloud of smoke issues from Steve McQueens pursed lips. Coming from a veneer so tough  collar starched, eyes concealed behind dark glasses  its the single note of expression, the breath the only proof the man is man and not made of wax. Herein lies the unreal reality of Wassers California: in this exhalation is all the nostalgia of a dream once dreamed. And despite the misty-eyed title of his book capturing the heyday of L.A. celebrity and counterculture, the fact is, everything you heard about living in Los Angeles in the early 60s was really true, the photographer says. It was a golden age and a hopeful time.

title: How Cats See in the Dark
description: Q. Does the slit shape of a cats pupil confer any advantages over the more rounded pupils of other animals?

title: Is Andrew Cuomo Liberal?
description: New Yorks Gov. Andrew Cuomo has spent almost four years trying to carve out a comfortable central spot in the states political spectrum.He is now known as a fiscal conservative who lowers taxes (even on the rich) and cuts costs (even for struggling communities), and as a social progressive who supports gun control and gay marriage

title: E.P.A. Unveils Plan to Slash Pollution
description: The Environmental Protection Agency administrator, Gina McCarthy, announced a plan that aims to cut carbon pollution from the nations power plants 30 percent from 2005 levels by 2030.

title: Isabel Toledos Beauty and Fitness Regimen
description: Born in Cuba and raised in West New York, N.J., Isabel Toledo, 54, has been designing a namesake womens wear line since 1984. Aside from dressing Michelle Obama on occasion and collaborating with Lane Bryant, Ms. Toledo designed the costumes for the Broadway musical After Midnight, for which shes been nominated for her first Tony Award (the ceremony is Sunday). She lives and works with her husband, the illustrator Ruben Toledo, in Manhattan. BEE SHAPIRO

title: Doctors Arent Strongly Republican Anymore
description: American doctors have shifted their political support away from Republicans toward Democrats, according to a study released on Monday.

title: The Serious Playfulness of a Rising Composer, and How It Has Spread
description: Few composers have seen their American reputations rise as swiftly in recent years as George Benjamins. Buoyed by the ecstatic international reaction to his 2012 opera, Written on Skin, which is to have its New York stage premiere next year, his newfound status is such that it was perfectly reasonable for him to be one of just two composers whose influence was celebrated by the Orchestra of St. Lukes over the weekend as part of the NY Phil Biennial.

title: The Nipple Artist
description: A tattoo parlor in Finksburg, Md., has become an unlikely destination for breast cancer survivors.

title: A Tattoo That Completes a New Breast
description: FINKSBURG, MD.  A tattoo parlor here has become a mecca for an unlikely crowd: women with breast cancer.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Welcome to NYT Now, the new app from The New York Times. (Download us for iPhone.)

title: Two Royal Ballet Dancers to Skip Russian Tour in Protest
description: Two Royal Ballet dancers have decided not to join the Royal Ballets upcoming tour to Russia, as a protest against the antigay legislation supported by President Vladimir V. Putin. The company would not name the dancers or give their rank, although The Independent described them as senior company members.

title: May the World Be Their Oyster
description: On a recent Friday afternoon, the Broadway actresses Ingrid Craigie, Gillian Hanna and June Watson took a car to Williamsburg, Brooklyn, to view Kara Walkers A Subtlety. They stepped into the shuttered Domino Sugar Factory, pausing to view the enormous central figure, with its African features and Aunt Jemima kerchief, crouched sphinxlike at the far end of the floor.

title: Exploring the Photographic Spirit
description: Raised on family tales of an old haunted farmhouse, Elizabeth Moran grew up to join relatives turned ghost-hunters in Memphis.

title: Ciro de Quadros, 74, Dies; Leader in Ridding Latin America of Polio
description: Dr. Ciro de Quadros, a Brazilian epidemiologist who navigated war zones and reimagined outmoded public health practices to lead an immunization campaign that eradicated polio in Latin America and the Caribbean, died on Wednesday in Washington. He was 74.

title: Strong Sales for Gentlemans Guide Ahead of Tony Awards
description: After the Tony Award winners are announced on Sunday night, what will happen to ticket sales for two of Broadways most-nominated musicals, A Gentlemans Guide to Love & Murder and After Midnight?

title: When Coral Reefs Thrive, So Does Variety in Fish
description: The fish that live off the Malay Archipelago, between Southeast Asia and Australia, are among the most diverse in the world. Now researchers are reporting that the area owes its diversity to the stability of coral reefs over the past three million years.

title: Brave, New and Lifted by Magic
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  Shakespeares late romance The Tempest itself undergoes a sea change in the inventive production of the play at American Repertory Theater here. The magic of Prospero has a razzle-dazzle allure in this freshly reimagined, steampunk-stylish production, directed and adapted by Aaron Posner and Teller (of the magic-meisters Penn and Teller) and featuring songs judiciously culled from the Tom Waits catalog.

title: Filing by Computer: A Pillow Helped
description: I was in a $6-an-hour motel in Oakdale, on Long Island, about 50 miles from Times Square. It was going to be my first time.

title: Complicated Brains, Walking Well Into Old Age, To Teleport Data
description: Bowel Disorders

title: Velocity, Vulnerability and Youth
description: The School of American Ballet, founded by George Balanchine and Lincoln Kirstein, is 80 years old this year. Inevitably, the anniversary calls for a staging of Serenade,  the first ballet choreographed by Balanchine on American soil, for the schools annual workshop showings. There are three performances; I caught the second, on Saturday evening. Serenade began the program of Balanchine dances; excerpts from his one-act Swan Lake and the third act of Copplia followed; the finale was the last movement of Western Symphony.

title: Facing Jail: Highlights From a Reporters Career
description: James Risen, a Times reporter, is facing a jail term for refusing to name a confidential source.

title: Pictures of the Day: Ukraine and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Ukraine, Spain, Afghanistan and Turkey.

title: Filtering Out Unwanted Gmail Messages
description: Moving Photos

title: Drones on Movie Sets? Lights, Camera, Takeoff
description: LOS ANGELES  Dont panic, that unmanned aircraft peering over your shoulder might soon belong to Steven Spielberg or one of his functional equivalents.

title: Salesforce Bottom Line Is Put at Risk by a Slide in the Companys Stock
description: Nearly everything about Salesforce.com is remarkable.

title: A Star-Gazing Palaces Hazy Future
description: James Lick, a piano manufacturer and land baron in 19th-century California, wanted to build himself a pyramid, but a friend persuaded him to leave his money to science. And so it came to be that Lick was buried under a telescope on Mount Hamilton, 30 miles south of San Francisco.

title: New Costumes for a Balanchine Classic
description: New York City Ballet recreates costumes for its new production of A Midsummer Nights Dream.

title: A Midsummer Costume Redo
description: Figuring out how to remake 104 of the costumes that the designer Barbara Karinska created more than a half-century ago for the fairies and foolish mortals of George Balanchines ballet A Midsummer Nights Dream for Tuesday nights opening performance required detective work, millinery archaeology and a scavenger hunt for material that eventually led to three continents.

title: Automating Cybersecurity
description: If only computers themselves were smart enough to fight off malevolent hackers.

title: Less Carbon, More Energy
description: The Environmental Protection Agencys new rule sets a goal for each state based on its carbon dioxide emissions divided by its electricity generation. A chart showing where each state stands.

title: Q. and A.: Liu Heung Shing on Photographing Tiananmen
description: The Hong Kong-born photojournalist Liu Heung Shing, who shared a 1992 Pulitzer Prize for documenting an attempted coup in Russia, now lives in Beijing, where he devotes most of his time to organizing photo exhibitions and editing books on historical photos of China. His own photos from China are themselves an archive of the countrys astounding changes since the death of Mao Zedong. His images for Time magazine and The Associated Press in China in the late 1970s and early 1980s have been collected in China After Mao.

title: Listen Up | Hercules and Love Affair Makes a Case for House Music
description: America has never fully had its house music moment, says Andy Butler  better known by his moniker Hercules and Love Affair  via Skype while vacationing in Brussels. In Europe, its another story. I feel its a rite of passage for people to go to the discotheque. Butler is an American through and through (he got his start D.J.ing around Denver and attended Sarah Lawrence College), but you wouldnt know it from Hercules and Love Affairs distinctly Continental sound. Audiences there have a tradition of integrating dance music in pop culture, he explains. Indeed, Butlers breakout hit, 2008s Blind, had its biggest reception in Italy, and was received warmly in Britain as well. If theres anyone in a position to get statesiders dancing, though, its Butler  thanks especially to his energetic third album, The Feast of the Broken Heart, just released on Big Beat/Atlantic Records.

title: The Overwhelming Maleness of Silicon Valley
description: Since its premiere, Silicon Valley has prompted discussion of sexism in the actual Silicon Valley. The shows season finale offers perhaps its best illustration yet of the male-dominated nature of the tech industry  but whether that illustration will rise to the level of critique remains an open question.

title: Miranda Lambert, Countrys Sophisticated Radical
description: MIRANDA LAMBERT

title: N.H.T.S.A. Investigates Effectiveness of Chryslers Air Bag Recall
description: Chrysler has repaired only about 13 percent of the 745,000 Jeep sport utility vehicles affected by a 2012 recall, and now the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration is investigating whether the automakers attempt to fix an air bag-related problem is working.

title: Target Gives a Defense of Its Efforts on Security
description: In advance of next weeks annual shareholders meeting, Target on Monday defended its management and oversight of customer data despite the extensive hacking it experienced last year.

title: Why Democrats Have Little to Lose in Taking On the Coal Industry
description: The Obama administrations proposal Monday to reduce carbon emissions from coal-fired power plants is already being characterized by Republicans as the latest salvo in a war on coal.

title: Summer Jam 2014
description: New York Citys leading hip-hop station, Hot 97 celebrates the end of winter with its annual concert Summer Jam.

title: Boutique Inns, Chain Hotels and the Business Traveler
description: NEW ORLEANS  WHEN Im traveling on business, as I have been the past two weeks, I require the following in a hotel: a comfortable bed, a bathroom, reliable Wi-Fi, adequate space to work and a good location. And there have been times when reliable Wi-Fi was at the top of that list.

title: For Now, Sponsors Unlikely to Cut Ties With Phil Mickelson
description: Professional athletes can earn millions of dollars by advertising everything from soda to mutual funds. But those lucrative endorsement deals can disappear  quickly  if a brand decides that its chosen superstar may no longer be good for its image.

title: Thai Protesters Flash Hunger Games Salute to Register Quiet Dissent
description: Having banned public protests, Thailands military faces a new challenge: how to treat citizens who make a three-fingered salute, a sign of resistance borrowed by opponents of last months coup from The Hunger Games, The Bangkok Post reported.

title: Food Matters | David Shrigley Puts His Twisted Spin on the Interior of the London Restaurant Sketch
description: Less death and defecation. Fewer swear words. A lot of things about cooking. These principles have much to recommend them, the artist David Shrigley explains, when you are redesigning a restaurant.

title: Judge Dismisses Legal Challenges to Defunct Library Plan
description: A New York State Supreme Court judge, addressing a dispute thats already been resolved, has dismissed two lawsuits that sought to block the New York Public Library from creating a circulating library inside its main research branch on Fifth Avenue at 42d Street.

title: The Luggage Tag With GPS
description: David Deeble opened his suitcase and realized that his machete was missing. So was the plunger, the stuffed rabbit and the juggling pins  not to mention his clothes.

title: Countdown to 2014 World Cup in Brazil: Day 10
description: The 2014 World Cup begins on June 12, when Brazil plays Croatia in the opening match. Reporters and editors for The Times will count down to the start of the tournament each day with a short capsule of news and interesting tidbits.

title: Vanishing Island
description: This short documentary profiles residents of the Isle de Jean Charles in Louisiana, as they confront a future threatened by sinking shorelines and rising seas.

title: The New York City Department of Investigations Findings on Charles J. Hynes
description: The inquiry reviewed about 6,000 emails to and from Mr. Hynes before the 2013 election.

title: Ex-Brooklyn Prosecutor Charles J. Hynes Accused of Misuse of Funds
description: A New York City Department of Investigation inquiry has implicated Charles J. Hynes, the former Brooklyn district attorney, in the improper use of money seized from drug dealers and other criminal defendants to pay a political consultant more than $200,000 for his work on Mr. Hyness unsuccessful re-election campaign last year.

title: Mixed Drinks for Shaken Passengers
description: IM a lucky person. By the age of 33, Ive had the pleasure of visiting four continents, 30 countries and more than 100 cities all over the world. I once traveled for 21 days straight, visiting three continents in three weeks, with more than 18 hours worth of time zone changes.

title: Report Calls for Huge Investment in Energy Development
description: LONDON  Enormous amounts of capital investment  up to $2.5 trillion a year  will be needed to supply the worlds energy needs through 2035, according to a report released Monday by the International Energy Agency, the intergovernmental organization based in Paris.

title: Vanishing Island
description: Although its only 80 miles from New Orleans, the Isle de Jean Charles feels much farther away. Its literally at the end of the road, connected to the mainland by a little two-lane strip of asphalt with water lapping at its edges.

title: A U.S. Midfielder Goes on the Offensive
description: HARRISON, N.J.  Several times during the United States national teams match Sunday against Turkey, midfielder Michael Bradley drifted so far forward that he was lined up with striker Jozy Altidore near the Turks penalty area. At that point, Bradley had almost stopped being a midfielder and was essentially a third forward.

title: The Writing Workshop Glossary
description: Most writers, at some point in their lives, join a writers workshop, a weekly gathering of a dozen or so scribes who read one anothers work and offer constructive criticism in a group setting. They hope that by sharing their material and receiving feedback they will improve their craft. But take it from me, putting your work out there for critique can be a difficult  and even mysterious  process. Here is a glossary that can help you understand the terms you may hear in a workshop:

title: Massachusetts Sues Fannie and Freddie Over Foreclosure Law
description: Martha Coakley, the attorney general of Massachusetts, filed suit on Monday against Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac in an effort to force the federally owned mortgage finance giants to comply with a state antiforeclosure law passed in 2012.

title: Smoke in the Water
description: CHAPEL HILL, N.C.  NO ONE is exactly sure when Duke Energys coal ash pit adjacent to the Dan River in north-central North Carolina began leaking toxic coal ash into the waterway. What is known is that by the time the leak was discovered, in early February, more than 39,000 tons of coal ash and millions of gallons of contaminated water had spilled into the river near the town of Eden, N.C.  making it the third largest coal ash spill in American history.

description: To the Editor:

title: New U.S. Effort to Aid Unaccompanied Child Migrants
description: Saying the surge in unaccompanied children crossing the South Texas border illegally had created a humanitarian crisis, President Obama on Monday ordered federal emergency authorities to take charge of the relief effort as immigration officials opened a second shelter for the youths in a military facility.

title: Jacksons Remarks on Fisher Prove Costly
description: Phil Jacksons coaching search has already cost him time. Now, it appears to be costing him money, too.

title: Cheap Migrant Labor
description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

title: Politics Seen Undercutting Credibility of a Court
