description: VIEQUES, P.R.  Sitting on a small boat in Mosquito Bay, a tapestry of stars above him, Mark Martin, a field researcher, scooped water into a canister. He studied the liquid for some sign of why, suddenly and inexplicably, one of the worlds most famous bioluminescent bays had dimmed.

title: Can the Minimum Wage Be Too High?
In Race for Rangels Seat, Top Rivals Promise Job Growth in Struggling Areas
description: With less than three weeks to go until the Democratic primary for Representative Charles B. Rangels seat in Congress, he and his top rival, State Senator Adriano Espaillat, courted voters on Wednesday by promising to bring sorely needed jobs to the struggling Harlem and Bronx neighborhoods that make up much of their district.

title: Spurs and Heat Are Starting Where the What-Ifs Left Off
description: SAN ANTONIO  Now that the Miami Heat and the San Antonio Spurs have arrived here, ready to reprise their riveting seven-game N.B.A. final of a year ago, among the many questions worth considering is one that is perhaps the simplest.

title: British Bank Regulators Pine to Win a Big Case
description: When Credit Suisse agreed on May 19 to plead guilty and pay $2.6 billion for conspiring to help Americans avoid taxes, it was yet another day of dreary headlines for bankers around the world.

title: Inquiry Urged on Site Called Mass Grave of Irish Babies
description: DUBLIN  The government and the police are coming under increasing pressure to open an investigation into allegations that a Roman Catholic religious order secretly buried up to 796 babies and toddlers born to unmarried mothers in a septic tank over several decades.

title: Lets Give Mississippi Less
description: When was the last time the nation turned its attention to Mississippi?

title: Clarifying, and Tightening, Patent Law
description: Two recent unanimous Supreme Court decisions should reduce abusive and frivolous patent litigation by raising the standards by which judges decide such cases. The number of cases has increased sharply in recent years.

title: For Rivals, a Rare Aligning of Form and Draw
description: PARIS  In an age of great rivalries in mens tennis, Rafael Nadal versus Andy Murray has been the one that keeps getting away.

title: Children on the Run
description: Along the southern border, particularly in Texas, a rising influx of young unauthorized migrants crossing the border with their parents  or, more alarmingly, alone  has overwhelmed the Border Patrol and sent the federal government scurrying for a coordinated response. Its first action was the right one: the creation of a top-level task force including the Federal Emergency Management Agency and the Department of Health and Human Services to care for the unaccompanied children.

title: Bettman Addresses N.H.L. Players Efforts to Hide Concussions
description: LOS ANGELES  Commissioner Gary Bettman said Wednesday that the N.H.L.s concussion protocol was working, and that the league was serious about enforcing it.

title: Mary Soames, Daughter of Churchill and Chronicler of History, Dies at 91
description: Mary Soames, the last surviving child of Winston Churchill, lived a storybook life and chronicled it in her own well-received books. After her family announced her death at 91 on May 31 in London, Prime Minister David Cameron called her an eyewitness to some of the most important moments in our recent history.

title: Standing Up to Mr. Putin
description: President Obamas decision to commit $1 billion to bolster security in Central and Eastern Europe sends important messages to both NATO allies and President Vladimir Putin of Russia. The crisis over Russias annexation of Crimea has calmed down a bit, and some Europeans, like France, seem eager to put it behind them. But Mr. Putin has shown he cannot be trusted. The alliance needs to be honest with itself and take full account of his ruthless unpredictability as it plans security arrangements for the future.

title: Democrats See a Break in a Gain for the Tea Party in Mississippi
description: WASHINGTON  It is a major headache for the national Republican Party and perhaps the biggest break Democrats have been handed in this difficult election year: a three-week runoff campaign in Mississippi between a party elder, Senator Thad Cochran, and the sometimes unpredictable Tea Party favorite, Chris McDaniel.

title: Recalibrated Finalists Renew Their Rivalry
description: For the second straight year, the Miami Heat and the San Antonio Spurs will meet in the N.B.A. finals, and it will again be easy to cast them as polar opposites: the old-school Spurs with their homegrown crop of stars  Tim Duncan, Tony Parker and Manu Ginobili were all drafted by San Antonio  against the modern mercenaries from Miami, including the transplants LeBron James and Chris Bosh.

title: Theres a Kind of Hush
description: SITTWE, Myanmar  Few people have fought as courageously for human rights as Daw Aung San Suu Kyi, the Nobel Prize-winning democracy advocate who stood up to the generals here in Myanmar.

title: Don Zimmer, Who Lived Baseball for 66 Years, Dies at 83
description: Don Zimmer, the stubby, Popeye-muscled baseball lifer with the unforgettable jowls whose passion for the game endured through 66 years as a player, manager, coach and adviser, died on Wednesday in Dunedin, Fla. He was 83.

title: Ex-Rangers Coach Hailed for His Role in a Success Story
description: Glen Sather, the Rangers general manager, clearly made the right call last June when he hired Alain Vigneault to replace John Tortorella behind the bench. Sather made an equally wise decision a decade ago when he tabbed Tom Renney to resurrect the franchise.

title: To Lure Bostonians, New Pop-Up Bus Service Learns Riders Rhythms
description: BROOKLINE, Mass.  Katie Pasciucco, 34, an account manager at a software company, is a typical Boston commuter. Her door-to-door trip to work is just 4.5 miles but takes at least 50 maddening minutes.

title: Criticism Over Troop Withdrawal Emerges From Beyond G.O.P.
description: WASHINGTON  Criticism of President Obamas announcement that American forces would leave Afghanistan by the end of 2016 has begun to come not just from his Republican adversaries, but also from another quarter: former military officers and civilian officials who worked for years to develop and defend his administrations strategy in Afghanistan.

title: Word of the Year
description: THURSDAYS PUZZLE  The book that Ed Sessa commemorates in todays puzzle was a game changer for me.

title: A Data-Driven Commute
description: The pop-up bus service Bridj made its debut in Boston, hoping to offer a quicker alternative for commuters by using algorithms to adapt its routes.

title: Just Mill About, You Know, as Any Crowd Would Do
description: The orders are as impossible as they are imperious: Do try and merge.

title: A Belmont Who Fought for Racing and for Soldiers
description: Horse racing fans are eagerly awaiting Saturdays Belmont Stakes, the race that will decide whether California Chrome will join racing royalty like Seattle Slew, Secretariat and Omaha as a Triple Crown winner. But a little more than a hundred years ago, racing was threatened, and the Jockey Club president, August Belmont Jr., decided to save it.

title: Yuri Kochiyama, Rights Activist Who Befriended Malcolm X, Dies at 93
description: Yuri Kochiyama, a civil rights activist who formed an unlikely friendship with Malcolm X when he was still promoting black nationalism and later cradled his head in her hands as he lay dying from gunshot wounds in 1965, died on Sunday in Berkeley, Calif. She was 93.

title: Maxine Greene, 96, Dies; Education Theorist Saw Arts as Essential
description: Maxine Greene, a teacher and education theorist who promoted the arts as a fundamental learning tool and in nearly 50 years at Teachers College, Columbia University, became its resident Pied Piper, known for her persuasive scholarship, her vivid writing and her imbuing teaching with a spirit of endless adventure, died on May 29 at her home in Manhattan. She was 96.

title: Karlheinz Bhm, Actor-Turned-Humanitarian, Dies at 86
description: Karlheinz Bhm, an Austrian actor turned humanitarian whose early reputation rested on numerous portrayals of princely heartthrobs and one role as a serial killer who films the agonies of his female victims, died on May 29 in Grdig, Austria, near Salzburg. He was 86.

title: Mets Are Benefiting From Competition at Shortstop
description: CHICAGO  When the Mets called up Wilmer Flores last month, Manager Terry Collins challenged Ruben Tejada to be better. While Tejada had made little progress at shortstop, he had not been pushed by anyone trying to take his job. But now that Flores felt more comfortable at shortstop, he would be Tejadas competition.

title: French Open Ball Kids Carry Gear and a Tune
description: PARIS  Spectators arriving early at Roland Garros encounter an unusual sight each morning: more than 200 children singing and chanting as they run down a wide walkway that leads past the empty stadium of Philippe Chatrier Court.

title: Special Parking Rules in New York
description: Because of Shavuot, alternate-side street-cleaning regulations will be suspended in New York City on Thursday. Other regulations remain in effect.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for June 4, 2014
description: June 4, 2014

title: Behind P.O.W.s Release: Urgency and Opportunity
description: WASHINGTON  Weeks before a Black Hawk helicopter lifted off in the dying light of eastern Afghanistan, carrying with it an American soldier who had spent five years in the hands of the Taliban, American officials grew increasingly worried that Sgt. Bowe Bergdahls life might be in jeopardy.

title: Jets Breno Giacomini Walks the Line on Offense
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Sitting at his locker Wednesday afternoon, Breno Giacomini traced an imaginary line on the inside of his stall. He then placed his index finger on top of that line.

title: Higher Minimum Wage Gains Support
description: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomos about-face on raising the minimum wage in New York has increased hopes among the citys lowest-paid workers that their pay will soon rise sharply.

title: In Bribery Trial, Lawyer Says Queens State Senator Was Entrapped
description: WHITE PLAINS, N.Y.  It was Valentines Day 2013 at Sparks Steak House in Midtown Manhattan, and gifts were exchanged.

title: Senators Show Frustration After Briefing on Ex-P.O.W.
description: WASHINGTON  White House officials failed Wednesday night to quell rising anger and frustration in both parties on Capitol Hill after a senators-only classified briefing about President Obamas decision to free five Taliban prisoners in return for the release of Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl, who military officials say walked off his base in Afghanistan five years ago.

title: 25 Years Later, Student Leaders Witness Freedoms Fought for in Tiananmen
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan  Wuer Kaixi took a microphone beneath a portrait of the Chinese revolutionary Sun Yat-sen and began firing up the crowd around him.

title: For Yankees, a Loss Overshadows Their Defeat
description: Around the sixth inning of the Yankees loss to the Oakland Athletics on Wednesday, Derek Jeter was told of the death of Don Zimmer. Suddenly, any attempt to come back in the game became much more difficult. There was grief to overcome in the Yankees dugout.

title: State and Local Officials Vow to End Homelessness Among Veterans
description: WASHINGTON  More than 80 state and local officials committed to try and end the problem of homelessness among veterans by the end of 2015, the Obama administration announced Wednesday, news that comes amid a scandal over medical care for veterans.

title: U.N. Official Urges Syria to Finish Chemical Arms Disposal
description: Acknowledging that Syria will miss the June 30 deadline for eliminating its chemical weapons, the top United Nations official overseeing the arsenals eradication said Wednesday it was very, very critical for Syria to export the final shipment, which is packed and ready to go but is trapped in an area contested by insurgents in the civil war.

title: Man Shoots and Kills 3 Canadian Mounties
description: OTTAWA  A man shot and killed three members of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police in Moncton, New Brunswick on Wednesday night and wounded two others.

title: Hamas Looms Over Latest Israel-U.S. Dispute
description: WASHINGTON  For allies who speak often of their unbreakable bonds and constant communication, this has been a season of static between Jerusalem and Washington. The latest eruption was over the announcement this week that the United States would work with a new Palestinian government that emerged from reconciliation talks with Hamas.

title: A Familiar Ring for Members of Heat and Spurs
description: Championships can define careers. Bill Russells 11 rings are often used as a trump card in arguments about greatness, while Charles Barkleys and Patrick Ewings reputations suffered because those stars never won it all.

title: In Downtown L.A., a Stylish Design Gallery for Special Guys
description: The puzzlingly named Please Do Not Enter is the newest intriguing venture to launch in downtown Los Angeles, that burgeoning mecca of all things cool and compelling. A cross between a gallery and a boutique, Please Do Not Enter offers a collection of contemporary goods that have been carefully curated by its French founders Nicolas Libert and Emmanuel Renoird for an audience of progressive minds. Both are art collectors with a special affection for design and architecture, and the space is like an extension of their lives.

title: Surrealist Photographs of Lifes In-Between Moments
description: In this weekly series, Ts photo editors share the most compelling visual projects theyve discovered.

title: Two Artists Who Want to Be Your Friends
description: The first image in the debut monograph of the Los Angeles-based artist duo of Arturo Sandoval III and Samuel Albert Borkson, a.k.a FriendsWithYou  called We Are FriendsWithYou (Rizzoli, $55)  is a group of cute little clouds with black beady eyes and tiny red smiles. The characters are from their short film Cloudy. Its like a very simplistic, reduced form that everybody can relate to, Borkson explains. It reminds you of childhood, it reminds you of your creativity, how people can look at the clouds and dream up whatever they want.

title: The Great Hamstring Saver
description: This article appeared in the June 8, 2014 issue of The New York Times Magazine.

title: The World Cup Is Bad for Brazil, Many Brazilians Say
description: The World Cup, the championship tournament of the worlds most popular sport, gets underway on June 12 in So Paulo, Brazil. In advance of the tournament, few Brazilians see hosting the event as advantageous for their country, a new survey shows.

title: Word of the Day | phoenix
description: phoenix \fe-niks\ noun

title: Think Like a Doctor: Arachnophobia
description: The Challenge: Can you solve the medical mystery of a woman who develops a sore on her leg and then fever, nausea and chest pain?

title: Quotation of the Day for Thursday, June 5, 2014
description: I dont have any headaches anymore. Its almost like a rebirth.

title: Q. and A.: Wuer Kaixi on Tiananmens Hopes and Taiwans Achievements
description: For the two student leaders most wanted by the Chinese government after the 1989 crackdown on the Tiananmen Square protest movement, Taiwan has become a home in exile. Wuer Kaixi and Wang Dan now live in a place that has undergone the sort of democratic transition they hoped would happen in mainland China 25 years ago.

title: In South Korean Voting, No Clear-Cut Victory for Either Party
description: SEOUL, South Korea  Local election results on Thursday showed the main opposition party winning nine of 17 races for big-city mayors and provincial governors in what was seen as a referendum on the leadership of President Park Geun-hye.

title: Kings Climb Out of Hole as Rangers Fall Into One
description: LOS ANGELES  The Los Angeles Kings are affectionately called the L.A. Cockroaches by some players and fans because they refuse to die. On Wednesday night at Staples Center, the Kings again showed uncanny resiliency as they overcame a 2-0 deficit and defeated the Rangers, 3-2, in overtime in Game 1 of the Stanley Cup finals.

title: Obamas Warsaw Workout Finds Its Way to the Internet
description: BRUSSELS  It may not be the same thing as having his telephone calls tapped by the National Security Agency, but President Obama got a taste of what it is like to have his privacy violated on Wednesday.

title: A Lifer Who Stood Up for His Players and His Teams
description: Baseball lost a little bit of its soul on Wednesday with the death of Don Zimmer, a character for the ages.

title: Dismay at Failure of Swap to Rescue More Hostages
description: WASHINGTON  Elaine Weinstein received a message from the White House on Saturday morning telling her to be ready for a phone call from a senior Obama administration official.

title: Cubs Blunder, but Not Enough for a Mets Victory
description: CHICAGO  Curtis Granderson hit a ground ball into the Chicago Cubs shift in the fifth inning Wednesday night, and for another team, it would probably have been a routine play.

title: Whats on Thursday
description: 4:15 P.M. (Starz Cinema) INCENDIES (2011) The adult children (Mlissa Dsormeaux-Poulin and Maxim Gaudette) of an Arab woman, Nawal (Lubna Azabal, above), living in Canada travel to an unnamed country that closely resembles Lebanon to seek out a brother they never knew existed on the instructions of Nawals last will and testament. In the process, they learn that their mother, a Christian, had fallen in love with a Muslim and fled her hometown, becoming in succession a student, an activist, a clandestine militant, a political prisoner  and more. The director Denis Villeneuve tells Nawals story in a way that is both subtle and emphatic, and Ms. Azabal, portraying Nawal from hopeful youth to despairing middle age, gives a performance that is all the more powerful for the restrained, unshakable sense of dignity she brings to it, A. O. Scott wrote in The New York Times about this Oscar nominee for best foreign-language film, based on a play by Wajdi Mouawad. The depth and complexity of her anger is both a product and a mirror of her native countrys self-destructive pathology, and as the full horror of her life is disclosed, she becomes, in her childrens eyes and the audiences, as grand and tragic as the heroine of an opera.

title: A More Militant Protest Demands Reforms From Beijing
description: While most eyes were on the huge vigil in Hong Kongs Victoria Park to mark the 25th anniversary of the Tiananmen Square crackdown, a separate demonstration by more ardently anti-Communist Party protesters drew several thousand people across the harbor on Wednesday night, highlighting the different approaches to confronting Beijings rule of the territory.

title: Corrections: June 5, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Alibaba to Take Stake in Chinese Soccer Team
description: HONG KONG  The e-commerce giant Alibaba Group agreed on Thursday to pay nearly $200 million for a stake in a Chinese soccer team, its latest in a recent spate of acquisitions.

title: Indicted German Financier Freed in Italy
description: FRANKFURT  A German hedge fund manager wanted on securities fraud charges in Los Angeles has been released from an Italian jail, his lawyer said, in what appeared to be a serious setback for United States prosecutors.

title: Henkel to Buy French Detergent Maker for $1.3 Billion
description: LONDON  Henkel of Germany said on Thursday that it would pay 940 million euros, or about $1.3 billion, for the Spotless Group, a French maker of laundry detergent and other home care products, from funds advised by the European private equity firm BC Partners.

title: Test Yourself | English, June 5, 2014
description: Take the Quiz

title: Libelous (Trivial)
description: But funny.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Crowds Gather in Hong Kong for 25th Anniversary of Tiananmen Killings
description: In Crowds Gather in Hong Kong for 25th Anniversary of Tiananmen Killings, Keith Bradsher reports on commemoration events in China.

title: ING Moves Ahead With I.P.O. of Insurance Unit
description: LONDON  The Dutch financial services company ING Group said Thursday that it would hold a long-anticipated initial public offering for the NN Group, its European and Japanese insurance and investment management arm.

title: Who Is Your Favorite Pop Diva?
description: The music world has been graced by many a pop diva. Whitney Houston, Madonna, Aretha Franklin, Mariah Carey, Jennifer Lopez, Diana Ross, Barbra Streisand and Lady Gaga have all reigned the stage at some point. Is Beyonc queen now?

title: Missing Japan, Balanced in Brazil
description: It doesnt matter that oceans are vast, deep and imposing. For much of history they have had to be crossed by force or necessity.

title: Web Editor Detained Over Photo Linking Mao to Fringe Sect
description: A Beijing-based web editor has been detained by the authorities on suspicion of posting a doctored photo that linked Mao Zedong with a fringe religious group accused in a high-profile murder, a lawyer said.

title: Xinjiang Hospital Asks Staff Not to Fast During Ramadan
description: A hospital in a city in the western region of Xinjiang that was the site of deadly ethnic unrest in 1997 has asked its staff members not to skip meals during Ramadan, the Muslim month of fasting that begins on June 28, the local health department said.

title: I.P.O. Values Zoopla Property Website at About $1.6 Billion
description: LONDON  The Zoopla Property Group, a British property listings website, could be valued at more than 1 billion pounds when it goes public in London later this month.

title: New York Today: No School, but Why?
description: Good soggy Thursday morning to you.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Welcome to the Morning Briefing on NYT Now. (Download us for iPhone.)

title: Teenage Sunburns Raise Melanoma Risk
description: The risk of developing the deadliest form of skin cancer may be closely tied to sun exposure in youth, a new study suggests.

title: Two Workouts for the Mayor
description: Two personal trainers, Justin Gelband of modelFIT and Will Torres of Willspace, explain workouts designed especially for Mayor Bill de Blasio.

title: A de Blasio Workout: New Routine, No Sweat
description: The very tall man, watched closely by a pair of police officers in business attire, stripped off his sweatshirt and windmilled his arms. He rolled his head in circles, stretching his neck.

title: As D-Day Tribute Nears, Leaders Maneuver Over Ukraine
description: LONDON  Veterans began gathering on Thursday on the Normandy beaches  some of them perhaps for the last time at such a major commemoration  to observe the 70th anniversary of the D-Day landings of World War II, even as their political leaders grappled anew with the conflicts legacy of East-West division.

title: Memories From Normandy
description: Beginning on June 6, 1944, more than 150,000 Allied troops landed on a broad stretch of beaches on the coast of Normandy, in German-held France. Entrenched behind concrete walls and bunkers were more than 50,000 German soldiers. Seventy years later, four veterans of the largest amphibious invasion in history recall their experiences.

title: Goldman Bolsters M.&A. Team in Asia
description: HONG KONG  Goldman Sachs is ramping up its mergers and acquisitions team in Asia amid a surge in deal volume in the region, according to an internal memo sent on Thursday.

title: Exiled Rally Leader Says He Slipped Into China
description: BEIJING  Despite the ramped-up security for the 25th anniversary of the Tiananmen Square crackdown, an exiled former protest organizer whose name and picture are on the Chinese governments 1989 list of the 21 most-wanted students managed to slip back into the country undetected this week, he said Thursday.

title: 1914: James Joyce Hears an Army
description: First Glimpses offers a look at the first times famous people or things appeared in the pages of The New York Times. Have an idea for someone or something you would like to read about? Send a suggestion in the comments section.

title: What Im Looking for in a New Partner
description: Ive always been a solo achiever. Im an only child, and at school I excelled at individual sports like long-distance running.

title: Why People Hate Taking Surveys
description: Its not easy to be a pollster these days. As polls have proliferated, the job of legitimate survey researchers has become increasingly difficult. Unfortunately, those of us who are trying to conduct quality surveys are painted with the same brush as those who are not.

title: Bank of England Keeps Interest Rates Unchanged
description: LONDON  The Bank of England on Thursday decided to leave its benchmark interest rate unchanged at a record low, even as Britains economy continues to gather strength.

title: Daily Report: Sprint and T-Mobile Move Closer to Merger
description: Responding to a wave of consolidation in the telecommunications industry, the nations third- and fourth-largest wireless phone operators have agreed on the terms of a deal to join forces, David Gelles and Michael J. de la Merced report.

title: Philippines Reports Chinese Ship Movement Around Disputed Reefs
description: MANILA  China is moving ships around disputed reefs in the South China Sea that could be used to reclaim land and build structures, President Benigno S. Aquino III of the Philippines said on Thursday.

title: Morning Views
description: The number of children crossing the border between Mexico and the United States illegally has doubled each year since 2011, with 60,000 more expected to arrive this year. This  The New York Times editorial board says  is not a security crisis, but a humanitarian one. Young people are being pushed out of their homes, not pulled, the board writes, citing increasing civil unrest in Mexico and parts of Central America. They are fleeing for their lives.

title: Accels Breyer to Partner With Venture Capital Firm in China
description: SHANGHAI  James W. Breyer, the venture capitalist who made a fortune with an early bet on Facebook, is putting some of his winnings to work in China, partnering with Beijing-based venture capital firm to invest in Chinese technology start-ups.

title: In Our Pages: June 6
description: 1914: Giant Warships Not Needed

title: European Central Bank Breaks New Ground to Press Growth
description: FRANKFURT  Banks typically make money on the cash they park at a central bank. Now the European Central Bank wants them to pay for the privilege.

title: No Time Off for Good Behavior
description: Is it a problem that Orange Is the New Black essentially treats prison like a bad day in high school, the kind that includes both a scary walk to the principals office and an embarrassing visit to the school nurse?

title: Young Love, Complicated by Cancer
description: The world is not a wish-granting factory. That line, from The Fault in Our Stars, is undoubtedly true, and it is also true that the movie, like the book before it, is an expertly built machine for the mass production of tears. Directed by Josh Boone (Stuck in Love) with scrupulous respect for John Greens best-selling young-adult novel, the film sets out to make you weep  not just sniffle or choke up a little, but sob until your nose runs and your face turns blotchy. It succeeds.

title: Tony Award Predictions: Readers (and Boldface Names) Weigh In
description: So said Anna Wintour, Cond Nast artistic director and editor-in-chief of Vogue, about the race for best actor in a musical as part of our Tony Award predictions series this week. At our invitation, Ms. Wintour, Oscar and Tony winner Liza Minnelli, Emmy Award winner Jim Parsons, and television host Kelly Ripa joined a few dozen of you in offering predictions.

title: Amazon Boycott Gets a Helping Hand From Stephen Colbert
description: Stephen Colbert went after Amazon Wednesday night, literally giving the retailer the finger on his Comedy Central show. Twice.

title: Talking Rebranding and Logos With Loewes Jonathan Anderson
description: Rebranding of heritage names has become something of a fashion trend recently, what with Hedi Slimanes conversion of Yves Saint Laurents ready-to-wear to Saint Laurent Paris; Pinault-Printemps-Redoutes transformation into Kering, complete with little owl pictogram: Celines new minimalism courtesy of Phoebe Philo, and so on. The latest entrant into this group is LVMHs Loewe, under the creative directorship of Jonathan Anderson (aka J Anderson, iconoclastic Young British designer), which unveiled its new logo and typeface yesterday.

title: Energy Choices
description: Nate Silver got a lot of grief when he chose Roger Pielke Jr., of all people, to write about environment for the new 538. Pielke is regarded among climate scientists as a concern troll  someone who pretends to be open-minded, but is actually committed to undermining the case for emissions limits any way he can. But is this fair?

title: China Sentences Scores in Xinjiang for Acts of Terror
description: BEIJING  Chinese courts in the northwestern region of Xinjiang sentenced 81 people on terrorism and other charges on Thursday, according to the state broadcaster China Central Television. The sentences are part of a widening crackdown in the region after a spate of deadly violence in China for which the authorities have blamed foreign-backed Islamist separatists.

title: Whats News in Washington: Obama Talks Climate Change at Summit
description: GoodThursdaymorning. Political controversies over aprisoner swapwith the Taliban and thescandal at the Department of Veterans Affairsare still swirling in Washington, but on this warm and gloomy day, President Obama has a busy agenda across the pond.

title: Israel Expands Settlements to Rebuke Palestinians
description: JERUSALEM  Israel says it is moving ahead with the planning and construction of hundreds of Jewish settlement homes as retaliation against the new Palestinian government, which has been accepted by the United States and much of the world even though it is supported by Hamas. The announcement enraged the Palestinians and flouted international opinion.

title: Where Have All the Couriers Gone?
description: Dear Diary,

title: Video and Updates on G.M. Internal Recall Investigation
description: As my colleague Bill Vlasic reports, Mary T. Barra discussed the findings of an internal investigation into why it took General Motors more than a decade to recall about 2.6 million small cars with defective ignition switches. The auto company says the problem has caused at least 13 deaths, but lawyers bringing suits against G.M. say the toll is at least 60.

title: A Little Something Special
description: Small, delicate pieces of jewelry, meant to be mixed and worn every day, are sentimental talismans of a particular moment in time.

title: G.M. Inquiry Cites Years of Neglect Over Fatal Defect
description: WARREN, Mich.  A sweeping internal investigation of General Motors released on Thursday condemned the company for its decade-long failure to fix a deadly safety defect, one that led to devastating consequences, including at least 13 deaths.

title: Morning Agenda: Sprint and T-Mobile Near a Deal of Their Own
description: Responding to a wave of consolidation in the telecommunications industry, the nations third- and fourth-largest wireless phone operators have agreed to a deal of their own. The operators, Sprint and T-Mobile, which have long contemplated a merger, finally settled on the terms of a $32 billion deal that is likely to be announced this summer, DealBooks David Gelles and Michael J. de la Merced write. The merger would create a more formidable rival to the two largest wireless phone providers in the United States, Verizon and AT&T. Under the terms of the deal, Sprint, which is majority-owned by Japans SoftBank, would acquire T-Mobile for about $40 a share in cash and stock, a 17 percent premium to Wednesdays price. Accounting for regulatory uncertainty, the early terms of the deal also include a breakup fee of more than $1 billion that Sprint would pay to T-Mobile.

title: Found Poem Favorite | In the Night
description: This poem, by Emma J., is one of the 11 winners of our fifth annual Found Poem Student Contest. It comes from a Travel article, A Big Sur Bath by the Light of the Moon.

title: Canadian Police Seek Suspect in Killing of Officers
description: OTTAWA  A full day after a heavily armed gunman killed three police officers and wounded two others, Moncton, New Brunswick, largely remained under siege on Thursday night.

title: If the Serial Killers Dont Get Him, the Fast Food Will
description: Calls to literacy come in many forms, most of them smug and self-defeating. Then there is the cult-film director John Waterss advice. In his one-man show This Filthy World, he instructs audiences, If you go home with somebody, and they dont have books, dont sleep with them.

title: A Long-Ago Blackout Burns Brightly
description: When Kim Rosenstock, Michael Mitnick and Will Connolly first staged their musical Fly by Night as Yale School of Drama grad students in 2009, it was nothing if not a DIY proposition.

title: A Brawny Vegetarian Soup Holds Its Own With Meat Lovers
description: Renee Ruder and her meat-loving family (her husband and their three daughters, 7, 9 and 11) have asked for help adding more vegetable-based meals to their weekly menu, and with making the most of their new C.S.A. (community supported agriculture) share. I am leading the way, holding a crash course in creating substantial vegetarian meals using pantry staples, the seasonal vegetables that come every week in the C.S.A. box, and ingredients from nearby supermarkets.

title: With Group of 7 Backing, Obama Gives Russia One-Month Ukraine Deadline
description: BRUSSELS  With the backing of other world leaders, President Obama effectively set a one-month deadline for Moscow to reverse its intervention in Ukraine and help quash a pro-Russian separatist uprising or else he said it would face international sanctions far more severe than anything it had endured so far.

title: 36 Hours in Canberra, Australia
description: To stand atop a Canberra hilltop is to contemplate the stark charm of the Australian bush: vast grassy fields, swaths of eucalyptus forest and Instagram-worthy sunsets. This outpost is Australias national capital  not, as is commonly thought, the glitzier city of Sydney, three hours drive north. In Canberra, there are no beaches or iconic opera houses, and European chic is best sought an hours flight away in Melbourne. But what the bush capital lacks in big-city tousle, it makes up for in big-sky beauty, breezy civic pride and a decidedly hipster underbelly. Set on an artificial lake and spread across a valley between mountain ranges, Canberra is the Brasilia of Australia, designed by the American architects Walter Burley Griffin and Marion Mahony Griffin, who won a competition in 1911 to create the countrys political heart because Sydney and Melbourne couldnt stop bickering about their own fabulousness. A year after the citys centennial celebrations and with a steady influx of artists and gastronomes, Canberra is best appreciated with deep intakes of mountain air and an ear tuned to the calls of sulphur-crested cockatoos and crimson rosellas.

title: Anatomy | The Fault in Our Stars
description: In Anatomy of a Scene, Josh Boone narrates a sequence from The Fault in Our Stars featuring Shailene Woodley, Ansel Elgort and Nat Wolff.

title: The Burden of Being Messi
description: In much of Argentina, where Lionel Messi lived until he was 13, native speakers replace the y sound with a sh sound. Yo, the personal pronoun for I, becomes sho, and calle, which other Spanish speakers would pronounce ka-yay, becomes ka-shey. The sound gives Argentine Spanish a slurry softness that resembles aspects of the Portuguese spoken in Brazil. More important to this story, that sh, and the fact that Messi has retained it all his life, has at times been the sole lifeline between the greatest soccer player in the world and the country he plays for.

title: Democrats Are Weary in Wake of Bergdahl Case
description: WASHINGTON  President Obamas handling of the Bergdahl prisoner exchange has renewed frustration among congressional Democrats about the administrations relations with its allies on Capitol Hill, and prompted criticism that the White House failed to prepare the lawmakers for the politically explosive case.

title: Exclusive Clip: Yves Saint Laurent
description: Yves Saint Laurent (Pierre Niney) prepares his models backstage for his first show after his well-publicized split from Dior. Yves muse Victoire (Charlotte Le Bon) surprises him with a new haircut.

title: In West Bengal, Communists Defeat Signals a Larger Loss
description: One afternoon in April in Baruipur, a rural expanse on the edge of Kolkata, Sujan Chakraborty, a leader of the Communist Party of India (Marxist), presided over a meeting with party workers before he set out to campaign on foot, days before the parliamentary election vote was held there.

title: Mary Barra of G.M. on Internal Report
description: In an internal investigation, General Motors cited bureaucratic problems and the failure of individual employees to address a safety problem that the company links to 13 deaths and 47 accidents.

title: Europes Central Bank Gets Serious About Fighting Deflation
description: The European Central Bank has seemed hopelessly behind the curve for ages, its leaders sitting on their hands as their continent seemed to drift inexorably toward Japan-style deflation.

title: When Plans Go Out the Window
description: Four years ago, when Finnerty Steeves bought her sunny Greenwich Village studio for $380,000, she thought she would remain there for the rest of her life.

title: How the Recession Reshaped the Economy, in 255 Charts
description: Five years since the end of the Great Recession, the private sector has finally regained the nine million jobs it lost. But not all industries recovered equally.

title: The Age of Online Memory
description: The poetically-named right to be forgotten has been much discussed recently, after a European courtruledlast month that E.U. residents can force Google to remove certain embarrassing search results about them. Indeed, according to a Time magazine article published yesterday, Google is receiving 10,000 requests per day to be forgotten in Europe. Neither the decision nor the volume of interest among Europeans in exercising this new right will affect Americans directly, but they may feed into a bigger conversation about memory and forgetting at a time when so much about our lives is recorded online.

title: Fears for Sergeants Life Led to Secrecy About Swap, Obama Official Says
description: WASHINGTON  A senior Obama administration official said Thursday that the operation to free Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl was kept a closely held secret because of fear that splits within the Taliban could lead gun-wielding guards to kill the soldier before he was turned over to American forces last weekend.

title: 1964: D-Day Remembered
description: OFFICIAL INVITATION  The engraving above is the frontispiece of an invitation to the commemorative ceremonies of the 20th anniversary of D-Day sent to distinguished persons by the D-Day Commemorative Committee, an official French group which is headed by Minister of Cooperation Raymond Triboulet.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, June 5, 1964.

title: Newly Elected Parliamentarians Take Oath in Sanskrit
description: NEW DELHI -At least two dozen newly elected members of Indias lower house of Parliament, which had its second meeting on Thursday, took their oaths in Sanskrit, Indias traditional language that harkens back to its ancient civilization.

title: Suspect in Brooklyn Stabbings Is Charged With Murder
description: The man arrested on Wednesday night in connection with the stabbing death of a 6-year-old Brooklyn boy was charged on Thursday with murder, the police said.

title: Putting a Price Tag on Natures Defenses
description: After Hurricane Katrina devastated New Orleans, the United States Army Corps of Engineers got to work on a massive network of levees and flood walls to protect against future catastrophes. Finally completed in 2012, the project ended up costing $14.5 billion  and that figure didnt include the upkeep these defenses will require in years to come, not to mention the cost of someday replacing them altogether.

title: In Store | A Cozy New L.A. Design Nook
description: One gets the feeling that Scott Barry and Brooke Intrachat would not be at all upset if you visited their new L.A. store Ouli simply to collapse into the buttery silver leather beanbag pouf (their design) and page through the adjacent copy of The Gentlewoman. In fact, with its exposed wood ceiling and feathery floral arrangements, Ouli is designed to feel more like a cozy, well-appointed living room than a gallery. People come in and say, what is this, a meditation center?' says Barry.

title: Karl Ove Knausgaard Brings His Struggle to Brooklyn
description: About 30 minutes before the start of Karl Ove Knausgaards event at the relatively small and narrow Community Bookstore in Park Slope on Wednesday, people packed the entire space in a scene more reminiscent of the calm before an indie-rock storm than an author appearance. Ezra Goldstein, an owner of the store, approached a microphone. Dont get excited, he said. This is just a sound check.

title: Harper Lee Lawsuit Is Dismissed
description: Updated, 5:59 p.m. |

title: New Access to a Nicaraguan Island
description: The government of Nicaragua is betting that a new $10 million airport will boost tourism on Ometepe Island, a Unesco Biosphere Reserve known for its towering twin volcanoes.

title: Three Things Students Wish Teachers Knew
description: As the school year winds down, I thought it would be helpful to hear from students in the vein of Five Things Teachers Wish Parents Knew and Three Things Parents Wish Teachers Knew. I spoke with and emailed over a hundred students in grades kindergarten through 12, enrolled in independent and public schools all over the country, and asked them to think back on the past year and come up with just one thing they wished that their teachers knew. The top three:

title: Josh Boone Narrates a Scene From The Fault in Our Stars
description: In this video, Josh Boone narrates a sequence from The Fault in Our Stars, featuring Shailene Woodley, Ansel Elgort and Nat Wolff. In the scene Isaac, played by Mr. Wolff, gets revenge on his ex-girlfriend with cartons of eggs and some friendly encouragement.

title: Ryan Carson of Treehouse, on When Titles Get in the Way
description: This interview with Ryan Carson, chief executive of Treehouse, an online interactive education platform, was conducted and condensed by  Adam Bryant.

title: Facts & Figures: Before and After Obamacare
description: Although few Americans say the Affordable Care Act has helped them, the uninsured rate has declined significantly since the law took effect, and appears to be leveling off at around 13.4 percent.

title: Strasbourg Music Festival Closes, Cites Poor Ticket Sales
description: The Strasbourg Music Festival has closed its doors just days before Sundays opening concert. Frances oldest classical music festival, the event was scheduled to run through June 15 and feature prominent artists such as the pianist Krystian Zimerman and the conductor Sir John Eliot Gardiner, leading the English Baroque Soloists.

title: Gannett Would Unlock Value by Splitting Off Publishing Unit
description: A breakup of Gannett is inevitable. Gannett, the owner of USA Today and other newspapers, is not getting much credit for the transformation of its television segment. As Time Warner sets its publishing arm free this week, a Breakingviews analysis suggests Gannett should do the same.

title: When the Teacher Is Depressed
description: The toll that a mothers or fathers depression takes on children has been well documented: Children of depressed parents may become anxious or withdrawn, may have trouble regulating their emotions or dealing with challenges, and may develop behavior problems or even become depressed themselves.

title: DNA Test Indicates Camel-to-Human Transmission of MERS
description: In the clearest evidence yet that the MERS virus can be passed directly from camels to humans, genetic sequencing has shown that a 44-year-old Saudi man who died of Middle East Respiratory Syndrome in November had a strain virtually identical to that in one of the camels in his herd, researchers said on Wednesday.

title: Moving On by Moving Around
description: Caregiving is a delicate dance, with a gradual shift in who is leading and who is following. One partner is, often, a frail, widowed mother, upended by the loss of her husband and living in the family home, too big, costly and difficult to maintain.

title: D-Day, 70 Years Later: A Frenchman Says, Merci
description: To the Editor:

title: Lennon Manuscripts Go for Nearly $3 Million in Auction
description: More than 100 John Lennon manuscripts  including short stories, poems and line drawings  have sold for $2.9 million, more than double the pre-sale estimate, at Sothebys in New York, Reuters reported.

title: Clintons Hectic Pace Acts as Retort to Health Fears
description: It was roughly 7 a.m. the day after Hillary Rodham Clinton had left her job as secretary of state. She had been up for a while and called a friend. O.K., Im rested! Mrs. Clinton told her friend.

title: Wheelies: The Audi Flagship Edition
description: A roundup of motoring news from the web:

title: Living With Cancer: Chronic, Not Cured
description: At the end of yoga sessions for cancer patients, we are told to say to ourselves, I am whole, healed and healthy in this and every moment. Perversely, since in yoga we express aspirations as if they were already so, the sentence reminds me of people who congratulate me on being cancer free. Stable disease often goes unrecognized.

title: Listen Up | The Smooth, Psychedelic Sounds of Glass Animals
description: Dave Bayley, the frontman for the quirky new Oxford, England-based band Glass Animals, says his original life plan was to become a doctor. In fact, Bayley insisted on finishing his degree in medicine at Kings College London before officially forming Glass Animals with three of his high school friends, Drew MacFarlane, Edmund Irwin-Singer and Joe Seaward, in 2012. It was a second beginning of sorts: Bayley had published some of the quartets demos on the Internet in 2010, but had removed them almost immediately when they proved too popular. People started getting in touch, says Bayley. We didnt know what it was like to be in a band. We didnt know anyone in a band at all, so we freaked out and took everything off the Internet.

title: The Fault in the Cobalt Ignition Switch
description: Diagram of the faulty metal pin that led to the G.M. recall of 2.6 million Chevy Cobalts.

title: Statements on Shooting in Canada
description: A witness and spokesman for the Royal Canadian Mounted Police described the scene on Wednesday night after three police officers were killed by an armed man still at large in Moncton, New Brunswick.

title: S.E.C. Chief Offers Rules to Govern Fast Trading
description: Updated, 7:38 p.m. | The stock market has transformed in the last decade into a place dominated by high-speed traders zapping orders to many exchanges, while regulators have been slow to react.

title: In Terms of Fans, the Heat Have Already Beaten the Spurs
description: Some of the commentary around the N.B.A. finals assumes that most Americans are rooting for the Spurs to beat the Heat. That makes sense. The Spurs are a likable group, with an older core of players perhaps chasing a last title. And theyre trying to dethrone a team that was built in large part on big-name free agents, including one who took his talents to South Beach.

title: Abstract Painters Afterlife, Reborn
description: Raymond Spillenger, who died in November at the age of 89, was among the very last of the first- and second-generation Abstract Expressionists. There cant be many others remaining, and few more obscure than Mr. Spillenger, who left scant traces. Some of his paintings hang  or have hung  at the Hirshhorn Museum in Washington, at the Contemporary Arts Museum in Houston and at the Walker Art Center in Minneapolis, and his name is mentioned in a few of the reference books. Thats about it. Mr. Spillengers reputation, or lack of one, is a reminder that the great art movements rise and then fall  with Abstract Expressionism eased aside by Pop, in turn overtaken by Super-Realism, Minimalism and all the other isms  and that from any one moment, often only a handful of names survive, some for good reason, some just from luck or self-promotion.

title: Before Arrest, a Long String of Violent Acts
description: Just before dawn on Wednesday, a man thought by the police to be Daniel St. Hubert sat on a bench in a Chelsea subway station. Two weeks before, Mr. St. Hubert had been released from a five-year term in prison for trying to strangle his mother with an electrical cord.

title: Deutsche Bank Warns Investors on Currency Investigation
description: LONDON  Deutsche Bank warned investors on Thursday that continuing investigations by financial regulators into potential manipulation of the $5-trillion-a-day currency markets could have a material financial effect on the bank.

title: G.M. Internal Investigation Report
description: The results of an investigation overseen by Anton R. Valukas, a former United States attorney, into the companys handling of a defective ignition switch.

title: Dither, a Guitar Quartet, to Play at the Noguchi Museum
description: When the Misers not out scouring the city on your behalf for all things cheap, hes been known to do a little pickin on the guitar, an instrument he was inspired to adopt as a teenager, predictably enough, by the great Jimi Hendrix. But the Miser was much less interested than his peers in learning Hendrixs soulful solos by rote and much more taken with how he made music out of sonic mistakes  feedback, static, effects  and a general irreverence toward proper technique.

title: Obama on G.I. Release at Group of Seven
description: President Obama said he makes no apologies for seeking the release of Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl in a prisoner swap with the Taliban and defended the exchange, which has dogged him on his European trip.

title: Image of the Day: June 5
Today in Small Business: Women in Manufacturing
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: The Biggest Champion of a Sprint-T-Mobile Deal: SoftBanks Chief
description: Sprint and T-Mobile have seemingly, inexorably been heading toward a merger agreement for more than a year. And such a deal has had no more outspoken advocate than Masayoshi Son, the Japanese billionaire who controls Sprint.

title: Bergdahl Is Said to Have History of Leaving Post
description: WASHINGTON  A classified military report detailing the Armys investigation into the disappearance of Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl in June 2009 says that he had wandered away from assigned areas before  both at a training range in California and at his remote outpost in Afghanistan  and then returned, according to people briefed on it.

title: Homecoming Queen
description: As party tricks go, Jennifer Lopez has the best and most effective one: Regardless of her milieu, she comes off as if shes slumming. Making records and having songs on the radio? Thats not something she appears interested in doing particularly often, even though shes welcomed when she does. Making movies? Here and there, sure, but nothing notably great in years. Appearing on television? On American Idol, she had twice the wattage of anyone else around her.

title: Australia Doesnt Seem So Far Away
description: Here is the choice: a bottle of brown HP sauce, with Londons Houses of Parliament in sky blue on the label and a secret recipe (tomatoes, tamarind, dates, molasses, malt vinegar, mysterious spices) dating from the late 19th century, or a ramekin of mayonnaise laced with a house-made sambal of birds-eye chiles, fish sauce and palm sugar.

title: The Triple Crown Eleven
description: Horse racing fans are used to the disappointment. Eleven times a horse has come into the Belmont Stakes having won the first two legs of the Triple Crown in the years since Affirmed captured the last one in 1978. Eleven times, it didnt happen. Each came with such possibility, and each left with heartbreak. When Spectacular Bid was outgunned down the stretch by Coastal in 1979, no one knew the drumbeat of failure that was ahead, that would become the unofficial background music of the Belmont.

title: Scottish Independence Debate Will Reach Edinburgh Fringe Festival
description: When David Bowie was named best British male solo artist at the Brit Awards in February, his acceptance speech, read on his behalf by Kate Moss, included the plea Scotland, stay with us, and he thus entered the divisive public debate over Scottish independence, which will come to a vote in September. Mr. Bowies phrase is the inspiration for All Back to Bowies, a freewheeling and decidedly political presentation by a group of Scottish artists, including David Greig and Cora Bissett, that is planned for this summer at the annual Edinburgh Festival Fringe. The show will include poetry, music and more in a variety format that will be different at each performance.

title: Barra Addresses G.M. Employees
description: The General Motors chief executive, Mary T. Barra, presents the findings of an internal investigation into the companys faulty ignition switches.

title: Jessye Norman: By the Book
description: The singer and author of Stand Up Straight and Sing! cried when she read Marian Andersons autobiography, My Lord, What a Morning: She blessed this earth by walking upon it.

title: Al Jazeera Journalists Speak From Behind Bars in Cairo
description: Speaking to reporters during a recess in their trial in Cairo on Thursday, two Al Jazeera journalists, wearing prison whites and shouting from inside a cage, denounced a prosecutors claims that they had facilitated terrorism and sought the downfall of the Egyptian state by reporting on current events before their arrest last year.

title: Maria Sharapova in French Open Final Again; Another Phenom Awaits
description: PARIS  It had almost become routine. Maria Sharapova was in the French Open semifinals again. Maria Sharapova forgot how to serve again. Maria Sharapova lost the first set again.

title: Year-End Roundup, 2013-14 | Language Arts, Journalism and the Arts
description: This week, we are looking back at all the lesson plans we published during the 2013-14 school year.

title: BNP Paribas Executive May Leave in Deal With Regulator
description: Under pressure from the United States authorities, the giant French bank BNP Paribas is considering cutting ties to one of its most senior executives, a rare concession that points to the severity of an investigation into the banks dealings with Sudan and Iran.

title: The Dangers of Brain-Speak
description: The brain is a powerful thing. Not the organ itself  though of course its powerful, too  but the word. Including it in explanations of human behavior might make those explanations sound more legitimate  and that might be a problem.

title: Dunford, Commander in Afghanistan, Is Picked to Lead Marine Corps
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama is nominating Gen. Joseph F. Dunford Jr., the commander of American and allied forces in Afghanistan, to lead the Marine Corps as commandant, the Defense Department said Thursday.

title: Australia, the World Cups Unluckiest Country
description: Among the thousands of draws that Australia could have received, its actual first-round grouping is the worst one possible.

title: Countdown to 2014 World Cup in Brazil: Day 7
description: The 2014 World Cup begins next Thursday, when Brazil plays Croatia in the opening match. Reporters and editors for The Times will count down to the start of the tournament each day with a short capsule of news and interesting tidbits.

title: Titillation or Illumination on The Timess New Sin Beat?
description: Mosi Secrets new beat  sin in New York City  has already resulted in a big spread in last Sundays Metropolitan section, an articlein The New York Observer and a lot of Twitter traffic.

title: Group of 7 Leaders on Russia
description: President Obama and Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain said Russia will face tougher sanctions from group members if President Vladimir V. Putin refuses to work with Ukraines new government.

title: To Some, Taliban Prisoners Are Gitmos Most Famous Five
description: WASHINGTON  They have in recent days become known as The Dream Team, the Taliban Five and the Crown Jewels of the captives held in the military prison in Guantnamo Bay, Cuba.

title: Brazil Posts Double Win with Simultaneous Soy Boom and Deforestation Drop
description: Brazil is considered a front runner as it hosts the World Cup, but on the long-troubled boundary between its agricultural frontier and the Amazon rain forest the country is already a big winner, according to a paper being published in the journal Science on Friday. Just savor this line for starters:

title: Play About Lester Bangs to Get World Premiere
description: The world premiere of How to Be a Rock Critic, a play based on the life and words of the influential music writer Lester Bangs, will cap off the 2014-15 season at Center Theater Group in Culver City, Calif.

title: Mexico, the World Cups Luckiest Country
description: Mexico finished far behind the United States in the two rivals World Cup qualifying group  and made the tournament only because the United States scored late in a match it did not need to win.

title: Burwell Wins Confirmation as Secretary of Health
description: WASHINGTON  The Senate on Thursday confirmed the nomination of Sylvia Mathews Burwell to be secretary of health and human services, which will make her responsible for delivering health insurance to more than one-third of all Americans.

title: Newest Cabinet Member Is Never Far From Her Roots
description: HINTON, W.Va.  When President Bill Clinton had thrashed out his first difficult budget with advisers, he turned to one of his younger aides for the final word, a seal of approval. Sylvia, are the folks in Hinton going to think weve done right by them? he said.

title: Germany Leans Toward Allowing Fracking
description: BERLIN  In a potential shift in German energy policy, the government of Chancellor Angela Merkel is preparing a framework that would let energy companies extract oil and natural gas by the controversial practice of hydraulic fracturing, or fracking.

title: There Is No Such Thing as a Clean Execution
description: Several commenters took exception to a line in a Taking Note post last week about Ohios moratorium on executions, which followed a series of botched attempts there and elsewhere to kill inmates using lethal injection.

title: Less Than Half of New York Citys Applicants for Pre-K Get Their Top-Choice School
description: Fewer than half of New York City children seeking a free prekindergarten seat received one in their top-choice public school for the next school year, Mayor Bill de Blasio said on Thursday.

title: Aquino on Chinas Move in Disputed Seas
description: President Benigno S. Aquino III of the Philippines criticized China for moving ships capable of reclaiming land around the disputed Spratly Islands in the South China Sea.

title: International Criminal Court to Focus on Sex Crimes
description: THE HAGUE  Alarmed by the growing evidence of the abuse of women during conflicts, the chief prosecutor of the International Criminal Court has pledged to step up the courts investigation and prosecution of sexual and gender-based crimes, including in cases that may involve offenses other than explicit physical brutality.

title: Senators Reach Accord Easing Worries Over Veterans Health Measure
description: WASHINGTON  In the wake of a revelations that officials at veterans hospitals across the country have been manipulating patients appointment times by creating secret waiting lists, two senators reached a bipartisan accord on Thursday to give authority to the acting Veterans Affairs secretary to fire senior officials and to expand access for veterans who do not live near medical facilities or have experienced long waits.

title: Wedding Q. & A.
description: Addressing an Unwelcome Split

title: In the Belmont Stakes, a Rested Commanding Curve
description: Terry Finley is a West Point graduate who served as an Army captain and an airborne Ranger. He began forming horse racing partnerships under the name West Point Thoroughbreds in 1991. Experience has taught him to cope with pressure and strip emotion from decisions.

title: When Brides Were Often Teenagers
description: The Times has converted all of its 1964 issues into a digitized, searchable format. Each week, The Upshot will unearth an item from 50 years ago and put it in the light of today. Study Finds College Girl Weds Later appeared on June 1 and can be seen in its original format on TimesMachine.)

title: Modern Love | Beyond Years
description: Tim and Sarah McEown never saw their 22-year age difference as an obstacle in their relationship, until Tim had a heart attack.

title: Company Fined $21 Million for Selling Parts to Iran
description: A unit of Fokker Technologies of the Netherlands, a leading aerospace company and Pentagon contractor, has agreed to pay $21 million in penalties to settle accusations that it repeatedly violated American sanctions on sales of aircraft parts to Iran and Sudan, the United States government announced Thursday.

title: The Way They Were
description: Pierre Berg responds to a new film about his consuming yet caustic relationship with Yves Saint Laurent.

title: The Challenges of Negotiating With Goliaths
description: At the most recent meeting of the She Owns It business group, the owners talked about negotiating with bigger businesses. Deirdre Lord, who owns the Megawatt Hour, has been negotiating with several large potential clients. She wondered whether the process is particularly challenging only for smaller companies just starting out.

title: In a Small Bag, She Packed All Our Hopes (Updated With Podcast)
description: UPDATED: You can now hear this essay read by the actor Harry Lennix in Modern Love: The Podcast. Look for the play button below or subscribe on iTunes or Google Play Music.

title: A Slowly Roasted Fish to Serve With Portuguese White Wines
description: Sometimes I take the What if? approach to cooking and have had more successes than errors. A few weeks ago I decided to roast some stunningly fresh ocean perch whole. But what if, instead of my usual hot-roasting method, I wrapped the fish tightly in parchment and put it in a slow oven? I was risking $18 worth of fish and the prospect of takeout for dinner. I guessed that the fish, about two pounds, might need an hour and reasoned that succulence might define the end result.

title: NYT Sports E-mail Signup
description: Sign up for NYT Sports, a regular digest of news, highlights and context from New York Times staff.

title: Staying True to Native Grapes
description: Of all the historical wine-producing countries, Portugal is the most overlooked.

title: More Fathers Who Stay at Home by Choice
description: Otis Johnson said he never fathomed becoming a stay-at-home father. But soon after he was laid off from his factory job in 2009, his first of two children arrived. And even when his job prospects improved, he made the calculation that millions of mothers had made before him: By the time I get a paycheck, it all goes to day care, or I can stay home and raise my own children.

title: This Weekend: Three Original Series
description: If youre in the mood to watch some TV this weekend, be sure to check out the second season of Orange Is the New Black on Netflix, the new comedy Spooked on Hulu or the new drama Power on Starz.

title: Susan Spencer-Wendel, Memoirist About Living and Losing Life, Dies at 47
description: Susan Spencer-Wendel, a former newspaper reporter who wrote a best-selling memoir about living life to the fullest after learning she had an incurable muscle-wasting disease  and wrote most of it on a smartphone with her right thumb  died on Wednesday at her home in West Palm Beach, Fla. She was 47.

title: Sweden Returns Ancient Andean Textiles to Peru
description: One of the worlds most precious troves of looted antiquities  brilliantly colored burial shrouds from an Andean civilization that flourished a thousand years before Columbus  is on its way back to Peru for a ceremonial handover in Lima.

title: Bodies Politic
description: While on a state visit to Warsaw to mark the 25th anniversary of the end of communism in Poland, President Obama took time out to pump some iron in a hotel gym  though not a lot of it. A leaked video showing him grunting and grimacing under the weight of what appeared to be a modest set of dumbbells drew attention from observers who seemed underwhelmed.

title: In Wake of Telecom Consolidation, Few Deals Are Left
description: Telecommunications bankers are running out of deals to pitch.

title: Texas Republicans May Endorse Gay Reparative Therapy
description: Over the past few years the march toward marriage equality has been slow and steady, and the reality-based community has recognized that there is no stopping or reversing the process.

title: Stuyvesant Town Lenders Move to Prevent Investor From Seizing the Property
description: Despite the turmoil that has racked Manhattans largest apartment complex over the past eight years, Stuyvesant Town-Peter Cooper Village is still an object of desire for speculators, investors and the tenants who make it their home.

title: The Gun Report: June 5, 2014
description: When most people think of Google Glass, they imagine Sergey Brin bopping around town sporting wiry, futuristic spectacles that make phone calls, go online and record everything you see. A growing number of people equate the new technology with concerns over privacy violationso much so that Glass pioneers, who are easily identified by their headsets, have been discriminated against in public settings. Few equate the burgeoning technology with guns. But that may change.

title: Iran Offers a Window to the West
description: Given a chance, and a week, to visit Iran, John Moore took to the road in central Iran to see daily life in a place that has opened a bit to the West.

title: Upfront Market for TV Ad Sales Begins to Move
description: Madison Avenue and big television networks are starting to make deals for the purchase of commercial time ahead of the 2014-15 season in what is known as the upfront market.

title: A Hollywood Sexual-Abuse Suit Is Dropped
description: LOS ANGELES  Michael Egan, the accuser in a series of Hollywood sex-abuse lawsuits, has dropped his complaint against David Neuman, a former Disney television executive.

title: The Rush to Demonize Sgt. Bergdahl
description: Four months ago, Senator John McCain said he would support the exchange of five hard-core Taliban leaders for the release of Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl. I would support, he told CNN. Obviously Id have to know the details, but I would support ways of bringing him home and if exchange was one of them I think that would be something I think we should seriously consider.

title: Hard-Boiled
description: Halfway through Mr. Mercedes, billed as Stephen Kings first hard-boiled detective novel, a fedora makes an appearance. Its a winking gift to the retired cop hero, Bill Hodges, from his first client, Janey Patterson. Every private dick should have a fedora he can pull down to one eyebrow, she tells him. Hodges tries it on for size, as do Jerome (his teenage Watson) and even Janey herself. No one seems to hang on to it for long. Then, at a critical point in the story, it disappears in a flash.

title: Man on a Mission
description: Jimmy Carter may be the most pious man ever to have occupied the White House. He was born again at age 11 and has taught Sunday school for decades. His penchant for godliness has ranged from prophetic  he was most likely the only businessman in 1950s Plains, Ga., to refuse to join the White Citizens Council  to priggish: As president, he once told civil servants who were living in sin that they ought to get married.

title: The Poster Child for Menopause
description: When Sandra Tsing Loh started her book The Madwoman in the Volvo, her aim was to capture the experience of what she calls the triple-M generation: the menopausal, middle-aged mother.

title: Tanaka (9-1) Stops the As, and the Yankees Slide
description: Early in the season, even when the Yankees starting rotation was at the vanguard of their success, there was always an extra jolt of excitement when Masahiro Tanaka took the mound.

title: Mary Anthony, Choreographer and Teacher of Modern Dance, Dies at 97
description: Mary Anthony, a modern dancer celebrated since the 1940s for the lyricism and drama in her choreography but even better known as a teacher of some of American dances leading performers and choreographers, died on Saturday at her home in Manhattan. She was 97.

title: Peter Glaser, Who Envisioned Space Solar Power, Dies at 90
description: Peter Glaser, who in the late 1960s envisioned a way to harness limitless solar power in space and transmit it for use on Earth via invisible microwaves  a notion so intriguing that the government spent $20 million studying it, only to conclude that it was too complex and expensive  died on May 29 at his home in Lexington, Mass. He was 90.

title: Harvard Confirms Book Is Bound in Human Skin
description: Scientists at Harvard have confirmed that a 19th-century French treatise in the universitys libraries is almost surely bound in human skin, thus ending months of uncertainty and setting off a torrent of online Hannibal Lecter (get it?) jokes.

title: Accident Prone
description: Elizabeth McCracken knows how loss can melt reality, forever altering a persons sense of time. In An Exact Replica of a Figment of My Imagination, a deeply affecting memoir about the stillbirth of her son, she tells us that she sought to write a book that acknowledges that life goes on but that death goes on, too, that a person who is dead is a long, long story. In her new collection, McCracken gives brilliantly splintered life to just that kind of story: These pages are filled with sudden deaths and lingering ghosts, some passings that are imminent, others that are uncertain or inferred.

title: An Education
description: Translated books make up only about 3 percent of titles published in America, so Im ecstatic to see the Korean writer Kyung-sook Shins rising popularity. Her previously translated novel, Please Look After Mom, hit the New York Times best-seller list and is now available in more than 20 countries.

title: An Inner Life
description: What Is Visible, a fictional biography, opens with two disparate glimpses of one life. A year before her death, elderly Laura Bridgman meets a busy-handed child named Helen Keller. Next we witness a much earlier historic encounter when Laura, at 12, meets Charles Dickens. The elder Laura is grumpy; the adolescent loops between self-aggrandizement and epic self-doubt. Were asked to forgive all, because of circumstances more dire than any invented by Dickens or borne by Keller. As a baby, Laura suffered an illness that took her sight, hearing, and senses of smell and taste.

title: REPLAY
description: With an eye on todays events, looking anew at historical sports photographs from The New York Times.

title: Asia Society Museum Director to Lead Hirshhorn
description: Melissa Chiu, the Australian-born, veteran director of Asia Society Museum in New York has been chosen to lead the Hirshhorn Museum and Sculpture Garden in Washington, a Smithsonian division that is trying to regain its footing after a series of bruising fights over finances, leadership and direction.

title: Snatching Atari Back From the Grave, Again
description: Its a fitting symbol for Atari that the most attention it has received in years occurred when one of its products, a notorious flop, was excavated from a landfill in April.

title: Citizen Koch and the Politics of Big Money
description: Part of the impact of Citizen Koch comes from juxtaposing average Americans with the moneyed interests that grip todays political process. When we see a Republican in Wisconsin weighing her dissatisfaction with her party and her stance on abortion, its an inspiring sight of a citizen at work, grappling in good faith with the situation at hand. Its a world away from the documentarys portrayal of Americans for Prosperity, the conservative advocacy group funded by the billionaires David and Charles Koch.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Welcome to NYT Now, the new app from The New York Times. (Download us for iPhone.)

title: Burning Woman
description: If menopause just made you want to kill someone, it wouldnt be so bad. The problem is, it makes you want to kill someone you love. And then it makes you want to love someone whos a complete and utter moron. And there you have it: the story of half the divorces in America.

title: Over There: Daughters of Liberty
description: ON A WARS FRONT LINE, FROM A WOMANS VIEW

title: A Passionate Symbol, Even Without the World Cup
description: In Waste Land, Lucy Walkers Oscar-nominated 2010 documentary, the Brazilian photographer Vik Muniz trekked around a garbage dump and collaborated with its workers in the name of art. It was topical, revelatory and inspirational. In This Is Not a Ball, directed by Mr. Muniz and Juan Rendn, the artist has another project  a piece for the 2014 World Cup (less than a week away!) involving 10,000 balls  but the process of documenting it only bogs down this film.

title: New Bug Found in Widely Used OpenSSL Encryption
description: Security experts are still trying to plug the hole left by Heartbleed,the bug found in the widely used OpenSSL encryption protocol, withsome 12,000 popular domains still vulnerable, according to AVG Virus Labs.

title: A Taste of Charleston, Old-School and New
description: Rain was falling in fits and starts on a late afternoon in downtown Charleston, and sodden azalea blossoms were scattered across the sidewalk along Queen Street.

title: Chic Stops in the Suburbs of La Paz, Bolivia
description: For the first time in a long time, La Paz is having a moment. And the center of the citys gentrification is now the Zona Sur  made up of four adjoining suburban neighborhoods  which sits 1,000 feet lower and is noticeably warmer than the far more visited colonial city center, a 15-minute taxi ride away. Pushed along by a culinary project from Claus Meyer, co-founder of Noma in Copenhagen, the well-heeled area has seen an influx of modern additions that the Andean city has long lacked.

title: For Kentile Floors Sign, Star of Brooklyn Skyline, the End Seems Near
description: The language of the plans recently approved by the New York City Buildings Department seems unambiguous:

title: World Cup Crib Sheet: Judging a Fans Soccer I.Q. by His Jargon
description: We continue our series of crib sheets designed to help readers watch the World Cup like a true fanatic  or at least sound like one. Learn the right phrases to yell at the screen while watching the matches.

title: Heaven and Earth, Sized to Grasp
description: Paper is the mother lode of the Morgan Library & Museum, and one of the great through lines of civilizations everywhere. Nearly every Morgan exhibition, whether of prints, drawings, rare books or musical scores, enlarges the understanding of paper as a means of expression, both personal and cultural. Right now, windows are being opened there by two delightfully focused exhibitions that center on artists using paper to different ends, in different centuries and parts of Europe.

title: A Star Client List and a Magic Touch
description: A valentine from one friend to another, Supermensch: The Legend of Shep Gordon is not entirely kidding about that title, or at least its tone. Directed by the comedian Mike Myers, this clubby documentary lauds the swellness and shrewdness of the talent manager Shep Gordon with the help of celebrities and the sunnily mellifluent subject himself.

title: On View | Henrik Vibskov, Fashions Renaissance Man, Showcases His Fine Art
description: With the Paris mens collections just a few weeks away, the Danish fashion designer Henrik Vibskov is busy at work. But its not just clothing thats on his mind. When he spoke to T, he was busy putting the finishing touches on Vibskovski;72 II, his new solo exhibition at the Cologne art space Ruttkowski;68. Hed also submitted the first proposals for a collaboration with his fellow Nordic multihyphenate Bjrk, a supersize restaging of her album Medlla. And then theres the fragrance hes developing, the upcoming art exhibitions in Moscow and Seoul, a set design for this months Roskilde Festival and a handful or so of other projects in progress listed on the pink sticky notes on his computer.

title: At a Wedding, You Are What You Wear
description: Im going to a wedding this summer, which means once again I am dealing with the sleeve problem. You ladies of a certain age know what I am talking about. There comes a time in your life, even if you have a personal trainer and are taking your meals in the gym, when the muscles and skin on your inner upper arms give up. Its as if theyre saying: Oh, the hell with it. Wheres the bar? Theyre just hanging off the bone, exhausted.

title: Pictures of the Day: South Africa and Elsewhere
description: Photos from South Africa, Israel, South Korea and France.

title: At Museum Born of Politics, New Chief Faces Economics
description: A little over a year ago, El Museo del Barrio, the oldest museum in the United States devoted to Latino art, had the equivalent of a nervous breakdown in public.

title: Pining for a Burnished Time, Long Ago and Far Away
description: As in politics, so in art: Some movements want to hasten us into the future, some want to turn back the clocks to a supposedly better time. The Pre-Raphaelite Legacy: British Art and Design, a small exhibition at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, is a modest introduction to one of the 19th centurys most interesting backward-looking groups.

title: A Few Carcasses Here, a Few Landscapes There
description: The lines between museums and galleries have become blurry, with major Chelsea dealers mounting scholarly, historical exhibitions. But it takes more than just great material to achieve a museum quality show, as you are reminded at the Paul Kasmin Gallery exhibition of 16 paintings by the Belarus-born Expressionist Chaim Soutine (1893-1943).

title: The Parent Trap
description: At the end of a long birthday party, my son put his hands around my nephews neck. (The boys are 7 and 4.) My brother-in-law yelled at my son before my husband had a chance to address the situation. My husband demanded we leave immediately.
