The decision will conclude a two-week contest between Tyson and Pilgrims Pride, both giants in the poultry industry.

title: Meanwhile, On the Health Front
description: You still encounter people claiming that Obamacare has been a disaster, that more people have lost insurance than gained it, etc., etc. But the reality is that it has already made a big dent in the number of uninsured; and the quality of insurance has gone up, too, because canceled policies were canceled because they offered little real protection.

title: Merck Bids $3.8 Billion for an Edge in Hepatitis
description: Updated, 8:32 p.m. | Merck will buy the biotechnology company Idenix Pharmaceuticals for $3.85 billion in an effort to bolster its arsenal of potential drugs in the competitive arena of hepatitis C treatments, the companies announced on Monday.

title: Disappointed Immigration Applicants Sue Canada
description: Lili Feng and her husband first drew up the plan for their familys future in March 2010. Their goal, like that of thousands of other wealthy Chinese, was to move via the investor immigration program to Canada, which they believed offered the best combination of public safety and education for their three daughters.

title: The Shift to Safer Chip-and-PIN Credit Cards
The World According to Renzo
description: Paris is for lovers and New York for dreamers, but when youre a classy canine accustomed to lifes finer things, getting there can be for the dogs.

title: From DigiFest to the Tonys, Fashions Major Missed Opportunities
description: For an industry that has made something of an art out of leveraging events  from the World Cup to the Super Bowl, the Oscars to Cannes  this weekend was, it seems to me, a shocking lost opportunity for fashion. The industry missed out on both DigiFest NYC, haven of all things young and up-and-coming, and the Tony Awards, the ultimate high-culture draw. In both cases, it was a striking, and arguably shortsighted, absence.

title: Q. and A. With Stuart Elliott
description: Stuart Elliott, the advertising columnist, answers questions from readers each week. Questions can be sent to stuarte@nytimes.com.

title: Accounts and People of Note in the Advertising Industry
description: Lee Allan joined Gage, Minneapolis, as the agencys design director. She succeeds Kenny Friedman, who left to join Flor, Chicago, as executive creative director. Ms. Allan had most recently been creative director at Go East Design, St. Paul.

title: Q. and A.: Yang Yong on Documenting the Damage to Chinas Rivers
description: As a geologist for a state-owned company, Yang Yong saw firsthand both the beauty of Chinas rivers and the damage done to them by the countrys rapid development. In 1992, he set out to document the degradation of Chinas waterways on his own, and has since widely explored rivers across China, particularly in the south and west of the country. His photographs of the Jinsha River, the Yangtze Rivers upper reach, which flows through Qinghai, Sichuan and Yunnan Provinces, show vividly how that critical waterway has been harmed by the development of mining and hydropower. In an interview, he discussed what led him to this line of research, what his exploration of Chinas rivers has revealed and how rapid development affects people living along these waterways.

title: A Remark in France Is Assailed as Racist
description: PARIS  Activists vowed on Monday to file a criminal complaint against the founder of the far-right National Front, Jean-Marie Le Pen, after he used an apparently anti-Semitic pun about ovens to dismiss one of his Jewish critics.

title: No Alarm Before Waters Rose, Say Survivors of Dam Flood
description: On Sunday evening, two busloads of engineering students on a field trip to the hilly northern state of Himachal Pradesh stopped on the national highway between the towns of Shimla and Manali, struck by the beauty of the Beas River, nestled between the hills.

title: An Ancient Form of Wrestling Fades in Mumbai
description: MUMBAI  At 5 a.m. five days a week, 15 traditional Indian wrestlers, known as pehlwan, meet at Mahatma Phule Akhara, one of the largest gyms dedicated to the sport left in Mumbai.

title: Whats News in Washington: Obama Turns to Student Debt
description: GoodMondaymorning from a cloudy Washington.

title: Found Poem Favorite | metallicity
description: This poem, by Hannah Llorin, is one of the 11 winners of our fifth annual Found Poem Student Contest. It comes from a Science article, The Archaeology of the Stars.

title: At Belize Lodge, Lessons in Coffee and Cocktails
description: Aspiring chocolatiers, baristas and mixologists may find inspiration in Belize this summer.

title: Foreign Mergers Expand Ranks at Big Law Firms
description: The number of lawyers at the countrys largest law firms rose last year, but the increase was largely because of mergers with foreign firms, not domestic hiring, according to a new survey from The National Law Journal.

title: Family Dollar Adopts Plan to Keep Carl Icahn at Bay
description: Family Dollar Stores has battened down the hatches days after the activist investor Carl C. Icahn declared the discount chain his latest target.

title: Understanding Ed OBannons Suit Against the N.C.A.A.
description: In the court of public opinion, the N.C.A.A. has been on trial for quite some time now.

title: Analog Devices to Buy Smaller Chip Maker for $2.45 Billion
description: Analog Devices, a chip maker that supplies technology for cars, wind turbines, medical devices, video surveillance and smartphones, has agreed to buy the Hittite Microwave Corporation, a smaller rival, for about $2.45 billion in cash.

title: Ad Age Campaign Offers a Look at Roads Not Taken
description: A leading advertising trade publication is promoting itself by enlisting some well-known industry executives to suggest the rewards of readership.

title: The Life-Hack Bias
description: Life hacking  the practice of optimizing ones home, time and behavior for maximum efficiency  has been a topic of popular discussion for long enough that it now inspires mockery. Witness a recent LinkedIn article that advocates (facetiously, one assumes) the interesting lifehack of using a wooden spoon to block areas of ones computer screen from view. While it is too early to talk about the long-term effects of the spoon, writes Joachim Bauernberger, it is bound to disrupt our relationship with technology as we know it.

title: The Nuts and Bolts of Automotive Photography
description: Photographs of cars are easy to take for granted. Every time a new model comes out, it is accompanied by a bombardment of images not unlike the wartime dumping of propaganda leaflets. Theyre everywhere.

title: 15 Crazy Facts About BuzzFeed That Will Totally Blow Your Mind
description: Ts culture issue looks at the numbers behind Jonah Perettis empire of cat pics and other click bait. Here, some of the highlights  presented, naturally, in the style of BuzzFeed.

title: By the Numbers | Thanks for Sharing
description: Even if youve never taken its Which Disney Princess Are You? quiz or scanned a listicle like 21 Smells 90s Girls Will Never Forget, you are likely aware that BuzzFeed is the mother lode of goofy, meme-y click bait. Its nearly 400 daily posts bring in over 130 million unique visitors a month  the kind of traffic coveted by any website, even if the means are often derided. Another enviable asset? BuzzFeeds $46 million in venture capital. But the eight-year-old sites founder, the viral-content guru Jonah Peretti, 40, isnt satisfied with just being the king of workday distractions. With the help of editor in chief Ben Smith, BuzzFeed has been making a play for serious journalism, with political scoops and breaking news stories percolating inside offices named after Internet-famous cats. With its profit margins still a closely guarded secret, its hard to know what the payoff will be, but the value is in the clicking.

title: Lisa Feldmans Yogurt and White Bean Ranch Dressing
description: Lisa Feldman, the director of culinary services atthe schools division of the food services company Sodexo, understands that where there is ranch dressing, there are kids who will eat vegetables. Lisa is working to devise menus for schools that meet or exceed the Department of Agricultures Healthier US Schools Challenge requirements. With a deep understanding of the ingredients that school lunch programs have to work with, she developed a white bean and yogurt salad dressing base. The mixture will make a dressing that has much more nutritional value, considerably less sodium, and none of the additives in the long ingredient list on a bottle of commercial ranch dressing.

title: White Bean and Yogurt Green Goddess
description: Ive always had a weakness for green goddess dressing. It has that creamy appeal that ranch dressing also has, with the heady flavor and fragrance of fresh tarragon, which is the key to its flavor. The base is modeled on the bean and yogurt salad dressing base that the Sodexo chef Lisa Feldman has introduced to school lunch programs. Serve it as a dip with spring vegetables like artichokes and asparagus or with crispy salads.

title: Yogurt and Bean Dressing With Thai Flavors
description: This version of Lisa Feldmans yogurt and bean dressing is based on her slightly sweet Thai ginger dressing. Sriracha sauce, Ive noticed, has become the go-to condiment for many chefs. It contributes just enough spice and pungency to the mix (you can add more if you want more heat). I like to serve this with grains, and as a dip or a dressing for crispy salads.

title: Yogurt and Bean Dressing With Cilantro and Lime
description: One of my favorite variations on Lisa Feldmans bean and yogurt dressing base is her cilantro-lime dressing. Blend cilantro into just about any dressing, pure, sauce or soup, and Ill be there with a spoon. I use a little more cilantro and lime juice than Lisa calls for, to achieve a pale speckled-green mixture that is slightly zingy; add a small green chile if you want a bit more spice.

title: Bean and Yogurt Caesar Salad Dressing
description: Lisa Feldmans bean and yogurt base is a great solution for a creamy Caesar salad dressing if you dont like the idea of using a raw egg. Parmesan is added to the mix, and I also use an anchovy fillet, which you can omit if you wish. But the anchovy and the Parmesan are what make this resemble a Caesar dressing.

title: Time Inc. Stock Falls in Its Debut
description: Shares of Time Inc., the magazine company that began trading Monday after being spun off from Time Warner, got off to a rough start, falling nearly 7 percent before recovering somewhat.

title: Outsmarting Breast Cancer With Evolving Therapies
description: Over the past few decades, changes in the treatment of breast cancer amount to a revolution in patient care. And its not over yet. There was a time when the standard approach was a radical mastectomy, which involved removal of not just the breast, but all the lymph nodes in the armpit and underlying muscles in the chest wall. This approach has been replaced by less extensive surgery that, through decades of clinical trials, has proved to be equally effective at treating patients, as well as safer and less disfiguring. Even simple mastectomies, in which most nodes and the muscles were left intact, have become far less common. Dr. J. Dirk Iglehart, director of the Susan F. Smith Center for Womens Cancers at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute in Boston, estimated that he now performs a tenth of the number of mastectomies than when he entered the field in the 1970s.

title: Food Curated | The Mandarins Tea Room
description: At the Mandarins Tea Room, Timothy Hsu walks tea novices through the ancient Chinese art of tea appreciation.

title: The Mandarins Tea Room
description: Liza de Guia is a video journalist whose blog, Food. Curated., profiles people who produce interesting food in New York and beyond.

title: Photographing a Difficult Love in South Africa
description: Zanele Muholi has been an activist using photography to champion the rights of black lesbians and transgender people in South Africa.

title: What a Merged Sprint and T-Mobile Would Look Like
description: With Sprint and T-Mobile having agreed in principle on the terms of a deal that would see the third- and fourth-largest wireless carriers in the United States join forces, eyes are already turning to Washington, where regulators will have to assess whether a combined company would be good for consumers.

title: Today in Small Business: Should Your Data Be in the Cloud?
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: James Reigns, Despite Unrelenting Siege
description: It was a good day to be king, from a sun-drenched clay court at Roland Garros in Paris to a restoratively air-conditioned hard court in San Antonio. About 11 hours apart, Rafael Nadal and LeBron James demonstrated why they are the ruling monarchs of their time and possibly all time.

title: Ping-Pong Redux
description: Our challenge this week was proposed by Dan Bennett and Avery Pickford, who teach math at The Nueva School near San Francisco. Dan Bennett came up with the idea way back when he was a grade school student, and both Mr. Bennett and Mr. Pickford worked on developing it further for use in their classrooms.

title: President Bashar al-Assad of Syria Declares General Amnesty for Prisoners
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  President Bashar al-Assad of Syria issued a decree on Monday granting a general amnesty for all crimes except acts of terrorism, Syrian state television reported, raising tentative hopes among Syrians with relatives in detention.

title: Russians Find Few Barriers to Joining Ukraine Battle
description: ROSTOV-ON-DON, Russia  It was at a barbecue outside a city in southern Russia, this Russian war veteran recalled, that he and some friends met an envoy for the separatist rebels in eastern Ukraine. They were fighting for their families, the envoy said, against the neo-Nazis and ultranationalists who had seized power in Kiev in a February coup.

title: California Chromes Co-Owner Apologizes for His Outbursts
description: Two days after a nationally televised outburst about how fresh horses had deprived horse racing of a Triple Crown champion, Steve Coburn, a co-owner of California Chrome, apologized to those affiliated with the Belmont Stakes winner, Tonalist, and to the horse racing world.

title: Brazil on Edge as World Cup Exposes Rifts
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Brazils list of feats since ending authoritarian rule in the 1980s is as long as it is varied, including antipoverty programs pulling millions into the middle class, the democratic election of presidents who suffered indignities under the dictatorship and the surging growth of tropical agriculture to help feed the world.

title: Bang on a Can Teams Up With the Jewish Museum
description: The new-music collective Bang on a Can will begin a yearlong relationship with the Jewish Museum, the museum announced Monday, and neither institution is wasting time getting started.The first concert is a free performance on Tuesday by the Asphalt Orchestra, Bang on a Cans idiosyncratic marching band, as part of the Museum Mile Festival. The performance, outside the Jewish Museum on Fifth Avenue at 92nd Street, begins at 6 p.m.

title: Laundry App Start-Up Gets New Financing
description: The venture capital firm Canaan Partners has led a $10.5 million round in Washio, which makes an app for on-demand laundry and dry cleaning services, both companies said on Monday.

title: How G.M.s Lawyers Failed in Their Duties
description: In the aftermath of the savings and loan scandal, Judge Stanley Sporkin asked how a once-prominent financial institution could engage in a pattern of misconduct. Where were the professionals when these clearly improper transactions were being consummated? he asked.

title: Image of the Day: June 9
Talk of a Kinks Reunion Heats Up
description: The signals are mixed, but talk of a Kinks reunion, first hinted at in the British press in December, heated up over the weekend when Ray Davies, the groups singer and principal songwriter, told The Sunday Times of London that he had been discussing the possibility with his brother, Dave Davies. I met Dave only last week to talk about getting back together again, he told the paper. Although the two generally composed separately during the Kinks heyday, Ray Davies said that he would like to write some new songs with his brother.

title: Video of Mass Sexual Assault Taints Egypt Inauguration
description: CAIRO  A video showing a mass sexual assault on a nearly naked woman in the midst of inaugural celebrations for Egypts new president is testing his pledge to curb an epidemic of such attacks, with captured scenes of a police officer with a gun in his hand struggling against a crowd of men to extricate the victim.

title: Game of Thrones Recap: The Battle at Castle Black
description: Here be spoilers  and the worlds softest anvil.

title: Entertainment | The Dreamer
description: Richard Linklater had an idea to make a film about boyhood. All it would take was 12 years and a whole lot of thought about the meaning of time.

title: N.C.A.A. Settles One Video Game Suit for $20 Million as a Second Begins
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  The N.C.A.A. has reached a settlement to pay $20 million to current and former college athletes who sued over the use of their likenesses in video games, the league said Monday. The announcement came as a higher-profile video game lawsuit, filed by the former U.C.L.A. basketball star Ed OBannon, began in federal court here.

title: Detroit Automakers Pledge $26 Million to Help Save Citys Art
description: CHICAGO  The Detroit Institute of Arts announced Monday that the nations three major automakers would donate a combined $26 million to help save the citys art collection, bringing the city a step closer to completing a deal aimed at coming out of bankruptcy by fall.

title: Monday Motorsports: Ricciardo Breaks Through in Formula One
description: Daniel Ricciardo scored his first career victory in Formula One, passing Nico Rosberg with three laps to go in the Canadian Grand Prix in Montreal on Sunday. Ricciardos win was also the first this season for the Red Bull Infiniti team. His teammate, Sebastian Vettel, the defending series champion, collected third place behind Rosberg.

title: Audit Shows Extensive Medical Delays for Tens of Thousands of Veterans
description: More than 57,000 patients have been waiting more than three months for medical appointments at hospitals and clinics run by the Department of Veterans Affairs, and nearly 64,000 others have been enrolled in the system for a decade but have still not been seen by doctors despite their requests, according to a nationwide audit released Monday.

title: Greece Replaces Finance Minister in Cabinet Shuffle
description: ATHENS  Prime Minister Antonis Samaras of Greece on Monday replaced his finance minister as part of a sweeping government shuffle intended to re-energize his coalition after its weak performance in European Parliament elections last month.

title: How Black Turnout Could Decide Senate Control
description: Black voters will play an outsize role in this years fight for control of the Senate. Mississippi, Louisiana and Georgia are the three states where African-Americans represent the largest share of the population, and North Carolina isnt too far behind, at seventh on the list.

title: Listen Up | Sofia Coppolas Music Man Strikes Out on his Own
description: Thats the Blade Runner synth,' Brian Reitzell notes, pointing to the hulking 70s-era Yamaha CS-80 keyboard in a corner of his L.A. recording studio. And this is the Terry Riley organ,' he continues, brushing the keys on another vintage Yamaha, the YC-45-D, before moving on to a sleek 80s-era PPG Wave 2.2. I remember being 12 years old and playing a chord on this at Guitar Center in San Francisco, and feeling like I was being transported to heaven on Mars, he says. These three machines are but a few of the vintage instruments crammed into the room where Reitzell  one of todays pre-eminent film and TV soundtrack composers and music supervisors  creates his evocative scores. This is only a fraction of the things that I have, Reitzell adds. And theres nothing in here thats new!

title: Driver Charged in Crash Involving Tracy Morgan Had Not Slept in 24 Hours, Prosecutors Say
description: The Walmart driver whose truck collided with a van carrying the comedian Tracy Morgan and other performers had not slept for more than 24 hours before the crash, New Jersey prosecutors said on Monday.

title: Merger Market Shows Signs of Froth
description: The merger market is showing symptoms of overheating. Global deal volume is up sharply this year  up 63 percent according to Bernstein research and 71 percent by Thomson Reuters tally. Mondays announcements, meanwhile, hint at toppiness.

title: Bobby Jindals Bergdahl Questions, Answered
description: Gov. Bobby Jindal of Louisiana, one of a long list of Republican politicians who yearn for national office and who grab the national spotlight by pandering to the far right, received applause from fellow Republicans on Friday by attacking President Obama over the decision to trade five Taliban prisoners for Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl.

title: How Audra McDonald Won Six Tony Awards
description: On Sunday night, Audra McDonald won her sixth Tony Award for acting, more than any other performer. Her achievement is all the more remarkable in that she has worked in just nine Broadway productions since she first appeared in The Secret Garden two decades ago.

title: With Stay Lit, Writers Persevere in a Hostile World
description: Writing is scary. It is especially scary now, as advances shrink, publishersfight with Amazon, and thedeath of the novelis forecast with ever-increasing frequency. Its a time when it would make a lot of sense to quit  and a time when simply not quitting is becoming its own art form.

title: Antigovernment Obsession Preceded Las Vegas Shootings
description: LAS VEGAS  Before 6 on Sunday morning, just hours before they killed two police officers and a civilian in a display of antigovernment violence, Jerad and Amanda Miller left their two beloved cats with Kelley Fielder, the next-door neighbor with whom they had been staying. Ms. Miller, 22, promised to return later. Mr. Miller, 31, did not. He gave Ms. Fielder a tearful hug, and said, I got to do what I got to do.

title: Russia and Ukraine Meet on Natural Gas Pricing Dispute
description: BRUSSELS  Russian and Ukrainian officials failed to reach a solution earlyTuesdayto a dispute over energy that has exacerbated tensions and led to concerns about cutoffs of natural gas to the European Union.

title: 1972 Grateful Dead Film to Be Screened in Theaters
description: This years installment of an annual Meet-Up event for fans of the Grateful Dead will be a big-screen showing of a rare television recording the group made during its European tour in the spring of 1972. Fathom Events and Rhino Entertainment will present Grateful Dead Meet-Up at the Movies: Beat Club 4/21/72 at more than 360 movie theaters around the country on July 17.

title: Raw Food Families Provoke Powerful Reactions. Why?
description: In this era of organic, farm-to-table eating, its not surprising that raw food diets  that is, meals consisting solely of fresh fruits, vegetables, seeds, nuts and sprouted grains  would gain an ardent following among some families. I wrote about this trend, and children who subsist on entirely raw fare, in Growing Up on Raw Foods for the Well.

title: Using iPhotos Contact Sheet Feature to Save Paper
description: Q. In iPhoto 11 on OS X Mavericks, is there a way to print certain pictures in an album with their names and dates showing and have it print several photos per page, to save paper?

title: Malnutrition: Starving Children Lack Crucial Gut Bacteria
description: When children are starving, the bacteria that live in their intestines may determine whether they can be saved, scientists working in Bangladesh are reporting. And they say it may become imperative to find a way to give children bacteria as well as food.

title: Christies Chief of Staff Says He Knew Nothing About Idea to Close Lanes to Bridge
description: The chief of staff for Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey testified on Monday that he had no knowledge in September of the decision to close several traffic lanes to the George Washington Bridge.

title: Catfish Whiskers, pH Detectors, Help Track Prey
description: Japanese sea catfish have an unusual advantage when hunting in pitch-dark waters, a new study reports: Their whiskers can detect minute changes in the waters acidity.

title: Corruption Claims Cast Cloud on Qatars World Cup Bid
description: DOHA, Qatar  As far as the soccer-mad rulers of this wealthy emirate are concerned, the British are just being sore losers and bad sports with all their complaints about corruption, slave labor, an epidemic of worker deaths and, lets not forget, the extreme heat associated with Qatars successful 2022 World Cup bid.

title: Remixing the Two Dots Soundtrack
description: The makers of the Two Dots game have invited members of the public to remix its theme song.

title: The Male Disappearing Act
description: My husband disappeared 18 days ago.

title: 5 Sentenced in Russian Journalist Murder
description: Lawyers and the family of Anna Politkovskaya reacted to the court sentencing of five men convicted of killing the Russian journalist in 2006.

title: Do-Nothing Congress? These Members Did Something (Annual Reports)
description: Public approval of Congress has fallen to record lows. Members have introduced little legislation and passed even less. But a small but growing number of lawmakers have taken to explaining to constituents, in great detail, that they have indeed been doing something.

title: The Vulnerable Democratic Coalition
description: Responding to my Sunday column, which compared the Democratic Partys diverse presidential-level majority to fin-de-siecle Austria-Hungary and cast Hillary Clinton as the lone political figure capable of playing Emperor Franz Josef and holding the fractious imperium together, Jonathan Chait tweeted that the argument needed 3000 words to be remotely persuasive. Consider this post, then, an attempt to add some of the missing words, with a focus on the Democratic coalitions potential 2016 weaknesses more than Hillary Clintons unique role within the party (which Ill mention below, but think is mostly self-evident).

title: Rosetta Gettys Art-Inspired Sophomore Collection
description: Today, Rosetta Getty will present her sophomore collection to a host of fashion editors at the Chelsea Arts Tower in Manhattan. Its fitting that the designer chose the art gallery condominium to set the scene for her resort 2015 outing: this season, like last, she sourced inspiration from one artist and one artistic muse. The personal style of Betty Parsons the gallerist, artist and proponent of the Abstract Expressionist movement infuses the set of sensible and effortless separates. And the palette of Jackson Pollock  specifically, his Mural painting, originally commissioned by Peggy Guggenheim in 1943 informed Gettys mostly chartreuse, black and white color choices for the season. Even Pollocks relaxed, fluid brush strokes come into play in the L.A.-based designers laid-back silhouettes.

title: Next-Best Thing to Living Next Door to Your Idol
description: During a break in a concert in the Bronx, Victor Goines, a jazz saxophonist and clarinetist, realized that he wanted to spend more time in that very place  a lot more time. Being there would put him close to people he idolized, like Duke Ellington, so he decided to spend $25,000 to buy the land behind the stage.

title: Weekly News Quiz | June 3-June 9, 2014
description: How many of the news stories below did you follow this week? How well can you do against others taking the quiz?

title: Back Home, Rangers Seem Lost
description: The Rangers played their first home game in the Stanley Cup finals in two decades, but the magic of 1994 did not fill Madison Square Garden on Monday night. Mark Messier sent encouraging words before the game, but there was no Messier on the ice, no Mike Richter in the nets, no Brian Leetch bursting down the ice on a rush.

title: Psy Teams Up With Snoop for Hangover Video
description: Can viral media success be engineered? Good question.

title: More on Kristof, Bergdahl and Risen
description: Here are some developments or commentary on three subjects I took up last week:

title: Killing a Patient to Save His Life
description: PITTSBURGH  Trauma patients arriving at an emergency room here after sustaining a gunshot or knife wound may find themselves enrolled in a startling medical experiment.

title: Cambodias Beating Heart, Draining Blood to Save a Patient, Witch-Hunts and Child Abuse
description: Tonle Sap, a lake that pulses through southeast Asia, could be saved by a computer model; E.R. doctors in Pittsburgh plan to treat a dying patient by replacing blood with saline; Emily Bazelon reviews The Witch-Hunt Narrative by Ross E. Cheit, which challenges the common wisdom surrounding child abuse.

title: A Possible Way to Save a Disappearing Leonardo
description: A new technique for tracking paper degradation could help save a fading Leonardo da Vinci masterpiece from the early 1500s.

title: Spiders Webs Hum With Information
description: Like strings on a guitar, spider silks can vibrate along a wide range of frequencies, transmitting information about prey, other spiders and even the condition of the web itself, researchers say.

title: Best Selling Science Books
description: 1 QUIET by Susan Cain. Crown. Introverts  one-third of the population  are undervalued in American society. (1)

title: Riddle by Riddle, a Murder Confession Unspools
description: The news from college friends tends to be the stuff of weddings, children and jobs. In The Antiquarian, the delightfully macabre first novel by the Peruvian writer Gustavo Favern Patriau, the narrator, Gustavo, receives a rather more alarming update: His closest friend from his university days, Daniel, has murdered his fiance, Juliana, by stabbing her 36 times, attempting to burn her body and leaving her in the trunk of his car while trying to kill himself with a gunshot to the head. He fails and lands in a psychiatric ward.

title: Proposal to Split Netflixs Chairman and C.E.O. Roles Fails
description: New York City Comptroller Scott M. Stringer had hoped that huge support for a proposal last year to split Netflixs chairman and chief executive roles would have carried over to this years shareholder election.

title: Making the Best Iced Latte
description: The secret to the iced latte served at Go Get Em Tiger and G&B Coffee in Los Angeles, one of the finest coffee drinks in the country: homemade almond-macadamia milk.

title: 6 Innovative Iced Coffees
description: Maybe its the heat, but coffee professionals who never put sugar in their espresso and believe milk is for cereal will loosen up when it comes to summer drinks. Here, in no particular order, are six iced coffees (actually, five iced coffees and one from a chilled keg) that are inventive, refreshing and delicious.

title: The Best Iced Latte in America?
description: LOS ANGELES  If coffee were a religion, Charles Babinski and Kyle Glanville would be two of its high priests.

title: Ask Well: Do Monogamous Women Still Need a Pap Smear?
description: Question:

title: American Held in North Korea Described as Family Man
description: An Ohio municipal worker seized by the authorities in North Korea while he was visiting on a tourist visa last month was described by his lawyer on Monday as an avid traveler, devoted husband and father to three young children, who was anxiously missed by his family.

title: At E3 Gaming Convention, Microsoft Shifts Emphasis of Xbox One Console to Games
description: LOS ANGELES  The latest video game consoles can play Internet radio, Netflix movies and YouTube video clips. But Sony and Microsoft, gearing up for a blistering battle in retail stores this holiday season, are reassuring consumers that their consoles are very much about games, too.

title: G.M. Suits Will Proceed as One Case in New York
description: A panel of federal judges handed General Motors a modest but meaningful victory on Monday, consolidating the pretrial phase of more than 80 lawsuits against the company into a single proceeding in Manhattan  the venue sought by the automaker.

title: All the Way and Of Mice and Men Recoup on Broadway
description: Two plays that brought Hollywood star power to Broadway this season have recouped their initial investments.

title: Podcast: Witch-Hunts and Child Abuse
description: Emily Bazelon talks about The Witch-Hunt Narrative by Ross E. Cheit, which challenges the common wisdom surrounding child abuse.

title: 2nd China Army Unit Implicated in Online Spying
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The email attachment looked like a brochure for a yoga studio in Toulouse, France, the center of the European aerospace industry. But once it was opened, it allowed hackers to sidestep their victims network security and steal closely guarded satellite technology.

title: Summer X Games Style
description: The annual sports event held in Austin, Tex., drew a crowd with eclectic style.

title: McCartney, Citing Doctors Advice, Postpones Start of American Tour
description: Paul McCartney, having canceled his tour dates in Japan and South Korea last month because of illness, has now postponed the first seven dates of the American leg of his Out There tour, his spokesman announced Monday.

title: Chrysler and Honda Issue Recalls
description: Chrysler is recalling almost 24,000 vehicles in two actions for problems with the electrical and cruise control systems, and Honda is recalling about 1,000 of its 2013 Fit compact cars because a drive shaft could break.

title: Abuse Cases, and a Legacy of Skepticism
description: Thirty years ago, Judy Johnson of Manhattan Beach, Calif., took her 2 1/2-year-old son, Matthew, to the pediatrician, fearing he had been sexually abused by his preschool teacher.

title: With Credibility on Line, World Cup Turns to Technology
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  The man from the goal-line-technology company left no margin for error, which was probably a good thing given his line of work.

title: Revolving Doors at Hospitals
description: Everyone on the ward fell hard for the patient in the room at the end of the hall. Her roommate was loud, demanding and a complete nuisance  nobody spent more time in that part of the room than was absolutely necessary. But the gently smiling, impeccably mannered little 90-year-old, admitted to the window bed with a touch of pneumonia, was a big favorite.

title: Handwriting Loses Ground, Healing Tattoos, Telescopic Legacies
description: EDUCATION

title: Leaving Searchlight Behind, Reid Is Moving to Las Vegas
description: For decades, Searchlight, Nev., has been synonymous with Senator Harry Reid, the Democratic leader whose birthplace has fueled scores of elegiac floor speeches, campaign eventsand even a book, The Camp That Didnt Fail, a history of the tiny mining town where he was raised.

title: Cocktail Culture | One Negroni for Every Month of the Year
description: For the fourth annual Negroni Social at the Rooster Bar at the rustic Italian restaurant Nostrana in Portland, Ore., the chef Cathy Whims recruited 11 of her female chef friends to contribute riffs on the quintessentially Italian cocktail. I dont know a chef that doesnt adore a perfect Negroni, explained Whims about her decision to recruit talent from the kitchen side of the house to dream up cocktail recipes. As an aperitivo, the Negroni opens up your palate, kick-starts your digestion and prepares you for the meal ahead of you. It actually makes you think about all the flavors your are experiencing, and I think thats part of why it lends itself to being so relevant to chefs developing their own versions.

title: Scene City: After the Tony Awards, the Partying Begins
description: Broadways big night goes on till morning, at various after-parties.

title: Police and Witnesses on Las Vegas Ambush
description: The Las Vegas police and witnesses described the rampage in which a married couple fatally shot three people before killing themselves.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Welcome to NYT Now, the new app from The New York Times. (Download us for iPhone.)

title: Let Go of the Money Worries
description: How many times have you had a conversation when you or the other person said something like:

title: If Virginia Doesnt Expand Medicaid, Blame This Guy
description: Considering what residents of New York have been through in recent decades, they might have thought no other state (except maybe Illinois) could outdo them in cynicism about their state government. In Albany in 2009, for example, a politician now on trial for bribery (Malcolm Smith) was briefly deposed as Senate president by two other senators who were later convicted of crimes (Hiram Monserrate and Pedro Espada Jr.) as party control of the chamber hung in the balance.

title: Governors Ball Festival Style
description: Music fans who stood out at this years festival.

title: Neko Case at Governors Ball Music Festival 2014
description: Looking for this seasons festival style? Its not only festivalgoers who experiment; some of this summers best looks can be seen on stage. Neko Case, who performed at last weekends Governors Ball on Randalls Island, explained her style inspiration.

title: Rethinking the Colorful Kindergarten Classroom
description: Imagine a kindergarten classroom. Picture the vividly colored scalloped borders on the walls, the dancing letters, maybe some charming cartoon barnyard animals holding up Welcome to School! signs.

title: Strong Senate Polls in Iowa and Georgia Give G.O.P. Slight Lead
description: For the moment, the Republicans appear to have the slightest edge in the fight for control of the Senate.

title: A Closer Connection for Smartphone Games and Soundtracks
description: Mobile phone games have come a long way since the late 1990s. Back then, the No.1 game  and maybe the only game on a device  was the ultrabasic monochrome maze puzzle, Snake.

title: In Sports, Its a Marathon, With Sprints in Between
description: Benjamin Hoffman has designed Times sports pages since 2004. Here, he talks about the unique challenge of producing the Sunday section, using this past weekends as an example.Deadlines were blown, tempers flared and compromises were made.

title: A Reporter Fits Cancer Into Her Busy Schedule
description: Purveyors of pop culture have a way of discovering a subject simultaneously. This is apparently the moment for the realization that young people can get cancer just like older ones. The top film at the box office over the weekend was The Fault in Our Stars, a weeper about two teenagers with cancer, and on Tuesday night ABC Family introduces Chasing Life.

title: Detroit Sends Hedge Fund Manager and His Goats Packing
description: A hedge fund managers plan to help clean up Detroit by letting baby goats graze on public land has come to an abrupt end  or so it seems.

title: Pictures of the Day: Pakistan and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Pakistan, Brazil, Yemen and Afghanistan.

title: Disparate Lives That Intersect
description: The emotional weather is as volatile as the changeable skies in When January Feels Like Summer, an engaging, buoyantly acted romantic comedy by Cori Thomas at Ensemble Studio Theater. In Ms. Thomass sweet-tempered play, the lives of a handful of problem-plagued New Yorkers intersect in surprising but satisfying ways, leading to unexpected alliances.

title: Of Fish, Monsoons and the Future
description: AKOL, CAMBODIA  As the sun rises on Tonle Sap Lake, fishermen head out from floating villages like this one, past half-submerged mangroves and flooded shrub land, to check their nets, much as they have for centuries.

title: Cambodias Declining Catch
description: The Tonle Sap, one of the worlds most productive freshwater ecosystems, is in trouble. A group of researchers is working with local fishermen to figure out how to save it.

title: Academy Museum Struggling to Recover
description: Maybe only in a city as art-packed as New York could a place like the National Academy, whose Beaux-Arts mansion rises on Fifth Avenue right next door to the Guggenheim Museum, seem as modest and obscure as it does.

title: GoDaddy to Tap Public Markets With I.P.O.
description: Updated, 6:10 p.m. | GoDaddy, the domain name registration giant, plans to sell its shares to investors in an initial public offering.

title: A Boy and Girl Meet Face to Face, Even When Theyre Not in the Same Room
description: Blink is everything you want in a relationship play: funny, painful, affecting. This is all the more remarkable when you consider that its two characters, young social misfits named Sophie (Lizzy Watts) and Jonah (Thomas Pickles), rarely address each other. Its a risky mode of storytelling, but the playwright, Phil Porter, makes it pay off beautifully.

title: Seeing Obstacle-Filled Path to Mars
description: Since the triumph of the moon landings more than four decades ago, presidents have made grand pronouncements about the next adventure for NASA astronauts, one that would culminate with humans on Mars. But each time, those ambitions faded, unfulfilled.

title: The Governors Ball Music Festival 2014
description: Scenes from the New York Governors Ball photo diary of Aurelie Pellissier.

title: Taking Her Tony Home
description: Jessie Mueller never expected to outgrow the Chicago theater scene. She grew up in a family of actors in Evanston, Ill., and loved nothing more than watching her parents dress up for local awards banquets when they were nominees. She went on to win acclaim there for roles in Carousel and She Loves Me, once even borrowing a dress for a prize ceremony that her mother had worn years earlier.

title: A Festival With a New York Heart
description: Every well-planned festival holds a skein of tangled story lines. This years Governors Ball  the fourth annual event, presented Friday through Sunday with 68 acts on four stages on Randalls Island  was, first of all, about hometown New York City pride. It had a headlining set on Sunday by Vampire Weekend and a much-anticipated, fully rewarding set on Saturday by the Strokes, as well as a lineup dotted with other New York City bands, notably a recharged TV on the Radio.

title: The Slow Lane
description: Q. Why do medicines with codeine tend to cause constipation?

title: Future Fossils: Plastic Stone
description: Plastic first became widespread in the mid-20th century. Since then, about six billion tons have been manufactured. Much of that has ended up as trash, and nobody knows what will become of it.

title: Outrage at Epidemic of Sexual Assault in Egypt
description: Womens rights activists in Egypt were outraged Monday after video was posted online that appeared to show a brutal sexual assault in Tahrir Square in Cairo during celebrations of President Abdel Fattah el-Sisis election victory.

title: Jack Whites Lazaretto, About Controlling and Letting Go
description: JACK WHITE

title: And Even More on Climate Change
description: Last week, the big news was that the Obama administration had unveiled a new Environmental Protection Agency regulation to cut carbon emissions from United States power plants 30 percent by 2030.

title: A Veteran Becomes a Rookie
description: In his nearly three months as team president, Phil Jackson has made it very apparent  in word and deed  that he wants to rebuild the Knicks by relying on his own network of associates and alliances. He has gone so far as to underscore the importance of his inner circle, although it might make more sense to refer to his inner triangle.

title: A Photographers Summer of Luck in San Francisco
description: Fifty years ago, San Francisco was the setting for cultural and political upheaval. And Arthur Tress was the lucky young photographer who captured it.

title: A Lift for One of Londons Financial Tech Start-Ups
description: The British capital is staking a claim as a global leader for financial technology start-ups.

title: Rape in India, Beyond the Fault Lines of Caste
description: To the Editor:

title: Tax Credit for Wind Power
description: To the Editor:

title: When Minors Flee to the U.S., Alone
description: To the Editor:

title: An Unlikely Friendship
description: Social scientists tell us that soldiers fight for one another more than for any other reason. Defending your unit has been shown to exceed a willingness to die for family, cause or country, and even the fear of capture. Yet unit cohesion in battle is a tricky thing to measure, let alone compare.

title: European Leaders Face Voter Impatience After Elections
description: BERLIN  If there is one thing her admirers and detractors agree upon, it is that Chancellor Angela Merkel moves deftly, and in these past few years of European crisis stuck stubbornly to policies despite dire predictions that they could lead to the end of the shared currency, the euro.

title: Does Royalty Still Have a Meaningful Role?
description: To the Editor:

title: Rik Mayall, British Alternative Comic, Dies at 56
description: Rik Mayall, an actor, comedian and writer whose work on The Young Ones and other television series helped define alternative comedy in Britain in the 1980s, died on Monday at his home in London. He was 56.

title: Turns Out That Guy in the Painting Really Is Rembrandt, Analysts Say
description: LONDON  After months of cleaning and painstaking scientific investigation, art specialists in Britain have apparently concluded a decadeslong debate over the authenticity of a self-portrait by Rembrandt, saying on Tuesday that it was genuine.

title: A Quiet Cheer for Solitude
description: See Hillary run.

title: Facts Are Murky on Location of Dead Babies in Ireland
description: TUAM, Ireland  That 796 children, mainly babies, died at St. Marys Mother and Baby Home between 1925 and its closing in 1961 is not disputed. A local historian, Catherine Corless, says she researched the death certificates. What troubled her was that she could find burial records for only one child and wanted a plaque to commemorate the lives of the others.

title: More Airports Adopt Free Wi-Fi
description: ATLANTA  Steve Parker, sitting in the atrium at Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport last week, was about to dig into his bag for a hot spot device when he noticed a poster nearby.

title: Controlling the Narrative
description: I used to be a polemicist. I was an editorial cartoonist, and wrote what I called artists statements to accompany my cartoons each week, which over the two terms of the George W. Bush administration lengthened and sharpened from rants into something more like essays. I became practiced at using language as a weapon. My role models were hilarious, elegant and brutal humorists from Mark Twain and H.L. Mencken through Hunter S. Thompson and Matt Taibbi, who raised American invective to an art form. This is a fine and honorable tradition when practiced with a certain amour-propre and panache, but in the last couple of decades its become our dominant mode of public discourse, degraded by hacks and amateurs who ape its cruelty but are rhetorically illiterate and tone-deaf to humor. Theyre just parroting talking points with profanity.

title: Obama on Helping Students Pay Off Loans
description: The president announced three actions to help young Americans pay off their student loan debt.

title: Obama, Noting Own Student Debt Burden, Expands Repayment Cap and Pushes Bill
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama signed an executive order on Monday intended to lessen the college loan burden on nearly five million younger Americans by capping repayments at 10 percent of the borrowers monthly income.

title: Children Aged Out of Immigration System Wont Get Special Priority, Justices Rule
description: A divided Supreme Court ruled on Monday that children of immigrants who lost their places in the slow-moving immigration system because they turned 21 before their parents received their immigrant visa could not be given special priority.

title: Seeking to Renew Balance in a Sites Dual History
description: CRDOBA, Spain  The Mosque-Cathedral of Crdoba, considered one of the worlds architectural wonders, is often portrayed as a symbol of coexistence between Muslims and Catholics.

title: Introduced to Monty Python, on the Concorde
description: MY parents made the mistake of getting me a Eurail pass when I was 19 years old. I havent stopped traveling since. Ive been flying for work for about 40 years. Im an attorney, specializing in protecting trademarks and designs and ideas. That means I have to meet with my clients face to face.

title: Competition Is Stiff to Manage Tech Billions
description: When Microsoft went public in 1986, its chief executive and largest shareholder, Bill Gates, wound up with a broker at Goldman Sachs, the Wall Street firm that had led the companys initial public offering.

title: North Korea: U.N. Attracts Threats for Plan to Monitor Human Rights
description: North Korea on Monday threatened ruthless punishment against South Korea for playing host to a United Nations office that will monitor the human rights situation in the North. In May, South Korea accepted a request from the Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights to open a field office in Seoul. On Monday, North Korea said that raising a racket over a nonexistent human rights issue was a politically motivated campaign to defame its government. It said the United Nations office and its staff would not be excepted from being targets of its punishment. In March, a panel of United Nations investigators published a report documenting what it called systematic and widespread human rights violations against political prisoners and others in the North. The United Nations has said it hopes that a field office in South Korea, where a large number of North Korean refugees have settled, will aid its investigation of human rights abuses in the North.

title: Making Holidays of Brazils World Cup Games
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  To work or not to work? Regardless of where anyone here stands on the logic of Brazils spending billions of dollars in preparation for hosting this years World Cup, the question as opening day approaches is hugely pertinent.

title: Israel: General Has Hopeful View About the Nuclear Talks With Iran
description: As Iran and the United States began two days of talks in Geneva on Monday to advance the stalled negotiations over Irans disputed nuclear activities, a top Israeli intelligence official said he believed that Iran was serious about ensuring the success of the negotiations. The assessment of the official, Brig. Gen. Itai Brun, the chief analyst of Israeli military intelligence, appeared more optimistic than that of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel, who has persistently warned against what he has called a bad nuclear deal with Iran. General Brun, speaking at Israels annual Herzliya Conference on policy and security, said that Iran was abiding by a temporary agreement with major powers, and that economic pressures on the country are leading it toward a dialogue, which we view as serious, on a permanent agreement. The temporary accord expires on July 20, and diplomats have said significant obstacles remain in achieving a permanent agreement to guarantee that Irans nuclear program is for peaceful purposes.

title: T.S.A. Charts a Rise in Guns at Checkpoints
description: LOTS more of our fellow travelers are packing for the airport, so to speak. So far this year (as of the end of last week), the Transportation Security Administration has found 892 guns in passengers carry-on bags at security checkpoints. Thats a 19 percent increase from the comparable period of last year, when the total was 750 guns.

title: Argentina: Vice President in Court for Questioning in Corruption Case
description: A simmering political scandal took a dramatic turn on Monday when a judge forced Vice President Amado Boudou to appear in a Buenos Aires court to answer questions about whether he had used his influence as economy minister to take ownership of a company that printed the nations currency. Mr. Boudou, 51, is accused of using a frontman to purchase shares in the printing company, which was awarded a government contract and later nationalized. He has denied the allegations and has accused news organizations of conspiring against him. The judge, Ariel Lijo, rejected Mr. Boudous call for the session to be broadcast live on television. The judge is expected to announce his decision later this month on whether to file criminal charges against Mr. Boudou.

title: Time Warner Said to Seek a Big Stake in Vice Media
description: Time Warner is in talks to buy a large stake in Vice Media for as much as $1 billion, a deal that could include providing Vice with the television network HLN, people with knowledge of the negotiations said on Monday.

title: Pope Francis Meets With Peres and Abbas
description: Pope Francis, the Israeli president Shimon Peres and the Palestinian president Mahmoud Abbas spoke after a peace prayer meeting in the Vatican gardens.

title: A Museum Devoted to Movies Is Still Writing Its Own Script
description: LOS ANGELES  In the dim light of a gutted department store, through the dust of nearby construction, Kerry Brougher sees a flickering movie future filled with hundreds of different cinemas. For tiny screens. Vast ones. Theaters yet to be conceived.

title: After a Short, Furious Battle, a Rich Offer for Hillshire
description: Just over three weeks ago, Hillshire Brands was focusing on shoring up support for its planned takeover of Pinnacle Foods despite vocal shareholder opposition.

title: Progress on Transgender Rights and Health
description: Progress on civil rights typically comes in incremental steps that discard old policies for new approaches advancing fair treatment. The Obama administration recently took such a step by reversing a 1981 policy that excluded gender reassignment surgery from coverage under Medicare.

title: Mona Freeman, First Miss Subways, Dies at 87
description: Mona Freeman, who had never ridden a subway when she was crowned New York Citys first Miss Subways in 1941  an appointment that led to a modest career as a film and television actress  died on May 23 at her home in Beverly Hills, Calif. She was 87.

title: Pakistans Latest Crisis
description: In its increasingly violent effort to destroy the Pakistani state, the Pakistani Taliban have attacked, among other targets, army headquarters in Rawalpindi, a naval base in Karachi, an air base in Kamra and an airport in Peshawar. The brazen assault over the weekend on the international airport in Karachi takes the campaign to a new level, striking at the countrys largest city and one of its most important commercial centers. Though militants and gangs operate freely there, Karachi is home to Pakistans central bank, a stock exchange and its hopes for desperately needed economic resurgence.

title: Peres, at 90, Is Ready to Leave the Israeli Presidency, but Not to Retire
description: ROME  Reaching the end of a red carpet after landing here for the latest of his more than 60 trips abroad as Israels president, Shimon Peres faced the group of journalists awaiting him.

title: More Voting Games in Ohio
description: Someday, after they figure out how to appeal to a broader swath of the electorate, Republicans will probably be embarrassed by how much time they have spent making it harder for Americans to vote. For now, though, the beat just goes on. In a misguided effort to hold on to power despite an ever-shrinking base of older white voters, Republican lawmakers around the country continue to impose all sorts of barriers to the ballot box.

title: Why Uber Might Well Be Worth $18 Billion
description: It was described as nuts, insane and idiocy.

title: The New Right
description: Conservatives generally believe that capitalism is a machine that cures itself. Therefore, people on the right have been slow to recognize the deep structural problems that are making life harder in the new economy  that are leading to stagnant social mobility, widening inequality and pervasive insecurity.

title: Walmart Reorganizes E-commerce Personnel
description: Walmart announced two high-level changes to its e-commerce team on Monday, as it pushes to ramp up its online business and compete with its archrival Amazon.

title: Battle Over Fracking Poses Threat to Colorado Democrats
description: DENVER  An impassioned national debate over the oil-production technique known as fracking is edging toward the ballot box in Colorado, opening an election-year rift between moderate, energy-friendly Democrats and environmentalists who want to rein in drilling or give local communities the power to outlaw it altogether.

title: As World Cup Nears, American Football Fans Adapt Foreign Traditions
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla.  Even if the fans known as the American Outlaws had not been clumped noisily together at one end of the stadium at the United States-Nigeria soccer match here Saturday, they would have been impossible to miss.

title: The Latest Tea Party Piata
description: About three weeks ago, Representative Jeb Hensarling, a Republican from Texas who is chairman of the House Financial Services Committee, gave a speech to the Heritage Foundation. Hensarling is a Tea Party favorite. His core view is that better government is less government, and that there is nothing government can do that the private sector cant do better.

title: Does Soccer Need FIFA?
Cup Chase Puts Gaborik Back on the Gardens Ice
description: Marian Gaborik is a man of few words and many goals.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for June 9, 2014
description: June 9, 2014

title: Frick Seeks to Expand Beyond Jewel-Box Spaces
description: Joining a trend toward major expansions, the Frick Collection, known for its intimate, jewel-box galleries, will announce on Tuesday plans for a new six-story wing that will increase its exhibition space, open private upstairs rooms, and offer views of Central Park from a new roof garden on East 70th Street.

title: In Britain, School Report Cites Division Over Islam
description: LONDON  A report released on Monday concluded that pressure from fundamentalist Islamic school board governors had created a culture of fear and intimidation among senior staff members in a number of British schools said to have been the targets of a campaign to impose Islamist views on parts of the educational system.

title: Plan to Refill Highway Fund Stokes Conflict in Congress
description: WASHINGTON  With federal highway funds just weeks from depletion, the struggle to replenish the Highway Trust Fund has linked Senator Harry Reid, Democrat of Nevada, the majority leader, with one of the Republicans brightest stars, Senator Rand Paul of Kentucky  and pushed against the bipartisan leadership of the Finance Committee  with the clock ticking.

title: For Western Oil Companies, Expanding in Russia Is a Dance Around Sanctions
description: MOSCOW  Like many chief executives of American companies, Rex W. Tillerson of Exxon Mobil didnt attend the major business forum in Russia last month, at the urging of White House officials. But the companys exploration chief, Neil W. Duffin, did.

title: Stuyvesant Town, Former Middle-Class Bastion, Awaits Mayoral Help
description: To discover a vaguely affordable apartment in Manhattan is like falling down a fire escape into a bed of clover.

title: Scant Support for Elite New York High Schools Admissions Options
description: Civil rights advocates have long complained about the relatively small number of black and Hispanic students in New York Citys most selective high schools. Mayor Bill de Blasio, during his campaign last year, complained about it, too.

title: Plan B Eased Clippers Deal: Sterlings Diagnosis
description: LOS ANGELES  At 7 on aSaturdaymorning, four weeks after her life had erupted in scandal, Rochelle Sterling was awakened by a ringing phone.

title: Secretive Classroom Activity
description: TUESDAYS PUZZLE  Todays puzzle by Pamela Klawitter has a theme that originally confused me, but it turned out to be a lot simpler and more elegant in execution than I thought, mainly because I am the queen of overthinking things. Not only that, but Ms. Klawitters theme takes advantage of one of the meaner tricks in crossword constructing, which actually made the Aha! moment even more fun than usual.

title: Supreme Court Rules in Favor of Electronics Plant in Poisoned Water Case
description: WASHINGTON  Landowners who say a North Carolina electronics plant poisoned their drinking water missed a filing deadline, the Supreme Court ruled on Monday.

title: Democrats See Winning Issue in Carbon Plan
description: WASHINGTON  He is a Democrat in a marquee Senate race, pressed by a strong Republican in a state with a challenging political environment. So when a new proposal to limit power plant emissions was seen as posing a threat to allies of the Obama administration, Senator Mark Udall of Colorado acted quickly: He embraced the plan.

title: Facebook Hires From PayPal to Focus on Messaging
description: SAN FRANCISCO  It couldnt be any plainer if it were in a post by Mark Zuckerberg himself: Facebook, which was built on the idea that people want to share information with dozens of friends and acquaintances, is getting serious about more private communications.

title: Colleges and Evangelicals Collide on Bias Policy
description: BRUNSWICK, Me.  For 40 years, evangelicals at Bowdoin College have gathered periodically to study the Bible together, to pray and to worship. They are a tiny minority on the liberal arts college campus, but they have been a part of the schools community, gathering in the chapel, the dining center, the dorms.

title: For Virginias Don Beyer, Obama Is Still a Positive
description: ARLINGTON, Va.  In an election season when many congressional Democrats are avoiding President Obama as if he were a quirky relative at a family reunion, Don Beyer has cast himself as an unrepentant advocate.

title: Tapes in State Senators Trial Reveal Quid Pro Quo Arrangements
description: WHITE PLAINS, N.Y.  State Senator Malcolm A. Smith had a Plan A and a Plan B.

title: Selling With Nostalgia, Post-Boomer
description: NOSTALGIA, according to the saying, isnt what it used to be. That is increasingly true on Madison Avenue, as advertisers  seeking to evoke warm feelings and fond memories in consumers  adjust the timelines for how far they look back.

title: Mickelson Takes Heart in a Change of Course
description: Two missed eight-foot putts, a drive into the left rough that created a double bogey, a 6-iron plunked into a greenside bunker and three putts from five feet above the cup for a double bogey, another drive off a hospitality tent followed by a 3-iron into a tree branch and a double bogey, two 3-wood tee shots into thick, heavy rough that led to two double bogeys, untimely three-putts and a missed green with a wedge on a 121-yard hole.

title: The Captain Is in the House, but Its Not 1994
description: At the airport gate Monday, there was a man wearing a pilots hat and a blue No. 11 Rangers jersey who was boarding passengers and playing air hockey and posing for iPhone photographs, oh, please, just one more. His head was shaved like Mark Messiers, and he sounded like Mark Messier and he squinted when he smiled just like Mark Messier  wait, it really was him, wasnt it?

title: State Senators Resignation Deepens Political Turmoil in Virginia
description: The resignation of a Democratic state senator in Virginia that flipped control of the Senate to Republicans set off charges on Monday of an unseemly deal and threatened Gov. Terry McAuliffes chances of expanding Medicaid under the presidents health care law.

title: Tanakas Matchup Against Ex-Teammate Falls Through
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.  Masahiro Tanaka could not have known it when he boarded his flight to Seattle on Monday afternoon: His pitching matchup on Tuesday night with Hisashi Iwakuma, his former teammate with Tohoku Rakuten in Japans Pacific League, was not going to happen.

title: Countdown to 2014 World Cup in Brazil: Day 3
description: Momentum is possibly one of the most coveted commodities entering a major tournament like the World Cup  that and a healthy roster.

title: At Juniors Site, Bidders See Brooklyn, Too, as a City of Spires
description: Strolling the bluffs of Brooklyn Heights in the 1850s, Walt Whitman would gaze out at the metropolis growing across the river.

title: Border Agency Replaces Head of Internal Affairs
description: The federal Customs and Border Protection agency has replaced its top official in charge of internal affairs, James F. Tomsheck, citing an effort to strengthen investigations, particularly into episodes involving shootings and other use of force by border agents.

title: Mets Murphy Discusses Fatherhood at White House Meeting
description: Mets second baseman Daniel Murphy, who earlier this year was criticized on New York sports talk radio for going on paternity leave, spoke about being a father at the White House on Monday as part of the Working Families Summit.

title: New Safety Standards Set for Baby Food
description: The Food and Drug Administration announced Monday that it had set new safety standards for infant formula. The rules require manufacturers to screen products for salmonella, which can cause fever and diarrhea, and cronobacter, a potentially lethal germ that thrives in very dry places, like powdered milk and baby formula. The F.D.A. said that companies must also test products for nutrient content and demonstrate that they support normal physical growth.

title: Oklahoma: Another Base to House Young Immigrants
description: Immigration and health authorities will open a shelter at Fort Sill, an Army base in Lawton, for unaccompanied minors caught crossing the southwest border illegally, Obama administration officials said Monday. About 600 youths will be sent there in the coming days, with the number expected to grow to 1,200. About 1,200 minors who were apprehended without parents are in a shelter at Lackland Air Force Base in San Antonio, and 575 are at Naval Base Ventura County near Oxnard, Calif. The authorities also set up temporary holding cells in Nogales, Ariz., to process the youths for deportation proceedings.

title: Myles J. Ambrose, Nixon Drug Czar, D.E.A. Midwife, Dies at 87
description: Myles J. Ambrose, who was President Richard M. Nixons first drug czar, but who resigned before he could take the helm of the new government arm he had helped shepherd into being, the Drug Enforcement Administration, died on June 3 in Leesburg, Va. He was 87.

title: Quotation of the Day for Tuesday, June 10, 2014
description: People are worried about how much has been spent. But once we see the first game, the parties will start.

title: Answering Readers Questions About Immigration
description: As Americans continue to debate border security, deportation policies and the possible path to citizenship for people living in the country illegally, the Obama administration is facing a political crossroads as it tries to cope with an immigration system that is overwhelmed.

title: USA Hockey Permits Use of Safety Feature Resembling Warning Track
description: USA Hockey, the sports governing body in the United States, announced Monday that it had permitted use of the Look-Up Line, an orange warning track painted on the ice designed to reduce paralyzing neck injuries that could result from collisions into the boards. However, the measure fell short of mandating its use in American ice rinks.

title: U.S. Team Hits Practice Field Soon After Touching Down in Brazil
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  The United States national team arrived in Brazil early Monday morning, and the players were on the field for their first training session by that afternoon. If that seems like a quick turnaround after a 12-hour, two-leg, overnight travel itinerary that began in Jacksonville, Fla., consider that Tim Howard, the starting goalkeeper, actually was surprised at how long it took for the team to get to work. With Jurgen, Im surprised we werent out here earlier, Howard said.

title: I Am Someone, Look at Me
description: Hailed as the 21st centurys answer to Proust for his controversial six-volume autobiographical work, My Struggle, Karl Ove Knausgaard responds to his sudden celebrity with this essay on his tortured relationship with fame  its intense lure, its perils and the Scandinavian culture that condemns its pursuit. Translated by Ingvild Burkey.

title: On One Kings Lane, a Trove of Treasures from Venice Curated by Fortuny
description: Design enthusiasts who werent fortunate enough to visit Venice this week for the opening of the Architecture Biennale (and might be suffering from a touch of Instagram envy), can at least fake the experience via an upcoming sale on One Kings Lane. Mickey and Maury Riad, the two brothers who run the century-old Venetian textile house Fortuny, were invited by the site to shop the towns various islands to assemble a massive home-accessories sale of over 200 items, which begins tomorrow. A tag sale of the brothers own personal collection will also debut on the same day.

title: Raf & Ruby
description: At the top of their creative fields, the fashion designer Raf Simons and the artist Sterling Ruby have succeeded at something almost more elusive and unexpected: a true, collaborative brotherhood.

title: Google Adds Graffiti to Its Art Portfolio
description: PARIS  Theres a portrait of an anonymous Chinese man chiseled into a wall in Shanghai, a colorful mural in Atlanta and black-and-white photographs of eyes that the French artist JR affixed to the houses of a hillside favela in Rio de Janeiro. These are among the images of more than 4,000 works included in a vast new online gallery of street art that Google is unveiling here on Tuesday.

title: Poll Shows Path to Citizenship Is Favored
description: While 62 percent of Americans favor a path to citizenship for immigrants living in the United States illegally, Republican voters are sharply split on the issue going into the November elections, according to a nationwide poll published Tuesday by the Public Religion Research Institute and the Brookings Institution, nonpartisan research groups in Washington.

title: Word of the Day | polemical
description: polemical \p-le-mi-kl\ adjective

title: L.A. Kings Led by Top Players Once Again
description: The Garden was ready. The capacity crowd  wearing special blue Stanley Cup finals T-shirts  was loud and prepared for the Rangers first home game in the finals since 1994. But the experienced Los Angeles Kings, who had never won a playoff game at Madison Square Garden, spoiled the party.

title: Will Ed OBannon Change the N.C.A.A?
description: The implications of OBannon v. N.C.A.A., a class-action lawsuit that could change the economics of college sports.

title: Video Notebook: Rangers Lose Game 3
description: Brad Richards talks about the Rangers 3-0 loss to the Kings at Madison Square Garden and what it means for the rest of the Stanly Cup finals.

title: A Turn for the Worse at Home
description: After losing the first two games of the Stanley Cup finals in overtime in Los Angeles, the Rangers were blanked, 3-0, by the Kings at Madison Square Garden.

title: Whats On Tuesday
description: 9:15 A.M. (HBO Signature) CHARLIE AND THE CHOCOLATE FACTORY (2005) Tim Burtons sugar rush, based on Roald Dahls book, stars Johnny Depp as an oddly sinister candy maker and Freddie Highmore (above, with Mr. Depp, left, and David Kelly) as a boy who wants nothing more than to swim in chocolate. Well, who wouldnt? Despite burdening Willy Wonka with a psychological back story, there is simply too much pleasure to be found in Wonkas world to get too hung up about his relationship with his dad, A. O. Scott wrote in The New York Times. The real lesson of Charlie and the Chocolate Factory is  or should be  that pleasure and curiosity are their own rewards.

title: Taliban Hit Airport Again After Pakistani Airstrikes
description: LONDON  Retaliating against a new wave of military airstrikes, Pakistani Taliban gunmen on Tuesday attacked security forces at Karachis international airport for the second time this week, underscoring their capacity to create mayhem in the countrys largest city.

title: China Complains About Plutonium in Japan
description: China has complained that Japan has 640 kilograms of plutonium that it did not report to the International Atomic Energy Agency.

title: Corrections: June 10, 2014
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Xi Urges Greater Innovation in Core Technologies
description: Even when President Xi Jinping of China urges his countrys scientists to blaze a trail into the future, he dwells on the defeats and humiliations of the past.

title: Test Yourself | History, June 10
description: Take the Quiz

title: Euronext Value Could Reach About $2.4 Billion in I.P.O.
description: LONDON IntercontinentalExchange, owner of the New York Stock Exchange, said on Tuesday that it expected the initial public offering of its Euronext unit to value the business at up to 1.75 billion euros, or $2.38 billion.

title: 6 Qs About the News | A Bold Counterpunch Shows Talibans Lasting Strength
description: In A Bold Counterpunch Shows Talibans Lasting Strength, Declan Walsh reports on an attack at Pakistans largest international airport.

title: Despite Critics, China Asserts Democratic Progress in Hong Kong
description: A week after roughly 100,000 people turned out in Hong Kong in a protest directed at Chinas Communist leadership, Beijing has issued a ringing defense of its oversight of the territory, crediting the central government with everything from combating the SARS epidemic to promoting democratic reforms and ensuring Hong Kongs economic success.

title: Friendly Fire Strike Kills 5 Special Operations Soldiers in Afghanistan
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Five American Special Operations service members and at least one Afghan soldier were killed when a United States Air Force B-1 bomber unleashed an airstrike on their position in southern Afghanistan, in one of the deadliest instances of friendly fire in more than a decade of war, Afghan and American officials said Tuesday.

title: Imperial Tobacco Plans I.P.O. of Logista Distribution Unit
description: LONDON  The British tobacco manufacturer Imperial Tobacco Group said on Tuesday that it planned to spin off its Compaa de Distribucin Integral Logista Holdings distribution unit in an initial public offering in Spain.

title: Does Live Theater Offer Something You Just Cant Get Watching Movies or TV?
description: Do you ever go to the theater to see live performances? Do you enjoy watching plays or musicals? Have you ever seen a Broadway or Off-Broadway show?

title: A Photographers Summer of Luck in San Francisco
description: Arthur Tress was one lucky young photographer. Mr. Tress, a 23-year-old New Yorker, happened to visit his sister in San Francisco in the summer of 1964, when big news kept breaking.

title: High-Profile Conference to Draw Attention to Sexual Violence in War
description: LONDON  The Hollywood star Angelina Jolie and the British foreign secretary, William Hague, opened a high-profile gathering here on Tuesday intended to combat the increasing prevalence of sexual violence in war zones, with Ms. Jolie calling for an end to a culture of impunity among perpetrators.

title: Silicon Valley Tries to Remake the Idea Machine
description: Like any supersecret lab thats supposedly trying to invent the future, Google X looks rather nondescript from the street. Besides the occasional hot pink driverless car parked out front, the facility is an archipelago of unmarked, low-slung, redbrick buildings, more Sunset Park than Silicon Valley. Inside, however, whiteboards offer clues about what exactly the future  at least as Google sees it  might look like. And while some diagrams  including one with parts labeled snooze and set time  suggest more mundane inventions, others, like one outlining a space elevator, seem a bit more ambitious.

title: Support for Blind University Aspirant Turns to Censure
description: Li Jinsheng, a massage center owner, was among the first blind people to take the gaokao, or nationwide university entrance examinations, after the government, in a major turnaround in April, allowed blind people to do so. But Mr. Li says he failed.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Welcome to the Morning Briefing on NYT Now. (Download us for iPhone.)

title: New York Today: Head Trip
description: Updated, 10:19 a.m.

title: Orange Is the New Black Recap: Taystee Gets Her Moment
description: Season 2, Episode 2: Could it be that weve found the most compelling storyline  and its not Piper?

title: In South Carolina, Graham Prevails Without a Runoff
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Lindsey Graham of South Carolina, once thought to be among the Republican incumbents most vulnerable to a Tea Party challenge this year, easily dispatched six primary opponents on Tuesday, capturing well over 50 percent of the vote and avoiding a runoff.

title: Finally, a Pollution Index Beijing Can Love
description: Transparency is a popular catchphrase these days in China, with ordinary people demanding more of it from their officials. In this regard, pollution is one area in which there has been some progress, even if the polluting activities themselves remain a chronic problem across the country.

title: Morning Views
description: The New York Times editorial board condemns the brazen assault carried out by Taliban militants on the international airport in Karachi, Pakistan, this weekend. One has to assume the militants will stop at nothing until the state is utterly destabilized and they have taken control, the board writes, calling on Pakistani political and military leaders to recognize the Taliban threat and quickly devise a strategy to protect the nations people. Time to find a solution is fast running out.

title: Daily Report: Report Implicates 2nd Chinese Army Unit in Online Spying
description: Just weeks after the Justice Department indicted five members of the Chinese army, accusing them of online attacks on United States corporations, a report released on Monday offers more evidence of the breadth and ambition of Chinas campaign to steal trade and military secrets from foreign victims, Nicole Perlroth reports.

title: Bergdahl Prisoner Swap Stirs Concern
description: Americans have serious misgivings about the prisoner swap that freed Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl from captivity in Afghanistan, and most disapprove of President Obamas failure to inform Congress ahead of the exchange with the Taliban, according to two new national surveys.

title: Applying the Lessons of Moneyball and Golden Motions to Your Business
