description: When I was young, and my little sister a bit younger, we went on a trip to China. We were visiting its famous Great Wall when, to our puzzlement, Chinese tourists began queuing up  ignoring the thousands-miles-long wonder of the world to photograph two arguably lesser wonders of the world: my sister and me.

title: Does the Way Your Classroom Is Decorated Affect Your Learning?
description: A new study tries to determine whether there might be a correlation between how a room is decorated and kindergartners learning. The researchers wanted to know if too many decorations could actually be distracting or overstimulating for young minds. But similar questions could be asked about how classroom environment might influence older students academic performance as well.

title: Where ISIS Is Gaining Control in Iraq and Syria
description: The Islamic State of Iraq and Syria  an organization once part of Al Qaeda  has effectively gained control of large swaths of Iraq and Syria over the past year.

title: Lufthansa Trims Profit Forecast for 2 Years
description: PARIS  Lufthansa on Wednesday sharply reduced its profit forecasts for the next two years, citing slower than expected recovery in demand for its passenger and cargo services, as well as the fallout from widespread strikes earlier this year.

title: Hagel Defends Bergdahl Trade as a Part of Waging War
description: WASHINGTON  A defiant Defense Secretary Chuck Hagel on Wednesday defended the prisoner exchange that freed Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl after years of captivity with the Taliban, telling skeptical lawmakers that the decision had been kept secret from Congress because leaks could have scuttled the deal or increased risks to the soldier before the swap.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Welcome to the Morning Briefing on NYT Now. (Download us for iPhone.)

title: New York Today: Not on My Home Ice
description: Good morning to you on this dreary Wednesday.

title: Beijings White Paper Sets Off a Firestorm in Hong Kong
description: In December 1984, Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher of Britain and Prime Minister Zhao Ziyang of China signed a document in Beijing pledging to restore Hong Kong to Chinese control. One of the basic policies laid out in the declaration was that while Hong Kong would be directly under the authority of Beijing, it would enjoy a high degree of autonomy except in foreign and defense affairs.

title: Beacon, N.Y.: Quaint City Rediscovered
description: Hats, carpets, baby carriages, shower doors, cookie cartons: These are among the many products made, at one point or another, in Beacon, a small city hugging the Hudson in southwestern Dutchess County. Because of them, said Clara Lou Gould, who was the mayor from 1990 to 2007, people with expertise in different categories would come to do different jobs and stay on, resulting in a population representing as many as 50 nationalities.

title: Campaign to Crack Down on Fringe Sects in China Worries Mainstream Churches
description: BEIJING  Last month, as she waited for her husband and 7-year-old son at a McDonalds in the eastern Chinese province of Shandong, Wu Shuoyan was approached by members of a Christian sect who were on an aggressive recruitment drive.

title: Daily Report: Microsoft Challenges Federal Warrant for Data Stored Overseas
description: Microsoft is challenging the authority of federal prosecutors to force the giant technology company to hand over a customers email stored in a data center in Ireland, Steve Lohr reports.

title: Tax Breaks for Apple and Starbucks Investigated by E.U.
description: BRUSSELS  European Union officials have been pushing some countries to plug corporate tax loopholes for years to help bolster government coffers in an era of shrinking public budgets and weak economic growth.

title: An Artist Fills Galleries With Emptiness
description: LONDON  You look suspicious, Marina Abramovic said to an older couple standing to the side of a room in the Serpentine Gallery here on Thursday. The couple looked, well, suspicious, as around them people contemplated panels of bright primary colors, or lay on the floor, eyes closed. Ms. Abramovic took them by the hand, gently asked them to close their eyes, and led them away, walking with a slow, measured tread.

title: Banks Fear Missing Collateral in China
description: Updated, 8:45 p.m. | Large banks and trading firms are frantically trying to determine whether they have fallen victim to a suspected commodities fraud emanating from the giant Qingdao Port in northeast China.

title: The Fathers Day Audit
description: At the end of each year, I get my financial statements so I can assess how my business did. And each Fathers Day I take a moment to think about how I did over the previous year as a father.

title: Your Personality Type, Defined by the Internet
description: In some ways, the Internet has become a game of type and be typed. Now you can play it at home, too.

title: Report Links Wen Family to Cambridge Professorship
description: A foundation that endowed a professorship at the University of Cambridge is linked to the family of the former Chinese prime minister Wen Jiabao, according to a report in The Daily Telegraph.

title: HSBC Sells British Pension Business to Swiss Re Unit
description: LONDON  The British bank HSBC said on Wednesday that one of its subsidiaries had sold its pension business in Britain to a unit of the insurer Swiss Re.

title: 1964: East Bloc Working to Win Bigger Share of Tourism
description: LONDON  All the Communist powers, apart from Albania and East Germany, are making a concerted drive to win a bigger share of the riches of the international tourist industry. Since the start of 1964 newspapers in Britain and Western Europe have been carrying a regular and impressive display of Communist tourist advertisements.

title: Whats News in Washington: Cantors Stunning Loss
description: GoodWednesdaymorning from a Washington that awoke stunned by a primary election upset for the ages.

title: Hong Kong Media Worries Over Chinas Reach as Ads Disappear
description: HONG KONG  In what may be a major escalation of pressure by mainland China on Hong Kongs independent-minded news media, two major British banks have stopped advertising with one of the citys biggest newspapers, a top media executive said.

title: Japan Protests Chinese Flybys Over East China Sea
description: TOKYO  Japan protested to Beijing on Wednesday after Chinese fighter jets flew within 100 feet of Japanese military planes in airspace claimed by both nations. Similar flybys in the same area took place several weeks ago.

title: Hillary Rodham Clinton: By the Book
description: The former secretary of state and author of Hard Choices keeps copies of Republican memoirs like Faith of My Fathers and Decision Points on her shelves.

title: George R. R. Martin Wants More Game of Thrones, Too
description: The culture has a crush on George R. R. Martins writing these days, specifically his best-selling A Song of Ice and Fire series, the inspiration behind the hit HBO show Game of Thrones, whose fourth season ends Sunday night.

title: OPEC to Hold Oil Output Steady as Turmoil Rocks Some Member States
description: LONDON  OPEC agreed on Wednesday to keep its petroleum production target at 30 million barrels a day for the rest of the year, a decision intended to calm global concerns about the supply and price of oil, despite increasing geopolitical tensions in some of the main supplier countries.

title: 1994 in Sports: Rangers Win the Cup
description: The Timess Bill Pennington reflects on the Rangers winning Game 7 of the Stanley Cup finals against the Vancouver Canucks.

title: 1994 in Sports: The Baseball Strike
description: Times staff reflect on the baseball strike of 1994.

title: Groggy Mornings Ahead for Chinas World Cup Fans
description: Despite not having a home team to cheer on, record numbers of Chinese soccer fans are expected to tune in to the 2014 FIFA World Cup early Friday local time  with some finding rather creative ways to get their football fix.

title: App Smart | Mobile Blogging
description: Kit Eaton reviews three apps that can help you keep your blog up to date from your phone or tablet.

title: 1994 in Sports: Legacy of World Cup
description: The Timess George Vecsey reflects on the impact the 1994 World Cup had on the United States.

title: Mobile Blogging Options Simplify Storytelling on the Go
description: AS I write this column, Im sitting in my favorite coffee shop. And instead of using my traditional computer setup, Im writing on an Internet-connected iPad with blogging apps.

title: 1994 in Sports: Yankees in First
description: The Timess Bill Pennington reflects on the 1994 Yankees.

title: 1994 in Sports: World Cup in America
description: The Timess Bill Pennington and George Vecsey reflect on the 1994 World Cup.

title: 1994 in Sports: Knicks Come Up Short
description: The Timess William C. Rhoden and Bill Pennington reflect on the Knicks losing to the Houston Rockets in the N.B.A. Finals.

title: Australias Graphic Cigarette Pack Warnings Appear to Work
description: SYDNEY  Australias landmark cigarette legislation banning logos and putting dire health warnings and graphic images of sick or dying smokers on packs seems to be working, data shows, even as tobacco companies argue business is better than ever.

title: 1994 in Sports: Reflections on Simpson
description: The Timess William C. Rhoden speaks about O.J. Simpson and the lessons learned from a tragic story.

title: 1994 in Sports: World Cup in New York
description: The Timess Jay Schreiber reflects on attending a World Cup match at Giants Stadium.

title: 1994 in Sports: O.J. and the Bronco
description: The Timess William C. Rhoden and Bill Pennington reflect on the O.J. Simpson Bronco chase from the summer of 1994.

title: 1994 in Sports: Reggie vs. Spike
description: The Timess George Vecsey and Jay Schreiber reflect on Reggie Millers performance against the Knicks during the playoffs.

title: 1994 in Sports: Messiers Guarantee
description: Mark Messier guaranteed a victory as the Rangers faced elimination in the Eastern Conference finals. The Timess Bill Pennington, George Vecsey and Jay Schreiber reflect.

title: Spanish Lawmakers Clear Way for Kings Abdication
description: MADRID  Lawmakers in Spain overwhelmingly approved on Wednesday an abdication law that paves the way for Crown Prince Felipe to ascend to the throne being vacated by his father, King Juan Carlos.

title: Film to Fashion Is About to Get a Whole New Meaning
description: Why should Frozen and The Little Mermaid be the only films with sartorial merchandising potential? And why should fashion companies such as Prada, Brooks Brothers or Brioni be the brands that benefit from a films costume impact  see The Great Gatsby and all the Pierce Brosnan Bond films  instead of the filmmakers themselves?

title: Manhattan Transfer
description: Dear Diary:

title: Happenings | In Big Sur, Sunday Night Storytelling Under the Redwoods
description: OK, you have an hour at your disposal, says Magnus Toren, on the phone from Big Sur, Calif. Youre in the dark. Youre steps from the Pacific Ocean, lying in the grass under a grove of redwoods, and all you can see are the stars overhead. What do you want to hear?

title: Uber-Inspired Handybook Raises $30 Million in Round Led by Revolution Growth
description: On the heels of a $1.2 billion investment in Uber last week, one of the start-ups that has taken inspiration from the car-ride company has raised a new round of capital as well.

title: J. K. Rowling Donates 1 Million to Oppose Scottish Breakaway
description: LONDON  Likening hard-line Scottish separatists to some of her sinister fictional villains, the author J. K. Rowling has donated 1 million pounds to the campaign to keep Scotland in the United Kingdom.

title: Evercore Hires Senior Banker for Energy Deals
description: The investment bank Evercore Partners has hired a senior banker to advise oil and gas companies on deals.

title: Weighing the Risks of Investing in Energy Companies
description: LONDON  Norways economy is highly dependent on oil and gas production, yet the Nordic countrys largest private pension fund manager, Storebrand, worries about the risks of investing in companies that extract fossil fuels. Figuring that tighter regulations on carbon emissions will emerge in the coming years in an effort to combat climate change, Storebrand has decided not to invest in businesses that it believes will be hurt most by those new rules: coal companies and large producers of oil from tar sands.

title: Once Snubbed, David Brat Turns the Tables
description: WASHINGTON  Three years ago, David Brat, a conservative economics professor, decided to have a go at politics, making a run for a seat in the Virginia House of Delegates. But the back-room deal makers of his Republican Party snubbed him for someone chosen by allies of Representative Eric Cantor, the majority leader.

title: Cantor and Brats Election Speeches
description: Excerpts from the concession speech by Representative Eric Cantor of Virginia and the victory address by David Brat, the Tea Party candidate who won Virginias Republican primary.

title: Lobbyists Connected to Eric Cantor Are About to Take a Pay Hit
description: House Majority Leader Eric Cantors stunning primary loss Tuesday night will reshape the landscape not only within the Republican caucus but on K Street as well. As Dave Brat, his primary challenger, highlighted in his campaign, Mr. Cantor had a close relationship with business lobbying groups like the Chamber of Commerce and the Business Roundtable.

title: Cantor Resigns Leadership Post in Effort to Smooth House Transition
description: WASHINGTON  Representative Eric Cantor, Republican of Virginia, resigned as majority leader Wednesday, completing a precipitous fall after his stunning loss in a primary and setting off an internal battle to remake the upper ranks of House leadership.

title: Leader in Austerity Push Appointed Head of Greek Central Bank
description: ATHENS  The next governor of Greeces central bank will be Yannis Stournaras, a Greek economist and former finance minister who led a two-year austerity drive that stabilized the economy but fueled a social crisis.

title: To Counter G.E., Japanese Company Mitsubishi May Join Siemens in Alstom Bid
description: PARIS  The German engineering conglomerate Siemens and Mitsubishi Heavy Industries of Japan said on Wednesday that they might bid jointly for Alstom, the French maker of power turbines and high-speed trains, as they seek to trump a rival $13.5 billion offer from General Electric.

title: Is Americas Economy Stuck in the Doldrums? The Case for Optimism
description: One of the most important economic debates of our time is whether Americas economic machine is fundamentally broken. What should it tell us that growth has been considerably slower since 2000 than it was in the decades before? Or that in recent years the economy has felt healthy only during an unsustainable credit and housing bubble?

title: Morning Agenda: An Impasse in Bank of America Settlement
description: BANK OF AMERICA SETTLEMENT DEADLOCKED | Bank of America and the Justice Department have reached an impasse in negotiations over a multibillion-dollar settlement, raising the stakes in an investigation into the banks role at the center of the mortgage crisis, DealBooks Jessica Silver-Greenberg, Ben Protess and Michael Corkery write. The talks stalled on Monday after the banks latest offer, at more than $12 billion, was said to be far short of prosecutors demands. The Justice Department has sought a settlement worth roughly $17 billion, which would be the largest payout by any bank to date.

title: In George V Show, Benson Meets the Beatles
description: The Four Seasons Hotel George V in Paris will showcase an iconic moment in music history with an exclusive exhibition of photographs of the Beatles.

title: Some Rare Handel, and Dracula, on Tap for Morgan Season
description: A performance of a rarely heard Handel oratorio, the JACK Quartets takes on Monteverdi as well as on its usual contemporary fare, and a screening of the 1931 version of Dracula with a score by Philip Glass are among the highlights of the Morgan Library & Museums 2014-15 season.

title: Key Moments From the Sports Summer of 1994
description: Twenty years later, revisit the most memorable moments from the sports summer of 1994, with archival photography and video recollections from Times reporters and editors on the Knicks, Rangers, World Cup and more.

title: D-Day Wasnt the First Time Eisenhower Felt as if He Had Lost a Son
description: During this week between the 70th anniversary of D-Day and Fathers Day 2014  next Sunday  here is one more observation about the supreme commander of Operation Overlord, Dwight Eisenhower.

title: Found Poem Favorite | collapsed
description: This poem, by Emily Rigby, is one of the 11 winners of our fifth annual Found Poem Student Contest.

title: A Tug-of-War of Tax Breaks Tightens Across the Hudson
description: Late last fall, bankers from BNY Mellon went to state officials in New York and New Jersey with a proposition: The bank was planning to sell its headquarters on Wall Street and was looking for office space on either side of the Hudson River for more than 1,100 employees.

title: Recalling 1994 in Sports
description: The sports year of 1994 included two New York teams chasing a title, a World Cup, the O.J. Simpson scandal and a baseball strike. Times reporters and editors reflect on these events from 20 years ago.

title: The Sports Summer of 1994
description: Twenty years after turning the sports world on its head, The New York Times revisits the most memorable moments from the summer of 1994. Our interactive timeline includes archival photography and video recollections from The Timess George Vecsey, William C. Rhoden, Bill Pennington and Jay Schreiber.

title: Broadway Raisin Recoups
description: The Broadway revival of A Raisin in the Sun, the biggest box-office hit play of the spring theater season, has recouped its entire $4.25 million capitalization. The producers made the announcement on Tuesday, two days after Lorraine Hansberrys classic reaped success at the 2014 Tony Awards. Raisin won for best play revival, best director of a play (Kenny Leon), and best featured actress in a play (Sophie Okonedo); its three Tonys were the most for any play in the 2013-14 season. The critically acclaimed production, which stars Denzel Washington and LaTanya Richardson Jackson, is scheduled to end its run on Sunday.

title: Dave Chappelle Makes the Case for High Marginal Tax Rates
description: Dave Chappelle, the comedian who walked away from a wildly successful TV show named for him a decade ago, made his first talk show appearance in ages Tuesday night. He probably wasnt intending to make an argument about maximizing the efficiency of the tax system in his appearance on the Late Show With David Letterman, but thats what he ended up doing.

title: Toyota Orders Big Recall Tied to an Air Bag Part
description: In a widening safety problem at one of the worlds largest auto suppliers, 2.3 million Toyota vehicles are being recalled worldwide because a defective air bag component made by Takata Corporation could injure passengers.

title: What You Get for ... $2.5 Million
description: PHILADELPHIA

title: The Power to Cure, Multiplied
description: Ten years ago Dr. Sanjeev Arora, a hepatologist at the University of New Mexico in Albuquerque, realized that he would need to change the way he practiced medicine if he was going to prevent his patients from dying.

title: Francesco Vezzolis Right You Are
description: Francescos first-ever performance for Performa was a remake of the famous play by Luigi Pirandello that took place at the Guggenheim Museum.

title: Score!
description: Five new picture books to help get ready for the World Cup.

title: Bliss by Ragnar Kjartansson
description: Kjartansson had his cast sing Mozarts final aria from The Marriage of Figaro over and over for hours.

title: In Chinatown, Remembering the Origins of a 126-Year-Old Synagogue
description: When visitors ask why a great synagogue was built in the middle of Manhattans Chinatown, it is clearly time for a history lesson.

title: Jesper Justs True Love Is Yet to Come
description: The Norwegian actor Baard Owe performed alongside a hologram-like projection of the actor Johannes Lileore.

title: Mike Kelley at Performa, 2009
description: Extracurricular Activity Projective Reconstruction #32, Plus brought to life the figures that appeared in his 2005-6 video installation, Day is Done  vampires, dancing Goths and bodybuilders.

title: Elmgreen & Dragset at Performa, 2011
description: Two English actors, Joseph Fiennes and Charles Edwards, played the artist duo in a performance.

title: Jennifer Rubell at Performa, 2009
description: Jennifers Creation-themed dinner opened Performa 09 which took place on three floors of a building in Chelsea.

title: I Feel Your Pain by Liz Magic Laser
description: Liz borrowed text from television and other media, showing how the news sounds in the mouths of young couples in a movie theater.

title: House Hunting in ... Bermuda
description: A VILLA DESIGNED FOR ENTERTAINING

title: Another School Day, Another School Shooting
description: In an all-too-familiar chain of events on Tuesday, a gunman armed with a rifle walked into Reynolds High School in Troutdale, Oregon, killed a 14-year-old student, Emilio Hoffman, and wounded a teacher, Todd Rispler. Later he was found dead by police, an apparent suicide.

title: Egyptian Dissident Sentenced for Challenging Ban on Protest
description: One of Egypts most prominent dissidents, the blogger Alaa Abd El Fattah, was among three men arrested on Wednesday while waiting outside a court in Cairo to stand trial for violating the governments ban on unsanctioned protests.

title: Bringing Women to the Table to Address Sexual Violence
description: In war zones, rape is a weapon. We cannot claim to be serious about stopping war crimes if we do nothing to prevent and punish these heinous acts  and if women are not part of the solution every step of the way.

title: In G.O.P., Far Right Is Too Moderate
description: The forces of political nihilism not only remain alive and well within the Republican Party, but they are on the rise. Witness the way they shook Washington on Tuesday by removing from power Eric Cantor, the House majority leader, who had been one of the most implacable opponents to the reform of immigration, health care and taxation. His crime (in addition to complacent campaigning)? He was occasionally obliged, as a leader, to take a few minimalist steps toward governing, like raising the debt ceiling and ending a ruinous shutdown.

title: Dads Going to Hate Her New Novel
description: The Who and the What, opening Monday at the Claire Tow Theater as part of Lincoln Center Theaters LCT3 program, is the new play from Ayad Akhtar, who won the Pulitzer Prize last year for Disgraced. That play, a tense dinner-party drama about the combustible combination of Islam and American culture, had also made its New York premiere under the LCT3 auspices.

title: The Forgotten Generation
description: Amid Americas obsession with millennials (and their narcissism or lack thereof), the generation directly above them has been a bit left out. But by some measures, the economic uncertainty of the last few years may be hitting Generation X harder than anyone.

title: Treasury Secretary Points to Lackluster Economy and a Need for Action
description: WASHINGTON  Has Treasury Secretary Jacob J. Lew just become the most prominent member of the secular stagnation club?

title: On Beauty | A Dramatic Absence
description: As Ziggy Stardust and Queen Elizabeth knew, a bare brow  bleached, stripped or powdered to invisibility  can transform the face and everything it conveys to the world.

title: Apollo Global Hesitant to Pursue Smaller Investors
description: Dont expect to see Apollo Global Management, a major private equity firm, rushing to raise cash from Main Street investors.

title: The Spurs Speak Out, in Different Languages
description: MIAMI  Tom James, senior director of communications for the multinational blend of united talent known as the San Antonio Spurs, was directing postgame news media traffic in the crowded intersection of a pitifully undersize visitors locker room at American Airlines Arena.

title: European Union Investigates Tax Rulings
description: The European Unions competition commissioner, Joaqun Almunia, announced the opening of three in-depth investigations into tax breaks affecting Apple, Starbucks and Fiat Finance and Trade.

title: After Eric Cantor
description: During the government shutdown last year, I wrote a series of posts trying to explain why anyone interested in a healthy conservatism, a viable and serious Republican Party, should be somewhat ambivalent about the fight between the partys insurgents and its congressional leadership.The insurgents pushed for the shutdown and the establishment resisted it, which meant that on the major question of the moment that establishment was right and the insurgents were not only wrong but utterly disconnected from reality. But in the bigger picture, the insurgents critique of the establishments lazy, K Street-oriented, repeal the Medical device tax! approach to policymaking was quite frequently correct, and it was noteworthy that some of the most prominent figures supporting the shutdown (Mike Lee, most notably, but also Marco Rubio and Rand Paul) were also sources of much of the partys post-2012 policy innovation.So the post-shutdown scenario favored by many centrist observers in the media, in which John Boehner and Mitch McConnell just found a way to crush the grassroots and bring their base to heel, was not really a long-term solution to the G.O.P.s lack of vision and seriousness. Instead somehow, somewhere the party would need to find leadership that couldchannelgrassroots populism into a constructive agenda, without being captured by that populisms follies and excesses.

title: 5 Accused of Luring Men to Strip Clubs for a Night They Wouldnt Remember
description: It seemed, at the time, to be an unlikely story.

title: An Honest Answer From David Brat
description: When an MSNBC interviewer asked David Brat, the economics professor at Randolph-Macon College who toppled Eric Cantor in a primary challenge Tuesday, whether he opposed the minimum wage, he responded on Wednesday, Um, I dont have a well-crafted response on that one.

title: So, Who, Exactly, Is David Brat, the Guy Who Beat Eric Cantor?
description: Im not the only one asking that question this morning after David Brat, an economics professor from Randolph-Macon College, defeated the House Majority Leader, Eric Cantor, in the primary in the 7th District of Virginia  with a tiny campaign budget and an unlimited willingness to represent Mr. Cantors record as too moderate for the Republican Party.

title: In Kyoto, Tradition Meets Today
description: Accommodations rarely get more atmospheric than this: a 100-plus-year-old Kyoto townhouse that once housed maiko, or apprentice geisha, now thoroughly renovated to 21st-century standards trimmed in 1,000-year-old temple beams, antique art and tatami mats. On the banks of the Kamogawa River, the two-bedroom named  Kamogawa-tei (Kiyamachi Street; 81-75-354-7770) is one of six traditional townhouses known as machiya renovated by Aoi Kyoto Stay.

title: Peter Mayle's Marseille
description: Provence, that languid, lavender-covered stretch of France along the Mediterranean, is the region most fans associate with Peter Mayle. His 1989 memoir, A Year in Provence, about restoring an 18th-century farmhouse in the Luberon, became such a blockbuster it spawned a veritable franchise of Provenal travelogues, food guides and novels. Indeed, Mr. Mayle said he and his wife had to leave the region for several years just to take a break from eager fans turning up at his doorstep (and from his detractors grumbling about those tourists disturbing the areas tranquillity).

title: Britain at the 2014 Venice Architecture Biennale
description: Organizers of the exhibition A Clockwork Jerusalem discuss the historic influences that shaped their presentation of modern British architecture. The Biennale opened on June 7 and will run until November 23.

title: Lasagna with Red Chard Satisfies a Meat-Loving Family
description: Martha Rose Shulman, the Recipes for Health columnist and cookbook author, is working with the Ruder family (Renee, her husband Chris, and their three daughters, ages 11, 9 and 7) to help these meat lovers adopt a plan of eating two vegetarian meals a week without feeling deprived  and to take advantage of a C.S.A.  a community-supported agriculture program  basket often filled with foods to which they are unaccustomed. This week, the family was traveling, so they took their new plan with them.

title: The Worlds Game
description: A collection of images of fans and amateur players from around the world illustrates how everyday people embrace the spirit of soccer.

title: Chappelle Clears Up the Mystery  Sort Of
description: Corporate bullying. Drugs. The illuminati. They have all played roles in the multitude of wild theories to explain why Dave Chappelle left his hit sketch show on Comedy Central in 2005. But on Late Show With David Letterman on Tuesday night, Mr. Chappelle offered grist for a new take on the controversy. Technically, I never quit, he joked. I am seven years late for work.

title: Hagel on Bergdahl Trade at House Hearing
description: Defense Secretary Chuck Hagel testified on the release of Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl before the House Armed Services Committee.

title: Egyptian Leader Apologizes to Victim of Sexual Assault in Tahrir Square
description: CAIRO  President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi of Egypt apologized on Wednesday to the victim of a mass sexual assault that took place in a crowd celebrating his election, declaring in a televised visit to her hospital bed that he urged every soldier, police officer and chivalrous man to eradicate such abuse.

title: Google Streamlines Its Tools for Small Businesses
description: On Wednesday, Google announced the introduction of Google My Business, a streamlined platform for small businesses to use its tools. The platform allows businesses to update their information, add photos, share news and see reviews, all in one place.

title: Alibaba Buys Rest of the Mobile Browser UCWeb
description: The Alibaba Groups coming initial public offering has done little to dent its appetite for acquisitions. The Chinese e-commerce giant announced yet another takeover on Wednesday.

title: Image of the Day: June 11
Photos: The Worlds Game
description: A collection of images of fans and amateur players from around the world illustrates how everyday people embrace the spirit of soccer.

title: Potent Voices of Conservative Media Propelled Cantor Opponent
description: If Eric Cantor needed evidence that his political career was in real trouble, all he had to do was look outside his living room window one night last week. At a stately country club about half a mile from his home in the affluent Richmond suburb of Glen Allen, so many people had come to see the radio talk show host Laura Ingraham stump for Mr. Cantors opponent in the Republican primary, David Brat, that the overflow parking nearly reached his driveway.

title: Chrissie Hynde, Minus the Pretenders
description: The Pretenders frontwoman talks to Dave Itzkoff about inadvertently going solo for her new album, Stockholm, John McEnroes chops on guitar and her disgust with award shows.

title: Versailles Revisited
description: Landscape architect Louis Benech and artist Jean-Michel Othoniel discuss the inspiration for their redesign of the Water Theater at Versailles and how trees have memories.

title: In Our Pages: June 12
An Ancient Fish
description: Metaspriggina swam the oceans more than 500 million years ago. Now its fossils are helping scientists understand how our own biology developed.

title: In Bid for Botox Maker, Valeant Defends Its Record on Research
description: As it pursues a hostile takeover of Allergan, Valeant has reiterated time and again its belief that most pharmaceutical research and development doesnt pay off.

title: Goldmans Blankfein Talks Energy and Politics
description: In a round of interviews this week, Lloyd Blankfein, the chief executive of Goldman Sachs, was eager to talk about natural gas drilling in advance of the banks energy summit, which began on Wednesday. But he was hesitant to throw his weight behind one of the most politically divisive issues in energy independence: the Keystone XL pipeline.

title: Militants Storm Turkish Consulate in Iraqi City, Taking 49 People as Hostages
description: ISTANBUL  The Turkish government reacted with alarm on Wednesday to the seizure of the countrys consul general and his staff by militants in Mosul, Iraq, vowing to retaliate if any of its citizens are wounded.

title: The Cantor Upset | The Upshot Countdown
description: The Upshots Nate Cohn explains just why Eric Cantors primary defeat was such a surprise, and why Republicans can expect to hold on to that district in November.

title: Creating for Children, Without the Cutesy
description: The first show the Scottish theater artist Andy Manley brought to the New Victory Theater in Manhattan was My House, a mostly wordless solo piece co-starring a cardboard box and a wayward melon, designed for children 18 months to 3 years old. Next, he brought White, a beguiling, still largely nonverbal show about color and disorder, created for 2- to 4-year-olds.

title: In Nature | The Gardener of Versailles
description: Andr Le Ntres 17th-century masterpiece for Louis XIV has not been altered for centuries  until now. The renowned yet humble French landscape designer Louis Benech is reimagining the four-acre Water Theater, the Sun Kings favorite grove.

title: My Previous Bosses Are Now My Customers
description: In 2002, Sherry Stewart Deutschmann quit her six-figure sales job at a Nashville company, cashed in her 401(k) and started a competing business.

title: Before Army, P.O.W. Failed at Coast Guard Training
description: Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl spent four weeks in basic training with the United States Coast Guard in early 2006 before he was given an administrative discharge, military officials said Wednesday. The disclosure raised new questions about whether Sergeant Bergdahl should have been allowed to enlist in the Army two years later, and whether he had to be given a waiver to join either because he had previously washed out of boot camp or because of concerns about his emotional fitness.

title: How Eric Cantors Defeat Could Hurt Republican Fund-Raising
description: Eric Cantors primary defeat against David Brat on Tuesday means that House Republicans will lose one of their best fund-raisers, and a crucial link to some major donors the party is otherwise not close to.

title: A Long-Ago Ancestor: A Little Fish, With Jaws to Come
description: Half a billion years ago, a new study suggests, your ancestors may have looked like this:

title: Sunni Fighters Gain as They Battle 2 Governments, and Other Rebels
description: GAZIANTEP, Turkey  The fighters with the Free Syrian Army were expecting an attack any day from the jihadists besieging the city of Minbej in war-torn Syria, fortifying their base, once a carpet factory, with concrete bomb-blast barriers.

title: Today in Small Business: Why Getting an S.B.A. Loan May Get Easier
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: With Uber, Less Reason to Own a Car
description: With a near record-setting investment announced last week, the ride-sharing service Uber is the hottest, most valuable technology start-up on the planet. It is also one of the most controversial.

title: F.B.I. Begins Criminal Inquiry in V.A. Scandal
description: WASHINGTON  The F.B.I. has opened a criminal investigation into accusations that Department of Veterans Affairs officials manipulated medical waiting lists and delayed care for thousands of veterans, the F.B.I. director, James B. Comey, said Wednesday.

title: G.M. Chief to Appear Before House Panel Once Again
description: The chief executive of General Motors and the former prosecutor hired by the company to investigate why it failed to recognize a fatal defect in Chevrolet Cobalts and other small cars will testify before a House subcommittee next Wednesday.

title: Morrissey Cancels American Tour, Citing Infection
description: Morrissey has canceled the rest of his current American tour, including a performance scheduled for Barclays Center on June 21, because of a respiratory infection. The other canceled dates on the tour include concerts in Chicago; Flint, Mich.; Hershey, Pa.; Atlantic City and Baltimore.

title: Ukraine and Russia Still Far Apart on Gas Deal
description: BRUSSELS  Russia and Ukraine failed on Wednesday to end an acrimonious standoff over the price of natural gas supplied by the Russian energy giant Gazprom, dashing hopes that the election of a new Ukrainian president might ease a dispute that has long poisoned relations between Moscow and Kiev. The failure to reach a deal also raised concern in Europe that its own supplies of energy from Russia could be interrupted.

title: Amazon Music Streaming Service Is Expected Soon
description: Amazon plans to introduce a limited music streaming feature as early as Thursday, according to several people briefed on its plans.

title: For Father and Son, a Creative Tug of War
description: R.O. Blechman, an author and illustrator, has drawn for The Times for more than four decades. Today, he often works closely with his son Nicholas Blechman, the art director for the Book Review and an illustrator and designer himself, who came to The Times in 1997 as art director of the Op-Ed pages. Fathers Day is this weekend, so we asked the Blechmans to talk about their collaboration. Nicholas calls his father Bob. The R in his initials stands for Robert.

title: Did Democratic Voters Defeat Eric Cantor? Probably Not
description: House Majority Leader Eric Cantors unexpected defeat has left many looking for equally unexpected answers. One suggestion is that his opponent, David Brat, was bolstered by Democratic crossover voters, who might have contributed to an increase in turnout from 2012. Mr. Cantors pollster, John McLaughlin, said the race was decided by Democratic voters.

title: Blind Soccer in Brazil
description: Brazils visually disabled defy the odds by taking part in their countrys favorite pastime, soccer.

title: Senate Race in Mississippi Exposes a Cultural Rift
description: JACKSON, Miss.  It is still not entirely clear what three supporters of the Tea Party favorite Chris McDaniel were doing locked in at 3 a.m. in a darkened courthouse where votes had been tabulated on the night of the states contentious primary election last week.

title: Stabbing Suspect Indicted on Murder Charges
description: The man accused of the elevator stabbings that left a 6-year-boy dead and a 7-year-old girl critically wounded in Brooklyn was formally indicted on Wednesday on charges of murder, attempted murder, assault and weapons possession.

title: The Democrats Still Have a Problem
description: So  I am aware that having the Republican House Majority Leader defeated by a no-name insurgent tends to cut against my ongoing argument, hotly contested by Jonathan Chait and others on the left, that the Democrats should be worried about their coalition holding together in the next presidential cycle. But because Im stubborn, Im going to celebrate Cantorgeddon by going one more round on the subject of whether President Obamas approval ratings should be a cause of concern for his party, by responding tomy colleague Nate Cohns contentionthat for now, at least, they shouldnt be.

title: Why Didnt the Data-Driven Media See Eric Cantors Defeat Coming?
description: Was the coverage  or lack thereof  of Eric Cantors doomed campaign an epic fail by the media?Or was Mr. Cantors defeat just one of those inevitable surprises that keeps political junkies coming back for more?

title: Would These Strategies Work With Your Employees?
description: In 2002, when Sherry Stewart Deutschmann quit her six-figure sales job at a Nashville company to start a competing business, she was convinced that her company would thrive if she could keep her employees engaged and committed. Today, that business, LetterLogic, which specializes in printing and mailing statements, invoices and letters, has $30 million in annual revenue and no debt.

title: Disability Does Little to Impair Passion for Soccer
description: Visually disabled soccer players compete on regional squads with the hope of qualifying for Brazils paralympic team.

title: Live Photos From the World Cup
description: A real-time stream of images from the World Cup by photographers for The New York Times, The Associated Press, Reuters, Getty Images, European Pressphoto Agency and Agence France-Presse.

title: Italian Bank Hits Market Turbulence With Share Sale
description: PARIS  Shares of Banca Monte dei Paschi di Siena, the troubled Italian bank, plunged on Wednesday after going essentially untraded for two days as it undertook a stock sale that seeks to raise nearly $7 billion in new capital.

title: Classical Playlist: Handel, George Benjamin, David Lang and Others
description: HANDEL: OrlandoBejun Mehta and other singers; Ren Jacobs, conductor; BRock Orchestra Ghent(Archiv Produktion; two CDs)For me, Orlando is Handels most innovative and psychologically astute opera, and one of his richest scores. The evocative story tells of Orlando, a renowned knight and crusader, who, weary of finding glory through combat, seeks meaning through love. He comes afoul of a magician who, determined to lead Orlando back to a life of valor, entices him into an enchanted forest where romantic involvements drive Orlando mad. Handel even gives us a mad scene in this opera. Ren Jacobs, the countertenor turned brilliant conductor, leads a crisp, stylish and immediate performance with the BRock Orchestra Ghent and an appealing cast, starring the countertenor Bejun Mehta in the title role, Sophie Karthuser as his love interest Angelica, and Konstantin Wolff as the magician Zoroastro. (Anthony Tommasini)

title: World Cup Schedule and Results
description: The schedule, results and standings for the 2014 World Cup.

title: Feeling For | Sustainable Surfboards Made in Maine, or in Your Own Garage
description: Before the advent of mass-produced polyurethane foam and fiberglass surfboards in the 1950s, the industrys material of choice was durable, hand-hewn wood. Now, a pair of Maine-based craftsmen are seeking to bring the sport back to its roots. Armed with traditional wooden boat-building and fine cabinetry backgrounds, the Grain Surfboards founder Mike LaVecchia and his partner Brad Anderson have created an aesthetically pleasing range of boards that blend old-school materials and craftsmanship with modern shapes and techniques.

title: Old Industry, Eclectic Styles in Eastern Market, Detroit
description: Sporting a vintage jumpsuit and her dads throwback frames, Lauren Stovall was channeling an era when Motown music ruled Detroit. Ms. Stovall was recently passing time in the citys Eastern Market neighborhood, a diverse area with rich history that she finds inspirational. She is a self-proclaimed 70s girl, a hippie at heart, and says comfort is her main approach to style. Heels, I mean, yeah, theyre cool, but I just love like some unique flats, Ms. Stovall said.

title: How We Left Iraq
description: As a backgrounder on todays grim news from Iraq the most important news of the day, with apologies to David BratIm just going to quote, without comment, fromDexter Filkins New Yorker piece todayon the reasons the country has slid back into chaos and civil war:

title: Roger Cohen: When to Read What Ive Read
description: In a recent column, Roger Cohen wrote about re-reading Saul Bellows Herzog, 50 years after the books initial publication. He mentioned the idea that some books may be read too soon or too late in life. We asked him to elaborate:

title: What Went Wrong for Eric Cantor
description: Jonathan Martin on the reasons behind Eric Cantors surprise defeat in Virginia. Was he just a weak candidate?

title: Loeb Backs Management of Auction House Sothebys After Bruising Fight
description: The activist investor Daniel S. Loeb gained three seats on the board of Sothebys only after one of the bitterest fights in recent corporate governance history.

title: A Chicago Homecoming for Hillary Clinton on Her Book Tour
description: CHICAGO  Hillary Rodham Clinton chose her hometown for the first public forum during a nationwide tour to promote her new book. And she shared the stage with an old friend, Mayor Rahm Emanuel.

title: Immigration: What Americans Think
description: Eric Cantors defeat has resulted in great speculation about the future of immigration politics.

title: Intelligence Too Big for a Single Machine
description: Ever since the computer scientist John McCarthy coined the term artificial intelligence in 1955, the field has gone through cycles of boundless optimism and sobering disillusion. Yet until recently, the supercomputer was the go-to operator of machine intelligence  both in science fiction (HAL, in Stanley Kubricks 2001: A Space Odyssey) and in reality (Watson, IBMs Jeopardy! champ).

title: European Firms Turn Privacy Into Sales Pitch
description: LONDON Timo Laaksonen wants to look after your online data.

title: Wheelies: The Porsche Martini Edition
description: A roundup of motoring news from the web:

title: In Modern Marketing, a Big Dose of Data in the Creative Juices
description: On Mad Men this spring, the plot hinged on whether the creative types like Don Draper could adjust to the newfangled device in the office  a gigantic computer.

title: Two Activists in Mormon Church Threatened With Excommunication
description: Two Mormons who have gained national attention for pushing their church to ordain women to the priesthood and to accept openly gay members have been notified this week that they face excommunication for apostasy.

title: Cloud Computing: A Special Section
description: An inside look at how technology is remaking an industry, lowering costs for some and handing even more influence to a handful of powerful companies.

title: Campaign-Finance Challenge in Alaska Senate Race
description: Dan Sullivan, the Republican candidate for the United States Senate in Alaska, says he will disavow all support from outside special interests if his opponent, Senator Mark Begich, a Democrat, agrees to do the same.

title: Resort Trends
description: From Derek Lams 60s/70s-inspired dresses to minimally white Balenciaga shirtdresses, here are a few of the trends that emerged for resort season.

title: Managing Play-Doh
description: John von Schmid, sculpture manager of the Jeff Koons studio, demonstrates how a part of the sculpture Play-Doh (19942014) will get through the front door of the Whitney for its Koons retrospective.

title: De Blasios Approval Rating Improves, Poll Finds
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio, freed from the torments of a harsh winter and working to put early stumbles behind him, has improved his reputation among New Yorkers, with a slim majority now saying they approve of his performance in City Hall, according to a poll released on Wednesday.

title: Carolina Herrera Resort 2015
description: Ms. Herrera showed a collection of organza ball gowns and long silk dresses.

title: Ralph Lauren Resort 2015
description: Mr. Lauren showed a collection of navy-and-white polka-dot and striped classics with eye-poppingly unabashed accents of gold.

title: Michael Kors Resort 2015
description: Mr. Kors showed sweet white eyelet dresses, sable-lined anoraks and tie-dyed suede flares.

title: Lanvin Resort 2015
description: The collection included a studded suede tank and not-quite-matching leather skirt.

title: Diane von Furstenberg Resort 2015
description: The collection included a multitude of flared trousers.

title: Louis Vuitton Resort 2015
description: Louis Vuittons inaugural resort presentation of neat silhouettes with look-at-me prints.

title: Think Big. Build Big. Sell Big.
description: On a spring afternoon with his first major retrospective in New York looming, the artist Jeff Koons, nattily dressed in navy blue from head to toe, calmly boarded a helicopter heading for a foundry in upstate New York. His mission was to check up on his Play-Doh, a monumental sculpture depicting the squidgy material ubiquitous in American playrooms.

title: Zeppelin Hits the Top 10; Miranda Lambert at No. 1
description: Miranda Lamberts acclaimed new album, Platinum (RCA Nashville), opened at No. 1 this week with 180,000 sales, according to Nielsen SoundScan.

title: Gucci Resort 2015
description: The collection included pastel cashmeres and oversize sailor bottoms.

title: Chanel Resort 2015
description: The collection included bouquets of boucls and florals.

title: The Weight of the World Rests on Brazil
description: BUENOS AIRES  For all its ability to excite and surprise, the World Cup has a tendency to be a conservative affair. The early group matches usually fulfill the heightened expectation  allowing the minnows of the tournament to have access to a world stage usually denied them  but the knockout phases are where a certain soccer order is restored.

title: Does Marriage Protect Women Against Violence?
description: W. Bradford Wilcox and Robin Fretwell Wilsonstarteda social-media firestorm Tuesday when they offered a prescription for lessening violence against women: marriage.

title: Let the Soccer Drama Begin
description: The top players are here (mostly), the stadiums are ready (sort of) and preparation time is up: The 2014 World Cup begins Thursday. After Brazil takes center stage in So Paulo (yes, Croatia will be there, too, but all eyes will be on the host), the two biggest heavyweight fights of the first round arrive in short order: Spain versus the Netherlands on Friday and England versus Italy on Saturday. So settle in for the next month and enjoy.

title: Truck Driver Pleads Not Guilty in Tracy Morgan Car Crash
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N.J.  The Walmart truck driver whose tractor-trailer slammed into a van carrying the comedian Tracy Morgan, critically injuring Mr. Morgan and killing another passenger, pleaded not guilty on Wednesday in a New Jersey courtroom.

title: RoseLee Goldberg Shares Her Favorite Moments From Performa
description: The article The Second Life of Performance, from Ts culture issue, explores the increasing ubiquity of live art and the role of RoseLee Goldberg in its growing popularity. Ten years ago, the curator and art historian founded Performa, the New York biennial dedicated to the practice, which has influenced museums around the world. Here, Goldberg shares her favorite moments from Performas decade-long history.

title: Excerpt: Fly by Night
description: Michael McCormick and Adam Chanler-Berat in a scene from the new musical at Playwrights Horizons.

title: San Jose Repertory Theater Closes Down
description: The San Jose Repertory Theater, one of the biggest theaters in Silicon Valley, announced on Wednesday that it had shut down.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Welcome to NYT Now, the new app from The New York Times.

title: Women Who Belong in the Kitchen
description: Jody Adams is sole owner of Rialto, a 20-year fixture on Harvard Square in Bostons Charles Hotel.

title: An Astute Waif Hopscotching Through Time
description: Tom Rachmans ingenious second novel, The Rise and Fall of Great Powers, is harder to describe than The Imperfectionists, his sensational first. So here is some sample dialogue, by way of introduction. Humphrey, an older man with a heavy Russian accent, is explaining Russian history to Tooly, an eager 10-year-old girl who will grow up to become the books tough, quick-witted main character and the most important person in Humphreys life.

title: Investors Wary of Putting Money Where the Cloud Is
description: Box, the Silicon Valley cloud storage company run by 29-year-old Aaron Levie, was on the cusp of going public earlier this year. Until it wasnt.

title: Work Sheds Mythic Aura as It Dons New Clothes
description: SEATTLE  Peter Boal, artistic director of Pacific Northwest Ballet, staged a revelatory Giselle for that company here in 2011. Yet Giselle is danced everywhere. So what needed to be revealed? In truth, the basic text of this central work is in a terrible state all round the world. (The same is true for most 19th-century ballet classics, alas. No classic play, opera or concert work is presented today laden with anachronistic and showy changes that are standard for the 19th-century ballets.)

title: A Season That Defies Its Own Description
description: So we come to the end of that interminable, puzzling, ill-defined womens wear season that is known as pre-spring  or almost the end, to be absolutely accurate; there are a few more shows dribbling out after the mens wear spring 2015 collections begin in London this weekend. But you have to draw a line somewhere. And having drawn it, we are left with ... what exactly?

title: A Mesh of Sounds
description: An alluring array of sounds filled St. Pauls German Lutheran Church in Manhattan on Tuesday evening during a performance of the Brazilian-born composer Felipe Laras Voz de Ventos (Voices of the Winds), part of the imaginative Chelsea Music Festival. Mr. Lara advised the audience not to turn around and watch the clarinetist Danny Goldman, the flutist Caitlyn Phillips and the bassoonist Brad Balliett as they played in a balcony at the back of the church, but to focus instead on how the music traveled in space.

title: Sutter, Given Plenty of Reasons to Boast by Kings, Deflects Praise Instead
description: News conferences featuring Los Angeles Kings Coach Darryl Sutter are works of art.

title: Experts Say a Matisse in a Munich Art Trove Should Go to Its Owners Heirs
description: BERLIN  A 1921 portrait by Matisse found in the private collection of the reclusive Cornelius Gurlitt was looted by the Nazis from a prominent French art collector and should be returned to his heirs, a team of international experts said on Wednesday.

title: G.E. May Still Hold Upper Hand in Alstom Bid
description: Siemens is smart to team up with its Japanese engineering peer Mitsubishi Heavy Industries in a potential bid for Alstoms power assets. But this probably wont be enough for Siemens to overcome rival interest from General Electric.

title: Hotels Get in the World Cup Spirit
description: A number of United States hotels are offering themed packages to coincide with the FIFA World Cup, held in Brazil from June 12 to July 13 this year.

title: Even Early Adopters See Major Flaws in the Cloud
description: The C.I.A. isnt afraid of the cloud.

title: New Yorkers Chosen for Grand National Teams
description: Each district of the American Contract Bridge League qualifies one team to play in the final stage of the Grand National Teams. This is held at the beginning of the Summer North American Championships, taking place this year in Las Vegas next month..

title: Countdown to 2014 World Cup in Brazil: 1 Day
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  The 2014 World Cup begins Thursday, when Brazil plays Croatia in the opening match. This is the final installment of the World Cup countdown.

title: In Felas Spirit, His Son Keeps Afrobeat Bristling
description: When Seun Kuti had his shirt off, dancing through the end of a sweaty, magnificently funky set at the Highline Ballroom on Tuesday night, the tattoo across his muscular shoulders was visible: Fela Lives.

title: A World of Hurt, and Films Still Able to Share Its Pain
description: Images of the horrors of war are so ubiquitous in the age of the camera phone that they threaten to overwhelm and desensitize us. For movie critics who are exposed more than many people to this barrage of carnage, the impulse after a while is to withdraw into a protective shell of world-weary cynicism.

title: A Colonial Inn Adds a Piece of Victoriana
description: Last month, Patrick OConnell, the chef and proprietor of the Inn at Little Washington, a clutch of historic buildings in Washington, Va., added the Parsonage to his complex. He did not restore this two-story house, with its six guest rooms, to its original 1850 dcor. Instead, he recreated the feeling of a grand old family home so that a guest room doesnt feel like a hotel room, he said. Built in the Colonial style, the building (across the street from the inn) later was Victorianized, to borrow Mr. OConnells verb. And its dcor has remained that way, though the palette was lighter than one usually finds in Victorians. The exterior and the porch facing a courtyard are painted green with cream accents. Interior walls are pale or papered in light colors, including the walls flanking a window seat in a second-floor guest room. Rooms start at $575 a night. Information: 540-675-3800 or theinnatlittlewashington.com.

title: Is a Steam Shower Worth the Expense When Its Time to Sell?
description: Q. Is a steam shower worth the expense when its time to sell?

title: Note to Forgers: Dont Forget the Spell Check
description: When angry collectors started suing Knoedler & Company for selling dozens of multimillion-dollar forgeries, the gallerys former president, Ann Freedman, insisted that she and her colleagues had had no reason to think that any of the paintings were counterfeit.

title: And the Rhubarb Is Easy
description: When it comes to decorating, entertaining and parenting, David Duplantis and Christopher Nordquist make everything look so effortless and appealing, its hard not to feel inadequate in comparison.

title: Sales at Broadway Panhandler, Company C and OLighting
description: Broadway Panhandler is discounting some knives, cookware and kitchen tools by up to 70 percent, through Sunday (a Cuisinart Vintage 3-quart copper mixing bowl, originally $100, is about $30; a Wsthof Classic forged fork-tip serrated tomato knife, originally $100, is about $40; a Le Creuset 4.25-quart cast-iron soup pot in select colors, originally $360, is about $140); 65 East Eighth Street (Broadway); 212-966-3434, broadwaypanhandler.com.

title: Skys the Limit on Game Videos Online
description: Thanks to cloud computing, your local youth soccer league may someday play a 12-and-under version of Moneyball.

title: Feeling For | The Adorable Daughter of Hugo Guinness, and Her Bunnies
description: Most know Hugo Guinness as the British artist whose whimsical drawings, paintings and linocut prints  of everything from inky florals to a playful pair of mens undies  line the walls of John Derians dreamland-like shops in downtown Manhattan, not to mention some of the citys best-appointed homes. But to his 12-year-old daughter Violet, he is simply dad. And though he doesnt enjoy the company of his younger daughters two pet rabbits, Blackie and Odette, as much as she does  he laments that one bites, while both pee everywhere and poop everywhere and they never stop eating, and weve got them for another 12 years he adores Violets fondness for them.

title: Bridesmaids Writers Team Up for New Comedy
description: LOS ANGELES  Since 2011, when Bridesmaids became a global hit and expanded the range of female-driven comedy, Hollywood has been desperate for its screenwriters, Kristen Wiig and Annie Mumolo, to team again on another big movie.

title: The Great Digital-Friendly Outdoors
description: Time was when people took to the forest for the weekend with dreams of solitude.

title: Glass Accessories: Showing Their Strength
description: Sebastian Herkner uses lots of different materials in the furnishings he makes for companies like ClassiCon, Moroso and Rosenthal. But glass has always held a special appeal for him.

title: With a Bit of Planning, Keep the Cloud With You Always Even Offline
description: Cloud computing may seem incompatible with being offline, but there are ways to live in the cloud even when you dont have an Internet connection. The most common situation occurs when you are actually in the clouds  stuck on a plane with no Wi-Fi, or, more likely, Wi-Fi so slow it might as well be nonexistent.

title: Cynics Need Love, Too
description: Sarcasm is the weapon of choice for the singer and comedian Emily Bergl, who opened at 54 Below on Tuesday evening. And oh, how bracing it feels! Just listen to this supersmart, platinum-haired spitfire sing tainted renditions of the Rodgers and Hammerstein standards People Will Say Were in Love and I Have Confidence. Inflected with notes of doubt, cynicism and contempt, they curdle from happy, life-affirming ditties into objects of suspicion.

title: A Detective Who Is More Softy Than Hard-Boiled
description: The closing credits of Breakthrough Weekend list a technical crew of five. That figure doesnt count the producing team, which consists of two of the actors and the director, or the composer, whose personal website is advertised below his name. This New York shaggy-dog story from Sujewa Ekanayake is an example of extreme-makeshift filmmaking  but not, unfortunately, a successful one.

title: Moving Beyond Clothing With Collections for the Home
description: Club Monacos shop in Southampton, N.Y., which opened Memorial Day weekend, has the expected clothing and accessories. But it also has home furnishings, and mostly vintage ones at that. Crossing the threshold, one comes upon a table full of hotel silver to the right and old-fashioned mirrors. Other collections throughout the 3,000-square-foot space include vintage glass bottles, silver cocktail shakers and ironstone dishes.

title: Pictures of the Day: London and Elsewhere
description: Photos from London, Portugal, Israel and Washington.

title: Where the Cool Things Are
description: When his lease was set to expire and his rent to triple, Patrick Parrish considered closing his TriBeCa design gallery, Mondo Cane, after almost 15 years and going online only. But in addition to selling vintage furniture and lighting, Mr. Parrish also holds contemporary art and design exhibits several times a year. I like having openings, interacting with people, he said.

title: Modernist Birds Can Roost Here
description: This artisanal birdhouse looks like a homage to Herzog & de Meurons birds nest Olympic Stadium in Beijing. But the resemblance probably was subconscious, said Joe Mansfield, a founder, with Ken Tomita, of Grovemade, a five-year-old woodworking company in Portland, Ore., that produces it. Mr. Mansfield said he started with an Adobe Illustrator plug-in, and then realized, Oh, thats like a bunch of branches in a tree. Made of walnut and what Mr. Mansfield described as responsibly harvested, domestic Eastern hard-rock maple, the small birdhouse comes with a solid brass perch and costs $200. Grovemades wood iPhone case has already appeared in the cult TV series Portlandia. If that show were to do a full-bore Grovemade parody, what product would be required? I guess theyd have us make a high-end bike-polo stick, Mr. Mansfield said. Its all the rage in Portland. Information: grovemade.com.

title: Italian Dcor Rooted in Pottery
description: Joseph Sciorra, 59, has spent three decades studying how Italian-Americans adapt traditions from their ancestral homelands. The folklorist has looked at, among other topics, the Americanized versions of Italian embroidery, Neapolitan music, ephemeral architecture built for street processions and lawn shrines with saint statues in grottoes. A director of the John D. Calandra Italian American Institute at Queens College, he has been roaming Brooklyn streets lately, documenting 1950s planters covered in beach pebbles and blogging about his finds at i-italy.org.

title: Losing the Key
description: In this age of rapid transformation, the house key has been surprisingly resistant to change. Cars have mostly switched to key fobs. Hotels and office buildings favor the pass card. And yet the little metal keys we carry around  part security device, part domestic totem  arent that different from the ones carried by our parents, their parents or their parents, going back to the Civil War, when Linus Yale Jr. invented the cylinder lock, modifying an ancient Egyptian design.

title: What Ferris Bueller Hath Wrought
description: The premise of Where We Started seems torn from an indie-script textbook: Will (Matthew Brumlow) and Nora (Cora Vander Broek), two lonely strangers locked in unhappy marriages, happen to run into each other on a night that might change their lives.

title: Seattle, the New Center of a Tech Boom
description: SEATTLE From his ninth-floor office in downtown Seattle, Hewlett-Packards cloud computing outpost, Bill Hilf can see the Space Needle, the Pike Street Market and the future of computing.

title: Summer Fashion: Small Canvases for Big Prints
description: Given the seasons giddy profusion of prints  the tribal patterns, the splashy botanicals, the retro blooms  it follows that they would feel right for swimwear as well. Gabby Sabharwal, the designer of the swimwear label Giejo, a collection made with vintage fabrics, worked with a brush-stroke print after seeing the painterly inspirations on the spring runways. Yodit Eklund, who designs the African surf and beach label Bantu, developed the prints for her collaboration with J. Crew from traditional West African wax cloth patterns. Her color palette was based on 1970s funk and high-life album covers from Africa. Kenzo swimsuits echo the popular fish motifs in its spring collection. And as Ms. Eklund points out, a swimsuit is an easy way to pull off ... well, loud prints. The surface area of a swimsuit is naturally small, so swimwear is a great opportunity to play with print without a head-to-toe look that might be overwhelming.

title: The V.A.s Problems, by the Numbers
description: Facts and figures behind the troubled Department of Veterans Affairs.

title: Tools for Troubleshooting
description: What you need to inspect your home.

title: Hillshire Stuck Between the Terms of 2 Deal Offers
description: Hillshire Brands is in deal limbo.

title: At the Tonys, a D.I.Y. Fashion Aesthetic Prevails
description: Just before midnight last Sunday, Mark Rylance, a Tony winner for Twelfth Night, was standing in the lobby of the Plaza Hotel, clutching his award and discussing his black top hat.

title: Processing Power, Delivered by the Truckload
description: HOUSTON Hidden off an unmarked, winding road near the George Bush Intercontinental Airport here is a 40,000-square-foot warehouse filled with boxes, most about the size of a tall chest of drawers. As soon as handlers load one truck, it seems as if they are unloading another.

title: Costuming Imelda Marcos in Here Lies Love
description: Clint Ramos was a boy of 13 when he first encountered Imelda Marcos. She alighted fairylike at his high school in Cebu in the Philippines, a beacon of munificence pinning medals on deserving lads.

title: Lady Gaga Becomes a Live Nation Client
description: Nearly a year after a public split with her former manager, Lady Gaga has become a client of Live Nation Entertainments management division.

title: Looking for Trouble at Home Can Pay Off
description: I know that preventive home maintenance is the grown-up way to save money in the long term and keep rats out of my pantry in the short term. All my friends from Shangri-La tell me so. And lets face it, theyre the only people on the planet who practice preventive home maintenance.

title: Bending the Rules to Offer Yoga With a Beer Chaser
description: A chef, 24 yogis and a dog walk into an Art Deco bar. Its 10:30 a.m. on a recent Sunday, and most of the yogis have just completed a 2.3-mile run through downtown Los Angeles, led by a chef, Rob Rice, who is a certified yoga instructor.

title: Tony Awards Committee Eases Limits on Promotional Swag
description: Get ready, Tony Award insiders  a whole lot of swag could be coming your way next spring.

title: A Breakdown of Six Sneakers and Their Wearers
description: What do your sneakers say about you? Heres a cultural breakdown.

title: U.S. Said to Rebuff Iraqi Request to Strike Militants
description: WASHINGTON  As the threat from Sunni militants in western Iraq escalated last month, Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki secretly asked the Obama administration to consider carrying out airstrikes against extremist staging areas, according to Iraqi and American officials.

title: A Rubber-Soled Revolution
description: The once ungentlemanly sneaker has undergone a fashion baptism, showing up in offices as well as cafe society.

title: Tips From Fashion Insiders on How to Wear Sneakers With a Suit
description: Sneakers with a suit? Of course. Mens wear experts offer their fashion tips for getting it right.

title: Security Needs Evolve as Computing Leaves the Office
description: SAN FRANCISCO Five years ago, people still spoke of cloud adoption as if they had a choice.

title: The Sneaker Comes of Age
description: When Christopher Tennant, the editor of the magazine Man of the World, met up with his future in-laws a few months ago at JoJo, an Upper East Side restaurant, he wore a navy blazer from Barneys New York, olive slacks and  what else?  a pair of sneakers by Common Projects.

title: U.S. Military Deaths in Afghanistan
description: The Department of Defense has identified 2,312 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It confirmed the death of the following American recently:

title: Goldman and Bain Settle Suit on Collusion
description: Goldman Sachs and Bain Capital have agreed to pay a combined $121 million to settle a lawsuit that accused them and other firms of colluding to drive down the prices of takeovers before the financial crisis, according to a court filing on Wednesday.

title: Danish Composer Wins $200,000 Prize From Philharmonic
description: Per Norgard, a Danish composer known for kaleidoscopic works with shimmering, seamlessly evolving textures, has been awarded the Marie-Josee Kravis Prize for New Music, presented every two years by the New York Philharmonic. The award carries a $200,000 cash prize as well as a commission to compose a work for the orchestra.

title: The Not-So-Smart Home
description: Molly Wood explores what it takes to connect lights, garage doors, door locks, speakers and other home electronics on a network. Its possible, she finds, but not so easy yet.

title: Moroccos King Slow to Deliver on Pro-Democracy Vows
description: RABAT, Morocco  A few weeks shy of his 15th anniversary as Moroccos ruler, King Mohammed VI was spotted on the streets of Tunisia in jeans and a T-shirt while on an official visit, living up to the King of Cool nickname given to him by the foreign news media.

title: Cloud Technology, in Translation
description: A Glossary of Terms

title: Controlling Your Smart Home With One Hub
description: THE smart home is full of promise: Coffee makers that turn on when you wake up, garage doors that open when you come home, relaxing music that is controlled remotely and air-conditioners and thermostats that perfectly regulate the home and save you money, too.

title: Browsing Boutiques Without Taking the Trip
description: Browsing the boutiques and bazaars of a foreign city is one of the many pleasures of travel. Its also becoming easier to do from your couch.

title: On the Road to a Photo of America
description: A road trip from Laredo, Tex., to Duluth, Minn., in search of how immigration has changed America in real lives demands a balance between plotted paths and serendipity.

title: The Era of Cloud Computing
description: SynapDx searches hundreds of thousands of genetic markers, looking for clues about autism in 880 children across 20 states. A few years ago, this would be the task of a major company or research institution. Thanks to cloud computing, the start-up in Lexington, Mass., does it with 22 people, a few laptops and an Internet connection.

title: Prisoners at Guantnamo: A Tally of 149 Cases
description: To the Editor:

title: A Cap and a Gown, but Where Is the Job?
description: To the Editor:

title: The Mystery of the Buried Babies in Ireland
description: To the Editor:

title: Democracys Prospects
description: To the Editor:

title: Aid Groups Allege Abuses of Young Border Crossers
description: Five legal assistance groups asserted in a complaint filed on Wednesday that unaccompanied children detained after crossing the southwest border illegally are held in cold, overcrowded, filthy cells and face mistreatment by border officers, including physical abuse and food deprivation.

title: A Lesson in Injustice
description: When I was 6, I saw my uncle slap, punch and kick the young boy who lived in his house. This wasnt unusual in the India of the early 90s, and it isnt unusual even now. Parents routinely beat up kids, convinced that it is the best way to discipline them. A friend of mine in Gangtok, my hometown, came to school with stick marks tattooed on his arms every other week. This, though, was the first time that I had actually seen my uncle beating up a child.

title: Mimicking the S.&P. With an Index for Ad Prices at 500 Publishers
description: A LEADING advertising trade publisher, MediaPost Communications, is seeking to be a kind of Dow Jones or Standard & Poors for Madison Avenue, introducing an index that intends to track in real time the movements in price for ads bought and sold on the websites of 500 publishers.

title: Undecided
description: With the end of the Supreme Courts term in view, the focus is naturally on the cases to be decided. So its worth pausing, before the final onslaught, over a case the court wont be deciding, one that the justices turned away earlier this week although it cried out for their attention, and ours.

title: G.M.s Flawed Culture
description: For me, portions of the report of the investigation into General Motors safety problems with certain cars were a journey down memory lane:

title: Shock Waves From Cantors Defeat
description: To the Editor:

title: The Case David Brat Made to Voters
description: David Brat made a simple case against Eric Cantor, and it seemed to resonate with voters as a convincing argument for getting rid of him. Here, culled from interviews and speeches, are some of his arguments.

title: The Cantor Omen
description: While the beltway chatter grows over the political death of Eric Cantor, the first House leader to be unseated in a primary, it would be easy to lose sight of just how unsettling his demise is for our politics in general.

title: In Most States, Unemployment Rates Havent Bounced Back
description: Five years since the end of the recession, many states still havent returned to, or neared, their previous levels of unemployment.

title: Missile Strike by C.I.A. Drone Kills at Least 4, Pakistan Reports
description: PESHAWAR, Pakistan  Ending a five-month hiatus, the Central Intelligence Agency resumed its drone campaign in Pakistan on Wednesday with a missile strike that killed at least four people at a compound in the tribal district of North Waziristan, Pakistani officials said.

title: U.S. Economic Recovery Looks Distant as Growth Stalls
description: WASHINGTON  Recessions are always painful, but the Great Recession that ran from late 2007 to the middle of 2009 may have inflicted a new kind of pain: an era of slower growth.

title: The Carnival Spectacle at a Bushwick Bar
description: The Folk Circus, a monthly event at a bar in Bushwick, is just one example of circus popping up across the city in unexpected ways and places.

title: A Digital Orchestra for Opera? Purists Take (and Play) Offense
description: Nothing about Wagners epic Ring cycle is small in scale, but when a would-be impresario came up with the idea of staging it in West Hartford, Conn., he envisioned replacing its massive orchestral forces with the digital sounds of sampled instruments.

title: Top Militant Leader Is Arrested in Philippines
description: HO CHI MINH CITY, Vietnam  The Philippines captured a top leader of a militant group on Wednesday who the United States says funneled money from Al Qaeda to Filipino rebels blamed for more than a decade of bombings, beheadings and kidnappings in the southern part of the country.

title: Texas Lawmaker Investigated Over Campaign Donations
description: WASHINGTON  The House Ethics Committee is investigating accusations that a Republican lawmaker from Texas  who lost a recent bid for a United States Senate seat  took illegal contributions from two of his staff members and may have made false statements in an effort to cover it up.

title: Sterling to Face Trial on Mental Capacity
description: LOS ANGELES  He did not know what season it was. He could not remember two objects after three minutes. He had difficulty drawing a clock.

title: Opponent Resonated With Christian Conservatives in a Way Cantor Could Not
description: WASHINGTON  As the lone Jewish Republican in Congress, representing a deeply conservative, overwhelmingly Christian district in Virginia while dreaming of becoming the first Jewish speaker of the House, Representative Eric Cantor always had a delicate task.

title: Seizing on Cantor Defeat, Obama Faults G.O.P. at Donor Speech
description: WESTON, Mass.  President Obama, addressing a small group of donors here on Wednesday night, could not help but weigh in on the dominant political issue of the day: the primary defeat of Eric Cantor, the No. 2 House Republican.

title: Plan Will Change on Young Migrants
description: The border authorities will no longer send female migrants with children to a makeshift detention center in Nogales, Ariz., and then release them in the state, Homeland Security Secretary Jeh Johnson said Wednesday at a Senate Judiciary Committee hearing. As of June 1, Mr. Johnson said, unaccompanied children caught crossing the border illegally are being sent to the Nogales center for initial immigration processing, and they will not be released in the state. Gov. Jan Brewer of Arizona had said that she was disturbed and outraged when hundreds of women and children were sent by immigration officials on buses to Phoenix and released with no assistance.

title: Target Seeks to Reassure Its Investors at Meeting
description: DALLAS  At Targets annual shareholder meeting on Wednesday, the questions were few and the attendance sparse, in stark contrast to the companys exceptionally tumultuous year.

title: CNN Covers Cantor, Shifts to Simpson
description: Did CNN abdicate its commitment to breaking news Tuesday night when it broke away from live coverage of the primary election upset of Eric Cantor, the House majority leader, in favor of a special about the anniversary of the O.J. Simpson trial?

title: Pinehursts Challenges at U.S. Open Will Include Footprints
description: PINEHURST, N.C.  Everyday golfers know about footprints in the sand. The scourge of recreational golf is that many players neglect to rake bunkers after hitting out of them. As a result, many weekend duffers are left playing shots from the imprints of shoes.

title: Golfer Mickelsons Role Said to Be Overstated in Insider Inquiry
