description: During the early months of 2010, Adnan A. Durrani found himself frequently thinking of kosher hot dogs. To be more precise, he was thinking of an ad campaign for them created decades earlier by the Hebrew National company. Its well-known slogan went, We answer to a higher authority.

title: S.E.C. Conducting Investigation of Port Authority Projects
description: The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey said this week that it is under investigation by the Securities and Exchange Commission, adding to the series of inquiries that have been ordered since the lane-closing scandal at the George Washington Bridge last year.

title: Chicago Competes Against Itself for Site of Obama Presidential Library
description: CHICAGO  The tussle over the location of President Obamas future presidential library seems to have come down to a debate over various places he has lived, including this city, New York City and Hawaii. Leaders from all three have been boasting lately of their relative assets as they lobby for the site, which they see as an honor, not to mention an economic driver.

title: Beleaguered Iraqis Court Iranian Mastermind of the Shiites Who Fought the U.S.
description: WASHINGTON  Gen. Qassim Suleimani, the shadowy commander of Irans paramilitary Quds Force, flew to Iraq this week with dozens of his officers to advise the countrys beleaguered leadership about how to blunt the advance of militant forces on Baghdad, American officials said Friday.

title: A Better Approach to School Discipline
description: The zero tolerance disciplinary policies that swept through the countrys schools beginning in the 1990s have led to millions of children each year being suspended, expelled and even arrested, mainly for minor misbehavior that would once have been dealt with at the principals office. Federal civil rights officials warned this year that these tactics are often used in a discriminatory fashion against black and Latino children, who are at greater risk of being thrown out of school and denied an education.

title: Obama, McCain and Maliki
description: THE debacle in Iraq isnt President Obamas fault. Its not the Republicans fault. Both bear some responsibility, but, overwhelmingly, its the fault of the Iraqi prime minister, Nuri Kamal al-Maliki.

title: With Attention Elsewhere, Kaymer Is in Midst of Run of Distinction at U.S. Open
description: PINEHURST, N.C.  With a second straight round of 65, Martin Kaymer set the United States Open record for the lowest score at the halfway mark and became the first player in any of the four major golf championships to open with back-to-back 65s.

title: Getting a Good Table by Flicking an App, Not Greasing a Palm
description: Who owns a restaurant reservation?

title: Veterans Watch as Gains Their Friends Died for Are Erased by Insurgents
description: A few weeks before their battalion was to get new mine-resistant vehicles, Capt. Adam P. Snyder, Pvt. Dewayne L. White and Sgt. Eric J. Hernandez were speeding toward a mission in Baiji, Iraq, when a roadside bomb engulfed their Humvee in flames, killing the two enlisted men. Captain Snyder, 26, died the next day, Dec. 5, 2007.

title: Seeing Their Gains at Risk, Shiites Flock to Join Militias
description: BAGHDAD  When he heard on Tuesday that Mosul, Iraqs second-largest city, had fallen to Sunni militants, Abu Ali Alakabaie knew what he had to do.

title: With No Body, Police Sought Murder Clues Elsewhere
description: Detectives entered a basement in the Bronx and recoiled at the stench and the scene.

title: Next Steps in Iraq
description: As a bit of an experiment were publishing my Sunday column on line tonight, Friday, because its newsy and based on todays events. My deadline for the Sunday column is Friday afternoon, because of early printings for the Sunday Review section, and the Sunday columns normally go on line roughly when the Sunday paper comes out. But were all trying not to hamper our digital product with our print constraints, so we decided to put this column up early. Let me know what you think of the idea. And dont be confused if you read it now on line and then encounter it Sunday in print.

title: Decorating and Design Meet Taxation and Politics Where Cuomo Lives
description: NEW CASTLE, N.Y.  The white clapboard colonial-style house at 4 Bittersweet Lane in this exclusive town is special for two reasons.

title: Pastor New to Harlem Takes Rangel On
description: The Rev. Michael A. Walrond Jr. knows he is the outsider. In the Democratic primary for the congressional seat carved out of Harlem that now stretches into parts of the Bronx, Mr. Walrond trails far behind the longtime incumbent, Representative Charles B. Rangel, and State Senator Adriano D. Espaillat in the polls.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for June 13, 2014
In a Downpour, Mexico Keeps Calm to Edge Cameroon
description: NATAL, Brazil  The rain was relentless, descending in thick sheets to turn this citys glistening new soccer stadium into an overstuffed water park. The officiating was contentious, as two apparent goals were canceled within a 20-minute span in the first half.

title: The Koch Cycle of Endless Cash
description: Its not enough, apparently, that some of the wealthiest Americans spend millions to elect their candidates to Congress. Now they are using their fortunes to lobby Congress against any limits on their ability to buy elections.

title: Sign at the End of a Freeway
description: SATURDAYS PUZZLE  If youre going to attempt to solve the Saturday New York Times Crossword  and why wouldnt you?  it helps to try one that has lots of white space in which to roam, plenty of fun, crunchy entries, some tricky cluing to keep you interested and some high-scoring Scrabble letters in the mix. Alex Vratsanoss puzzle pretty much achieves all of these. Hes also hit for the cycle  published a puzzle for each day of the week  with this one, so congratulations are in order.

title: Spain Was Asking for Trouble Against the Netherlands
description: Spain played a high defensive line, positioning themselves well forward, near midfield. It left them vulnerable, giving the Netherlands multiple opportunities for long passes to streaking forwards, resulting in many high-quality chances  and many goals.

title: Recreating Wilderness in Spain
description: A reserve in the countrys west seeks to transform unused farmland into the type of wild area that disappeared from Europe centuries ago.

title: From Untended Farmland, Reserve Tries to Recreate Wilderness From Long Ago
description: LA ALAMEDILLA, Spain  The forces of nature were getting more than a little prodding recently on the grassy 1,200-acre reserve outside this village near Spains border with Portugal.

title: So Triple Crown Is Tough? Try Sweeping Golfs Majors
description: PINEHURST, N.C.  Thirteen horses have won the first two legs of the Triple Crown since 1978, when Affirmed completed the feat with a victory in the Belmont. In the same span, only one man, Tiger Woods, has won the first two legs of golfs holy grail.

title: Threat Grows From Liver Illness Tied to Obesity
description: Despite major gains in fighting hepatitis C and other chronic liver conditions, public health officials are now faced with a growing epidemic of liver disease that is tightly linked to the obesity crisis.

title: A Game of Groans
description: Today lets find fun ways to talk about the Highway Trust Fund.

title: Walking in a Graduation Procession, 50 Years Late
description: Richard Zirpolos heart pumped. His hands sweated. It was his high school graduation ceremony in 1964, and he was ready to receive his diploma.

title: Peace Corps Volunteers Deserve Fairness
description: Women make up more than 60 percent of the Peace Corps, volunteers who are often put in situations where safe and reliable medical care is difficult to find and where they face the risk of sexual assault. Yet federal law does not allow abortion coverage in the volunteers health care program, even in cases of rape or incest, or when a pregnancy endangers a womans life. Next week, subcommittees in both the House and the Senate will begin work on a Peace Corps budget for the next fiscal year. The lawmakers should repeal this unfair prohibition.

title: Reprisal Killings Reported in Iraqs Militant-Held Areas
description: ERBIL, Iraq  While still largely refraining from terrorizing the population inside Mosul, militants, working from a list they have obtained, have begun seeking out citizens who worked for the government, offering some a chance to repent and live under their authority, and in other cases executing them on the spot, according to accounts of residents and a top United Nations official.

title: Friday Night Music: Sylvan Esso
description: My wife, who hates you all, suggested this as todays music selection:

title: Immigration Is Key, Not Top, Issue in South Carolina County
description: GREENVILLE, S.C.  Dripping with sweat while working in his front yard here, Kevin Bailey had sharp words about President Obamas health law and what he sees as runaway spending on Capitol Hill. Those issues, he said, were those that mattered most.

title: After Heats Humbling Loss, Future Is Uncertain
description: MIAMI  His numbers were solid, nothing out of the ordinary for LeBron James. He finished Game 4 of the N.B.A. finals with 28 points and 8 rebounds, plying his trade against a convoy of defenders that included the San Antonio Spurs Kawhi Leonard, who, at a precocious 22, somehow plays with both energy and polish.

title: Franz Beckenbauer Barred by FIFA for 90 Days
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  FIFAs ethics committee on Friday suspended Franz Beckenbauer from all soccer activity for 90 days, saying he had refused requests to cooperate with an investigation into the bidding for the 2018 and 2022 World Cups.

title: Spurs Have Made N.B.A. Finals Anything but Close
description: The N.B.A. finals were billed as a repeat of one of the most competitive series in history. The defending champion Miami Heat may have won their 2012-13 series against the Spurs, but you had to really squint to see the difference between the two teams. At the end of seven intense games, the San Antonio Spurs had actually outscored the Miami Heat by five points.

title: Drowsy Drivers, Dangerous Highways
description: Days before an accident in which an allegedly drowsy truck driver crashed into a van carrying the actor Tracy Morgan, critically injuring him and killing another passenger, a Senate committee voted to roll back regulations meant to keep fatigued truckers off the nations highways.

title: Try a Little Common Sense
description: Last month, around the same time the European High Court ruled that Europeans had a right to be forgotten by the search engine Google, a man named Tim Barefield approached me with the following story:

title: Idaho Republican, Appealing to Right, Enters Race to Replace Cantor
description: WASHINGTON  Representative Ral R. Labrador, a Republican of Idaho who has barely served two terms in Congress, jumped into the race for House majority leader on Friday, offering himself as the more conservative alternative who could pull the House rightward in the wake of Representative Eric Cantors loss in a primary.

title: Jeters Return to Oakland Recalls a Defensive Gem
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  Unless the Yankees and the Oakland Athletics meet in the playoffs, shortstop Derek Jeter will make his final stop this weekend at the O.co Coliseum, the site of perhaps the most memorable defensive play in his 20-year major league career.

title: Strategies in the Political and Athletic Arenas
description: The opening game of the World Cup had everything the advance hype promised  battles between the police and protesters outside the So Paulo stadium; boos for the leaders of Brazil and FIFA, the governing body of world soccer; dodgy refereeing; and a beautiful game between Brazil and Croatia.

title: U.S. Airstrikes Could Help in Reversing Insurgent Offensive, Experts Say
description: WASHINGTON  American air power could play an important role in reversing the Sunni insurgent offensive in Iraq, current and former American military officials said on Friday, but it would be most effective with improved intelligence about insurgent targets and if the United States were willing to deploy small teams of advisers to call in airstrikes.

title: Kings Beat Rangers for Cup, Ending Short Series of Long Games
description: LOS ANGELES  Bad omens stared at Henrik Lundqvist at the start of Game 5 of the Stanley Cup finals. It was the 666th game of his Rangers career. A full moon  the first on Friday the 13th since 2000  hung over Staples Center.

title: Whats on Saturday
description: 8 P.M. (HBO) THE CONJURING (2013) Patrick Wilson and Vera Farmiga, above, play Ed and Lorraine Warren, the real-life paranormal investigators who declared an infamous Dutch colonial-style house on Long Island haunted, leading to more than a dozen Amityville movies. Their target this time is a Rhode Island farmhouse, where the blissful dreams of Carolyn and Roger Perron (Lili Tayor and Ron Livingston) and their five daughters become a moaning, creaking nightmare when they find themselves playing cat-and-mouse with an evil force. The director, James Wan, smartly keeps enough distance from the Warrens that you can see that these true believers are also hovering at the edge of dangerous fanaticism, Manohla Dargis wrote in The New York Times. That gives the movie a shiver of political currency, even if a greater, more sustaining pleasure of this particular haunted-house fantasy is how it works as a metaphor for moviegoing itself. When the Perrons first settle into their house, theyre facing the future with bright, anxious smiles that arent much different from those of the horror-film faithful who are waiting nervously, hopefully, to be jolted by the next great shocker. Its here.

title: Kings Capture Cup at Home
description: The Kings rallied in the third period to force overtime and scored in the second extra period to beat the Rangers in Game 5 and win the Stanley Cup.

title: Talk of Puck Luck Bounces Both Ways for Both Teams
description: LOS ANGELES  Its called puck luck, and it would seem to be an appropriate phrase for some of the bounces, deflections and goal-line theatrics that threaded their way through the Stanley Cup finals.

title: Chuck Noll, Coach of Steelers 1970s Dynasty, Dies at 82
description: Chuck Noll, who built the Steel Curtain Pittsburgh Steelers of the 1970s into one of the most dominant teams in pro football history, becoming the only N.F.L. coach to win four Super Bowl championships, died on Friday at his home in Sewickley, Pa., outside Pittsburgh. He was 82.

title: Mets Choosing Sides in World Cup
description: Mets reliever Carlos Torres was sitting at his locker Wednesday, speaking into his phone in a hushed tone and a hurried manner. Torres sounded desperate, almost as if he were begging.

title: Republicans at Romney Retreat Search for Focus
description: PARK CITY, Utah  The official topic of the conference, emblazoned on materials handed out to guests gathered here at a luxury Norwegian-inspired resort, was The Future of American Leadership.

title: Quotation of the Day for Saturday, June 14, 2014
description: The equivalent of this is foie gras. You have to force feed ducks to get fatty liver, but people seem to be able to develop it on their own.

title: Phelps Shuts Down Athletics as He Gets Support From Yankees Offense
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  No one saw thiscoming Fridaynight from Yankees right-hander David Phelps against the Oakland Athletics.

title: Corrections: June 14, 2014
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Afghans, Looking Ahead to U.S. Withdrawal, Vote With Guarded Optimism
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Afghans lined up on Saturday to vote in the second and final round of the countrys presidential election, choosing a new leader to steer Afghanistan through the coming withdrawal of American-led military forces. Despite reports of numerous attacks in rural parts of the country, the Taliban appear to have failed to disrupt the voting.

title: Separatists Down Military Transport Jet, Killing 49 in Eastern Ukraine
description: LUHANSK, Ukraine  Separatists in Ukraine used a shoulder-fired missile to shoot down a large Ukrainian military transport jet as it was trying to land at an airport in this eastern city on Saturday, killing all 49 people on board, the military said. The attack was the deadliest episode for the Ukrainian military since the unrest began in the countrys east.

title: Analytics: Poem by Committee
description: The following Analytics appears on the letters page in the June 15 issue of the magazine.

title: Iraq Rebels Stall North of Baghdad as Residents Brace for a Siege
description: BAGHDAD  A rebel juggernaut that captured Iraqs second-largest city and raced nearly 200 miles south in three days, raising fears of an imminent assault on Baghdad, stalled for a second day on Saturday about 60 miles north of the capital, leaving residents bracing for a siege that so far has not happened.

title: Why That Phone Charger Took Two Years to Arrive
description: I first heard about the JuiceTank, a slim iPhone case that doubles as a wall charger, when my friends started raving about it two years ago on Twitter. There was one catch, though it didnt bother them: The JuiceTank didnt yet exist.

title: We Will Be Welcomed As Liberators
description: Ive often noted that to a first approximation, nobody ever admits having been wrong about anything. My usual prime example is all the people who issued dire warnings five years ago that runaway inflation was imminent  and are issuing identical warnings to this day. But all of that is nothing as compared with the way the same people who assured us that the invasion of Iraq would be a splendid little war  remember Everyone wants to go to Baghdad, real mean want to go to Tehran?  are now insisting that we should go all in on behalf of a corrupt, incompetent regime that is basically Irans ally, not ours.

title: At De Beers, Collecting Images and Inspiration
description: Above the buzz

title: On the Steamboat, and Striking Up the Calliope
You Cant Have A Wage-Price Spiral Without Wages
description: There was a fairly characteristic argument over dinner last night about when the Fed should tighten. Im in the camp that says it should wait until we see wages rising at least at pre-crisis rates. The other side says that wages are a lagging indicator, and if it waits that long the Fed will be behind the curve.

title: Bernard Schwartz, on the Philosophy of Just Say Yes
description: This interview with  Bernard L. Schwartz, an investor who is the former chairman and C.E.O. of the Loral Corporation, was conducted and condensed by  Adam Bryant.

title: Finding Shock Absorbers for Student Debt
description: President Obama last week signed an executive order aimed at easing the debt burden on millions of people who borrowed money for college. Soaring loan costs, he said, have put too big a debt load on too many people, and its time to do something about it.

title: Pension Funds, Dancing a Two-Step With Ratings Firms
description: Pension fund investors lost billions of dollars trusting the rosy credit ratings stamped on troubled mortgage securities before the 2008 crisis. In its aftermath, they have spent years and many dollars suing Moodys and Standard & Poors, the main purveyors of those dubious grades.

title: Allergan, Defending Its Fort Botox
description: David E. I. Pyott spent a couple of hectic days in Manhattan last week, paying calls on institutional investors and Wall Street analysts, trying to persuade them that his company is worth much more than $54 billion.

title: The Nations Economy, This Side of the Recession
description: In the five years since the United States began its slow climb out of the deepest recession since the 1930s, the job market has undergone a substantial makeover.

title: The Chatter for Sunday, June 15
description: Noncompetes are a dampener on innovation and economic development.

title: Troubled by Lengthy Elevator Repairs
description: Ask Real Estate is a weekly online column that answers questions from across the New York region. Submit yours to realestateqa@nytimes.com.

title: Colombia vs. Greece: Live Blog
description: Live coverage and analysis of the match between Colombia and Greece. Colombia, the seeded team and a sleeper pick by many to make a deep run, lost its star striker Radamel Falcao to a knee injury, but the team still has plenty of talent.

title: Room Service, Ill Have a Massage
description: In-room massages are a standard amenity at most upscale hotels, but luxury properties are increasingly giving their guests a chance to enjoy more elaborate spa treatments en-suite.The Chatwalin New York City, for example, has a package through its Elizabeth Arden spa that includes reflexology, a warm cream manicure and a blow dry and style for women and hair trim and neck cleanup for men ($534).

title: Carrying Fragile Hopes, England Stumbles in Opener
description: MANAUS, Brazil  England had just counterattacked and counterpunched, quickly responding to a goal by Italy with one of its own. But this is the World Cup, and England never seems to escape the bizarre.

title: Variety: A Somewhat Hostile Acrostic
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  Samuel Butler had a complicated relationship with his parents, but particularly his father, which could explain the underlying hostility in todays acrostic quote. In the 1932 book Samuel Butler: A Mid-Victorian Modern, he wrote: He never liked me, nor I him; from my earliest recollections I can call to mind no time when I did not fear him and dislike him  I have never passed a day without thinking of him many times over as the man who was sure to be against me.

title: E3 Still Dazzles, Even as Video Game Sales Go Digital
description: LOS ANGELES  The Electronic Entertainment Expo, or E3, the video game industrys annual convention, is very good at a certain ritual: building hype for big-budget games  more often than not for consoles  just before summer starts, so publishers can maximize their sales when games land on store shelves for the holidays.

title: The End of Iraq
description: EVERY so often, in the post-9/11 era, an enterprising observer circulates a map of what the Middle East might look like, well, after: after Americas wars in the region, after the various revolutions and counterrevolutions, after the Arab Spring and the subsequent springtime for jihadists, after the Sunni-Shiite struggle for mastery. At some point, these cartographers suggest, the wave of post-9/11 conflict will necessarily redraw borders, reshape nation-states, and rub out some of the lines drawn by Sir Mark Sykes and Franois Georges-Picot in a secret Anglo-French treaty almost 100 years ago.

title: Letters to the Sports Editor
description: To the Sports Editor:

title: Latest Updates on the Insurgency in Iraq
description: Open Source is collecting reports from bloggers and journalists in Iraq on Saturday, as the government in Baghdad attempts to regroup following a string of victories by Islamist militants.

title: 21 Flat-Screen TVs, 18 Holes, One Pair of Eyes
description: PINEHURST, N.C.  It was the first round of his 20th United States Open telecast, and the Golf Channel and NBC producer Tommy Roy had a meaty morsel of information for the on-air host Dan Hicks, who could not decipher what Roy was shouting into his earpiece.

title: After Midnight to Close After 8 Months
description: The Broadway musical After Midnight, a revue of song-and-dance numbers from the Cotton Club era of the 1920s, will close on June 29 after more than eight months of performances, a spokesman for the show confirmed on Saturday. The producers of After Midnight were hoping to boost their modest ticket sales by winning the Tony Award for best musical last Sunday, but another nominee, A Gentlemans Guide to Love & Murder, took the prize. After Midnight, which was capitalized at about $7 million, will close at a financial loss. Investors may recoup some money if a national tour of the show  now in discussions  comes together and proves successful.

title: Medical Device Maker Medtronic Is Said to Be Near a Deal for Covidien
description: Medtronic Medtronic is nearing a deal to buy a competitor, Covidien, for more than $45 billion, people briefed on the matter said on Saturday, in a deal that would combine two major medical device makers.

title: Ukrainian Military Plane Shot Down
description: A Ukrainian military plane was shot down by Pro-Russia separatists in Novohannivka, Ukraine. All 49 people aboard were killed.

title: Flying 3 Flags and Seeking One Banner
description: SAN ANTONIO  Benny Mills, it appears, is the type of man who is incapable of speaking without a smile, one that instantly gives his cherubic face an impish glint. His wife, Yvonne, is a more serious study, a woman who chooses her words carefully, as if they are irrevocable, and speaks them with a quiet force.

title: A Cantor Effect for Businesses and the G.O.P.
description: WASHINGTON  The day after Representative Eric Cantor became the first congressional leader in modern times to lose his seat in a primary, one of the biggest aftershocks occurred not on Capitol Hill or in the sprawling Richmond suburbs he has represented for more than a decade but on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Kings Second Stanley Cup in Three Seasons Defies Cap Logic
description: LOS ANGELES  One team winning two Stanley Cups in three seasons during this salary-capped era of parity in the N.H.L. defies logic. But the Los Angeles Kings have never paid mind to the expectations of others.

title: New Position for Angels: Contention
description: In his first two seasons as general manager of the Los Angeles Angels, Jerry Dipoto watched his team all but disappear from contention in the early-season quicksand. In 2012, the Angels doomed themselves with a 6-14 start. Last year, they lost 22 of their first 33.

title: Minority Gun Owners Face Balancing Act, Weighing Isolation and Stigma of Violence
description: INDIANAPOLIS  Standing in a small booth surrounded by displays for rifles, pistols, holsters and other firearm accouterments, the Rev. Kenn Blanchard signed copies of his book Black Man With a Gun: Reloaded. Amid the sea of thousands of white faces that descended on this city for the National Rifle Association convention in late April, Mr. Blanchard, an N.R.A. member since 1991, offered his reasoning for why he was one of the few black visitors.

title: Big City Book Club
description: The Big City Book Clubs hot-summer reading selection is Richard Prices best-selling 2008 novel, Lush Life. The book is both an evocation of decades of life on the Lower East Side of Manhattan and the tale of a violent crime whose effects ripple. One of the witnesses of the murder is initially considered a suspect, and even when he is exonerated, the trauma of the event stays long with him. Join us for the live discussion of the book on Tuesday, July 15, at 6:30 p.m.

title: Uruguay vs. Costa Rica: Live Blog
description: After falling behind 1-0, Costa Rica scores three goals to defeat Uruguay in one of the first upsets of the World Cup.

title: A Conflict on Campus
description: Readers discuss whether college groups should be allowed to exclude students.

title: Notes From the Plasticene Epoch
description: Like diamonds, plastics are forever. The tons dumped into the ocean float around, swirling on currents, breaking into smaller bits, never going away. Scientists have identified huge gyres of plastic in the Pacific. There is an Eastern Garbage Patch, between Hawaii and California; a Western Garbage Patch, off Japan, and a patch between them called the Subtropical Convergence Zone, north of Hawaii.

title: Highways Need Help, but Not This Way
description: It should surprise no one that the federal Highway Trust Fund is on the brink of insolvency. The 18.4 cents a gallon federal gas tax that is the funds main source of revenue has not been raised since 1993. Since then, the population has grown by 55 million people. Roads, bridges, tunnels and public transit have not been maintained or upgraded to meet the increased demand.

title: Peggy Smith
description: Peggy Smith was a chef at Chez Panisse in Berkeley for 17 years before co-founding Cowgirl Creamery, which makes award-winning artisan cheeses. The company, in Point Reyes Station, Calif., was among the first American cheesemakers inducted into Frances prestigious Guilde Internationale des Fromagers.

title: 5 Principles for Iraq
description: THE disintegration of Iraq and Syria is upending an order that has defined the Middle East for a century. It is a huge event, and we as a country need to think very carefully about how to respond. Having just returned from Iraq two weeks ago, my own thinking is guided by five principles, and the first is that, in Iraq today, my enemys enemy is my enemy. Other than the Kurds, we have no friends in this fight. Neither Sunni nor Shiite leaders spearheading the war in Iraq today share our values.

title: My Father, Body and Soul
description: ITS been eight years since I last saw my father, lying in his reclining chair in his living room, as perfectly still as the half-filled coffee cups on the side table.

title: A Paper Boat Navigating a Digital Sea
description: ITS Wednesday morning and 39 editors have filed in to the 10 a.m. meeting in The Timess third-floor conference room, some carrying laptops and smartphones, others with pens and notepads.

title: Naked Confessions of the College-Bound
description: THE Yale applicant had terrific test scores. She had fantastic grades. As one of Yales admissions officers, Michael Motto, leafed through her application, he found himself more and more impressed.

title: When Will Hillary Let It Go?
description: WASHINGTON  NO one wrote about blondes like Raymond Chandler.

title: The Fog Machine of War
description: FORT LEAVENWORTH, Kan.  WHEN I chose to disclose classified information in 2010, I did so out of a love for my country and a sense of duty to others. Im now serving a sentence of 35 years in prison for these unauthorized disclosures. I understand that my actions violated the law.

title: Abortion and Birth, Together
description: SOME of the pregnant women who arrive at Buffalo Womenservices in upstate New York are there for checkups or tours of the birth center, with its pool and homey delivery room. Others arrive to talk to a doctor, nurse or counselor. But they are not waiting for prenatal tests. They are there to get abortions.

title: Poetry: Who Needs It?
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla.  WE live in the age of grace and the age of futility, the age of speed and the age of dullness. The way we live now is not poetic. We live prose, we breathe prose, and we drink, alas, prose. There is prose that does us no great harm, and that may even, in small doses, prove medicinal, the way snake oil cured everything by curing nothing. But to live continually in the natter of ill-written and ill-spoken prose is to become deaf to what language can do.

title: Sunday Breakfast Menu, June 15
description: A primary race in Virginia rocked the political world when Representative Eric Cantor, the House majority leader, lost to his Tea Party-backed opponent David Brat, an economics professor. By the following day, Mr. Cantor announced that he would resign his leadership position by July 31. Mr. Cantor will appear on both ABCs This Week and CNNs State of the Union, to give his opinion on why he lost his congressional seat and what went wrong with his campaign.

title: The Milk Carton Guy
description: In early 2003, military investigators traveled to Guantnamo Bay, Cuba, to interview one of the prison camps most valuable detainees, a Qaeda loyalist from Morocco named Abdullah Tabarak. According to multiple reports, Mr. Tabarak had been Osama bin Ladens chief bodyguard and longtime confidant, and he gave himself up to help bin Laden elude capture shortly after the Sept. 11 attacks.

title: The Ultimate Underdog
description: TOKYO  Itaru Kobayashi remembers what his baseball coach at the University of Tokyo used to tell the team before games, and he remembers what the coach said after the team inevitably lost.

title: A Stigma of Black Gun Ownership
description: In recent decades, gun ownership has been taboo among many African-Americans, but that may be changing.

title: Teams Win N.B.A. Titles, but Superstars Sell the Sizzle, and Themselves
description: I get nervous whenever people begin pining for the good old days. There has been a lot of this over the last few days as the San Antonio Spurs have mopped the floor with the Miami Heat during the N.B.A. finals.

title: Extremist Video Appears to Show American
description: Intelligence analysts believe that a video released by a Syrian rebel group last month shows Moner Mohammad Abusalha, the American who blew himself up in the conflict recently.

title: Syria Suicide Bombing Puts U.S. Face on Jihad Video
description: WASHINGTON  Like a trailer for a summer blockbuster, the video begins with loud music and the words Coming Soon.

title: Rift Bared as Palestinians Aid Israel in Search for Teenagers Missing in West Bank
description: JERUSALEM  As the search continued on Saturday for three Israeli teenagers who were missing in the West Bank and were presumed to have been abducted by Palestinian militants, the crisis underscored the complexity of Israels relations with the Palestinian Authority and the authoritys deep differences with Hamas despite a recent reconciliation pact.

title: A Piece of the Game Beyond the Walls
description: CONTAGEM, Brazil  Hugo Alves used to play professional soccer for a living. He remains connected to the sport, but not in the way he intended. Now his uniform consists of a red T-shirt and pants, and he makes soccer balls at a factory in prison.

title: A Baseball Binge Woven From Dreams
description: This would be a week from my dreams: five major league baseball games in five cities in five days.

title: Palace of Squatters Is a Symbol of Refugee Crisis
description: ROME  On a recent evening, two volunteer doctors and a handful of medical students moved gingerly around a dimly lit room, examining dozens of newly arrived migrants from the Horn of Africa. The medics treated blotchy arms, legs and feet  symptoms of scabies  lighting the infected areas with a smartphone app. Nearby, a pediatrician listened to the chests of newborns and toddlers.

title: Obama Moves to End Rail Workers Strike in Philadelphia
description: A transit strike in Philadelphia ended late Saturday after President Obama signed an executive order creating a presidential emergency board to help resolve the labor dispute.

title: Graduates Cautioned: Dont Shut Out Opposing Views
description: Commencement speakers made news this year mostly by their absence. Protesters on the left assailed speakers who had been invited by colleges and universities, and in some cases, they got their wish, driving away the intended guests.

title: The Fight Over New Standards
description: Backlash reigns in schools nationwide after the introduction of Common Core standards. Critics say they are overly difficult, but others say they challenge students to become better thinkers.

title: Tears of Joy and Heartbreak After an Enthralling Series
description: LOS ANGELES  Long passages of breathless excitement and almost unbearable anxiety, and then, in an instant, utter joy and utter despair. Alec Martinez leaps once, his arms aloft in joy; a second time, and tosses away his stick; a third time, and throws off his gloves. He turns to embrace his teammates  he has just scored to win the Stanley Cup for the Los Angeles Kings.

title: Common Core, in 9-Year-Old Eyes
description: He could have written about the green toy truck he kept hidden in his room, a reminder of Haiti, a place he did not yet fully understand.

title: England vs. Italy: Live Blog
description: With goals by Claudio Marchisio and Mario Balotelli, Italy outlasted England in the punishing heat and humidity of Manaus in the first match in the Amazon rainforest.

title: At Commencement, Obama Mocks Lawmakers Who Deny Climate Change
description: ANAHEIM, Calif.  President Obama, appearing emboldened after his recent move to cut carbon emissions from coal-fired power plants, on Saturday ridiculed members of Congress who deny climate change or plead scientific ignorance as an alibi for avoiding an uncomfortable truth.

title: Enrich
description: SUNDAYS PUZZLE  O.K., so its not really a Fathers Day puzzle, unless, of course, you really like the letter N, in which case, surprise! Happy Fathers Day!

title: Koreas Fish Special: A Delicate Mix of Outhouse and Ammonia
description: HEUKSAN ISLAND, South Korea  South Korea has a generous list of foods some find hard to swallow, among them boiled silkworm pupae and live baby octopuses, which have been known to attach their suction cups to the roofs of diners mouths in what appear to be desperate bids to escape.

title: Cambodias Scam Orphanages
description: In Cambodia, less than a quarter of children in orphanages are actual orphans.

title: Property Taxes and the Urge to Tinker
description: Ross Ramsey, the executive editor of The Texas Tribune, writes a regular column for the Tribune.

title: Cambodian Activists Fall Exposes Broad Deception
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia  The fall from grace of one of Cambodias most prominent social activists and the unraveling of her sad tale of being an orphan sold into sex slavery has highlighted what aid workers here say is widespread embellishment and in some cases outright deception in fund-raising, especially among the countrys orphanages.

title: Trying to Limit Outside Influence in Prescribing Drugs
description: As sales representatives for pharmaceutical companies brought doughnuts and lunch over the years to physicians at the 20 Kelsey-Seybold medical clinics in the Houston area, Patrick Carter worked to limit the representatives presence.

title: Lee Hyla, 61, Who Mixed Rock and Jazz Into Classical Works, Dies
description: Lee Hyla, an American composer whose work married the formal rigor of classical music with the driving energy of rock and the improvisational abandon of jazz, died on June 6 in Chicago. He was 61.

title: Recognizing a Hurdle and Finding Her Voice
description: Kat Candler, the writer and director, fell in with an ambitious group of filmmakers when she first moved to Austin from Florida in 1997.

title: Alan Douglas, Who Mined Hendrix Archive, Dies at 82
description: Alan Douglas, a music producer and packager who worked with jazz greats like Duke Ellington, recorded the prerap stylings of the Last Poets and published a book of monologues by Lenny Bruce  but who is best known as a controversial steward of the legacy of Jimi Hendrix  died on June 7 at his home in Paris. He was 82.

title: In Democratic Stronghold, a Republican Fights Back
description: EL PASO  A San Antonio native and former C.I.A. agent is trying to break through in the only region in this Republican state where congressional Democrats hold a steady grip: Texas border with Mexico.

title: Frank Schirrmacher, German Newspaper Publisher, Dies at 54
description: BERLIN  Frank Schirrmacher, a co-publisher of the Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung and one of Germanys most prominent and forceful intellectuals, died on Thursday after a heart attack. He was 54.

title: After Annexing Crimea, Euphoric Russia Turns Thoughts to Ukraine
description: MOSCOW  The event in Moscow last week was billed as an expert discussion, not a political one, on Ukraines future. But Sergei Y. Glazyev, an economic adviser to President Vladimir V. Putin with a distinctive Stalinist bent, unleashed some rather overtly political remarks.

title: University of Tokyos Favorite Disappointment
description: The university, locally known as Todai, churns out success in almost every field, except baseball. The team has lost 76 straight games.

title: As the Demand for Court Interpreters Climbs, State Budget Conflicts Grow as Well
description: SANTA FE, N.M.  Judge David Segura of Santa Fe County Magistrate Court called his first housing case of the day, a disagreement between Gabriela Herrera and her landlord over a rental payment. In Spanish, Ms. Herrera  born in California, raised in Mexico and a resident of this city for six years  recounted her side of the story, fixing her eyes on the judge, whose eyes, in turn, kept shifting to the interpreter translating her words into English in a booming baritone.

title: Ivory Coast vs. Japan: Live Blog
description: This is Ivory Coasts moment after two cycles of bad luck and bad draws at the World Cup. While Japan is looking to atone for some spotty pre-World Cup performances.

title: With Spurs Minds on a Title, the Heat Give Theirs a Break
description: SAN ANTONIO  After the San Antonio Spurs dealt his team two straight losses in Miami, Heat Coach Erik Spoelstra took an unconventional approach, advising his players to avoid even thinking about basketball. That was his prescription for Friday: no practice, no second-guessing themselves, no stress.

title: Massachusetts Democrats Hand Coakley a Setback
description: WORCESTER, Mass.  Massachusetts Democrats on Saturday endorsed for governor Steve Grossman, the state treasurer, passing over Martha Coakley, the attorney general, and setting up an intense fight for the party nomination in the September primary.

title: Calling Back a Zombie Ship From the Graveyard of Space
description: For 17 years, it has been drifting on a lonely course through space. Launched during the disco era and shuttered by NASA in 1997, the spacecraft is now returning to the civilization that abandoned it.

title: A Nation Teased by a Stale Promise of Supremacy
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay  Few in Uruguay will have heard of the English man of letters Cyril Connolly. Yet his most famous phrase  Whom the gods wish to destroy they first call promising  would not be lost on a country used to auspicious starts.

title: Rebels Fast Strike in Iraq Was Years in the Making
description: ERBIL, Iraq  When Islamic militants rampaged through the Iraqi city of Mosul last week, robbing banks of hundreds of millions of dollars, opening the gates of prisons and burning army vehicles, some residents greeted them as if they were liberators and threw rocks at retreating Iraqi soldiers.

title: Despite Five Bogeys, Kaymer Calmly Holds On to a Five-Shot Lead
description: PINEHURST, N.C.  No one plays the United States Open without hitting a shot that ends up somewhere unforeseen or, worse, somewhere unbelievably unlucky. What happens after that often defines the golfers competitive journey.

title: In Second Career Start, Harveys Former Teammate Blanks the Mets
description: After the finest pitching performance of his young career, in front of about two dozen friends and family members at Citi Field, Jesse Hahn returned to his locker in the visiting clubhouse and checked his phone. He found a simple text message: Good job. It was from Matt Harvey.

title: Yankees Arent Exactly Bombers, but Their Bats Are Showing Signs of Life
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  The Yankees went 12 straight games without scoring more than four runs before beating the Seattle Mariners, 6-3, on Thursday night to sweep their three-game series.

title: High School Stars Mix With Pros at Grand Prix
description: After the womens 1,500 meters Saturday at the Adidas Grand Prix on Randalls Island in New York, Alexa Efraimson had to put her hands on her knees, with beads of sweat dripping down her forehead as she tried to catch her breath. She had finished the race in 4 minutes 7.05 seconds, the second-fastest time in the event by a high school runner in the United States.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for June 14, 2014
Worry Under the Big Top as Mexico City Moves to Ban Circus Animals
description: MEXICO CITY  It is a weekday evening under the circus tent, and Bebeto Fuentes does it all effortlessly. He soars on the trapeze, vaults on and off a cantering horse, keeps an eye on the tigers, spins off the trampoline and takes a turn as a melancholy clown.

title: Pinehurst Scary? Not After Heart Surgery
description: PINEHURST, N.C.  While Erik Compton rested for his Saturday afternoon round at the United States Open, his mother, Eli, monitored the morning wave of players at Pinehurst No. 2. It was like watching a man-made disaster unfold. The first 33 golfers to tee off averaged 75.06 strokes, and four did not break 80.

title: Orphan Black Recap: Alison and Donnie Team Up
description: Season 2, Episode 9:

title: Czech Star Loses Again in His Own Showcase
description: Based on his inconsistency and unfilled potential, the Czech grandmaster David Navara is one of the more enigmatic of the worlds elite players.

title: Amanda Miller, Richard Nash
description: Amanda Christine Miller and Richard Nash were married Saturday in New York. Benjamin Eakeley, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated at a house owned by Lela Goren and designed by Ghiora Aharoni, a friend of the couple.

title: Ian Shin, Peter Hill
description: Kin-Yee Ian Shin and Peter Schwaner Hill were married Saturday at the Multicultural Arts Center in Cambridge, Mass. Peter J. Crosby, a friend of the couple who received permission from Massachusetts to solemnize the marriage, officiated.

title: Caroline Spencer, Thomas Spanos
description: Caroline Bliss Spencer, the daughter of Jody Boghossian Spencer and Randal W. Spencer of Providence, R.I., was married there Saturday to Thomas Michael Spanos, a son of Mary Kelly Spanos and Thomas Spanos of Campbell Hall, N.Y. The Rev. Henry J. Bodah, the chaplain of the Roman Catholic community at Brown University, performed the ceremony at the universitys Manning Chapel.

title: Jennifer Park, Daniel Choi
description: Dr. Jennifer Ahjung Park, the daughter of Hee Ja Park and Thomas Park of New Hyde Park, N.Y., was married Friday to Dr. Daniel Eunsuk Choi, the son of Hye Choi and Kyung Choi of Arcadia, Calif. Pastor John Park, the founder of the Numa Church, a nondenominational Christian group in Cerritos, Calif., officiated at Oheka Castle in Huntington, N.Y.

title: Christine Show, James Clarke II
description: Christine Lynn Show and James Anton Clarke II were married Saturday at the St. John of God Parish in Central Islip, N.Y. The Rev. Christopher Nowak, a Roman Catholic priest and the pastor of the church, performed the ceremony.

title: Sarah Meyer, Ari Brochin
description: Sarah Rachel Meyer, the daughter of Ruth Meyer and Jeff Meyer, both of Melbourne, Australia, is to be married Sunday to Ari Spicehandler Brochin, the son of Rabbi Reena Spicehandler and Jeremy Brochin of Philadelphia. Rabbi Micah Kelber will officiate at the Abode of the Message, a retreat center in New Lebanon, N.Y.

title: Nicole Rossi, Gregory Bleier
description: Nicole Lee Rossi and Gregory Charles Bleier were married Saturday by the Rev. Eric P. Raaser, a Roman Catholic priest, at the Immaculate Conception Church in Tuckahoe, N.Y.

title: A Lasting Third Impression
description: Juliana Margaret Thorstenn, the daughter of Susan E. Thorstenn and Magnus G. Thorstenn of Garden City, N.Y., was married Saturday to Thomas Moore Trudeau, a son of Jane Pauley and Garry Trudeau of New York. The Rev. Canon Robert A. Picken, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at the Cathedral of the Incarnation in Garden City.

title: Alexandra Steel and James Scott
description: Alexandra Deaton Steel and James Michael Scott were married Saturday on Aspen Mountain in Aspen, Colo. The Rev. Ted Pardoe, an Episcopal priest, officiated on land owned by Katherine and John Miller, friends of the bride.

title: Kate Hart, Sean Finnigan
description: Kate Celia Hart and Sean Walter Finnigan were married Saturday evening at the Metropolitan Building in Long Island City, Queens. The officiant was George S. Karyczak, a friend of the groom who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion.

title: Whitney Krueger, Duncan Kopp
description: Whitney Tate Krueger and Duncan Rath Kopp were married Saturday at the Watch Hill Chapel in Watch Hill, R.I. The Rev. Rebecca L. Spencer, a minister of the United Church of Christ, performed the ceremony.

title: Alexandra Press, Frank Maguire IV
description: Alexandra Boman Press and Frank Gregory Maguire IV were married Saturday by Gerald Fierst, a minister of the Universal Brotherhood Movement, in Sandy Hook Chapel at the Gateway National Recreation Area in Sandy Hook, N.J.

title: Fanny Schwartz, Michael Pertnoy
description: Fanny Rose Schwartz and Michael David Pertnoy were married Saturday evening at Center548, an event space in New York. Rabbi Mark H. Kula officiated.

title: Lisa Aronson, Matthew Wein
description: Lisa Rebecca Aronson and Matthew Jonathan Wein are to be married Sunday by Rabbi Gil Steinlauf at the Carnegie Institution for Science in Washington.

title: Lynn Feng and Quindlen Krovatin
description: Lynn Shi Feng, the daughter of Yaping Yu and Shengli Feng of Hong Kong, was married Wednesday to Quindlen Krovatin, a son of Anna Quindlen and Gerald Krovatin of New York. Judge Kimba M. Wood of the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York officiated at her chambers in New York. On Saturday Judge Wood led another ceremony at the grooms parents home in Stroudsburg, Pa., which incorporated the couples vows.

title: Martha Brown, Brett Zuckman
description: Martha Elizabeth Brown and Dr. Brett Michael Zuckman are to be married Sunday evening at the Castle Hill Inn in Newport, R.I. Rabbi Leon Waldman will officiate.

title: Nina Kretzmer, Gabriel Seed
description: Nina Sara Kretzmer, a daughter of Deborah S. Rosenberg of Kansas City, Mo., and Peter E. Kretzmer of Millwood, N.Y., is to be married Sunday in Jericho, N.Y., to Gabriel Nachman Seed, a son of Lori R. Seed and Rabbi David C. Seed of Toronto. The grooms father will perform the ceremony at the Jericho Jewish Center.

title: Rachel Stockman, Robert Koven
description: Rachel Lauren Stockman, a daughter of Jennifer B. Stockman and David A. Stockman of Greenwich, Conn., was married Saturday evening to Robert Jerold Payne Koven, a son of Gale S. Koven and Robert P. Koven of Marietta, Ga. Rabbi Irwin Kula officiated at the home of the brides parents.

title: David Barrineau, Marc Borsak
description: David Clark Barrineau and Marc David Borsak were married Saturday at Ici, a restaurant in Brooklyn. Stephen Borsak, a brother of Mr. Borsak who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated.

title: Melinda Anderson and John Moore
description: Melinda Christe Anderson and John Burnette Moore were married Saturday evening at the Guilford Yacht Club in Guilford, Conn. John Rosica, a friend of the brides family who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated.

title: Joanna Parga, Daniel Belinkie
description: Dr. Joanna Jean Parga, the daughter of Janet Kress Parga and Anthony L. Parga of East Norwich, N.Y., was married Saturday in West Suffield, Conn., to Daniel Evan Belinkie, a son of Kathy Eckber Belinkie and Dr. Steven A. Belinkie of West Hartford, Conn. The brides father, a State Supreme Court justice in Mineola, N.Y., officiated, as allowed by Connecticut law, at the summer house of the grooms family.

title: Shayna Solomon and Ross Zachary
description: Dr. Shayna Marlee Solomon, a daughter of Sheila Solomon Rudd of St. Petersburg, Fla., and Stanford R. Solomon of Tampa, Fla., was married Saturday evening to Ross Michael Zachary, a son of Nancy L. Zachary and Seth M. Zachary of Greenwich, Conn. Rabbi Jonathan E. Blake officiated at Three Sixty Degrees, an event space in New York.

title: Jeffrey Hoffman, Robert Lane
description: Jeffrey Faulkner Hoffman and Robert William Lane were married Saturday. Mayor Robert G. Foster of Long Beach, Calif., officiated at the Long Beach home of Michelle and Andrew Walker, friends of the couple.

title: Alison Scaramella, Thomas Baker
description: Alison Claire Scaramella and Dr. Thomas Max Baker were married Saturday at the Inns of Aurora in Aurora, N.Y. Angela Carrano, an aunt of the bride who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated.

title: Leigh Stearns, Christopher Dellasega
description: Leigh Asher Stearns and Christopher Michael Dellasega were married Saturday evening by the Rev. Lissa Smith, a cousin of the bride and an Episcopal priest, at the Ausable Club in St. Huberts, N.Y.

title: George Chauncey Jr. and Ronald Gregg
description: George Austin Chauncey Jr. and Ronald Eric Gregg were married Thursday in New Haven. Bianca J. Bowles, a justice of the peace there, officiated at City Hall.

title: Emily Washkowitz, Adam Tarkan
description: Emily Rosine Washkowitz, the daughter of Barbara Washkowitz and Alan Washkowitz of New York, was married Saturday at her parents summer house in East Hampton, N.Y., to Adam Joseph Tarkan, a son of Shirley A. Tarkan and Dr. Steven K. Tarkan of Miami. Rabbi David Posner officiated.

title: Connor Crawford, Ian DeAndrea-Lazarus
description: Connor Roberts-Lariscy Crawford and Ian Anthony DeAndrea-Lazarus were married Saturday at River House, an event space in St. Augustine, Fla. Alex Abenchuchan, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated.

title: Sarah Cassar, Matthew Haddad
description: Sarah Catherine Cassar and Matthew John Haddad were married Saturday evening at Monteverde at Oldstone, a banquet hall in Cortlandt Manor, N.Y. The Rev. Yejide Peters, an Episcopal priest, officiated.

title: Christina Chiou, Eric Tong
description: Christina Chiou, a daughter of Joanna Lee-Yun Ho and Jeffrey Jen-Shan Chiou of Irvine, Calif., was married Saturday to Eric Aisi Tong, the son of Dr. Jie Hu of Wexford, Pa., and Penger Tong of Hong Kong. The Rev. Gregory Norton performed the ceremony at the Westwood United Methodist Church in Los Angeles.

title: At Long Last, Love Trumped Art
description: Ashley Marie Laracey and Troy Louis Schumacher, dancers with the New York City Ballet, were married Saturday at the home of Darren Henault and Michael Bassett, friends of the couple, in Millbrook, N.Y. The officiant was David Prottas, another dancer with the company who became a minister of American Marriage Ministries for the occasion.

title: Heather Platt, Benjamin Jacobson
description: Heather Anne Platt, a daughter of Barbara Bishoff Platt and Steven Platt of Warren, Vt., was married Saturday to Benjamin Paul Jacobson, a son of Susan E. Jacobson and Douglas E. Jacobson of Berkeley, Calif. The grooms father performed the ceremony at the Trapp Family Lodge in Stowe, Vt., with permission from the state.

title: Katerina DeVito, Mohammad Al Seaidan
description: Katerina Maria DeVito and Dr. Mohammad Saleh Hamed Al Seaidan were married Saturday evening at St. John Seymour Chapel of Choate Rosemary Hall, a boarding school in Wallingford, Conn., attended by the bride. Janice Favreau, a Connecticut justice of the peace, performed the ceremony.

title: Alexandra McArthur, Owen Fitzpatrick
description: Alexandra Cline McArthur and William Owen Charles Fitzpatrick were married Saturday at Oak Hill, an event space in Hudson, N.Y. Angela H. Wright, a minister of the United Church of Christ, officiated.

title: Kari Floren, Michael McKenzie
description: Kari Joanne Floren and Michael McKenzie were married Tuesday at the Hotel Giraffe in New York. Gillien Goll, a friend of the couple who is a minister of the Spiritual Science Church, officiated.

title: Annie Wang and Kenneth Fan
description: Annie Chandler Wang, the daughter of Joyce Kang and Dr. Albert Wang of Dayton, Ohio, was married Saturday to Kenneth Chen Fan, a son of Christina Fan and Dr. Titan Fan of Falmouth, Me. The Rev. Geoff Parker, a minister of the United Church of Christ, performed the ceremony at the First Parish Church in Brunswick, Me., where he is the associate pastor. The Rev. Ryan Yi, a minister of the Evangelical Covenant Church, participated in the ceremony.

title: Elizabeth Clark-Polner, David Miller
description: Elizabeth Paige Clark-Polner and David Wilkins Miller were married Saturday. Peter Salovey, the president of Yale University who is also a justice of the peace in Connecticut, officiated at Yales Dwight Chapel in New Haven.

title: Clarissa Polk, Tushin Shah
description: Clarissa Vaughn Polk, the daughter of Cheryl D. Polk and Charles E. Polk of St. Louis, was married Saturday to Tushin Parthiv Shah, the son of Monica P. Shah and Parthiv D. Shah of West Windsor, N.J. The Rev. Alex I. Peterson, a Baptist minister, performed the ceremony at Trinity Church in Princeton, N.J. Afterward, Harendra Dave, a Hindu priest, led a Hindu ceremony at the Hyatt Regency Princeton.

title: Maria Kanos, Stavros Karageorgiou
description: Maria Kanos and Stavros Karageorgiou were married Saturday at the Greek Orthodox Church of the Holy Resurrection in Brookville, N.Y. The Rev. John Vlahos, a Greek Orthodox priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Sari Fandel, Stefan Weiss
description: Dr. Sari Nicole Fandel and Dr. Stefan Craig Weiss were married Saturday evening by Rabbi Jonathan Kaplan at the Ritz-Carlton hotel in Fort Lauderdale, Fla.

title: Malisa Iannino, Michael Frakes
description: Malisa Catherine Lucia Iannino and Michael Allan Frakes were married Saturday at the Kings Chapel in Boston. The Rev. Kristin G. Schmidt, a Unitarian Universalist minister, performed the ceremony.

title: Mary Jo Kinser, Greg Hawkins
description: Mary Jo Kinser and Greg Hawkins were married Friday evening at Heritage Farms Village Chapel in Huntington, W.Va. The Rev. W. Ford Price, a United Methodist minister, officiated.

title: Quotation of the Day for Sunday, June 15, 2014
description: Cantor was the hub for finance, the hub for a host of big corporations that could trust him to get things done. He was the one standing between the conservative pitchforks and the business community on a whole host of issues.

title: Young, Former Titans Quarterback, Retires
description: Quarterback Vince Young, who has not played in the N.F.L. since 2011, told NFL.com that he had retired. Young, the No. 3 overall pick in 2006 by the Tennessee Titans, was released in 2011 after a falling-out with Jeff Fisher, then the Titans coach. Young participated in the Cleveland Browns minicamp before signing with the team May 1, but the team cut him four days after drafting Johnny Manziel.

title: Tim Cook, Making Apple His Own
description: Tim Cook, Apples chief executive, was an adolescent boy in a small Alabama town in the early 1970s when he saw something he couldnt forget.

title: Ballparks Lights Fail in Oakland, as Does Yankees Offense
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  First, a bank of lights above left field was out at the O.co Coliseum, causing a 38-minute delay in the fourth inning.

title: Corrections: June 15, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Fearing a Junta Crackdown, Cambodian Workers Stream Out of Thailand
description: Tens of thousands of Cambodians working in Thailand have fled the country in a chaotic exodus that appears to be driven by fears of a crackdown on illegal foreign laborers by the military junta that seized power in Thailand last month.

title: There Are Iowa Reasons for Talking About Illegal Immigration
description: In this clip from his June 13 show, Jan Mickelson, a conservative radio host in Des Moines, discusses one of the ways illegal immigrants enter the state.

title: Massacre Claim Shakes Iraq
description: BAGHDAD  Wielding the threat of sectarian slaughter, Sunni Islamist militants claimed on Sunday that they had massacred hundreds of captive Shiite members of Iraqs security forces, posting grisly pictures of a mass execution in Tikrit as evidence and warning of more killing to come.

title: Lou Dalton: Spring 2015 Menswear
description: London

title: The Worlds Best Father Gets a Close Shave
description: Today is Fathers Day! Whether its cooking breakfast in bed or playing superheroes together, my daughter Alice Bee always has something fun planned for the two of us. And its sounding like today is going to be no exception: She just informed me that she has scheduled my first-ever straight razor shave down at the local barbershop.

title: Morning Views
description: Republicans continue to rail against President Obamas trade of five Taliban detainees for Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl on May 31, writes The New York Times editorial board. But prisoner releases in wartime are never simple or clean. The board cites President George W. Bushs release of a Moroccan Al Qaeda operative by the name of Abdullah Tabarak, chief bodyguard to Osama bin Laden, in 2004 as precedent for President Obamas decision. The Times believes opposition to the swap derives not from concerns for national security but for partisanship: Perhaps Republicans were not troubled by such releases and the more than 500 others that occurred during the Bush administration because they were not then blinded by hatred of the White House occupant.

title: Kent & Curwen: Spring 2015 Menswear
description: London

title: Topman Design: Spring 2015 Menswear
description: London

title: The Corporates and the Crazies
description: Jeremy Peters and Shaila Dewan write about corporate shock over the sudden fall of Eric Cantor; its further confirmation of the story I told in my last column. Corporations and plutocrats had a good deal going: they bankrolled politicians who talked cultural populism during campaigns, but more or less ignored all that and focused on tax cuts and deregulation after the polls closed. And Cantor fit that profile perfectly.

title: Where Dishonesty Is Best Policy, U.S. Soccer Falls Short
description: NATAL, Brazil  The list of improvements that the United States mens soccer team needs to make is considerable. Coach Jurgen Klinsmann would like to see a more consistent back line, better touch from his midfielders and plenty more production from the attackers.

title: Bombings Kill Up to 21 People in Baghdad
description: Insurgents set off two bombs in separate incidents in central Baghdad on Sunday, killing as many as 21 people, witnesses said, and breaking a recent although brief lull in attacks in Iraqs capital city.

title: Disciplined Democrats
description: Matt Yglesias pushes back against claims, by Ross Douthat among others, that the Democratic Party is a fragile coalition held together only by Hillary Clintons personal popularity. Hes right; Id just like to add a few thoughts.

title: In Our Pages: June 16
description: 1914: Terrific Storm Sweeps Over Paris, Causing Roads to Collapse, Engulfing Passers-By

title: Double-Duty Dads
description: Anne-Marie Slaughter has noted that while everybody asks expectant moms how theyre going to balance work and family, few think to ask the same of dads. But now that may be changing  and dads answers reveal a lot about American culture at home and at the office.

title: Netanyahu Says Three Were Taken by Hamas
description: JERUSALEM  Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Sunday that Israel knew for a fact that the kidnapping of three Israeli teenagers was the work of the militant Islamic movement Hamas but held the Palestinian Authority responsible, arguing that the abduction proved that the world was wrong to accept the Palestinian government formed this month with Hamass consent.

title: Looking at Link Between Violent Video Games and Lack of Empathy
description: The sound of machine guns rattled through the building as explosions shook the walls.

title: Jonathan Saunders: Spring 2015 Menswear
description: London

title: Casey Kasem, Wholesome Voice of Pop Radio, Dies at 82
description: Casey Kasem, a disc jockey who never claimed to love rock n roll but who built a long and lucrative career from it, creating and hosting one of radios most popular syndicated pop music shows, American Top 40, died on Sunday in a hospital in Gig Harbor, Wash. He was 82.

title: Switzerland vs. Ecuador: World Cup 2014 Live Blog
description: The fact that Ecuador emerged from the daunting qualifying process in South America should tell you theyre not to be discounted. But Switzerland will be eager to start strong before facing France in its second game.

title: Casey Kasem, an American Voice
description: At the height of his career, Casey Kasem was among the best-known D.J.s in the country. His weekly four-hour show, American Top 40 defined middle-of-the-road radio taste in America at the time.

title: Vows | A Defining Moment
description: Yale University professors George Chauncey and Ronald Gregg have been together 20 years, but they did not decide to marry until after Mr. Chauncey testified in two high-profile Supreme Court cases.

title: Whats On Sunday
description: 8 P.M. (Smithsonian) SHARK GIRL My family and morals have made me the person I am today, Madison Stewart, above, says, before adding what might give some viewers pause: When I speak of family, I speak of sharks. The 20-year-old Ms. Stewart, who was 2 when she began crisscrossing the Great Barrier Reef off the coast of Australia on a boat with her parents, goes where few others dare. Since the age of 12, she has been diving with sharks, without the protection of a cage but armed with the video camera she uses as a media weapon to fight the misconceptions circling these creatures. This documentary follows Ms. Stewart as she travels from Australia to Mexico, Palau and the Bahamas to commune with tiger sharks, Caribbean reef sharks and silky sharks  and in the process debunks myths and alleviates fears by demonstrating how these predators help keep the entire ocean ecosystem in balance.

title: MAN: Spring 2015 Menswear
description: London

title: Six Are Killed in a House Fire in Newark
description: NEWARK  An 11-year-old boy and five of his relatives died on Sunday in an early morning fire that swept through the familys house here, killing everyone inside and leaving a neighborhood in mourning.

title: Making Balls Behind Bars
description: In a maximum security prison in Brazil, select inmates make soccer balls in exchange for reduced sentences.

title: Dancing for the Knicks Is a Coveted Opportunity, but the Salary Is a Secret
description: There were no rabble-rousers among the aspiring Knicks City Dancers who poured into a dance studio in Midtown last week. There was no rebellion amid the shoulder shimmies and high kicks as dozens of young women prepared for an upcoming audition for a coveted spot on the squad.

title: 22 Jump Street and Dragon 2 Power Weekend Box Office
description: Two well-reviewed sequels became immediate hits at North American theaters over the weekend, but ticket sales for some films already playing fell sharply.

title: Casey Kasem Remembered on Twitter
description: Kerri Kasem used her Facebook page on Sunday to announce the death of her father, Casey Kasem. She described the family as heartbroken.

title: Host in a Big-Tent Era of Pop Music
description: The music didnt matter that much on American Top 40, the syndicated radio countdown show devised by Casey Kasem and a handful of Los Angeles radio colleagues. Individual songs might advance steadily toward No. 1, stall out along the way, suddenly leapfrog into the Top 10 or peak early and plummet. They would come and go: rock or pop, soul or country, hip-hop or synth-pop. The format would hold them all.

title: Pakistan Military Wages Assault Against Militants
description: PESHAWAR, Pakistan  Ending years of hesitation, Pakistans military on Sunday said it was launching a major military operation against the Pakistani Taliban and allied foreign militants at their main base in the tribal belt along the Afghan border.

title: Obama Discusses Climate Change
description: At a commencement ceremony at the University of California, Irvine, President Obama called for action on climate change.

title: For Your Birthday, We Got You the Sun
description: With permanent works installed on the High Line and at the newly opened National September 11 Memorial & Museum, Spencer Finch is now pursing his interest in the passage of light and time across the all-but-transparent atrium of the Morgan Library & Museum.

title: Up at a Villa, Down in a Temple
description: The annual summer festivities at Caramoor, a genteel estate and pleasant getaway from the city, kick off on Saturday with an opening-night gala featuring Joshua Bell playing Sibeliuss soulful Violin Concerto with the Orchestra of St. Lukes.

title: Side by Side by Riverside
description: The River to River Festival, presented by the Lower Manhattan Cultural Council, gets better every year, and this summer, two female choreographers  both integral to postmodern dance in New York  make the lineup even brighter. Eiko, the extraordinary Japanese dancer revered for her haunting collaborations with Koma, her usual male counterpart, shakes up her creative process in Two Women, a new duet featuring the young Japanese dancer Tomoe Aihara.

title: Senior-Year Blues in 1950s Texas
description: It is 1951 at the start of Peter Bogdanovichs The Last Picture Show (1971), and a bleak winter wind whips through the dusty small town of Anarene, Tex., as high school students (played by Cybill Shepherd, in her screen debut; Jeff Bridges; and Timothy Bottoms) prepare for graduation and the rigors of adulthood. From what they encounter  marital infidelity, class struggle, economic and cultural decline  the future doesnt look promising.

title: Peace, Love and Mayhem
description: Hardcore can be a closed circle, with dogmas attacking from every side, which is why its refreshing to see the nonlinear path Trash Talk has taken to its career.

title: When Barristers Do Battle
description: If youre chained up in a safe at the bottom of a shark tank, a colleague advises early in The Escape Artist, what you do is call for Houdini. The Houdini he means is Will Burton (David Tennant, expressive as ever), Londons top-ranked junior criminal defense barrister, according to a recent poll, and well up the ladder toward queens counsel because of his ability to win any case. But his invincible legal acrobatics backfire when a handshake denied sends his latest client, the reclusive bird lover, sadist and psychopath Liam Foyle (Toby Kebbell), into a rage  leaving Will, his wife (Ashley Jensen) and their son (Gus Barry) targets of his revenge. Enter Wills professional nemesis, Maggie Gardner (Sophie Okonedo, fresh off a Tony victory for best supporting actress in a play for A Raisin in the Sun), frothing to overtake her rival. David Wolstencroft, the mastermind behind the BBC spy series MI-5, wrote this two-part Masterpiece Mystery! thriller, beginning Sunday night on PBS, which plumbs Wills justification for his job in all its ramifications. Everyone deserves a defense, he maintains. Even he.

title: Siemens and Mitsubishi Heavy Industries Nearing an Offer for Alstom
description: Updated, 2:41 p.m. | FRANKFURT  Competition to acquire the French energy equipment maker Alstom was expected to intensify on Monday, as Siemens of Germany and Mitsubishi Heavy Industries of Japan were said to be preparing to make a joint offer that could pressure General Electric to improve its $13.5 billion bid.

title: Richard Nicoll: Spring 2015 Menswear
description: London

title: There Is a Divide in Republican Party, Cantor Says
description: Washington  Representative Eric Cantor of Virginia, the House majority leader, said Sunday that he saw a troublesome division within the Republican Party, as he discussed his stunning primary defeat, which many are assessing for possible evidence that the Tea Party is regaining steam among Republicans.

title: France vs. Honduras: Live Blog
description: France rolled past Honduras in its opening match, helped by a red card to Honduran midfielder Wilson Palacios and two goals from forward Karim Benzema.

title: Christopher Shannon: Spring 2015 Menswear
description: London

title: Obama Pushes Iraqis to Mend Sectarian Rifts
description: RANCHO MIRAGE, Calif.  As President Obama weighs airstrikes against marauding militants in Iraq, he has concluded that any American military action must be conditioned on a political plan to try to heal Iraqs sectarian rifts, a senior administration official said on Sunday.

title: Allergan, Defending Its Fort Botox
description: The feisty chief of Allergan, Botoxs maker, says a takeover would imperil the companys drug-discovery mission, reports Natasha Singer of The New York Times. Read more

title: The Making of a Male Model
description: In January, we followed Tomas Gajdos during his first season  from London to Paris and from castings to fittings  as he tried to break into the fashion business.

title: U.S. Plans to Evacuate Many Embassy Workers
description: ERBIL, Iraq  The American Embassy in Baghdad plans to evacuate a substantial number of its personnel this week in the face of a militant advance that rapidly swept from the north toward the capital, the State Department announced on Sunday.

title: Agi & Sam: Spring 2015 Menswear
description: London

title: Moving Together, if Not in Unison
description: One evening in 2007, Preston Miller found himself at a birthday party full of crazy talented people. A freshman in Fordham Universitys B.F.A. program with the Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater, he was surrounded by the likes of Wynton Marsalis, Desmond Richardson and a mentor, the Ailey dancer Matthew Rushing. At one point, Mr. Miller recalled, Matthew leaned over to me and said, Man, if we wanted to, we could go out tonight and turn New York out, if we all got together.

title: For Fox, Much Is Riding on 3 Sequels to Avatar
description: LOS ANGELES  Like the deep-sea craft James Cameron used to dive nearly seven miles down in the Pacific, the long-awaited screenplays for his three sequels to Avatar will soon pop to the surface, probably within weeks.

title: Editorial Cartoon
description: Promises of universal suffrage for Hong Kong cant seem to get through to Beijing.

title: Argentina vs. Bosnia-Herzegovina: Live Blog
description: Argentina is again fully committed to its attack, but Bosnia, with punishing finishers, is a perfect candidate to exploit the Argentines possible defensive flaws.

title: Williams Companies to Pay $6 Billion for Controlling Stake in Shale Gas Firm
description: The Williams Companies said on Sunday that it had agreed to pay nearly $6 billion in cash to acquire control of Access Midstream Partners, a natural gas services company active in several areas with shale gas formations.

title: A Regular-Guy Gumshoe Tiptoeing in Literary London
description: In J. K. Rowlings latest novel, The Silkworm, her appealing detective hero Cormoran Strike is back, and so is his resourceful sidekick, Robin Ellacott, a gumshoe team thats on its way to becoming as celebrated for its mystery-solving skills as Nick and Nora Charles of Thin Man fame, and Mikael Blomkvist and Lisbeth Salander (a.k.a. the girl with the dragon tattoo).

title: Bridge World Meets at Longevity Valley Event in China
description: Major bridge events are in a lull in the United States, while everyone waits for the Summer North American Championships in Las Vegas next month. Fortunately, for those who dont mind watching bridge from abroad, theres the Internet.

title: Evolution and the Bible Literalists
description: To the Editor:

title: Were Eating Too Much
description: To the Editor:

title: These Girls Just Want to Play Baseball ...
Detroits Savage Wasteland: The Future of Our Cities?
description: To the Editor:

title: James Franco to Direct Play
description: James Franco, below, will soon add another occupation to his extensive cultural rsum when he makes histheatrical directorial debut for the premiere of The Long Shrift by the author Robert Boswell, presented as part of the Rattlestick Playwrights Theaters coming 20th anniversary season. The play tells the story of a convict just released from jail who was accused of rape as a teenager. Performances at the Rattlestick are scheduled from July 7 to Aug. 23. Other world premieres in the 2014-15 season are Pitbulls by Keith Josef Adkins (The Last Saint on Sugar Hill), which is to run from Nov. 6 to Dec. 13, and Shesh Yak by Laith Nakli, scheduled for Jan. 15 to Feb. 19. The Rattlestick also announced that Jurez: A Mythology Documentary by Rubn Polendo, would be part of the second annual Theater: Village festival, in which a number of new works at West Village locations share a playwright or theme.

title: Batting Leadoff, Granderson Helps Mets Beat Padres
description: During Saturdays game, Mets Manager Terry Collins approached Curtis Granderson on the bench in the dugout and began asking him questions, like Have you hit well out the leadoff spot before? and How have you felt up there?

title: Tony for Best Musical Is Nice, but a Profitable Hit Is Better
description: All winter and spring, the Broadway producer Joey Parnes wore his game face to the advertising meetings at 11:30 a.m. Wednesdays for his $7.5 million musical A Gentlemans Guide to Love & Murder. The show was losing money most weeks, and his big bet  that the June 8 Tony Awards could be a game changer  was a ways off and hardly a sure thing.

title: Subs
description: MONDAYS PUZZLE  Theres a revealer here in Bruce Haights grid, but you might have to look for it. Its at 11 Down, not a place where you might normally expect to find the punchline of the puzzle.

title: Out of Desert Dust, a Miracle on a Shoestring
description: MECCA, Calif.  About an hour east of Palm Springs, past the Tesla and Maserati dealers and the poodle and labradoodle walkers, lies St. Anthonys Trailer Park, in the eastern Coachella Valley. It is a vast psychic and economic distance from the annual spring hipster music festival. This Coachella is a place where farmworkers live in dilapidated mobile home parks improbably named after saints. These are communities where clean drinking water and reliable electricity are never givens, and where, during the rainy season, children wrap plastic bags around their sneakers to stay dry while parched desert turns to mud.

title: Some New Games to Sink Your Claws Into
description: LOS ANGELES  One of the hardest things to do at the Electronic Entertainment Expo, the annual video game trade show here, is actually to play video games. Even if you possess a media badge that lets you skip the long lines at the Los Angeles Convention Center, youre often allowed only to watch a developer play a forthcoming game  or worse, watch a video pitch that highlights the concepts that the makers will try to execute over the next year or two. At times, it can feel like a book expo where you read only proposals or a film festival for screenplay treatments.

title: The Other Veterans Scandal
description: WASHINGTON  THE Department of Veterans Affairs is mired in scandal. More than 57,000 veterans have been waiting at least three months for a doctors appointment. Another 64,000 never even made it onto a waiting list. There are allegations that waits for care either caused or contributed to veterans deaths.

title: Among a Troupes New Works, a Battle ...
description: In the three years since Robert Battle became artistic director of Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater, he has shown remarkable poise in balancing between boldness and cool calculation as he revamps a repertory long in need of renovation.
