title: ... And an Ostrich That Spreads Its Wings
description: One of the newest additions to Alvin Ailey American Dance Theaters repertory is, in another sense, the oldest. Asadata Dafora choreographed Awassa Astrige/Ostrich in 1932, soon after moving to New York from his native Sierra Leone. On Friday at the David H. Koch Theater, Ailey became one of a handful of troupes to present this three-and-a-half-minute gem, with Antonio Douthit-Boyd as its majestic interpreter: part prowling warrior, part resplendent bird.

title: Museum Power Squabble Borders on the Surreal
description: NORTH MIAMI, Fla.  In a somewhat bizarre arrangement, scholars gathered at the Museum of Contemporary Art here this weekend for a symposium led by a man whom city officials view as the museums director and who museum officials regard as an impostor. It was scheduled despite objections from the museums board, which ultimately gave up its effort to cancel the event inside the museums city-owned building.

title: Racing by Snowmobile for Economic Survival in Michigan
description: Cool in tone and temperature, Nick Bentgens Northern Light turns white vistas and blue language into a sneakily compelling, endlessly patient observation of three working-class families in the Upper Peninsula of Michigan.

title: France Leaves Scoring Struggles Behind in Its Opener
description: PORTO ALEGRE, Brazil  It was a rocky start to the World Cup in Porto Alegre.

title: For Katie Couric, Shift to Web From TV Is Complete
description: After three decades of continuous work in television, Katie Couric has now officially moved on to what she is calling my new chapter.

title: A Theme Park for Thomas Trains
description: A theme park based on the adventures of the popular childrens character Thomas the Tank Engine is to begin construction at Edaville USA Railroad in Carver, Mass., The Associated Press reported. The park, called Thomas Land, will have 14 rides inspired by characters in the British television show Thomas & Friends, which is broadcast on PBS in the United States. A 20-minute train ride on a life-size Thomas the Tank Engine is to be the parks centerpiece when it opens in the summer of 2015.

title: How We Play the Game
description: Every team plays in distinct ways. To understand their style, one must learn a bit about each countrys history.

title: A Long Days Bach Journey, by Train, Foot and Ferry, With Cello
description: When two festivals combine to produce an event, you might expect it to be a big deal. And A Suite Ride Through NYC, which was presented on Friday by the Five Boroughs Music Festival but was also the opening program in the new Early Music Festival: NYC, was indeed big in many ways.

title: London Welcomes the Tech Set and Its Money
description: LONDON  From hipster hangouts in East London to corporate headquarters in West London, the British capital will roll out the red carpet this week for many of the worlds leading tech entrepreneurs and investors.

title: The True Cost of Hidden Money
description: GABRIEL ZUCMAN is a 27-year-old French economist who decided to solve a puzzle: Why do international balance sheets each year show more liabilities than assets, as if the world is in debt to itself?

title: High-Scoring As Punish Yankees in a Matchup of Fill-In Starters
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  The Yankees and the Oakland Athletics have both lost multiple starting pitchers to injury this season. In a matchup of replacements at the Coliseum on Sunday, the As gave another reason they have the best record in the American League.

title: Kaymer, Leading All the Way, Wins by 8 for His First U.S. Open Title
description: PINEHURST, N.C.  Martin Kaymer arrived at the first tee Sunday dressed appropriately for a methodical man with a modest, logical plan for the day.

title: Device Maker Medtronic Agrees to Merger and Will Move to Ireland
description: Updated, 10:13 p.m. | Medtronic agreed on Sunday to buy Covidien for $42.9 billion, combining two of the worlds biggest medical device makers and helping Medtronic lower some taxes by gaining access to cash held overseas.

title: Starbucks to Provide Free College Education to Thousands of Workers
description: Starbucks will provide a free online college education to thousands of its workers, without requiring that they remain with the company, through an unusual arrangement with Arizona State University, the company and the university will announce on Monday.

title: Out of Power Almost 7 Years, Blair Is Still Haunted by a Legacy of War
description: LONDON  Twiggy Garcia, a part-time bartender, had talked with friends about making a citizens arrest if he ever got near Tony Blair, the former prime minister who led Britain into war in Iraq. But he never seriously imagined it happening.

title: Its Privacy vs. the People in the Battle for Martins Beach
description: HALF MOON BAY, Calif.  The Pacific Ocean glistens in the distance, past the rolling bluffs that rise beyond the electric gate that blocks off Martins Beach Road. The road leads to Martins Beach, once a revered hideaway for surfers, fishers and beachgoers drawn by its isolation, dramatic cliffs and sweep of soft sand.

title: Modern Cosmology Versus Gods Creation
description: This is the seventh in a series of interviews about religion that I am conducting for The Stone. The interviewee for this installment is Tim Maudlin, a professor of philosophy at New York University and the author of Philosophy of Physics: Space and Time.

title: Eric Cantors Defeat Exposed a Beltway Journalism Blind Spot
description: Its now clear why the primary defeat of the House majority leader, Eric Cantor, came so completely out of the blue last week: Beltway blindness that put a focus on fund-raising, power-brokering and partisan back-and-forth created a reality distortion field that obscured the will of the people.

title: A Curious List of People Who Donated to the Central Park Zoo
description: Almost from the time Central Park opened in the late 1850s, prominent citizens pushed for the inclusion of an animal menagerie like those in London and Paris. Unsolicited donations quickly followed, from powerful men like the secretary of state for Abraham Lincoln and a 10-year-old boy with no ties to power or fame. Each animal and donor was listed in the parks annual reports, including the report from 1866:

title: Egyptian Police Confiscate Newsletter, Arrest Sign Holders and Close Grocery Stores
description: CAIRO  The Egyptian police over the weekend confiscated a human rights groups newsletter, arrested two activists for a paper sign criticizing the police and shut down two Cairo grocery store chains that the police said had ties to the Muslim Brotherhood.

title: Giving Life to Central Park Zoo, One Donation at a Time
description: The year was 1864, and a Manhattan hatter named Nicholas Espenscheid had come into possession of a spare nutria  the beaver-size water rat whose fur was used for hats.

title: Thousands to Be Questioned on Eligibility for Health Insurance Subsidies
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration is contacting hundreds of thousands of people with subsidized health insurance to resolve questions about their eligibility, as consumer advocates express concern that many will be required to repay some or all of the subsidies.

title: Breaking Up Is Hard to Do for the Rangers
description: The N.H.L. playoffs are grueling, but the truly hard part for the Rangers comes now, as General Manager Glen Sather decides who will be back for another try at the Stanley Cup and who will be gone.

title: With an Amazon Smartphone, the Retailer Seeks a Tether to Consumers
description: Hold the phone: Amazon wants to burrow even deeper into your life.

title: Events in Iraq Open Door for Interventionist Revival, Historian Says
description: McLEAN, Va.  In a much-discussed essay, the historian Robert Kagan recently depicted President Obama as presiding over an inward turn by the United States that threatened the global order and broke with more than 70 years of American presidents and precedence. He called for Mr. Obama to resist a popular pull toward making the United States a nation without larger responsibilities, and to reassume the more muscular approach to the world out of vogue in Washington since the war in Iraq drained the country of its appetite for intervention.

title: William M. Roth, Shipping Heir Who Became Lifelong Public Servant, Dies at 97
description: As the scion of a shipping empire, William Matson Roth grew up in a 43-room home with 16 acres of formal gardens. When his twin sisters made their debut at a ball there in 1939, The San Francisco Chronicle said they were launched like luxury liners.

title: Yes He Could
description: Several times in recent weeks Ive found myself in conversations with liberals who shake their heads sadly and express their disappointment with President Obama. Why? I suspect that theyre being influenced, often without realizing it, by the prevailing media narrative.

title: Evacuating Children Along a Dangerous Ukraine Route
description: SLOVYANSK, Ukraine  It was a trip no mother would wish to take. But faced with few options, a group of women and children piled into a blue minivan on a recent day to take to the dangerous road out of town on the way to a safer place.

title: Dangerous Divisiveness
description: For an increasing number of Americans, the tenor of politics has reached a near-religious pitch, in which people on opposing ends of the ideological scale take on theological properties: good or evil, angels or demons, here to either save our way of life or destroy it.

title: Worries Over Access to Free Public TV
description: Public television officials are raising the concern that the Federal Communications Commissions planned spectrum incentive auction, intended to free airwaves for use by wireless broadband companies, could leave parts of the country without over-the-air public television access.

title: Bank Tool Is Expanding Unbanked Households, Regulators Say
description: In her early college years, when Charlette Williams started routinely mismanaging her finances and pushing her checking account balance into the red, she never thought the mistakes would haunt her five years later, she said. Now, she is paying a steep price.

title: Corporate Confidence Likely to Bring Pricier Deals
description: As companies feel bolder in making acquisitions this year, the price they are willing to pay seems likely to rise as well.

title: A Cramped View of Antitrust Laws
description: American antitrust laws have protected consumers against monopolies and cartels for more than a century. But a recent appeals court decision could severely limit the enforcement of those laws against foreign cartels that supply critical components used in cellphones, computers and other products Americans buy.

title: Ultra Violet, Warhol Superstar, Dies at 78
description: Isabelle Collin Dufresne, the French-born artist, actress and author known as Ultra Violet, the beauty among the superstars of Andy Warhols glory days at his studio, the Factory, died on Saturday at a Manhattan hospital. She was 78 and lived in Manhattan and in Nice, France.

title: Despite a Shadow, Messi Shimmers in Argentinas Cup Opener
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Lionel Messi can never be the man Argentina wants him to be, since that man is Diego Maradona, and in their eyes not even Messi  no matter what genius he conjures  will ever measure up to Maradona.

title: How to Stabilize Iraq and Stop the March of ISIS
Fighting Terrorism With More Money
description: If all goes according to President Obamas plan, the United States will soon be making a major new investment of $5 billion so that other countries can help in the fight against extremists. Regardless of how sensible such a proposal might sound, many things can go wrong, and the new program already seems too heavily dependent on military responses.

title: Agency Aims to Regulate Map Aids in Vehicles
description: Getting directions on the road from Google Maps and other smartphone apps is a popular alternative to the expensive navigation aids included in some cars. The apps are also a gray area when it comes to laws banning the use of cellphones or texting while driving.

title: Why Hispanics Dont Have a Larger Political Voice
description: Hispanic-Americans are growing in number, coveted by the nations political parties and deeply in favor of an overhaul of the nations immigration laws. Given this combination, why does such an overhaul still seem to be such a long shot in Washington?

title: In History-Making Event, Men and Women Share the Stage
description: PINEHURST, N.C.  On the Pinehurst No. 2 driving range Sunday, a teenage girl shyly approached Sergio Garca, who greeted her with a warm embrace. She walked away as if there were clouds beneath her feet.

title: An Explosion in Washington
description: The timing could not have been more eerily ironic. On June 17, 1864, an official read a letter thanking the girls and women who worked at Washingtons federal arsenal for a donation to a monument for the 78 victims of a deadly 1862 arsenal blast in Pittsburgh. Then, just hours later, an explosion  like a sudden flash of lightning, in the words of one survivor  went off inside the arsenals 100-foot-long wooden laboratory.

title: Never Boring, Always Beautiful
description: Some people party too soon. I was in Brazil in spring 2006, and Brazil was in a festive mood. The World Cup in Germany was on the way, and Brazilians, rightly convinced they had the best team, were already celebrating their triumph. At one public event, I said: Just calm down, please. Italy is going to win this one. The audience chortled, saying: Come on. Italian soccer is in the midst of its biggest scandal ever. Two championship titles have been revoked. The players are in shock, and the clubs are in disgrace! Thats why, I said.

title: Where Prose Turned to Poetry
description: In Brazil, soccer was initially played among elite clubs behind closed doors. Blacks were excluded. Outside the confines of formal championships, however, the sport was quickly taken up as a game played in abandoned lots, meadows and urban gaps. Balls were improvised, fields were improvised, and the game was fertile ground for the spirit of improvisation.

title: Life Sentences for 2 Sex Traffickers Who Preyed on Mexican Immigrants
description: It was a sprawling family business, employing drivers, dispatchers and doormen. There were steerers who passed out chica cards on the street to solicit customers. There was even a mechanic who swept vehicles for tracking devices that might have been surreptitiously placed by federal agents, prosecutors said.

title: How We Play the Game
description: Every team is simply trying to score goals while preventing its opponent from doing the same. But they all seem to go about it in distinct ways. To understand what is happening on the fields in Brazil at the World Cup, one must learn a bit about each countrys history, and literature, and music, and regionalism, and economy  not to mention bicycles and pottery.

title: A Boys Execution, 70 Years Later
description: On the first page of the official sentencing report for George Stinney Jr., the outline of a boy is visible in a short string of numbers. Age: 14. Height: 5-1. Weight: 95. His complexion is listed as Black, his religion as Baptist, his occupation as None. Next to Build one word is typed: Small.

title: A Smartphone Keyboard App That Anticipates What You Want to Type
description: LONDON  Typing on the glass of a smartphone can be a headache. The keyboards are tiny. Errors are easy to make, even on the simplest of words. And autocorrect, the function meant to fix typing mistakes, often introduces errors, switching words that have little to do with what people actually mean.

title: V.A. Punished Critics on Staff, Doctors Assert
description: WASHINGTON  Staff members at dozens of Department of Veterans Affairs hospitals across the country have objected for years to falsified patient appointment schedules and other improper practices, only to be rebuffed, disciplined or even fired after speaking up, according to interviews with current and former staff members and internal documents.

title: Artificial Pancreas Shows Promise in Diabetes Test
description: A portable artificial pancreas built with a modified iPhone successfully regulated blood sugar levels in a trial with people who have Type 1 diabetes, researchers reported Sunday.

title: A Nemesis in the Black Stars
description: NATAL, Brazil  For more than two days straight here in this beach town in northeastern Brazil, the rain came down with the strength of an open fire hose. It shook the cashew trees and bent the palm trees so that their fronds nearly kissed the ground. It turned roads into rivers, caused mudslides and turned some neighborhood soccer fields into ponds.

title: Senate Panel Examines Stock Market, and Fed Moves Closer to End of Stimulus Program
description: SENATE HEARING TO EXAMINE STRUCTURE OF STOCK MARKET

title: Colombian President Re-elected After a Race Challenging His Peace Negotiations
description: BOGOT, Colombia  Voters elected President Juan Manuel Santos to a second term on Sunday, giving him a chance to complete peace negotiations with rebel groups that could end decades of guerrilla war.

title: Population Shifts Turning All Politics National
description: SOUTHAVEN, Miss.  When William E. Davis was growing up here in DeSoto County, just across the state line from Memphis, there were more than 300 dairy farms, and he was raised on one of them.

title: 2 Deals Focus on Big Data and Youth
description: A COUPLE of deals are shining a spotlight on just how big of a deal big data is becoming on Madison Avenue.

title: News From the Advertising Industry
description: Accounts

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of June 16
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: New York Adoptees Fight for Access to Birth Certificates
description: Maureen Sheridans search for her biological mother began in the late 1990s, after she had a precancerous mole removed and her doctor suggested she look into her medical history. That research led her to the New York Public Library, where in 2001, sifting through a vast trove of vital records, Ms. Sheridan discovered the name she had been given at birth: Beth Lyons.

title: Louisville Brings the Heat and the Funk
description: OMAHA  The entrance lacked drama and everything else Nick Burdi imagined.

title: Methodist Church Pension Board Links Divestment to Firms Role in Israeli Prisons
description: A decision by the pension board of the United Methodist Church tosell its stock in a company that provides security equipment to Israel has set off a backlash from supporters of Israel, who are gearing up for another fight over divestment this week at the convention of another mainline Protestant denomination, the Presbyterian Church (U.S.A.).

title: The United Nations of the Hardwood
description: SAN ANTONIO  The Spurs played seamlessly through all five games of the N.B.A. finals, moving the ball from player to player, from corner to corner, all their effortless teamwork earning them their fifth N.B.A. championship in 16 seasons.

title: Her Heart Didnt Belong to Daddy (or the Prince)
description: Despite the teeth-baring title, the tone is mostly cool and considered in Pat Kirkwood Is Angry, a spellbinding cabaret show at the 59E59 Theaters written by and starring the gifted singer Jessica Walker. The titular actress, portrayed by Ms. Walker, was a British star probably unknown to most Americans. Her up-and-down career included glittery stints in the West End, steep plunges into the panto circuit when things got tough, a brief stay in Hollywood that sent her to a sanitarium and, most spectacularly, a festive night with a royal that made her a figure of scandal for decades.

title: New York City Street Treasure
description: Dear Diary:

title: With Offensive Bonanza, Spurs Force the Heat to Consider Taking Fewer Gambles
description: SAN ANTONIO  Lost in the sweatbox of the N.B.A. finals opener, amid cramps and complaints about the failed air-conditioning system at AT&T Center, was a road map for how the rest of this series would turn.

title: Popular Demand
description: Frozen, released last November, is the second-highest-grossing 2013 film after adjusting for inflation, surpassed only by The Hunger Games: Catching Fire  and it is still in theaters. Despicable Me 2, even without a hit song, was No. 4, and Monsters University ranked sixth.

title: Game of Thrones Finale: Sibel Kekilli Takes Home an Odd Souvenir
description: Warning: this post contains spoilers about Sundays season finale of Game of Thrones.

title: Success Academys Expansion Plans Put de Blasio in a Tough Spot
description: A charter school networks plan   to double in size over the next few years could reignite a war over classroom space in New York City, only this time with the ground rules already tilted against the mayor.

title: Dispute Over Judges Leaves Family Courts in Limbo
description: In a drab waiting area on the fifth floor of Manhattan Family Court, a 6-year-old boy danced among the wooden benches and two strangers wrangled over custody schedules as Natasha, 39, stared plaintively at a closed courtroom door.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for June 15, 2014
Spurs Win Fifth Title, Cementing Dynasty Across Decades
description: SAN ANTONIO  The arena rumbled. It was only the first half on Sunday night, but there was already a growing sense of inevitability with each passing possession. Having withstood the best that LeBron James could offer, the Spurs were closing in on another championship.

title: Halt and Catch Fire Recap: Please, Hurry Up and Kill the Bird
description: Season 1, Episode 3: This show has lost the plot. In the span of a single episode, Halt And Catch Fire has descended from a fairly enjoyable melodrama about the dawn of the personal computing industry into a writhing mess. This third episode was a tossed-salad of seeming arbitrary stabs at character development; everyone does something a little weird, shocking, or apparently deep, but little of it adds to a sense of who these people are or what on earth theyre trying to do.

title: Penny Dreadful Recap: Its a Bloody Fathers Day
description: Season 1, Episode 6: Happy bloody Fathers Day here on Penny Dreadful. The episode picks up with Vanessa and Sir Malcolm surveying the carnage left by their demonic visitor in Episode 4. But its impossible not to view what happens in What Death Can Join Together  and what led up to it  through the prism of the full-length flashback that made up the previous episode. (As with previous weeks, spoilers are sprinkled throughout.)

title: Unexpected, Unplanned and Unwanted
description: When her second son was born, six weeks premature, Emily Guillermo recalled thinking, Youre not supposed to be mine. You were not supposed to be made.

title: Thinking of Ways to Harm Her
description: Postpartum depression isnt always postpartum. It isnt even always depression. A fast-growing body of research is changing the very definition of maternal mental illness, showing that it is more common and varied than previously thought.

title: Quotation of the Day for Monday, June 16, 2014
description: I dont know if you call it a problem or a weakness, but its clear that the American nature is to try and make everything fair, to try and be fair to the game.

title: In Fez, a Restaurant Starring the Finest Chefs in the World
description: Deep in the hive-like medina (old city) of Fez, Morocco, one of the worlds most beautiful restaurants has just reopened as a venue for an intriguing new visiting-chef-in-residence project that casts the kitchen as an incubator for both cultural exchange and culinary innovation.

title: Steering Clear of Poison Ivy
description: I was once among those who claim, I could walk through a field of poison ivy and not get it. One day I learned otherwise: On a hike, I needed to relieve myself in the great outdoors and ended up with an impossibly itchy, blistering rash on a most delicate body part.

title: Word of the Day | irretrievable
description: irretrievable \ir-i-tre-v-bl\ adjective

title: Whats On Monday
description: 8 P.M. (FXX) THE GIRL WITH THE DRAGON TATTOO (2011) Daniel Craig stars as a crusading Swedish journalist hired by a wealthy industrialist (Christopher Plummer) to investigate the disappearance of his niece 40 years earlier. Rooney Mara, above, in an Oscar-nominated performance, is Lisbeth Salander, the vulnerable yet ruthlessly competent computer hacker who helps him solve the mystery in this adaptation of the Stieg Larsson novel, directed by David Fincher. She is a marvelous pop-culture character, stranger and more complex than the average superhero and more intriguing than the usual boy wizards and vampire brides, A. O. Scott wrote in The New York Times about Lisbeth, first played by Noomi Rapace in the 2010 Swedish adaptation. It has been her fate, unfortunately, to make her furious, uninspiring way through a series of plodding and ungainly stories. And despite the slick intensity of Mr. Finchers style, his movie is not immune to the same lumbering proceduralism, Mr. Scott said. Still, he added, Mr. Finchers impressive skill is evident.

title: First True Test, and a Noticeable Gaffe, for Goal-Line Technology
description: PORTO ALEGRE, Brazil  Goal-line technology was put to its first serious use at the World Cup on Sunday in the 48th minute of Frances match with Honduras.

title: Outrage After Pencil-Chewing Is Blamed for Lead Poisoning
description: The dangerous levels of pollution in a village in Hunan Province have been well known for some time, but after a Chinese state television investigation and a particularly callous remark by one local official, the authorities have begun taking action.

title: James, Even at His Best, Cant Carry the Heat to the Finish
description: SAN ANTONIO  Miamis LeBron James sat on a trainers table an hour before tipoff, his eyes closed, his headphones on as he sang to himself, his back rested squarely against a wall.

title: Corrections: June 16, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Three Sentenced to Death Over Tiananmen Attack
description: A Chinese court sentenced three men to death on Monday for their roles in carrying out an attack near the entrance to Beijings Forbidden City in October that left six people dead and 39 injured, in what the police said was a terrorist act carried out by Islamic jihadists belonging to the Uighur ethnic minority.

title: China Surpasses U.S. as Largest Corporate Debt Issuer
description: HONG KONG  China has overtaken the United States as the worlds biggest issuer of corporate debt, despite worsening cash flow at Chinese companies since the financial crisis, according to a report released Monday by Standard & Poors.

title: Found Poem Favorite | Wind and dust, not flame and steel
description: This poem, by Ibante S., is one of the 11 winners of our fifth annual Found Poem Student Contest.

title: Fathers Day Plea to Educate Chinas Illegal Children
description: Fathers Day is an imported concept that not all Chinese are comfortable with, but the news media celebrated on Sunday with photographs of new fathers and, in a display of filial piety, children thanking dads by scrubbing their feet.

title: Mota-Engil Africa Plans I.P.O. Amid Flurry of London Offerings
description: LONDON Mota-Engil Africa, a subsidiary of the Portuguese conglomerate Mota-Engil, said on Monday that it planned to list an initial public offering on the London Stock Exchange, the latest in what has been a rush of offerings in London.

title: Coast Town Is Attacked in Kenya; Dozens Die
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  At least 48 people were killed when dozens of militants attacked a Kenyan coastal town overnight, targeting a police station and two hotels, officials said Monday.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Unrest in Iraq
description: In Obama Pushes Iraqis to Mend Sectarian Rifts, Mark Landler and Michael R. Gordon write about the U.S. reaction to recent events in Iraq and the unrest there.

title: Student Crossword | Ancient Egypt
description: Test your knowledge of ancient Egypt by playing our crossword (PDF). You can find the answers here.

title: Echoes of Africa Along the Carolina Coast
description: Africa endures in the language and customs of the Gullah people, descendants of slaves who have lived along the Carolina coast for generations, sustaining themselves through the land and water.  Pete Marovich, who grew up in South Carolina aware of this distinctive culture, wanted to photograph these communities, so about a decade ago he pitched the idea to a magazine editor.

title: Atos of France to Spin Off Its Payments Unit in I.P.O.
description: LONDON The French computer services provider Atos announced on Monday that it was spinning off its electronic payments unit in an initial public offering that could value the business at up to 2.4 billion euros, or $3.2 billion.

title: Gazprom Cuts Russias Natural Gas Supply to Ukraine
description: MOSCOW  Further aggravating already tense relations between Russia and Ukraine, the Russian energy giant Gazprom cut off natural gas supplies to its neighbor on Monday, warning that the reduction could diminish the amount of gas flowing to Europe.

title: Britains Mitchells & Butlers to Acquire 173 Pubs
description: LONDON  Mitchells & Butlers, Britains largest operator of managed pubs and restaurants, said on Monday that it would acquire the bulk of Orchid Group, including 173 pubs, for about $451 million.

title: Israel Demands Palestinian Leaders Help After Abductions
description: JERUSALEM  Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel told President Mahmoud Abbas of the Palestinian Authority on Monday that he expected his help in finding three kidnapped Israeli teenagers and capturing their abductors. The telephone conversation, initiated by Mr. Abbas, came after Israeli troops killed a Palestinian man overnight as they continued an aggressive campaign across the West Bank, arresting a total of 150 people, most of them leaders of the militant Islamic movement Hamas.

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: Welcome to the Morning Briefing on NYT Now.

title: New York Today: Test Time
description: Good sunny Monday morning to you.

title: Buddhist-Muslim Unrest Boils Over in Sri Lanka
description: ALUTHGAMA, Sri Lanka  In some of the worst religious violence in Sri Lanka in decades, three people have been killed and 78 injured in riots between Buddhists and Muslims in this southwestern coastal town after months of rising tensions, officials said Monday.

title: Game of Thrones Recap: Season 4 Finale
description: Here be spoilers, and the end of our watch  for now.

title: Daily Report: Amazon Seeks Tighter Hold on Shoppers Through a Phone
description: Amazon is expected to introduce a smartphone on Wednesday at an event in Seattle, a long-rumored project that aims to close any remaining gap between the impulse to buy and the completed act, David Streitfeld reports.

title: In London, the Mens Wear Revels Begin
description: That green juice, the sip choice in New York, has reached London was only one of the takeaways of a late lunch on Saturday, held in honor of the London mens wear designer Craig Green. A fruit-and-veg concoction was passed around at Hoi Polloi, the restaurant at the Ace Hotel in the designer-heavy Shoreditch, but it was only one green offering of many: The theme of the lunch (and its official hashtag) was Eat Your Craig Greens, and each course  soup, salad and supper  was a rhapsody in that color.

title: Alibaba Clarifies Leadership Structure as I.P.O. Approaches
description: Updated, 9:00 p.m. | The Alibaba Group, Chinas biggest e-commerce company, is continuing to slowly reveal more about its operations.

title: The Trouble With Apples Health App
description: Earlier this month, Apple made news with the introduction of Health, an iPhone app that will allow users to collect biometric information like heart rate and blood pressure and send it automatically to doctors or hospitals. The company also announced a partnership with Epic Systems, one of the largest suppliers of electronic medical record systems in the United States. This has led many to speculate that a new age is upon us, with patients having much greater access to health information, as well as the ability to share it with their doctors.

title: Definition of Rich Changes With Income
description: Congratulations, Joe! Youre rich! John McCain said to Joe Wurzelbacher in the 2008 presidential campaign. Joe was thinking of buying a small plumbing business. He was dismayed to learn from Barack Obama that the candidates plan to raise marginal tax rates on individuals earning more than $200,000 a year was described as taxing the rich.

title: J.W. Anderson: Spring 2015 Menswear
description: London

title: UGL of Australia to Sell Property Management Arm for $1.15 Billion
description: LONDON  The Australian engineering services company UGL said on Monday that it had agreed to sell the property management business DTZ to a consortium of investors, including the Ontario Teachers Pension Plan and the private equity firms TPG Capital and PAG Asia Capital, in a deal that values the business at 1.22 billion Australian dollars, or about $1.15 billion.

title: What Makes a Great Editor? Part I.
description: I am not the editor of a newspaper and shall always try to do right and be good so that God will not make me one.

title: Grocery Delivery Service Instacart Raises $44 Million
description: Companies like Uber and Airbnb have prospered by allowing people to sell their services to strangers on a smartphone-powered network.

title: Morning Views
description: If all goes according to President Obamas plan, the United States will soon be making a major new investment of $5 billion so that other countries can help in the fight against extremists, writes The New York Times editorial board. The goal is to scale back American involvement in combatting terrorism by funding and equipping foreign counterterrorism operations. The Times is skeptical: As Iraq demonstrates, just training troops to shoot and providing generals with expensive weapons will not address the threat.

title: Start-Up WeLab Raises $14 Million From Sequoia Capital and Hong Kong Tycoon
description: HONG KONG  WeLab Holdings, an Internet finance start-up in Hong Kong, said on Monday that it had raised $14 million from Li Ka-shing, Asias richest man, and Sequoia Capital, a stalwart of Silicon Valley.

title: In Our Pages: June 17
description: 1889: Improving Africa

title: Summer 2014 on The Learning Network
description: As we do every year, well be scaling back our offerings a bit this summer in order to make time for planning and experimentation.

title: PAI Partners Plans Joint Venture to Control Labeyrie Fine Foods
description: LONDON  The European private equity firm PAI Partners said on Monday that it was moving forward in its effort to acquire a stake in the gourmet food producer Labeyrie Fine Foods.

title: Hillshire Lays Out Path to End Its Deal With Pinnacle Foods
description: Hillshire Brands said on Monday that its board would no longer back its planned $4.3 billion takeover of Pinnacle Foods, paving the way for the company to sell itself to Tyson Foods for $7.7 billion.

title: My Biggest Failure? Failing to Recognize Failure
description: Anyone who has picked up a business book, attended a panel discussion or read an entrepreneurship blog in the past several years has probably learned about the virtues of failing fast.

title: Morning Agenda: Alibabas Inner Circle Revealed
description: The Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba Group on Monday publicly disclosed the names of all 27 individuals who will make up the companys select inner circle in an amended initial public offering prospectus, DealBooks Michael J. de la Merced writes. The individuals, led by a company founder, Jack Ma, will essentially control the online market operator through their ability to nominate a majority of directors.

title: Level 3 to Buy TW Telecom for $5.7 Billion
description: Level 3 Communications said on Monday that it had agreed to buy TW Telecom, a provider of business Internet connections, for about $5.68 billion, as consolidation continues in the telecommunications industry.

title: Airbus and Safran Plan to Merge Satellite Launch Activity
description: PARIS  The Airbus Group and Safran of France plan to merge their satellite launching activities into a new company that aims to better compete against lower-cost rivals from Russia and the United States.

title: SanDisk to Buy Fusion-io for $1.1 Billion in Cash
description: The SanDisk Corporation said on Monday that it would buy the data storage provider Fusion-io for $1.1 billion.

title: London Mens Fashion Week: Agi & Sam Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the mens fashion week photo diary of Russ McClintock.

title: Executive Editor of The New York Times Is Treated for Cancer
description: Dean Baquet, the executive editor of The New York Times, had a malignant tumor removed from his kidney on Saturday and will spend about a week away from the office while recovering, he said in an email to the newspapers staff on Monday morning.

title: Whats News in Washington: Situation in Iraq Worsens
description: GoodMondaymorning. President Obama is returning from Southern California today to a Washington heat wave and a Middle East crisis.

title: Modi Underscores Ties to Bhutan in First Foreign Visit
description: NEW DELHI  The Indian prime minister Narendra Modi concluded a two-day visit to Bhutan on Monday afternoon, making the tiny landlocked country nestled toward the eastern end of the Himalayas his first stop on his foreign policy tour.

title: Insurgents in North Ambush Militia Volunteers and Seize Another City
description: BAGHDAD  The Sunni extremist militants threatening Iraq seized another northern city on Monday in a battle with the Iraqi Army after having ambushed a convoy of untrained Shiite volunteers in the first lethal encounter between Sunni and Shiite combatants since the government began mobilizing thousands of Shiites.

title: In Battle Over Allergan, Morgan Stanley Gets in the Crossfire
description: In its quest to defend against a $53 billion hostile takeover, Allergan pulled back the veil on the usually secretive world of mergers and acquisitions banking on Monday.

title: Should Modeling Be Treated Like Driving, or Drinking?
description: Theres a very good piece on the Terry Richardson is-he-a-sexual-predator-or-not scandal in this weeks New York magazine. I think its worth reading not simply because it lays out a very hot-button issue fairly dispassionately, but because it also highlights one of the problems with modeling that is related to the recent skinny-models controversy, yet may actually be more essential than both: namely, the young-models problem.

title: Argentinas Debt Appeal Is Rejected by Supreme Court
description: Updated, 7:57 p.m. | The Supreme Court handed Argentina two major defeats on Monday in cases brought by bondholders who refused to accept reduced payments after the countrys 2001 default.

title: Opening Ceremony Collaborates with Fashions Favorite Florist
description: The Brussels-based floristThierry Boutemyhas decorated the runways ofLanvinand Dries Van Notenand the halls of Versailles for Sofia CoppolasMarie Antoinette. Now hes lending his darkly romantic aesthetic to Opening Ceremonyfor a range of capsule collections  including Opening Ceremony clothing, Manolo Blahnik shoes and a fragrance made in conjunction with Le Labo  which go on sale today at the brands stores and online. Working with the Opening Ceremony founders Humberto Leon and Carol Lim, Boutemy created still lifes  from artfully smashed petals to lavish arrangements of blue roses, dahlias and delphiniums  which were then photographed and translated into a vibrant series of digital prints. The scent, meanwhile, was formulated to capture what Boutemy calls thepermanent feeling of walking in a perfectly arranged mad and wild garden.

title: Behind the Cover Story: Eliza Griswold on the Roots of Extremism, Boko Haram and the Weight of Public Opinion
21st-Century Concentration Camps
description: Nicholas Kristof travels to Myanmar, where Muslims are confined to camps or within their own villages, deprived of jobs, schools and doctors. Why is the world silent?

title: Myanmars Persecuted Minority
description: A collection of stories from a recent trip focusing on a Muslim minority who are confined to camps and villages. UPDATED June 20: Nicholas Kristof responds to readers questions.

title: Another Factor Said to Sway Judges to Rule for Womens Rights: A Daughter
description: WASHINGTON  It was, Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg later said, such a delightful surprise.

title: In Drive Against Militants, Pakistani Airstrikes Hit Strongholds
description: LONDON  As a full Pakistani military offensive in the tribal district of North Waziristan took shape on Monday, commanders promised a crushing blow to the jihadi groups that have flourished there in the past decade, spreading chaos in the region and posing a security threat to the West.

title: Pop Music to Get Its Due on BBC Awards Show
description: Evidently in the belief that the entertainment industry does not have sufficient opportunity to pat itself on the back, the BBC announced on Monday that it would present the inaugural BBC Music Awards at a live ceremony at Earls Court, in London, on Dec. 11.

title: London Mens Fashion Week: Lou Dalton Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the mens fashion week photo diary of Alexandra Waespi.

title: Food Curated | Zucker Bakerys Cookies
description: Inside Zucker Bakery in the East Village, where Zohar Zohar, the owner and head baker, creates cookies and pastries that incorporate the flavors of Israel and other countries.

title: Video: Zucker Bakerys Cookies
description: Liza de Guia is a video journalist whose blog, Food. Curated., profiles people who produce interesting food in New York and beyond.

title: Cruises With Unesco Sites as Destinations
description: The small-ship cruise line Seabourn has tied virtual mooring lines to Unesco in a new program that offers increased access to the organizations diverse World Heritage sites such as Avignon, France, the Giants Causeway in Northern Ireland and Peterhof Palace in St. Petersburg.

title: A Long Way From Wonder Bread
description: SAN RAFAEL, Calif.  Pam Ross showed up at Ponsfords Place Bakery & Innovation Center at 5 p.m. sharp, just minutes after the owner, Craig Ponsford, put out the sidewalk bread man sculpture that alerts customers: Pizza night is on.

title: Germany vs. Portugal: World Cup 2014 Live Blog
description: Loaded with talent, Germany is a contender to win it all, as it is at almost every World Cup. Portugal is increasingly regarded as a one-man team. But that man is Cristiano Ronaldo, who is the reigning world player of the year. Expect Germany to swarm him with defenders.

title: London Mens Fashion Week: Dunhill Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the mens fashion week photo diary of Roberta Ridolfi.

title: Measuring Recovery? Count the Employed, Not the Unemployed
description: South Carolinas unemployment rate dropped to 5.3 percent in April, lower than in December 2007, when it stood at 5.5 percent on the eve of the Great Recession.

title: Rise of the Internet Hate Machine
description: Welcome to the age of Internet hate, when its never been easier to send an anonymous death threat, writes Jack Shafer for Reuters. As with so many of lifes labors, advanced technology has removed most of the work and hazard from sending cowardly messages to people to frighten them.

title: Stir-fried Broccoli Stalks and Flowers, Red Peppers, Peanuts and Tofu
description: Probably most of you have used broccoli time and again in stir-fries. In this version I cut the stalks into 2-inch julienne, which is almost like adding a separate vegetable to the mix of broccoli flowers and red pepper (also cut in julienne). Theres a lot of texture at play here  crisp-tender vegetables, crunchy peanuts and soft tofu. You can add a little spice if you want, but Ive made the chili flakes optional.

title: Pan-Fried Broccoli Stems
description: This was an experiment and now it is a keeper. Peel broccoli stems, slice them thin, and pan-fry in hot oil just until the slices are charred on the edges, then flip over and brown for just a little bit of time on the other side. If you do this just right, the medallions will have edges that are slightly crispy with that wonderful fried flavor, and tender interiors. With a little salt (or even without) they are irresistible. One stems worth of medallions will disappear quickly, so count on 1 per person (at least!). Although you will use a fair amount of oil for frying, it doesnt all get absorbed by the broccoli stems.

title: Pre-Summer Greek Salad With Shaved Broccoli and Peppers or Beets
description: Classic Greek salad is a summer dish in my house; impossible to make if tomatoes are not in season and wonderful. But other vegetables take to the same treatment  a simple dressing with a high ratio of acid (in this case a combination of lemon juice and vinegar with olive oil), feta cheese and lots of mint and parsley.

title: Pasta With Mushrooms and Broccoli
description: Broccoli stems and flowers can be prepared and cooked separately, like two different vegetables. For this pasta I used a vegetable peeler to shred the broccoli stems into thin ribbons, which I cooked briefly with the mushrooms. I sliced the crowns very thin and blanched them briefly with the pasta. The result is a dish with different textures and shades of green: the stems should be crisp-tender, their color faded. The crowns will be bright green, and 2 to 2 1/2 minutes cooking will render them tender but not mushy.

title: ScienceTake | Secrets of the Bat Wing
description: The spectacular flight of bats may be aided by long, thin muscles in the skin of their wings.

title: Spring Rolls With Shredded Broccoli Stems, Vermicelli and Red Pepper
description: Lately Ive been finding bags of shredded broccoli stems or broccoli stem slaw in supermarkets. I used just such a bag for this. You can grate the stems that come with your bunch broccoli for these, or you can save a bit of time and effort by buying the bagged product.

title: New Insight Into How Bats Conquer the Air
description: Bats are an extraordinary evolutionary success, the only mammals to conquer the air. Their flying ability has long attracted the attention of engineers and biologists, and it comes through soft, flexible wings unlike those of birds or insects.

title: Medtronic-Covidien Deal Is a Marriage of Convenience
description: The marriage of Medtronic and Covidien looks to be one of convenience. The $42.9 billion deal includes a premium that exceeds the estimated cost savings. Stents and sutures are not an obvious fit. And moving Medtronics headquarters from Minneapolis to Covidiens Dublin base will not obviously cut the American companys tax bill. Freeing up overseas cash is too shallow a reason to tie the knot.

title: Tony Gwynn, Hall of Fame Batting Champion, Dies at 54 of Cancer
description: Tony Gwynn, who won a record eight National League batting championships, amassed 3,141 hits and gained acclaim as one of baseballs most passionate students of the art of hitting, died on Monday in Poway, Calif. He was 54.

title: Aftermath of a Militant Attack in Kenya
description: Scenes from Mpeketoni, where militants attacked a police station and two hotels, according to officials.

title: Microsoft Unveils Machine Learning for the Masses
description: Microsoft has a new strategy to win cloud business: A supposedly comprehensive predictive analysis service  and all you have to do is store your data in Azure, the Microsoft cloud.

title: Col. George Sichermans Dice
description: Our challenge this week is a classic by recreational mathematician Col. George Sicherman, who hit upon the insight in 1977. The resulting Sicherman Dice are a curiosity known to pretty much anyone whos spent some time with recreational math. I reached Col. Sicherman by phone and asked him  How did he even think to look for something no one else had even considered?

title: Today in Small Business: Webrooming Versus Showrooming
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: Former Medtronic C.E.O. Defends Inversion Deal
description: Bill George, a former chief executive of the medical device maker Medtronic, came out last month against Pfizers proposed inversion  a deal to acquire an overseas competitor and reincorporate abroad, lowering tax rates and freeing up overseas cash.

title: Alibaba Drops In to Say Hi to Institutional Investors in U.S.
description: The Alibaba Group is not expected to begin a formal road show with prospective investors in its upcoming initial public offering for at least a month.

title: True Appreciation of These Spurs Will Come
description: Suffering is good. It reinforces character, resolve and commitment. Experienced in public, it exposes vulnerability. Handled with class, it heightens likability.

title: Schumacher, Out of Coma, Leaves French Hospital
description: Michael Schumacher, the former Formula One champion, has left the hospital in Grenoble, France, where he was admitted with brain injuries nearly six months ago, to continue his long phase of rehabilitation. He is no longer in a coma, his family announced in a statement Monday.

title: China Executes 13 in Xinjiang Region After Attacks
description: HONG KONG  The Chinese government executed 13 people in the Xinjiang region on Monday, part of an intensifying response to growing violence in the region that is spreading to other parts of the country.

title: No Comment Necessary: Penalties for Gay Themes
description: Gov. Nikki Haley of South Carolina upheld a budget item requiring two universities to spend $70,000 to teach United States founding documents  as punishment for having assigned gay-themed books to freshmen last year.

title: London Mens Fashion Week: J.W. Anderson Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the mens fashion week photo diary of Alexandra Waespi.

title: Image of the Day: June 16
Justice Dept. Takes Hard Look at G.M.s Handling of Issues
description: The Justice Department is taking a hard look at who should be held accountable when it comes to the General Motors debacle.

title: Crafts Retailer Michaels Stores Aims to Raise $500 Million in I.P.O.
description: The crafts retailer Michaels Stores may be nearing the end of its long journey to the public markets.

title: Monday Motorsports: Audi Works Hard for 13th Le Mans Win
description: Audi won the 24 Hours of Le Mans on Sunday for the 13th time in the last 15 years, with its diesel-electric hybrid R18 e-tron quattros finishing one-two ahead of a field of exhausted rivals. The winning Audi entry, for the third time in four years, was shared by Benot Trluyer of France, Andr Lotterer of Germany and Marcel Fssler of Switzerland.

title: A Faster Way to Find the Origin of Malaria
description: By using a DNA bar code of 23 short snips from the genes of parasites that cause malaria, scientists can now often quickly determine where they originated, British researchers report.

title: Siemens and Mitsubishi Counteroffer for Alstom Is Less Than G.E.s Bid
description: Updated, 5:12 p.m. | PARIS  Siemens and Mitsubishi Heavy Industries formally presented a counteroffer for Alstom on Monday in an attempt to assuage French fears about losing one of its most important companies, even as their combined bid was less than what General Electric had proposed.

title: A Merger in a Race With Congress
description: Why does Medtronic want Covidien?

title: At the London Mens Wear Shows, Exuberance Reigns
description: LONDON  As the mens wear shows here finish up their second day, its hard not to be struck by three things that almost every show so far has shared in common: the size of the crowds, the energy in the rooms and the youthfulness of the attendees who jam into their seats or line the back walls, craning for a look at the fashion on exuberant display.

title: Alexander McQueen: Spring 2015 Menswear
description: London

title: Bitcoin Security Firm BitGo Raises $12 Million
description: The Bitcoin security platform BitGo announced on Monday that it had raised $12 million, the latest example of how investors see opportunity in a growing industry aimed at making virtual currency easier and safer to use.

title: U.S. Is Exploring Talks With Iran on Crisis in Iraq
description: WASHINGTON  A senior American diplomat met with his Iranian counterpart in Vienna on Monday to explore whether the United States and Iran could work together to create a more stable Iraqi government and ease the threat from Sunni militants.

title: Accounts and People of Note in the Advertising Industry
description: Daniel Ahiakpor joined the New York office of Vdopia in a new post, vice president for business development. He had been senior director and head of publisher platform sales at Adap.tv, New York, part of AOL.

title: Q. and A. With Stuart Elliott
description: Stuart Elliott, the advertising columnist, answers questions from readers each week. Questions can be sent to stuarte@nytimes.com.

title: S.E.C. Fines Hedge Fund in Demotion of Whistle-Blowing Employee
description: Updated, 8:37 p.m. | The Securities and Exchange Commission has sounded a warning to Wall Street and corporate America, taking aim at a hedge fund not only for improper trading but for punishing the employee who blew the whistle on the wrongdoing.

title: The Wisdom of Breaking Away
description: In February 2012, a group of experienced skiers headed into the backcountry near the Stevens Pass resort in Washington State to look for untracked powder. It was a beautiful day, and everyone expected to have a great time skiing the popular Tunnel Creek section.

title: For the Fargo Finale, Many Unanswered Questions
description: Two weeks ago, a very pregnant Molly Solverson and her sleepy postman husband, Gus Grimly, cozied up in bed, a sublime scene of domestic tranquillity amid all the violence and trouble that has coursed through the episodes of FXs Fargo.

title: A Mothers Anguish, a History of Violent Crime and Rocks That Ring
description: A womans suicide sheds light on maternal mental illness; a vast database of trial transcripts from the Old Bailey Courthouse in London helps historians figure out when British justice shifted from brutal to civilized; researchers discover the hidden musical qualities of Stonehenge.

title: Frida Kahlos Garden to Sprout in New York City
description: I paint flowers so they will not die, Frida Kahlo once said, and in her paintings as well as her life, flora of many varieties  flowers, trees, roots, tendrils, watermelon, cactus fruit  took on an almost supernatural presence. Next year the New York Botanical Garden will explore her obsession with the vegetable world in Frida Kahlos Garden, an exhibition that will include not only rarely seen paintings by Kahlo but also a re-creation of her studio and garden at Casa Azul in the Coyoacn neighborhood of Mexico City, where she lived for many years and where she died in 1954.

title: Thanks to Ad Agency, Youre in the Picture at Museum Exhibition
description: An agency known for its creativity has developed an interactive installation for an exhibition at a museum that is devoted to an artist known for his creativity.

title: Gazprom Cuts Gas to Ukraine
description: A Gazprom spokesman, Sergei Kupriyanov, explained the Russian gas giants action to stop supplying natural gas to Ukraine.

title: Blast From the Past: No Digital Technology for Beatles LPs in Mono
description: Many fans of the Beatles, including the groups producer, George Martin, and the band members themselves, have long argued that the most authentic way to hear the groups music is in the original mono mixes. Those were the bands principal focus during recording and mixing sessions, and they sometimes differ strikingly from the now more familiar stereo versions.

title: Sex, Drugs and G.D.P.
description: Help me out here.

title: James Long: Spring 2015 Menswear
description: London

title: I.R.S. Commissioner to Testify on Ex-Officials Lost Emails
description: WASHINGTON  The Internal Revenue Service commissioner will testify before two House committees next week about the agencys disclosure that it lost thousands of emails sought by investigators looking into accusations of politically motivated misconduct by the agency, the committees said Monday.

title: Met Opera Tax Filing Reveals Pay For Gelb
description: The Metropolitan Opera, which is seeking concessions from its workers amid tough labor talks, reported in a tax filing on Monday that its general manager, Peter Gelb, had earned a total of $1.8 million in pay and benefits in 2012  but said that he had since taken a pay cut.

title: MyCopter Simulator
description: This video from the University of Liverpool demonstrates the myCopter, a personal helicopter being developed in the United Kingdom.

title: Popcast: Jimmy Giuffre and Eric Dolphy, Rediscovered Jazz Innovators
description: The saxophonist Jimmy Giuffre, who died in 2008 at the age of 86, was often out of step with jazz, even after he wrote the swing anthem Four Brothers for Woody Hermans band in 1947 and led the Jimmy Giuffre 3, a late-50s, drummer-less group that created cultural weight out of light-toned music. He started new groups that got away from swing rhythm and other conventions of jazz; his searches made him fall out of favor with audiences, and after the 1962 album Free Fall, he released no new records for 10 years.

title: Whose Dress Code Is It, and Why?
description: The dress code  for girls, at least  has become a complicated issue. Is it intended to protect the girls against unwanted advances, or the boys against temptation? If the intent is to foster an atmosphere conducive to learning, why would spaghetti straps interfere with an understanding of algebraic equations? Does demanding that young women disregard the siren song of advertising and the media and leave the midriff-baring tops on the racks teach them that they are worth more than their appearance, or that their appearance is the measure of who they are? Is sexy strong, or is sexy dangerous?

title: A Helicopter of Ones Own
description: LIVERPOOL, England  You know what would be cool?

title: Exploring Academias Role in Charting Paths to a Good Anthropocene
description: I spent the tail end of last week at the annual conference of the Association for Environmental Studies and Sciences, a young network of scholars and students aiming to foster collaborations among disciplines  from ecology to ethics  in studying, and improving, the human relationship to the environment.

title: Gluten-Free Eating Appears to Be Here to Stay
description: In the luxe dining room of Del Posto, one of New Yorks most heralded and expensive Italian restaurants, one-third of the tables on any given night will have at least one gluten-free diner.

title: Iran vs. Nigeria: World Cup 2014 Live Blog
description: Nigeria won the African Nations Cup last year, but it lacks a star striker. Iran is solid defensively, so goals could be hard to come by.

title: Supreme Court Rules Against Straw Purchases of Guns
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Monday allowed a challenge to an Ohio law banning lies in political campaigns to move forward, turned back a challenge to a law concerning gun purchases and refused to hear a case about holding high school graduations in churches.

title: Afghan Candidate Alleges Voting Fraud by Karzai and Aides
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Less than 48 hours after a runoff election to choose the next president of Afghanistan, the first signs of a looming political crisis emerged on Monday, with the campaign of Abdullah Abdullah claiming there had been widespread ballot stuffing and suggesting he was being set up for a defeat he would not accept.

title: Asparagus, Revisited
description: Q. Why does eating asparagus make ones urine smell funny?

title: London Mens Fashion Week: Margaret Howell Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the mens fashion week photo diary of Roberta Ridolfi.

title: Syrian Government Making Aid Delivery More Difficult, U.N. Official Says
description: GENEVA  The government of President Bashar al-Assad is making it harder to deliver humanitarian aid to millions of war-battered civilians in Syria, the United Nations chief aid coordinator, Valerie Amos, said on Monday.

title: Producers Aim to Bring Love Letters to Broadway This Fall
description: A Broadway revival is in the works for A.R. Gurneys Love Letters, a two-character epistolary play that has long been a favorite of famous actors, with producers aiming to mount the show at the Vivian Beaumont Theater in the fall. The director would be the Tony nominee Gregory Mosher (Broadways A View from the Bridge in 2009-10) and the lead producers include Nelle Nugent (The Trip to Bountiful in 2013), Barbara Broccoli (the James Bond movie series) and Fred Zollo (Once), according to two Broadway producers who are not involved with the show but are familiar with the plans.

title: Two Kids Still Hopelessly Devoted to Each Other
description: Theres certainly some heart in the serviceable production of Grease at the Paper Mill Playhouse in Millburn. But the shows pulse can be overwhelmed by percussion. Here, the big tunes are belted out, then underscored in fear you might miss a beat. That leaves only the modest, quiet numbers to give those peppy characters some much-needed depth.

title: Festival Style: Bonnaroo Music and Arts Festival
description: Music fans gather in Manchester, Tenn., for the music and to don their favorite festival-style interpretations.

title: Pterosaurs, Flying Reptiles, Were a Social Lot
description: Scientists have discovered the first intact eggs from pterosaurs, the flying reptiles that lived alongside the dinosaurs. The eggs, along with dozens of pterosaur fossils, are from a site discovered in 2005 in northwestern China. In a new study in the journal Current Biology, the scientists report that the pterosaurs belong to a new genus and species, Hamipterus tianshanensis, dating to the Early Cretaceous, 145 million to 100 million years ago. They had wingspans of five to 11 feet.

title: Sounds of Frog Lust, Made Even Sexier
description: Tiny frogs in Taiwan are making the most of urban development by using storm drains to amplify their mating calls and impress females, researchers say. Open concrete drains are common in Taiwan, and male Mientien tree frogs (above, one in its more usual setting) like to perch inside when courting. Writing in The Journal of Zoology, researchers reported that the drains enhanced the volume and duration of calls.

title: The Mother Who Jumped
description: A few months after Cindy Wachenheim gave birth to the child she had long dreamed of, she became convinced that she had caused her son irrevocable brain damage. It was a certainty she couldnt shake.

title: In Defeat, Portugal Shows Its Ugly Side
description: SALVADOR, Brazil  The goals came in volume for Cristiano Ronaldo this year, as he stretched nets in towns across Europe at a stunning rate. While playing for Real Madrid, Ronaldo scored 51 times in 47 games, earning him the Ballon dOr for best player in the world.

title: Weekly News Quiz | June 10-16, 2014
description: How well did you follow the news this week? How well can you do against others taking our 10-question quiz?

title: Green Space So Exclusive Its Off Limits Even to Residents
description: Deborah Nevins is one of the most sought-after landscape designers in the world. She has seeded and sodded estates for the likes of the entertainment mogul David Geffen, the Greek shipping magnate Stavros Niarchos and the media tycoon Rupert Murdoch, and her haute habitats dot townhouse backyards and prewar rooftops from Greenwich Village to Park Avenue.

title: After Baby, an Unraveling
description: Cindy Wachenheim was someone people didnt think they had to worry about. She was a levelheaded lawyer working for the State Supreme Court, a favorite aunt who got down on the floor to play with her nieces and nephews, and, finally, in her 40s, the mother she had long dreamed of becoming.

title: Spurs Title Is a Testament to Persistence
description: SAN ANTONIO  In a corner of the San Antonio Spurs locker room, there is a framed quotation from the muckraking social reformer Jacob Riis.

title: A Chain Reaction of Change Behind Dams
description: When settlers in 18th-century New England dammed their lakes, they unwittingly set off evolutionary changes in the herring species called the alewife. Now researchers have discovered that those changes rippled across the food web.

title: Ticketless Fans Breach Security Gate at World Cup
description: FIFA and World Cup officials faced questions about security Monday after two incidents Sunday kept ticketed fans out of one match until after it had begun and nearly allowed fans without tickets to force their way into another.

title: Voice by Eternal Lips
description: A premiere of the bands latest music video features the dancer Alex Sotomayor as Michael Jackson.

title: Creating a Supply Chain of Work by Female Playwrights
description: All but daring American theaters to put on more new plays by women, an advocacy group of female writers and producers released a list of 46 such works on Monday that have been recommended for production by dozens of other playwrights, dramaturges and artistic directors.

title: Middle School Never Ends
description: Do cool kids suffer for their status later in life? A new study suggests they may  and its reception shows how much power childhood hierarchies seem to have over us, even decades later.

title: Computing Crime and Punishment
description: In 1765, John Ward was hanged for stealing a watch and a hat.

title: Bill de Blasio Loves L.A. (We Love It!)
description: Sports wagers by politicians are boring and not worth your time. But this one could have been interesting.

title: United States vs. Ghana: World Cup 2014 Live Blog
description: The pressure to mount an attack for the Americans will be on Clint Dempsey, Jozy Altidore and Michael Bradley. Ghana will look to the stalwart captain, Asamoah Gyan, and the young Jordan Ayew, starting instead of Kevin-Prince Boateng.

title: Merrill Lynch to Pay More than $32 Million for Overcharging Clients
description: The Financial Industry Regulatory Authority has ordered Merrill Lynch to pay more than $32 million over sales fees it charged on certain mutual funds.

title: Diplomacy and Soccer for Biden in Brazil
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Seeking an opening during the World Cup soccer tournament to thaw relations with Brazil, Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. arrived in Latin Americas largest country on Monday, expressing a desire to rebuild trust after the souring of ties over revelations of the National Security Agencys surveillance practices.

title: Jonathan Ive on Apples Design Process and Product Philosophy
description: When Steven P. Jobs led Apple, he created a core principle for the companys designers and engineers: stay fully focused on making great products.

title: Poetry Profiles: Octopus Press
description: The latest in a series of occasional profiles of poetry publishers. These questions were answered by editors at Octopus Books, Hajara Quinn, Zachary Schomburg, Mathias Svalina and Alisa Heinzman, and book designer Drew Swenhaugen.

title: Casely-Hayford: Spring 2015 Menswear
description: London

title: Moschino: Spring 2015 Menswear
description: London

title: The Earths Hidden Ocean
description: An analysis of seismic waves passing through the deep earth appears to confirm what laboratory experiments have suggested was possible: that an ocean of water is tied up in the mantle, 400 miles below the surface.

title: The Making of a Male Model
description: During Mens Fashion Week, hundreds of young men head to Europe, hoping it will be the start of their modeling careers. I think that most people think that when you become a model, you dont have to worry anymore about money, said Tomas Gajdos, a 17-year-old high school student from Slovakia who was discovered by a modeling agent while riding the London Tube. But, it isnt so easy as it maybe looks.

title: American Tower Expands Cellphone Tower Holdings in Brazil
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  The American Tower Corporation has agreed to acquire a Brazilian cellphone tower company, BR Towers, backed by the private equity firm GP Investments, for about $978 million, the companies said in regulatory filings on Sunday.

title: Listen Up | A Brooklyn Experimental Musician Gets in Touch With His Inner Michael Jackson
description: I avoided pop music for a long time, says Grey Gersten, a veteran of the Brooklyn indie music scene, of his new pop-minded solo project Eternal Lips. I thought pop was all about consumerism. Then I realized pop was about dreams and fantasy.

title: Father, Doctor, Role Model
description: In a career that spanned more than five decades, from the 1950s into the 21st century, Dr. Phillip I. Lerner witnessed vast transformations in medicine. But as his son, Dr. Barron H. Lerner, writes in this exquisitely insightful new memoir, none of the changes was more profound than the evolution of the doctor-patient relationship.

title: In Another Blow, G.M. Recalls 3 Million More Defective Cars
description: General Motors said on Monday that it would recall 3.36 million defective cars worldwide, another low point in the seemingly endless safety crisis that has engulfed the nations largest automaker.

title: Dense Breasts May Obscure Mammogram Results
description: The doctors were pleased to inform me, the letter said, that the results of the mammogram were normal. Early detection of cancer is important, a report was sent to my referring physician, I should report any lumps, see my health provider, have a physical.

title: Ask Well: Feeding Heavy and Thin Kids Together
description: Question:

title: Delay in Translating Recordings May Affect Jury Availability at State Senators Trial
description: WHITE PLAINS  A mistrial in the federal governments bribery case against State Senator Malcolm A. Smith and two other defendants seemed highly possible on Monday after the judge said he would ask jurors whether they could serve into mid-July so defense lawyers could digest dozens of hours of conversation in Yiddish and English.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Welcome to NYT Now, the new app from The New York Times.

title: Senate Hearing on Fairness of High-Speed Stock Trading Could Get Heated
description: Updated, 7:14 p.m. To the average investor with a brokerage account, the process of buying and selling shares of stock seems straightforward. But the back end of these systems, governing how billions of shares are traded, remains opaque to many customers.

title: Best Week Yet for Gentlemans Guide After Tony Win
description: Last week was the best yet at the box office for the Broadway musical A Gentlemans Guide to Love & Murder, following the show winning the Tony Award for best musical on June 8. Gentlemans Guide, one of the most modest-selling musicals of the 2013-14 season until it became a front-runner for the Tony last month, grossed $851,262 for eight performances last week; its previous high was $816,932 for nine performances during Christmas week last year. The average paid ticket price was $121.89, up nearly $22 from the week before  a big jump that reflects theatergoers buying more premium-price tickets, a goal of the shows producers as they try to leverage the Tony into making the show a commercial hit.

title: Despite a Wayward Journey, Mrquez Is a Rock for Mexico
description: NATAL, Brazil  With one arm folded across his chest, Rafael Mrquez of Mexico stood in the pouring rain and belted out his countrys national anthem. Moments later, he was cruising around the drenched field, influencing play in his typical subtle ways, helping lead his team to a  1-0 victory over Cameroon.

title: A Superspy Races to Halt Armaggedon
description: Neither its plot nor its provenance do much to recommend Terry Hayess I Am Pilgrim. So its all the more surprising that this first novel by a screenwriter of films not renowned for their dialogue turns out to be the most exciting desert island read of the season.

title: With His Best Finish in a Major, Fowler Displays Substance and Style
description: PINEHURST, N.C.  As befits the perfect pitchman, Rickie Fowler met with the news media Sunday wearing a cap with Puma spelled in large writing and a shirt bearing a Puma logo so large the eye was reflexively drawn to it.

title: Rocks With Resonance
description: The sounds of ringing rocks at Preseli Hills in West Wales, the source area of some of the Stonehenge bluestones.

title: Older Than the Rolling Stones
description: Before dawn Saturday, thousands of revelers will again gather among the monoliths at Stonehenge to sing, bang drums and frolic beneath a solstice sunrise.

title: Relatives of Missing Teenager Speak Out
description: Relatives of Naftali Fraenkel, an Israeli-American teenager who is believed to have been kidnapped by Palestinian militants, expressed hope that he would be found soon.

title: As Robotics Advances, Worries of Killer Robots Rise
description: From driverless cars to delivery drones, a new generation of robots is about to revolutionize the way people work, drive and shop. But there is one area where robots are already entrenched and spreading fast: the industrial sector, especially manufacturing and storage.

title: A Hublot Timepiece Specially Designed for World Cup Fans
description: In this weekly series, the mens fashion editors of T invite creative personalities to put their own aesthetic spin on a new watch. Here, the photographer Rob Kulisek captures a timepiece from Hublot.

title: A Delay at La Guardia Becomes The French Connection
description: I HAVE been flying for most of my 35-year career. As the chairman and chief investment officer at Saguenay Strathmore Capital, Im constantly traveling for business. I was on a plane two and a half weeks after rotator cuff surgery. The doctor thought I was nuts.

title: Hoping the Tale of a Glass Slipper Fits Into a Troupes Repertory
description: The stylistic versatility offered by American Ballet Theater at its best is a marvel. During this spring season, it has been dancing choreography by four thoroughly unalike 20th-century masters  Leonide Massine, George Balanchine, Kenneth MacMillan and Frederick Ashton  and, often enough, the standards it has set in each have been world class.

title: Squeezing the Life Out of Airline Travel
description: SUMMER is coming, airplanes are fuller than ever, and the airlines are squeezing every penny they can from passengers. Even stalwart fliers like my friend Heather Poole, a flight attendant and author of a humorous memoir about her career (Cruising Altitude: Tales of Crash Pads, Crew Drama and Crazy Passengers at 35,000 Feet), are taking a deep breath.

title: Efforts to Inspire Students Have Borne Little Fruit
description: An occasional column on developments in what educators call STEM  for science, technology, engineering and math.

title: Keeping Health in Stock at New York Citys Bodegas
description: At Sandy Ortizs bodega in the Bronx, no platanos means no business.

title: Did George W. Bush Foresee Whats Happening in Iraq?
description: In their rush to blame the escalating violence in Iraq on President Obama, Republican critics brush off any suggestion that his predecessor may also be to blame, offering up some version of Oh yeah, Democrats always want to blame Bush, but Obama has been in office for more than five years.

title: A Newsroom Tradition Comes to an End, Sort Of
description: A Times tradition ended on Monday: the coffee cart, which had been wheeled into the third-floor newsroom to provide a free caffeine fix every weekday afternoon around 4:30 for more than 20 years. The company told newsroom employees in an email that it would be replaced by an offering of fruits and other healthy snacks.

title: Transforming Phone Video Into Publicity and a Film
description: Chicago was blowing up. There were explosions at the convention center, cars cartwheeling down South Wacker Drive, pandemonium in Millennium Park and helicopters swooping down the river, ducking under drawbridges.

title: What Olivier Theyskenss Departure From Theory May Really Mean
description: On Monday, Theory announced that its artistic director, Olivier Theyskens, was leaving the brand to pursue other design projects. The recent pre-spring 2015 collection was his last.

title: Ring Cycle With Digital Orchestra Is Postponed
description: The effort to bring Wagners Ring cycle to Connecticut with digital samples instead of a traditional orchestra has been postponed. Organizers announced Monday that they were canceling their first offering, a production of Das Rheingold planned for August, saying that several artists had withdrawn, citing threats to their careers.

title: Bonnaroo 2014
description: Scenes from the Bonnaroo 2014 photo diary of Tamara Reynolds.

title: Tell Us What You Love About Your Bodega
description: Bodegas, the trusty neighborhood shops that carry the bare essentials and are never far away when you need them, have long been a point of pride for New Yorkers.

title: Sending Patients Home, Dcor and Distraction, Priceless Nature
description: Health Care

title: In Performance | The Village Bike
description: Greta Gerwig and Scott Shepherd in a scene from Penelope Skinners dark comedy at the Lucille Lortel Theater.

title: The Redesign of a Design Museum
description: Andrew Carnegie used the third floor of his Fifth Avenue mansion as a gymnasium where he practiced his putting. The current owner, the Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum, plans to put a small mini-golf green there on Tuesday when the news media gets a preview of the mansions nearly completed $91 million renovation.

title: Pictures of the Day: Syria and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Syria, Iraq, Palestine and Spain.

title: Willie Nelson, Mali Music and Keith Jarrett and Charlie Haden
description: WILLIE NELSON

title: As Brazil Cheers, Protesters Struggle to Be Heard
description: Twelve months after hundreds of thousands of protesters took to Brazils streets to complain of lavish public spending on stadiums for the World Cup, the tournament organizers have been relieved to see just hundreds attend scattered demonstrations as the first round of games got underway.

title: Creative Destruction Yada Yada
description: Jill Lepore has a great article in the New Yorker debunking the hyping of disruptive innovation as the key to success in business and everything else. Its not a bah-humbug piece; it is instead a careful takedown, in which she goes back to the case studies supposedly showing the overwhelming importance of upstart innovators, and shows that what actually happened didnt fit the script.
