Specifically, many of the upstarts were actually long-established firms, and more often than not the big payoffs went not to disruptive innovators but to firms that focused on incremental change and ordinary forms of efficiency and quality.

title: Spanish-Language Vagina Monologues Closes After Short Run
description: Spanish-speaking audiences didnt turn out for Los Monlogos de la Vagina, forcing the quick closure of Eve Enslers play after 15 previews and 33 regular performances.

title: At Home, a Dramatic Organist
description: A well-remembered highlight of the Boston Early Music Festival a year ago was a Bach organ recital by John Scott. Mr. Scott, the organist and director of music at St. Thomas Church Fifth Avenue in New York, is better known here for his work with the splendid St. Thomas Choir of Men and Boys than as an organist.

title: Drifters Look for Work; One of Them Finds Love
description: For all of the dearly departed New York City Operas contributions to American culture, the 30 or so new operas it presented were never really among them. Seen Gian Carlo Menottis The Most Important Man or Thea Musgraves The Voice of Ariadne lately? Neither have I.

title: A Red Carpet for Young Guests
description: Travis Evans could meet his friends in just about any bar around Washington, but he is drawn to the Dignitary Bar at the Marriott Marquis, where he takes time to enjoy his favorite drink, an Old-Fashioned.

title: Questions and Answers About the Crisis in Iraq
description: The conflict in Syria has escalated into a wider regional crisis, edging neighboring Iraq closer to all-out sectarian warfare, as Sunni militants led by the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, or ISIS, have  declared a caliphate that stretches across eastern Syria and much of northern and western Iraq.

title: Mariano Rivera and JPMorgans James Lee Honored by Sports Charity
description: It isnt quite a merger of pinstripes, but one of Wall Streets top deal makers is taking the stage with a New York Yankees legend to raise money for a sports-focused childrens nonprofit.

title: Reclaim the Firefox Search Box
description: Q. How do I restore the Google search box and its search engines list to Firefox version 29.0.1?

title: Excerpt: Much Ado About Nothing
description: Lily Rabe and members of the cast of the Shakespeare in the Park production at the Delacorte Theater in Central Park.

title: Moelis Creates Private Equity Fund-Raising Team by Hiring From a Rival
description: Moelis & Company said on Monday that it has hired four executives from a rival boutique investment bank, Greenhill & Company, to start up a group specializing in raising money for private equity firms.

title: Iraqs Current Conflict Foretold
description: As rebel forces capture Iraqi cities, veteran photojournalists look at the lessons learned and the obstacles that lie ahead for independent coverage in the region.

title: Who Will Win in Iraq?
description: WASHINGTON  TO go by much of the commentary about Iraq in recent days, the country is already past the breaking point under the lightning campaign by Sunni insurgents. Reinforced by hardened fighters from Syria and sympathetic communities in northern and western Iraq, the insurgents control much of Mosul, the most important city in northern Iraq, and Tikrit, the home of Saddam Husseins clan, and they have laid siege to Samarra, the site of one of Shiisms most storied shrines. It would be no surprise if the next few weeks brought them to the gates of Baghdad.

title: With SmartBinge, WNYC Wants Listeners to Load Up on Its Podcasts
description: DURING pledge drives, public radio hosts often highlight what they call driveway moments, those instances when, upon arriving home, motorists are so captivated by a radio segment that they remain behind the wheel until it concludes. Now a new campaign from WNYC promotes the notion that in the era of smartphones and podcasts, far from being confined to their cars, listeners can tune in wherever and whenever they want.

title: U.S. Military Deaths in Afghanistan
description: The Department of Defense has identified 2,317 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It confirmed the deaths of the following Americans recently:

title: A Judges Attack on Teacher Tenure
The Culture at G.M.: A Call for Congressional Action
description: To the Editor:

title: Fiber Networks for Phones
Whats in a Brooklyn Sign?
description: To the Editor:

title: Spains Mosque-Cathedral
description: To the Editor:

title: A New Video of Modern-Day Concentration Camps
description: On my recent trip to Myanmar, I was accompanied by a Times video journalist, Adam Ellick, who just published a searing video of the modern-day concentration camps for Rohingya in that country. I must say that sometimes as a scribbler, I find it a hassle to make videos on trips. Theres more equipment, and were always fussing over microphones and capturing sunsets, and the cameras make us more obvious to the authorities. I like nimble, and videos arent nimble. But then I see the finished results, and Im so impressed.

title: Egypt to Free Ill Journalist Who Staged Hunger Strike
description: CAIRO  Prosecutors will release a hunger-striking journalist, Abdullah Elshamy, because of his deteriorating health, the Egyptian state news media said on Monday, offering a concession on the treatment of one of more than 16,000 prisoners detained since the military takeover last summer.

title: Suze Ormans Approved Prepaid Debit Cards Are Quietly Discontinued
description: Suze Orman is quietly getting out of the payments business.

title: A Church-PAC Link Raises Questions in Mississippi
description: The full-page advertisement in Mississippi Link, a weekly newspaper aimed at black residents of Jackson, the states capital, urged readers to vote for Senator Thad Cochran in the June 3 Republican primary.

title: General to Lead Bergdahl Inquiry
description: The Army has appointed a two-star general on Monday to conduct an investigation into the disappearance of Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl from his outpost in Afghanistan in 2009. The officer, Maj. Gen. Kenneth R. Dahl, who has combat experience in Afghanistan, will conduct the inquiry into Sergeant Bergdahl, who returned to the United States from an Army hospital in Germany last Friday, two weeks after being released in exchange for five senior Taliban detainees. Sergeant Bergdahl is undergoing therapy and counseling at an Army hospital in San Antonio.

title: Marriage by Force Is Addressed in Britain
description: LONDON  England and Wales made it a criminal offense as of Monday to force anyone into marriage, an effort to persuade victims to come forward and to emphasize secular legal values.

title: Can the Port Authority Save the Planet?
description: THIS has been a bad year for the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, with scandals over a bridge closure and, most recently, a shady real estate deal. But the authority has a chance at redemption, if it is willing to move beyond its traditional mandate. Its model of interstate cooperation could do much more than prevent traffic jams; it could also play the leading role in managing the ecological health of the Hudson River estuary, and serve as an example for other coastal cities around the world facing complex environmental problems in a time of climate change.

title: Writing in the Here and Now
description: There may be no literary genre that, at its best, evokes sense of place more than travel writing. The whole point is to make the reader feel there, not here, to transport proverbial armchair travelers from their dull, quiet living rooms to a cacophony of scarlet macaws clearing their throats deep in a tropical rain forest in Costa Rica.

title: Obama to Send Armed Support to U.S. Embassy in Baghdad
description: In a letter to the speaker of the House, the president explained that United States soldiers will be sent to Baghdad to protect American citizens.

title: World Cup 2014: Belgium Defeats Algeria, 2-1
description: Two second-half goals enabled Belgium to rally for a 2-1 victory against Algeria and keep alive its hopes of winning the group.

title: British Spy Agencies Assert Power to Intercept Web Traffic
description: LONDON  In a broad legal rationale for collecting information from Internet use by its citizens, the British government has asserted the right to intercept communications that go through services like Facebook, Google and Twitter that are based in the United States or other foreign nations, even if they are between people in Britain.

title: In Medtronics Deal for Covidien, an Emphasis on Tax Savings
description: To invest in the United States, Medtronic says it needs to move to Ireland.

title: Ruling on Argentinas Debt May Give Creditors More Power
description: For decades, a country in deep financial trouble could, as a last resort, cut a deal with its creditors to slash its debt load, perhaps gaining relief for its economy and its people.

title: In Two Michigan Villages, a Higher Calling Is Often Heard
description: FOWLER, Mich.  Aside for the mole grazing his right eyebrow, it is difficult to distinguish Gary Koenigsknecht from his identical twin, Todd, four minutes the elder.

title: Climbing Out of the Darkness of Maternal Mental Illness
description: Two articles in the Health section, Thinking of Ways to Harm Her and After Baby, an Unraveling, shed new light on the timing and range of maternal mental Illness. New studies and research suggest that maternal mental illness can appear during pregnancy, or can appear not only in the first few weeks after birth but in later months. In the year after giving birth, studies suggest, as many as one in five and at least one in eight women develop symptoms of mental illness, including not just depression, but anxiety, bipolar disorder, obsessive-compulsive disorder or a combination as well.

title: A Dream Start
description: NATAL, Brazil  It began with the magical. It ended with the miraculous.

title: Court Rulings on Voter Restrictions Create Limbo as Midterms Near
description: MIAMI  With the midterm elections only months away, efforts to carry out some of the countrys strictest photo ID requirements and shorten early voting in several politically pivotal states have been thrown into limbo by a series of court decisions concluding that the measures infringe on the right to vote.

title: The Structures of Growth
description: Most of us are trying to get better at something. And when we think about our future progress, we tend to imagine we will improve linearly. Well work hard at mastering some skill; well steadily get better and better.

title: Frances Foster, Childrens Book Editor With an Imprint, Dies at 83
description: Frances Foster, a childrens book editor who published authors like Roald Dahl, Peter Ss and Philip Pullman, and who had her own imprint, died on June 8 in Manhattan. She was 83.

title: Truckers Resist Rules on Sleep, Despite Risks of Drowsy Driving
description: The tractor-trailer set off at 2:30 a.m. from Springfield, Mo., the usual time and place. Nearly 11 hours later, along the Will Rogers Turnpike in Oklahoma, fatigue caught up.

title: Ruling Against J.C. Penney in Dispute With Macys Over Martha Stewart Products
description: A New York judge on Monday ruled that J. C. Penney unlawfully interfered with an exclusive merchandising agreement between Macys and Martha Stewart Living Omnimedia.

title: Study Asserts Startling Numbers of Insider Trading Rogues
description: There is often a tip.

title: How Health Care Systems Stack Up
description: Britain and Switzerland were top scorers in a study examining the quality and efficiency of health care systems in 11 advanced nations by a leading American research organization. As usual, the United States finished last over all and last on several important measures of cost and health outcomes, despite having the most costly system in the world.

title: Legislating Ignorance About Guns
description: Eighteen months and dozens of school shootings after the massacre at Sandy Hook Elementary School in Newtown, Conn., public-health experts still lack basic information on the roots of gun violence and how best to prevent it.

title: Innocents at the Border
description: The surge of desperate young migrants across the southwest border has the Obama administration scrambling to respond. It was clearly ill-prepared for a problem that grew steadily for years before exploding this year, with more than 47,000 unaccompanied children caught at the border since October.

title: In a .338 Lifetime Average, Every Day Counted
description: Tony Gwynn may have embodied the game of baseball better than anyone else who has played. It was not because Gwynn, who died of cancer on Monday at age 54, was among its greatest hitters. It was because of the wonder he found in the game and the joy he took in applying his daily discoveries.

title: Sunnis and Kurds on Sidelines of Iraqi Leaders Military Plans
description: BAGHDAD  Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki has presented himself as the man who could bring Iraqis together, but with the collapse of his army before a Sunni militant assault, he has taken on only one role  that of commander in chief of Iraq.

title: A New College Model
description: On Monday, Howard Schultz, the chief executive of Starbucks, unveiled his companys newest  and possibly most important  perquisite for its employees: a free college education. He announced this new program on a stage in The Times Center in Midtown Manhattan, alongside his partner in the new venture, Michael Crow of Arizona State University.

title: Sharptons Coolness to Rangel Marks Waning of a Political Generation
description: When the Rev. Al Sharpton abruptly summoned the candidates in the Democratic primary for Representative Charles B. Rangels seat to the headquarters of Mr. Sharptons organization, the National Action Network, this month, the incumbent showed up an hour late.

title: Guantnamo Detainees Lawyers Seek Further Delays
description: FORT MEADE, Md.  Defense lawyers on Monday sought further delays in the war crimes case against five Guantnamo Bay detainees accused of aiding the Sept. 11 terrorist attacks, telling a military judge that there had been greater scrutiny of defense teams by the F.B.I. than had previously come to light.

title: U.S. Judge Denies Stay of Execution in Georgia
description: ATLANTA  A federal judge on Monday rejected a Georgia inmates argument that his execution, scheduled for Tuesday evening, should be stayed because the state had refused to disclose details about the drug to be used in his lethal injection.

title: To Bolster Its Claims, China Plants Islands in Disputed Waters
description: BEIJING  The islands have all that one could ask of a tropical resort destination: white sand, turquoise waters and sea winds.

title: Chicago Is Freed From Oversight on Graft
description: CHICAGO  The city that was once known as the patronage capital of the world may no longer live up to the title.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for June 16, 2014
Tensions Mount as Troops Scour Hebron in Search for Missing Youths
description: HEBRON, West Bank  Kayed and Hassan Jaber, brothers who drive trucks loaded with marble from this citys quarries into Israel each day, stood in the doorway of their Star of the South company here Monday afternoon watching pretty much nothing happen on the street.

title: Abduction of Young Israeli Hitchhikers Spurs Debate on Conduct
description: NOF AYALON, Israel  The three Israeli teenagers kidnapped by Palestinian militants while hitching a ride in the West Bank last week have provoked an outpouring of sympathy in Israels ordinarily fractious society, with nonstop news coverage and gatherings of thousands who have recited psalms for the safe return of the hostages, all students at yeshivas in West Bank settlements.

title: Bratton Still Sees Challenges in a New York He Made Safer
description: In his office on the 14th floor of Police Headquarters, William J. Bratton displays copies of his memoir, Turnaround, his account of taming New Yorks crime-filled streets and subways in the 1990s. On a mostly empty wall hangs a framed Time magazine cover from 1996, declaring over a steely photo of Mr. Bratton: Finally, Were Winning the War Against Crime. Heres Why.

title: Big Retailers Agree to List Unit Prices on Websites
description: Is that television-size box of graham crackers at Costco really a better deal than a standard box at Walmart? Soon, online customers wont have to do the math to figure it out.

title: The Shadow of the Patriarch
description: Matters of faith and family, gender and culture are stirred together into a fiery-flavored stew in The Who & the What, the probing new play by Ayad Akhtar that opened on Monday at the Claire Tow Theater at Lincoln Center. Like Mr. Akhtars Disgraced, which won the 2013 Pulitzer Prize and will be seen on Broadway this fall, this new work considers the itchy frictions that emerge when religious belief and contemporary life rub up against each other, as they do for the family at the center of the play, a Pakistani immigrant and his two grown daughters.

title: Dancing Between Battles
description: Fair weather never lasts forever, not even in the Eden-like patch of Sicily that has popped up in Central Park. Thats the setting for Jack OBriens pleasure-filled production of Much Ado About Nothing, which opened on Monday night at the Delacorte Theater. Though skies and temperaments are sunny when the show begins, youre always conscious of brooding storms waiting to make their angry entrances.

title: Pop the Question
description: TUESDAYS PUZZLE  It took me a long time to figure out what the theme was for Zhouqin Burnikels puzzle. Thats not a bad thing, mind you; Theres a revealer at 69 Across that explains everything, albeit in a very quiet way (pun intended).

title: Migrants Flow in South Texas, as Do Rumors
description: McALLEN, Tex.  Exhausted and dazed, hundreds of Central American migrants, mainly women with small children, come to the bus station of this border city every day now, spilling into a church next door that has opened its doors. Having crossed into the United States illegally, the new arrivals are often grimy and famished. In the church, they eat, bathe and sleep, changing into donated shoes and clothes.

title: How the United States Scored Against Ghana
description: An annotated diagram of the United States goal against Ghana in the 2014 World Cup.

title: Critics Point to Drawbacks in Starbucks Tuition Program
description: Within hours on Monday of unveiling, with much fanfare, a program to pay employees college tuition, Starbucks faced criticism for drawbacks in the fine print  notably that students could have to pay thousands of dollars out of pocket, and wait months or years before being reimbursed.

title: Spanish Police Target Cells Recruiting War Volunteers
description: MELILLA, Spain  Starting in this tiny North African enclave, the Spanish police have cracked down in recent weeks on a network of Islamic militants with footholds in Spain and Morocco that they say has recruited and dispatched young volunteers to join insurgencies from Mali to Libya to Syria.

title: Mets Experiment Doesnt Yield Positive Result
description: ST. LOUIS  Manager Terry Collins has worked all season to find the right lineup to try to ignite the Mets offense. It can be a fundamentally flawed and draining process that has seemed to grow more difficult each day.

title: Teenagers Arrested After Videotaped Attacks
description: HUDSON FALLS, N.Y.  They were beatings meted out with seemingly no motive other than capturing a moment of small-town adolescent fame. And, in a bizarre way, they succeeded.

title: Intersection | Clinton Hill, Brooklyn
description: In the diverse Clinton Hill neighborhood of Brooklyn, Kenard Bunkley, an educator and longtime resident, says his urban-prep style is easy and comfortable.

title: Secret Tapes of Politicians Cause a Stir in Poland
description: WARSAW  Mysterious tapes of high-level officials discussing what seem to be unsavory deals, recorded in the back room of a restaurant popular with the political elite, are threatening the careers of some of Polands most prominent leaders and perhaps even the survival of the current government.

title: Ready to Fight for a Drink That Tastes Like a Slap in the Face
description: BUDAPEST  Zoltan Hajas learned to make palinka from a neighbor who lives on the other side of his backyard fence.

title: Moise Safra, Banker and Philanthropist, Dies at 79
description: Moise Y. Safra, a member of a prominent Brazilian banking family who last year bought a stake in the General Motors Building on Fifth Avenue in Manhattan, died on Friday in So Paulo, Brazil. He was 79.

title: Shell to Sell Large Stake in Australian Gas Company
description: HONG KONG  Royal Dutch Shell said on Tuesday that it would offload the majority of its stake in Woodside Petroleum, Australias biggest independent oil and natural gas producer, in a deal worth $5.7 billion.

title: Tracy Morgans Condition After Crash Is Upgraded to Fair
description: The comedian Tracy Morgan, who was gravely injured in a crash more than a week ago, has been upgraded to fair condition, his publicist said on Monday, calling it a great improvement.

title: Richards Silent, but Others Address Future
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  Brad Richards did not speak to reporters on the Rangers breakup day on Monday, an unusual step for a player who spoke practically every day this season.

title: Dark Clouds Hover Over a Funny Man
description: During the 20-month hiatus between Seasons 3 and 4 of Louie, the shows creator, writer, director and star, Louis C. K., said he needed a little breathing room to gather his ideas and take the series  one of the smartest and funniest comedies on television  in a new direction.

title: Quiet About Adversary, U.S. Posts a Victory That Speaks Volumes
description: NATAL, Brazil  In the days leading up to the United States national teams game against Ghana on Monday, not one American player said a word about the past.

title: Deadly Tornadoes Sweep Across Northeast Nebraska
description: Tornadoes ripped through northeastern Nebraska on Monday afternoon, killing at least one person and causing serious damage in the town of Pilger, the authorities said.

title: A Bolder Effort by Big Tobacco on E-Cigarettes
description: Electronic cigarettes, promoted as a healthier alternative to tobacco, are getting powerful new backers with an unhealthy reputation: big tobacco companies.

title: Word of the Day | imply
description: imply \im-pli\ verb

title: Quotation of the Day for Tuesday, June 17, 2014
description: I heard in Guatemala that people were caught by immigration, but then they let them go and gave them a permit. The word got around, and thats why so many people are coming.

title: Player Ratings: United States (2) vs. Ghana (1)
description: It was not pretty, and it was not perfect, but the United States defeated Ghana for a promising start in its uphill climb to advance out of a challenging Group G.

title: Whats On Tuesday
description: 10 P.M. (Starz Cinema) HELLO I MUST BE GOING (2012) A divorced 30-something (Melanie Lynskey) finds a haven from her adult problems in the suburban Connecticut home of her critical mother (Blythe Danner) and indulgent father (John Rubinstein) in this comedy written by Sarah Koskoff and directed by Todd Louiso. There, she finds sex and romance with the 19-year-old stepson (Christopher Abbott, above with Ms. Lynskey) of a potential client her father is desperate to impress, who has allowed his doting mother (Julie White) to believe he is gay. Needless to say, there are complications, some farcical, some belonging more to the realm of therapeutic melodrama, A. O. Scott wrote in The New York Times. This is ultimately a tale of affirmation, self-acceptance and second chances, and its lessons, while not unwelcome, are a bit too forced and neatly packaged to make it fully satisfying. But when Ms. Lynskey and Mr. Abbott are together, there are inklings of a wilder, riskier, less predictable movie  one you may wish the characters could escape into, even though you know they never will.

title: If Affirmative Action Is Doomed, Whats Next?
description: Affirmative action as we know it is probably doomed.

title: Nests Smoke Alarm Returns, With Price Cut
description: Nests smoke and carbon monoxide detectors are coming back to store shelves two months after safety concerns prompted a recall of the devices.

title: Big Voice, Defying Gravity
description: Midway through her Radio City Music Hall concert on Monday evening, Idina Menzel expressed her displeasure at reading a description of her voice as screechy. Thats not a word any soprano could appreciate, and in Ms. Menzels case, it isnt even accurate.

title: Corrections: June 17, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Female Activist in Haryana Works Within System for Change
description: Over a cup of milky tea some months ago in a nondescript hotel in Rohtak, a dusty town of steel and oil mills, colleges and auto repair shops, Santosh Dahiya reflected on the slow-moving pace of change in the mostly rural state of Haryana.

title: City Aims to Play Down Its Dog Meat Festival
description: Animal rights advocates say they have seen signs that the southern city of Yulin is trying to lower the profile of its much-criticized dog-eating festival. The feasting is expected to go ahead as scheduled this weekend, but local officials have taken steps to deflect outside attention from the annual event, at which thousands of dogs are consumed.

title: European Auto Sales Continue to Climb
description: PARIS  Europes car market has continued to slowly regain the ground lost since the financial crisis, industry data showed on Tuesday, with sales in May posting a ninth straight month of advances.

title: Student Crossword | Famous Artists and Works
description: Test your knowledge of famous artists and their works by playing our crossword (PDF). You can find the answers here.

title: Found Poem Favorite | Dotted Splashes of Paint
description: This poem, by Aya Zaky, is one of the 11 winners of our fifth annual Found Poem Student Contest.

title: Kenyan Leader Blames Domestic Foes, Not Shabab, for Attacks
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  As Kenyan officials reported a second lethal attack on a coastal village, Kenyas president said Tuesday that the violence, which has left at least 57 people dead, was the work of local political networks and was not carried out by the Shabab, a Muslim extremist group that has claimed responsibility.

title: Travel Food Company Seeks to Raise $849 Million in London I.P.O.
description: LONDON  The SSP Group, an operator of food and beverage locations at airports and train stations, said on Tuesday that it planned to raise as much as $849 million in an initial public offering in London.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Starbucks to Provide Free College Education to Thousands of Workers
description: In Starbucks to Provide Free College Education to Thousands of Workers, Richard Prez-Pea reports on a companys plan to help employees gain a college degree.

title: Apax Partners to Sell Majority Stake in Marketing Outsourcing Company
description: Funds advised by the private equity firm Apax Partners have agreed to sell a majority stake in the marketing outsourcing company Advantage Sales and Marketing to the private equity firms Leonard Green & Partners and CVC Capital Partners.

title: Rick Perrys Groundhog Day
description: Boys, I am going to bless this meal, Rick Perry said, ducking his head and folding his hands under his chin. We were sitting at Nate n Al, the Jewish Deli in Beverly Hills, and the governor of Texas was looking every bit the regular customer in a tight black polo shirt and designer glasses. His face was nicely tanned; his hair, as ever, was coifed and TV-ready. He had just ordered a corned-beef Reuben (I worked out this morning) and a Diet Dr Pepper (you got those critters? he asked the waiter). But before diving in, Perry took a moment to appreciate his surroundings. Im more Jewish than you think I am, he told me. I read the part of the Bible that said the Jews are Gods chosen people. He boasted that he has been going to Israel since 1992. Then Perry got down to business, thanking the Lord for His many blessings, and asking Him to be with our men and women who defend our freedom, bring em home safe, be with the president, give him wisdom.

title: Iraqs Current Conflict Foretold
description: With Sunni rebel extremists increasing their attacks on Iraqi government forces, the conflict has drawn in Shiite civilians who had been mobilized in defense. The rebels of the Islamic State of Iraq and Syria, who claim to have executed hundreds of Iraqi troops, have overtaken cities in the northern and western parts of the country.

title: Britain Says It Is Ready to Reopen Iran Embassy
description: LONDON  Underscoring its warming relations with Iran, Britain announced Tuesday that the circumstances are right to reopen the British Embassy in Tehran and that it would establish a small presence there as soon as possible.

title: As Sunnis Die in Iraq, a Cycle Is Restarting
description: BAGHDAD  As Sunni militants rampaged across northern Iraq last week, executing Iraqi soldiers and government workers and threatening to demolish Shiisms most sacred shrines, Iraqs Shiites suffered mostly in silence, maintaining a patience urged on them by their religious leaders through months of deadly bombings.

title: Military to Let Enlistees Be Shorter and Stouter
description: China has spent years trying to streamline its military, the worlds largest by personnel count, but its latest modernization may see it swell a little. The Peoples Liberation Army will be admitting new recruits who are slightly shorter and pudgier than their predecessors, the state-run China Daily reported on Tuesday.

title: New York Today: Riding to Albany, for Higher Wages
description: Good Tuesday morning to you.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Welcome to the Morning Briefing on NYT Now.

title: E. Tautz: Spring 2015 Menswear
description: London

title: Takeover Bid for Property Developer in China Fails on Head Count Test
description: HONG KONG  A $2.4 billion takeover and privatization bid by Cheng Yu-tung, one of Asias richest men, won support from investors who owned 99.84 percent of the eligible shares in the target, New World China Land, a property developer in mainland China. But it was not enough.

title: Daily Report: British Spy Agencies Are Said to Claim Right to Intercept Web Communications
description: In a broad legal rationale for collecting information from Internet use by its citizens, the British government has reportedly asserted the right to intercept communications that go through services like Facebook, Google and Twitter that are based in the United States or other foreign nations, even if they are between people in Britain, Mark Scott reports.

title: Search for Missing Malaysia Airlines Jet to Move Southwest, Officials Say
description: CANBERRA, Australia  Australia plans to resume searching for Malaysia Airlines missing Flight 370 to the southwest of the area in the Indian Ocean where the seafloor was scanned in detail last month, Australian officials say.

title: Lindsay Lohan Cheerleads for Jeremy Scott
description: LONDON  Jeremy Scotts fashion shows are infamous for their celebrity contingents, an audience bloc with a history of delaying proceedings past even the fashion worlds usual loose interpretation of timeliness. (At his Moschino debut in Milan in February, Rita Ora and Katy Perry were so delayed that their arrivals were greeted by boos from the photographers pit.) So it was all the more a surprise to see, at his debut mens show for Moschino here Monday, a famous friend perched quietly and punctually front row.

title: Morning Views
description: The New York Times reports dozens of school shootings have occurred in the 18 months since the massacre at Sandy Hook Elementary School in Newtown, Conn., and the public-health community still lacks necessary information on how to prevent gun violence. And if pro-gun members of Congress have their way, it will stay that way, the editorial board writes. Representative Jack Kingston, Republican of Georgia and head of the House subcommittee that sets the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention budget, has labeled efforts to understand the socio-psychological causes of gun violence as propaganda for gun-grabbing initiatives. The price of ignorance is measured in tens of thousands of preventable deaths and avoidable injuries from guns, year in and year out, the board notes. Compared with that, $10 million for the C.D.C. to study the problem and propose solutions would be a small price to pay.

title: U.S. Professors Call on Colleges to Re-evaluate Confucius Institutes
description: The American Association of University Professors is calling on universities to uphold principles of academic freedom by either terminating or renegotiating the agreements that have brought nearly 100 Chinese government-backed cultural and language programs called Confucius Institutes to campuses across the United States and Canada.

title: Swedish Cable Company Com Hem Raises $853 Million in I.P.O.
description: LONDON  The Swedish cable company Com Hem Holding said on Tuesday that it raised 5.67 billion Swedish kronor, or about $853 million, in its initial public offering on the Nasdaq OMX Stockholm exchange.

description: The latest mens collection from Burberry at London Fashion Week.The live stream has ended. Please visit burberry.com for the replay.

title: Morning Agenda: Argentinas Court Loss Buoys Creditors
description: The Supreme Court on Monday handed two major defeats to the government of Argentina, which has been fighting with New York hedge funds over bonds that the country defaulted on in 2001. Along with putting Argentina at risk of another default, the setbacks could also make it harder in the future for a financially troubled country to cut a deal with its creditors to reduce its debt load, DealBooks Peter Eavis writes. Argentina had asked the Supreme Court to overturn a lower courts ruling that had required the country to pay back defaulted bonds held by the litigating hedge funds, known as holdouts.

title: A Bookstore Owner Taps a Wound to Write a First Novel
description: In the opening pages of Lisa Howorths novel, Flying Shoes, her heroine, Mary Byrd Thornton, gets a phone call from a police detective. He has news: The unsolved 30-year-old murder of her brother is being reinvestigated. She picks up a glass-laminate dish, advertised as indestructible, and shatters it on the kitchen floor.

title: In Performance: Greta Gerwig and Scott Shepherd of The Village Bike
description: This weeks video features the actors Greta Gerwig and Scott Shepherd in a scene from Penelope Skinners dark comedy The Village Bike.  The play centers on Becky (Ms. Gerwig), a pregnant young woman who moves to a small English town with her husband, only to embark on an adventurous but troubled affair with a local lothario, Oliver (Mr. Shepherd). In this scene, Becky and Oliver get acquainted, and theres some awkward flirtation. The show, directed by Sam Gold for MCC Theater, continues through July 13 at the Lucille Lortel Theater.

title: Ugly Disagreements
description: Its the most basic of grammatical rules, and in most instances, theres little room for debate: Subjects and verbs should agree in number. And yet  here are just a few of our recent missteps:

title: Orange Is the New Black Recap: Morello Hears Wedding Bells
description: The flashbacks have settled into a bit of a routine at this point in the series; one begins, with its star, and you realize that this is going to be her episode.

description: GoodTuesdaymorning from a sun-baked Washington.

title: Extremist Groups in Iraq Threaten Regional War, U.N. Panel Warns
description: GENEVA  The onslaught of extremist Sunni militants in Iraq will have violent repercussions in Syria and could bring wider war in the Middle East, a United Nations panel warned on Tuesday.

title: Feeling For | Illesteva Shades You Design Yourself
description: In the four years of its existence, the New York-based eyewear and accessories brand Illesteva has made some noise with its collaborations, including House of Waris, the Webster boutique and Lou Reed. Lou Reed! How to follow up a partnership with the man who helped invent punk? Perhaps the only thing more punk than punk is the ethos of D.I.Y., and so today, the line  whose colorful, unisex shades have been sported by Beyonc, Lady Gaga and Cara Delevingne  is unveiling a new custom sunglasses service. Using Illestevas website, users can select one of three frame styles, then choose from up to eight colors for the fronts and sides and match them up with one of up to nine lens varieties, including a polarized option. Like all of the brands offerings, the shades will be made in Italy or France. Ive never seen this offered in sunglasses before. Im interested to see what color ways people will come up with, says Daniel Silberman, the brands co-owner and designer. His decision to hand control over to his customers comes down to one of punks main tenets: self-expression. Everyone wants to feel like they have something unique, he says, something that someone else doesnt have.

title: Central Bank Chief Resists Call to Expand Judicial Oversight
description: The governor of the central bank of India on Tuesday argued against a call by a government-appointed commission for greater judicial oversight of financial regulators.

title: Britain to Reopen Iran Embassy
description: Remarks by the British foreign secretary, William Hague, on a diplomatic breakthrough in the Middle East and his expectations for Iran.

title: Este Lauder Goes Long on Mens Skin Care
description: The London Collections: Men may be well underway in Britain, kicking off the autumn/winter mens wear circuit, but it turns out that fashion is not the only style sector increasingly focused on the revenue potential of the hairier sex. Este Lauder, the American beauty behemoth that owns the likes of Clinique, Bobbi Brown and La Mer, has just created a new stand-alone mens skin care group. Its the first time the company has treated the segment as its own category.

title: At Senate Hearing, Brokerage Firms Called Out for Conflicts
description: Updated, 10:43 a.m. | WASHINGTON  TD Ameritrade, a brokerage firm that handles vast numbers of stock trades for average investors, promises to execute those orders on the best possible terms.

title: In Wichita, Koch Influence Is Revered and Reviled
description: WICHITA, Kan.  In national politics, playing in Charles Kochs arena can mean saturation advertising against vulnerable Democrats, calls for tax cuts, demands to roll back government regulation and bitter clashes over climate change.

title: London Mens Fashion Week: Alexander McQueen Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the mens fashion week photo diary of Kasia Bobula.

title: From Bach to Mavis Staples: The White Light Festival
description: The 2014 edition of the White Light Festival, Lincoln Centers annual exploration of spirituality in the arts, will include Peter Sellarss staging of Bachs St. Matthew Passion, a performance of Islamic and Sufi devotional music by the Rizwan-Muazzam Qawwali ensemble from Pakistan, a screening of Krzysztof Kieslowskis 10-part film The Decalogue and a concert by Mavis Staples among its 28 presentations. The festival will run from Oct. 7 through Nov. 11.

title: Koch County, Kansas
description: The Koch brothers have their name on a lot of things in Wichita, home of Koch Industries  a zoo exhibit, a YMCA, a basketball arena. But even in a city theyve given millions to, there are skeptics.

title: At the Cutting Edge of Gay Family Law
description: We always thought our story would be pretty typical: Boy meets girl; girl asks boy for sperm to impregnate her wife; boy relinquishes parental rights so girl can second-parent adopt. You know, just a run-of-the-mill beginning to your average American family.

title: 7 Killed as Pakistan Police Clash With Preachers Followers
description: LAHORE, Pakistan  At least seven people have been killed and about 100 wounded in Lahore in violent clashes between the police and followers of Muhammad Tahir-ul-Qadri, a fiery preacher turned political activist who has called for a mass movement against the government of Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif.

title: The Economy May Be Improving. Worker Pay Isnt.
description: The latest economic data out Tuesday morning was generally good. Home building activity remained above the one million a year rate. Consumer prices rose 0.4 percent in May, such that inflation over the last year is now 2.1 percent, about in line with what the Federal Reserve aims for.

description: London

title: Twin Tornadoes Touch Down in Nebraska
description: Video captures rare twin tornadoes in Pilger, Neb., on Monday. At least two people died in the storm, and 16 were critically injured.

title: Has the Electronic Image Supplanted the Written Word?
description: Each week in Bookends, two writers take on questions about the world of books. Fifty years ago, Marshall McLuhan suggested that the electronic image had supplanted the written word. This week, Dana Stevens and Rivka Galchen discuss whether we are living in a new revolutionary age, or just a continuation of the old one.

title: German Labor Costs
description: I gather from some of the reactions to my post on innovation hype  that many readers dont know about the remarkable German export story. Heres the key point: German labor is very expensive, even compared with the United States:

title: Animation of Cleveland Police Shooting
description: The Ohio attorney general released an animated re-creation of the Nov. 29, 2012, pursuit and shooting by Cleveland police officers of two apparently unarmed people.

title: A Top Currency Executive at Citigroup Is Leaving
description: A top executive is leaving Citigroups currency business, the second prominent departure this year.

title: Narendra Modis Election Sparks Hope for Sanskrit
description: NEW DELHI  The Indian governments National Sanskrit Institute, whose headquarters are in a run-down section of western New Delhi, has the hallmarks of a long-neglected state project.

title: Surge in Child Migrants Reaches New York, Overwhelming Advocates
description: For more than a month, 16-year-old Cristian threaded his way from his home in rural Guatemala to the United States, hoping to reunite with his father, whom he had not seen in nearly four years. Guided by smugglers, he rode in cars, buses and trains, walked countless miles, dodged the authorities in three countries, hid out in dreary safe houses and went days at a time without food.

title: Belgium vs. Algeria: World Cup 2014 Live Blog
description: Belgium, the favorite to win the group, is led by a host of Premier League stars. Algerias top scorer is one of many players on the team plying their trades for second- or third-tier European teams. This might not be pretty.

description: A roundup of motoring news from the web:

title: Deadly Clashes in Pakistan Over Preacher
description: At least eight people were killed in Lahore, Pakistan, in a standoff between a preachers followers and police officers.

title: Twin Tornadoes Leave Behind a Devastated Nebraska Town
description: PILGER, Neb.  The employees of the bank here in this small village in northeast Nebraska watched the skies darken late Monday as they handled the deposits and withdrawals. They felt the air thicken and get sticky as the humidity rose. Moments later, after reports of a funnel cloud southwest of town, they found themselves huddling in the bank vault.

title: Ode to the Classic Bistro
description: PARIS  It is a question I have come to dread: Can you recommend the perfect bistro?

title: Should We All Learn to Code?
description: The idea that Americans must all learn to code or risk being left behind by the world economy has become so ubiquitous that its inspired a significant backlash. But some are saying what we need most isnt coding proficiency per se but a broader understanding of how to use computers to approach problems.

title: U.S. Seizure of Suspect in 2012 Benghazi Assault Ends Long Manhunt
description: WASHINGTON  American commandos operating under the cover of night seized the man suspected of leading the deadly attack on the United States Mission in Benghazi, Libya, the government announced on Tuesday, ending a manhunt that had dragged on for nearly two years and inflamed domestic and international politics.

title: Microsofts Surface Pro 3 Isnt for Everybody
description: FOR the better part of a month, Ive been trying to replace the laptop that I use for my daily work, an Apple MacBook Pro, with Microsofts new tablet computer, the Surface Pro 3. I say trying because thats what it has felt like; this is a machine that Ive had to put a lot of work into adjusting to, in the hope that, at some point, Id get used to it and see some kind of payoff.

title: Drug Suspect Who Took Control of Police Car and Fled Is Found
description: The two men had been arrested, handcuffed and stuffed in the back seat of an unmarked police vehicle, a seemingly routine part of a drug investigation on Monday evening in Queens.

title: As Justice Department Scrutinizes Local Police, Cleveland Is Latest Focus
description: CLEVELAND  As cries of shots fired shrieked from police radios, a caravan that grew to 62 patrol cars chased an old blue Malibu through 20 miles of this citys streets and highways. The vehicle and its two occupants were surrounded in a school lot, and in a disorienting jumble of sirens and strobes, officers fired 137 rounds at close range.

title: World Cup 2014: Mexico and Brazil Play to a 0-0 Draw
description: Brazil dominated much of the match against Mexico, but with four points each, both teams are in good position to advance from the group.

title: Burberry Gives a Garden Party
description: LONDON  Give us a smile please, Tom, one of the paparazzi shouted at the actor Tom Felton (Harry Potter) as he stood awkwardly in the bright afternoon sunshine on Tuesday, waiting to go into the Burberry show in Kensington Gardens.

title: World Cup 2014: Russia and South Korea Play to 1-1 Draw After Keeper's Blunder
description: Russia could not overcome a costly error by its goalkeeper and wound up settling for a 1-1 draw with South Korea.

description: Scenes from the Northside Festival 2014 photo diary of Sandy Kim.

title: China Sends Top Diplomat to Begin Talks With Vietnam
description: HANOI, Vietnam  A senior Chinese official will hold talks here on Wednesday with Vietnam about the contentious deep-sea oil rig stationed by China in disputed waters, the two countries announced Tuesday.

description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: DreamWorks Animation Aiming Beyond Film
description: GLENDALE, Calif.  For months, DreamWorks Animation has been working on a prototype for a product it hopes will change how the worlds children meet Santa each Christmas. Code name: DreamHouse.

title: Mistrial Is Declared in Malcolm Smith Corruption Trial
description: WHITE PLAINS  Malcolm A. Smith, at times one of New Yorks most powerful political officials as the majority leader and the minority leader of the State Senate, was granted a mistrial on Tuesday by a federal judge in his trial for bribery and wire fraud.

title: Medtronic-Covidien Deal Rewards Just 2 Advisory Firms
description: Investment bankers had a rude awakening over the weekend. A megamerger like the $43 billion cash and stock deal Medtronic and Covidien announced on Sunday often provides a feast for a raft of advisory firms. Not this time. The two medical devices companies are only using one each.

title: Uber, American Express Partner for Loyalty Points
description: Much like our universe, options to earn loyalty points through travel are ever-expanding.

title: China Keeps a Close Eye on Oil Interests in Iraq
description: As the violence of the American-led invasion of Iraq and the ensuing civil war ebbed after 2008, some analysts said that China had emerged as the big winner from the strife, at least in terms of oil interests. China National Petroleum Corporation, the largest state-owned energy company, had become the biggest foreign investor in the Iraqi oil industry. With a tolerance for risk and willingness to accept lower profits, C.N.P.C., as it is commonly called, won major government contracts and invested billions of dollars in Iraq.

London Mens Fashion Week in 140 Characters
description: Here are highlights of our staffs tweets from the spring 2015 mens shows.

title: Facebook Releases Slingshot for Self-Destructing Selfies
description: When Facebook ended negotiations to buy Snapchat last year, that did not mean the company stopped thinking about the disappearing photo messages that have made Snapchat so popular for casual conversations, especially among younger users.

title: Valeant Tries New Tactics to Woo Shareholders of Botox Maker Allergan
description: Valeant Pharmaceuticals is planning to take an exchange offer to Allergan shareholders, as it moves ahead with its $53 billion hostile takeover attempt for the maker of Botox.

description: The choreographer David Parsonss signature work, Caught, has a soloist soaring through the air as if caught in a photograph.

description: LOS ANGELES  To the competing films in development about Edward Snowden add another pair of projects on a hot-button political subject: Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl, the recently freed Taliban prisoner of war.

description: In 1982, David Parsons made his greatest choreographic discovery: He invented a way for a dancer to fly.

title: Bathhouse Dutchman Heads to Chicago
description: The artist Rashid Johnsons production of Dutchman, which was staged last year as part of the Performa 13 Biennial in a true hothouse environment  the Russian and Turkish Baths on 10th Street in the East Village  is heading out on the road to another storied urban bathhouse.

title: Vans and Ace Hotel Team Up for a Sleek Take on the Skateboarding Shoe
description: At the Ace Hotel Downtown Los Angeles, which opened earlier this year in what was once the United Artists building, the doormen and front-desk team have been outfitted with a fresh new set of kicks: a leather-and-canvas mens lace-up designed in collaboration with Vans, the skate-shoe company which has previously teamed up with everyone from Hello Kitty to Kenzo. The black-on-black version of the classic Era model is the ultimategrown-up sneaker, equally at home in the hipster-chic, movie-set-like hotel or on the SoCal streets. Starting this weekend, the shoes are also available in limited quantities in the gift shop; next Monday, theyll be sold online.

title: Knicks Changing, With or Without Anthony
description: Phil Jackson is not one to deal in absolutism. He is pragmatic but whimsical. Basketball is his honored career, not his spiritual calling.

title: At the Fragrance Foundation Awards, the Sweet Smell of Success
description: Wtih Coco Rocha and Carine Roitfeld as co-chairwomen for the evening, there was glamour in the air.

title: Live Video from State Department Briefing on Suspect Arrested in Attack on Benghazi Compound
description: State Department officials answer questions about the arrest of a suspect in the attack on the compound in Benghazi on Sept. 11, 2012.

title: How to Choose a Hospice
description: The American Hospice Foundation, an advocacy group that has worked to improve care for the dying and bereaved since 1995, will close its doors at the end of this month. The foundation has lost too much funding to continue, its founding president and chief executive Naomi Naierman told me in an interview. As a parting gift, however, Ms. Naierman  a hospice executive for more than 30 years  has passed along some consumer advice.

title: Hearing Indicates Easy Path for Obamas Housing Nominee
description: WASHINGTON  President Obamas nominee for housing secretary, Mayor Julin Castro of San Antonio, fielded a series of mostly friendly questions on Tuesday from members of the Senate Banking Committee, signaling a smooth path to confirmation in the coming weeks.

title: A World Premiere From Patti Smith and Her Daughter at Crossing the Line Festival
description: Killer Road, a work by the rock iconoclast Patti Smith, her daughter Jesse Smith and the ambient composer-performers of Soundwalk Collective, is one of three productions that will have their world premieres as part of Crossing the Line, the multidisciplinary festival presented by the French Institute Alliance Franaise (FIAF).

title: Finally, an Executive Order on LGBT Workplace Discrimination
description: Workplace discrimination based on sexual orientation or gender identity needs to stop, President Obama said last November, because in the United States of America, who you are and who you love should never be a fireable offense. But November came and went, as did 2013, and the first quarter of 2014, without the president heeding the rising calls for executive action.

title: U.S. Calls on Europe to Ease Limits on Gene-Altered Food
description: BRUSSELS  The top American agriculture official on Tuesday called on the European Union to do more to ease restrictions on gene-altered food and feed crops if it hoped to reach a trans-Atlantic trade pact.

title: Obama Plans Protected Marine Area in Pacific Ocean
description: WASHINGTON  In an effort to protect diverse habitats of coral reefs, whales, dolphins, sharks, sea turtles and numerous fish species from commercial fishing and other activities, President Obama announced Tuesday that he intended to use his executive authority to create the worlds largest marine protected area in the south-central Pacific Ocean.

title: Scoop: A Glimpse Into the NYTimes CMS
description: You know the importance of technology to the future of journalism has become a widely accepted fact when a prominent editor decides to join a new company because of its content management system. Thats what Ezra Klein told The New York Times about his decision to leave The Washington Post for Vox Media, a digital publisher with a fancy, custom-built CMS. Klein couldnt quite describe what made the Vox system so special, but the fact that a journalist said he loved, let alone even tolerated, his CMS was all you needed to know that the world has changed.

title: Defensive Shift Finds Some Believers in College Baseball
description: OMAHA  It is not that big a deal, Texas Tech Coach Tim Tadlock said. Sometimes he overshifts his infield against left-handed pull hitters, putting three players on the right side of second base like major league teams do for David Ortiz of the Boston Red Sox. Sometimes he moves defenders a few feet, subtly, all in the hope of getting an out.

title: Brazil vs. Mexico: World Cup 2014 Live Blog
description: Both teams won their first games, so a win is not vital. Brazil will expect one nonetheless, while Mexico would be ecstatic with a draw.

title: Stepping Into the Role of the Ringmaster
description: When a restaurant is founded by a chef whose kitchen acrobatics make us sit up and notice, it can be confusing for everybody when that chef moves on. Will the replacement be a caretaker cook mimicking the style that made the place exciting? Or will the successor be a creative whiz who can make the menu jump through a new set of hoops?

title: London Mens Fashion Week Street Style
description: Looks range from dapper to experimental.

title: An 80s Warhol Brings $30 Million at Art Basel
description: BASEL, Switzerland  An Andy Warhol self-portrait priced at more than $30 million led the rush of early sales at the V.I.P. preview of Art Basel, the worlds pre-eminent fair devoted to modern and contemporary art. The 45th edition of this event, held at a time when auction prices of contemporary art are booming, features hundreds of international galleries.

title: Spy Photographers Capture Camouflaged Mini F-150
description: Its not unusual for automotive spy photographers to pop up with images of heavily camouflaged prototype vehicles, typically taken from the other side of a fence. This week, though, the photographers shot something a bit smaller: a tot-size F-150 pickup.

title: London Mens Fashion Week Spring 2015 Accessories
description: Statement pieces and staples from the mens collections in London.

title: Roma Boy, 16, Is Comatose After Beating Outside Paris
description: PARIS  A teenage Roma boy lay in a coma in a hospital here on Tuesday after being abducted from a shantytown and beaten last week, apparently in retaliation for what his assailants thought were thefts he committed in a nearby housing project, the French authorities said.

description: In business, there is a right way and a wrong way. But as General Electric has been learning, there is also a French way.

title: Met Opera Cancels Simulcast of Klinghoffer
description: The Metropolitan Opera announced on Tuesday that it was canceling plans to simulcast John Adamss The Death of Klinghoffer this fall to cinemas around the world, drawing praise from some Jewish groups who object to the opera, but laments from the works fans and a warning from its composer that the decision promotes intolerance.

title: Koch Group Forms Super PAC as 2014 Races Near
description: A political nonprofit group at the center of the philanthropic and political network overseen by Charles and David Koch has formed a new super PAC, according to documents filed earlier this month with the Federal Election Commission, providing a new outlet for the hundreds of millions of dollars the Kochs and their fellow donors are preparing to funnel into the 2014 election.

title: Brazen Figure May Hold Key to Mysteries
description: CAIRO  Ahmed Abu Khattala was always open about his animosity toward the United States, and even about his conviction that Muslims and Christians were locked in an intractable religious war. There is always hostility between the religions, he said in an interview. That is the nature of religions.

title: AnonyWatch: When Unnamed Sources Are Flat Wrong
description: In a blistering column this week, the Reuters media critic Jack Shafer takes The Times to task for using a particular kind of anonymous source  the kind who turn out to be wrong.

title: How to Help Myanmars Muslim Minority
description: Its a question Ive heard over and over again from readers who learn about the persecuted Rohingya Muslim minority in Myanmar. For a couple of weeks now, Ive been asking myself the same thing: What can we do to help?

title: The Wonking Dead
description: The Commonwealth Fund is out with a new report comparing advanced-country health care systems, and the (mostly pre-Obamacare) US system looks very bad indeed: vastly higher spending per capita than anyone else, with worse results.

title: A Scrapped Aphex Twin Album Finds New Life on YouTube
description: Fans of the electronic music composer Richard D. James, who releases his music under the name Aphex Twin, have come up with an elaborate plan to get some of his unreleased music out there. When members of We Are the Music Makers, an online electronica forum, learned that a collector was selling one of five known acetate test pressings of Caustic Window  an Aphex Twin album that Mr. James produced in 1994 but scrapped  they sprang into action.

description: A belated reaction to Mark Thomas comments on Barry Ritholtz and the issue of pundit accountability. Mark writes:

title: SolarCity Is Acquiring a Start-Up, Silevo, to Build Panels
description: SolarCity, the fast-growing provider of rooftop solar electricity systems, is moving into the panel manufacturing business, acquiring a start-up and planning to build one of the worlds largest module factories in Buffalo, executives said on Tuesday.

title: David Henry Hwang and Lynn Nottage Joining Columbia Playwriting Faculty
description: The playwrights David Henry Hwang and Lynn Nottage will join the faculty of Columbia Universitys School of the Arts, the schools dean, Carol Becker, has announced, thus raising the profile of an M.F.A. program in playwriting that has existed since 1965 but in recent years has had only two professional playwrights, Charles L. Mee and Kelly Stuart, on its full-time faculty.

title: Ramen: A Quick Fix for the Soul
description: It tells you something about the philosophy of Roy Choi that one of the recipes in his 2013 book, L.A. Son, doesnt seem at first glance like a recipe at all. You make some instant ramen. Slide an egg into the hot broth, then some butter.

title: Putting Fun in Fatherhood
description: As every dad knows, fatherhood isnt all fun and games. But our recent Fathers Day question, Are you a fun dad? did prompt a number of amusing stories. We heard about dads who moonwalk, sing ZZ Top songs, play name that potato, dress up as the Grim Reaper on holidays and find various other ways to connect with their sons and daughters.

title: Does TV Ignore Female Sexuality?
description: Much criticism of Game of Thrones  and, indeed, of cable TV in general  has focused around its depictions of violence against women. But at Salon, Lili Loofbourow points to another problem: Much of television may offer not just too many scenes of brutality toward women but also too few designed to make them feel good.

title: Israelis Start #BringBackOurBoys Campaign
description: Updated, Wednesday, 5:44 p.m. | Inspired by the success of Nigerian activists who used a simple hashtag to trigger a global outpouring of sympathy for schoolgirls kidnapped by Islamist militants, a group of Israelis trained to promote their country online started a #BringBackOurBoys campaign last week after three teenagers disappeared on their way home from religious schools in the occupied West Bank.

title: Roy Choi, King of L.A. Food Trucks, Moves On to a Hotel
description: LOS ANGELES  Roy Choi stood on the roof of the Line, a new hotel in the same Koreatown neighborhood he used to roam around as a child, and surveyed the surrounding blocks like a ships captain scanning the ocean waves.

title: Russia vs. South Korea: World Cup 2014 Live Blog
description: With Belgium as the favorite to win this group and Algeria a longshot to advance, the winner of this match should be in good position to qualify for the knockout round.

title: On View | Lee Ufans Contemplative Sculptural Installations at Versailles
description: For the past several years, the Chateau de Versailles has invited different contemporary artists to exhibit works on its grounds, including Takashi Murakami and, controversially, Jeff Koons. Starting today, the palace will be hosting 10 new pieces by the South Korean-born, Japan-based artist Lee Ufan, nine of which have been installed outdoors in the vast gardens designed by Andr Le Ntre for Louis XIV.

title: Torn Between Competing Perspectives on Iraq
description: Is this what 1975 felt like?

title: With Business Initiative, Obama Aims to Show He Can Act Without Congress
description: PITTSBURGH  President Obama acted as a pitchman for entrepreneurs on Tuesday afternoon, fielding questions from small-business owners in an attempt to highlight creative ways to bolster manufacturing.
