title: An Evening of Sonic Exploration on Keyboards, Electronic and Otherwise
description: All composers are interested in sound, but Anthony Cheung more than most. His orchestral work Fog Mobiles (2010) has its horn soloist create tones that suggest foghorns heard from various distances. Lyra, first performed last week by the New York Philharmonic, calls for shimmering transitions between a live ensemble and taped music.

title: In House G.O.P.s Leadership Fight, the Main Event Is Still to Come
description: WASHINGTON  House Republicans will vote on their leadership on Thursday, but the outcome will essentially keep them in a holding pattern, with the real contest months if not years away.

title: Pop-Up Restaurants on the Rails
description: Stars of Londons restaurant scene will be periodically hopping aboard the vintage Art Deco cars of the British Pullman, one of several luxury trains operated by Belmond, the former Orient Express Hotels Group, to serve as one-night-only pop-up chefs.

title: Watch for Low-Flying Angels
description: Dominion, beginning Thursday night on Syfy, is a television series spun off from a movie. But were not talking about something like The Avengers or even, say, Buffy the Vampire Slayer. The source in this case is the little-noticed 2010 film Legion, in which a motley crew of humans, holed up in a desert diner, fight off a crew of malevolent angels with the help of the archangel Michael, who takes our side for one reason or another. Maybe pity? Hey, its been a while.

title: Families of G.M. Victims Speak Out
description: Relatives at a news conference provided accounts of accidents that they say involved General Motors ignition defect.

title: Summer Fashion for the Sandal Averse
description: Summertime footwear can be extreme: too-high strappy sandals that are simply painful; or, on the trendier front, all of those Birkenstocks and Teva styles. And maybe youre just not a woman who is crazy about showing off her feet. In the face of all that, demure closed-toe pumps are now looking right, and nicely refined, for the office and for evening hours. At the recent CFDA awards, Marion Cotillard, left, glorious as always, wore a Dior pair with her haute couture dress. Few of us will be wearing couture, but we can pull off the elegant statement with any of these closed-toe options and, perhaps, a pencil skirt and mannish button-down or a smart cocktail dress.

title: A School Is a Jungle Where Teeth Are Bared
description: Funny thing about the Neanderthals. Although scientists tell us that these cave men cousins of ours became extinct about 30,000 years ago, they have a way of reappearing in contemporary society, especially classrooms.

title: Giants Jason Pierre-Paul Says He Is Healthy
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Giants defensive end Jason Pierre-Paul knows he had an unproductive season last year as he recovered from back surgery. But he feels some people around the N.F.L. have been too quick to declare that his days as a Pro Bowl-caliber player are over.

title: Amazons Phone: Its Not About the Phone, Really
description: Youve probably heard that Amazon introduced a phone today, called the Fire. But are phones already so yesterday?

title: A Rare Double, Even by the Mets Standards, Helps Prevent a Sweep
description: ST. LOUIS  There is an old baseball saying that goes something like this: Every day at the ballpark, you might see something new.

title: No Body Talk Summer Camps
description: Last August, on a clear summer day, Tom and Maura Gould were driving their 12-year-old daughter from Eden Village, an organic farming camp in Putnam Valley, N.Y., to their home in Cambridge, Mass., when they started talking about family members who were particularly hairy.

title: Farewells, and Some More Questions, for Press Secretary
description: WASHINGTON  At the top of his last briefing as White House press secretary on Wednesday, Jay Carney acknowledged to his adversaries in the news media how hard it can get in here, how hot it can sometimes be.

title: Curating the Dcor
description: AGE 29

title: Amazons Fire and the Real Cost of Switching Phones
description: Amazons new phone has loads of features: the ability to recognize thousands of products in stores, supposedly tangle-free earbud cords and a screen that gives images the illusion of depth.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Welcome to NYT Now, the new app from The New York Times.

title: Going Past the Grave to Gain His Love
description: Playing the character of Giselle, a great ballerina can put herself through astonishing changes: A village girl falls in love with a count (named Albrecht) who is pretending to be a peasant, and when she learns he is betrothed to someone else, she goes mad, dies of shock and returns as an ethereal spirit. But a great ballerina often has to play Giselle again and again; and over time, a radiant performance can settle into habit.

title: In Single Gene, a Path to Fight Heart Attacks
description: Two major studies by leading research groups published on Wednesday independently identified mutations in a single gene that protect against heart attacks by keeping levels of triglycerides  a kind of fat in the blood  very low for a lifetime.

title: Pulling Back the Veil, or Keeping It On
description: A Yemeni photographer worked both sides of the camera as she and her daughter  and a doll  posed for a visual mediation on the increasing covering of women.

title: No Fat Talk and No Skinny Talk, Either, at Some Camps
description: Many children figure out young that one road to conversation with peers, older children and even parents is to talk appearance  theirs, or someone elses. She really shouldnt wear those pants, or even just Did you notice his beard? spark conversations (not always kind), and can lead, eventually, to the dubious bonding ritual that is negative self-talk: No cookies for me! Not with these thighs! Oh, I know, my jeans are getting so tight! Ninety-three percent of college women told one researcher they had engaged in such fat talk, and such talk comes with a cost, putting the focus on weight and appearance, and not in a positive way.

title: Rappers Lyrics and Lifestyles Scrutinized in Murder Case
description: Studio time until 5 a.m., $400 bottles at nightclubs, taking a bullet to the head: Such is the life of a modern-day rapper.

title: Croatia vs. Cameroon: World Cup 2014 Live Blog
description: Losing a World Cup opener as these teams both did, is bad, but not fatal. Losing Game 2 as well is the end of the line. Both teams must win to have a shot at the second berth behind Brazil.

title: Exploiting Circus Animals
description: To the Editor:

title: Pictures of the Day: Iraq and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Iraq, Albania, Kenya and England.

title: A Charter Leaders View
description: To the Editor:

title: Theres Pride in Embracing the Past
description: The Orchestra of the League of Composers gave its final concert of the season on Monday at Miller Theater at Columbia University, under the baton of Louis Karchin.

title: Pull Over, Its John Waters
description: The film director and author hitchhiked across the United States and lived to tell the tale.

title: The Controversy Over The Death of Klinghoffer
The Value of a NanoDegree
description: To the Editor:

title: Cocktail Culture | A Flight of Top-Shelf Books About Drinking
description: This season a number of excellent books about spirits come to market, covering every corner of drinking culture. Pick one up if youre thinking about new ways of serving drinks this summer.

title: John Waters on Hitchhiking Across America
description: John Waters was safely ensconced in his Greenwich Village apartment, which is unexpectedly tasteful  Oriental rugs, carefully arranged books  for the filmmaker known as the Pope of Trash, thanks to movies like Hairspray and Pink Flamingos that traffic in camp, gore and, ahem, bodily functions.

title: Boy, 14, Fatally Stabs Schoolmate in Bronx, Police Say
description: A 14-year-old Bronx boy who may have been teased and robbed by a 14-year-old schoolmate stabbed him to death on Wednesday afternoon outside the school they attended, the police said.

title: With Wind Calm, Serenity in Slovenia
description: The subject was the Bora  the ferocious northern wind that wreaks seasonal havoc on the western Slovenian region known as the Vipava Valley, where we had just arrived  and my friend expressed disappointment that we had just missed out on the chance to experience it. It sounds so impressive, she said.

title: At London Mens Fashion Week, Designers Fly the Flag for Individuality
description: LONDON  One of the standout shows of London Collections: Men, the citys three-day mens fashion week, was by a 27-year-old novice named Craig Green. It was all the more astonishing because it was, technically, his first.

title: Cupid Flitted About Briskly, While the TV Stars Just Stood There
description: Julia Roberts couldnt stop smiling during Tuesdays On Site Opera performance of Rameaus Pygmalion. Kim Kardashian maintained a more skeptical pose, hands on peplum-frilled hips, a hint of a pout on her closed lips. Of course, neither of them was a reliable measure of the shows success. Their facial expressions, like everything else about them, were perpetually frozen in wax.

title: Yellen Delivers Remarks on Fed Policy
description: The Federal Reserve chairwoman, Janet L. Yellen, said the Fed would maintain its plan to trim its stimulus campaign by reducing its monthly bond purchases to $35 billion beginning in July.

title: When Time Isnt Free
description: How much free time do you have? On a basic level, you could answer that question by tallying up the hours you spend working, sleeping and doing chores, and figuring out whats left over. But some argue that the real answer is a lot more complicated  and that the way you experience time might have a lot to do with money.

title: Facebook Makes Its Own Computer Networking Switch
description: In pretty short order, Facebook is out to shake up big parts of what makes the Internet go.

title: Openings and Sales for the Week of June 19
description: Openings

title: Careful Defense in a World Wide Bridge Contest Heat
description: In the World Wide Bridge Contest held on June 7, Corey Krantz and Bruce Lang came in second, playing at the Bridge Club of Center City in Philadelphia. They had a 73.14 percent game, finishing 1.48 percent behind George Criparacos and John Vergitsakis from Greece.

title: Klinghoffer Composer Responds to Mets Decision
description: John Adams said he learned that the Metropolitan Opera was scrapping plans to transmit his opera The Death of Klinghoffer to movie theaters around the world when the Mets general manager, Peter Gelb, told him on Sunday by telephone that he had gotten unimaginable pressure from some Jewish groups that oppose the work.

title: New Yorks Film Czar Preserves Indie Spirit
description: When Cynthia Lpez was 9 years old, her mother told her, Make sure you hold the door for those who come behind you.

title: Protection Sought for Vast and Ancient Incan Road
description: It is an engineering marvel of antiquity, comparable, experts say, to the Roman road system, but more remarkable for the rugged terrain it has traversed for more than 3,000 years.

title: At Beijing School, Some Parents Take a Sex Education Class
description: If life were a movie, the meeting of 50 mothers and a doctor would have been called Sex Ed 2: The Parents.

title: Gyms Add More Obstacles to Fitness Training
description: Steven Beckwith was desperate. A friend had convinced him to sign up for a Spartan Beast, a notoriously tough obstacle course race stretching more than 12 miles, and he knew lifting weights and running on a treadmill at his regular gym wouldnt prepare him to, say, spider-man across the flat face of a wall or climb a 20-foot rope.

title: Twitter Restores Access to Blasphemous Tweets in Pakistan
description: Pakistanis disappointed by Twitters decision last month to block content deemed blasphemous or unethical by their government expressed satisfaction when the company restored access to the blocked text and images early Wednesday.

title: Do Childrens Backyard Play Areas Turn Off Buyers?
description: Q. Will childrens outdoor play structures make the yard look junky to buyers?

title: William Maclays Road Map to Get Off the Grid
description: Books by architectural firms are often vainglorious marketing efforts that keep the content glossy and light. But an ambitious new book from William Maclay, an architect in Waitsfield, Vt., and his associates, challenges the genre.

title: Sales at Kikkerland, ABC Carpet & Home and MoMA Design Store
description: Some items are up to 65 percent off at Kikkerland, from Saturday through June 25 (a Mona Lisa wall clock by Constantin Boym, originally $35, will be $25; a Gator grater, $3.50, down from $10); 493 Sixth Avenue (West 12th Street), 212-262-5000, kikkerlandnyc.com.

title: Furnishing an Outdoor Room
description: After a longer and more-brutal winter than usual, many outdoor spaces are in need of a little sprucing up.

title: From Ma Bell to Design Central
description: Ameico, an importer of contemporary design, has turned an abandoned telephone exchange building in New Milford, Conn., into an unlikely showcase. The 1917 structure, which had been boarded up for two decades, has been renovated and filled with a retail shop, called 29 Church. It sells clocks and watches from Braun, flatware by Konstantin Grcic for Serafino Zani, and classic posters by Bruno Munari and Enzo Mari for Danese. Upstairs, shoppers will find furniture and lighting from &Tradition, Santa & Cole, Max Bill and the Josef Albers Foundation. The 6,000-square-foot complex includes a library stocked with books on industrial design and will be open to the public for research. Plans are afoot to host industrial design conferences and exhibitions. We have always felt that one of our missions is to educate consumers about what is good design, said Peter Kahane, Ameicos founder. Information: 888-350-8765 or ameico.com.

title: Breaking Free of Boundaries
description: Design Miami/Basel, a part of the semiannual Art Basel fair, opened on Tuesday in Switzerland with a new feature called Design at Large. Curated by Dennis Freedman, the creative director of Barneys New York, the program displays six large-scale installations stationed under an oculus. The works, a few of which have interactive or performance-based elements, arent intended to be commercial, Mr. Freedman said, adding, None of these pieces could ever have been shown in a booth. The group includes a tiny biomorphic plastic house, designed in 1965 by the French architect Jean Maneval, and Sheila Hickss interactive color lab, Sance, which consists of colorful fiber bundles that look like boulders Information: designmiami.com.

title: He Found His Corner of the Sky
description: As a boy growing up in Brooklyn Heights, Peter Heller was fascinated by the mythic West, in particular the cowboy novels of Louis LAmour. I remember the cover of this one LAmour book showed a guy on horseback, leading a pack horse across a creek in the snow, Mr. Heller, 55, said. Something about that cover  all I wanted to do was drift the high lonesome on horseback.

title: Mastering a Collision Course Called Home
description: By the time my son was 9 months old, I had fully baby-proofed our tiny Brooklyn walk-up. Cabinets containing toxic chemicals were locked. Doorknobs and stove dials had been disabled. All four corners of the coffee table were padded. Easy. Effective. The process of blind-proofing the apartment, for myself, was far more complicated.

title: Bringing Rio a Bit Closer
description: Cristiane Peixoto, a floral designer, and her husband, Marcus Silberman, an investment banker, are from Rio de Janeiro, and as Ms. Peixoto said, Life in Rio is all about being on the beach and outdoors. So when the couple bought an apartment for their family in Manhattan, they chose one with as much space outdoors as there is indoors.

title: Descend Into Giddiness
description: I think it would change our lives if we could slide more, said the Belgian artist Carsten Hller, who has been building slides on and off since 1998. The structures not only carry you efficiently from place to place, he believes, but they also create a special state of mind that, borrowing a phrase from the French sociologist Roger Caillois, he likes to describe as voluptuous panic. On Wednesday, Mr. Holler unveiled his first free-standing slide on the campus of the furniture company Vitra in Weil am Rhein, Germany. It is a steel spiral descending from a 100-foot-high tower with a platform that offers a rare elevated view of the architectural masterworks around it. (Among the neighbors are buildings by lvaro Siza, Tadao Ando and Zaha Hadid.) Topping the structure is a large, numberless clock that is positioned askew so that viewers must tilt their heads and guess the correct time. Mr. Holler prefers that idea to consulting a cellphone, a gesture that can be construed as rude. People think you could be checking your email, he said. Information: vitra.com.

title: What Good Taste Smells Like
description: Meredith Mellings duplex loft in NoHo features the polished decorating of Ariel Ashe  lots of neutrals with some standout pieces like a tufted royal-blue velvet sofa and a burl-wood-and-chrome dining table  set against its bleached wood floors and gutsy exposed beams and columns. Tying it all together is an invisible, but palpable, element: a sandalwood, vanilla and pepper fragrance, designed especially for Ms. Melling and her apartment, wafting from a sleek metal machine the size of a tablet hidden behind the blue sofa.

title: Another Blow to the Redskins Name
description: When it canceled the trademark on the Washington Redskins name on Wednesday, the Trademark Trial and Appeal Board ruled that the word was disparaging. But many came to that conclusion  and stopped using the name  a long time ago.

title: Assembly Is Not Required
description: Instead of trying to make sense of the dizzying array of boxes and shelving options at the Container Store, you can now hire somebody to figure it out for you. After successful runs in Texas, the company just started At Home in its two Manhattan locations. Twelve orderly professionals are ready to lend a hand, said Eva Gordon, vice president for stores. Theyll come to your home, look at your space to understand your style, assess your needs and come back with an organizational plan. The cost to get started is $50, which covers the visit and creation of the plan. The organizer recommends Container Store products to carry it out, and returns  at $50 an hour  to oversee the installation of shelving systems and the like, help with staging and styling, and even paint the space. Information: 855-827-4663 or containerstore.com/athome.

title: Aston Martin Racing to Explore Solar Technology
description: Aston Martin Racing announced last week that it would join with the Hong Kong-based Hanergy Global Solar Power & Applications Group to find ways to apply solar energy to racecars.

title: List of Potential Bitcoin Bidders Is Accidentally Released
description: A musician, a college professor and the head of public policy for Yelp could all bid on 30,000 Bitcoins being auctioned by United States Marshals Service this month, according to a list that was accidentally leaked by the office on Wednesday.

title: Bits of Brooklyn, Everywhere
description: For decades, the Brooklyn Academy of Music flourished comfortably at the edge of New Yorks cultural life. Residents of the borough found it a well-tended and accessible garden of sometimes exotic delights, while Manhattanites could congratulate themselves for their adventurousness, and for finding a taxi willing to take them across the East River.

title: SAC Capitals Deal With S.E.C. Gets Final Court Approval
description: The Securities and Exchange Commissions insider trading lawsuit against Steven A. Cohens former hedge fund SAC Capital Advisors is finally over.

title: Markit, a Big Financial Data Provider, Raises Nearly $1.3 Billion in I.P.O.
description: One of the most important names in the world of debt trading, Markit, is poised to join the public stock markets  and generate a payday for the banks that are both owners and customers of the financial data firm.

title: As the U.S. Ponders What to Do in Iraq
description: To the Editor:

title: How Amazon Measures Phone Success
description: Amazons new Fire phone might be less about the phone and more about what its computing power can do in a few years, when it is built into futuristic devices like Internet-connected contact lenses, as I wrote today on the Upshot.

title: Abdullah Elshamy Released From Prison
description: Abdullah Elshamy, an Al Jazeera correspondent who had been on a hunger strike for more than 100 days, was released late Tuesday from an Egyptian prison.

title: New York Citys Emergency Management Chief Resigns
description: Joseph F. Bruno, the commissioner of New York Citys Office of Emergency Management for a decade, has resigned, after remaining in office for several months at the request of Mayor Bill de Blasios aides.

title: The Gall of Dick Cheney
description: The situation in Iraq is truly worrisome, as militants threaten to tear the country asunder and disrupt the fragile, short-lived period absent all-out war there.

title: Popular at Easter, Peeps Candy Extends to the Quirky Holidays
description: PEEPS, the 61-year-old brand of marshmallow candies, is wildly popular for Easter, but the brand has struggled to expand beyond the holiday.

title: Battle Between Argentina and Hedge Funds Continues in New York
description: Updated, 8:46 p.m. | A fierce legal battle between Argentina and New York hedge funds took a new twist on Wednesday when the country offered to negotiate with the funds just hours after announcing measures that would help it avoid a settlement.

title: College to No Longer Consider Test Scores in Its Decisions
description: Hampshire College, in Amherst, Mass., said on Wednesday that it would no longer consider SAT or ACT scores in admissions or financial aid decisions. Meredith Twombly, the dean of admissions, said Hampshire had been test optional since it opened in 1970 but would become test blind, both for greater fairness and because Hampshire favors assessment through written work, projects and discussions, not test scores. Robert Schaeffer, public education director of FairTest, said Hampshire would be the only test-blind college: Sarah Lawrence College was test-blind for several years, but it reverted to test-optional two years ago after U.S. News and World Report stopped ranking it because of the lack of test scores.

title: 2 Million Tune In to See Hillary Rodham Clinton on Fox News
description: Apparently the Fox News audience was intensely interested in what Hillary Rodham Clinton had to say about her latest book.

title: J.K. Rowlings The Silkworm a Boon for Other Booksellers as Hachette and Amazon Brawl
description: Like any mystery novel expected to be a summer blockbuster, Robert Galbraiths The Silkworm, set for release on Thursday, features shadowy subtext and crafty machinations  but in this books case the maneuverings are both on and off the page.

title: What to Call Iraq Fighters? Experts Vary on Ss and Ls
description: Everyone seems to agree that the Sunni extremists who are striving to carve out a caliphate in Syria and Iraq have upended the region, but there is no consensus on what to call the militant group, in English at least.

title: An Answer on a Postcard
description: WASHINGTON  THIS year, more than 20 million college students will complete the dreaded 108-question Free Application for Federal Student Aid, commonly known as the Fafsa. Most do it again every year theyre in school. Some pay someone to help them. Colleges hire thousands of staff members to assist. Too many students are so intimidated by the form that they dont bother to apply.

title: The Not-So-Beautiful Game
description: ITS wonderful that America has fallen in love with World Cup soccer, as it plays out across the greenswards of Brazilian host cities like Natal, Manaus and Curitiba. To walk through New York City on Monday night and hear the restaurant crowds whooping at John Brookss late-game goal, which propelled the United States over Ghana, was to experience soccer as it is experienced in the rest of the world: collective, noisy and cathartic.

title: Leaders Words About Women Jolt Morocco
description: Prime Minister Abdelilah Benkirane of Morocco told Parliament this week that women would be better off at home than in the workplace, setting off alarm in a country that has seen slow but steady gains in womens rights.

title: Drones Kill 5 as Pakistan and U.S. Target Tribal Belt
description: PESHAWAR, Pakistan  An American drone strike killed at least five people in North Waziristan on Wednesday, Pakistani officials said, as the Pakistani military continued its offensive against militants in that tribal district.

title: Jeff Bezos Shows Off Amazon Fire Phone
description: Mr. Bezos, Amazons chief executive, demonstrated the companys new phone at a presentation on Wednesday.

title: Parity Could Be a Plus for the So-So Yankees
description: The Toronto Blue Jays hold first place in the American League East, but their grip on it is slipping. They have lost 8 of 11 games and, as usual, fell again to the Yankees in the Bronx on Wednesday. It was their 15th loss in a row at the new Yankee Stadium.

title: After 10 Months in Jail, Freed Egyptian Journalist Says, I Have Won
description: As my colleague David Kirkpatrick reported from Cairo on Monday, prosecutors decided to release a hunger-striking journalist, Abdullah Elshamy, because of his deteriorating health.

title: Pressure Grows in Hunt for Kidnapped Israelis
description: JERUSALEM  President Mahmoud Abbas of the Palestinian Authority on Wednesday denounced the abduction of three Israeli teenagers and vowed to help catch the kidnappers, as pressure mounted on him and threatened to collapse his fraying reconciliation pact with the militant Islamic movement Hamas.

title: Guantnamo Detainee Arraigned in Case That Could Help Decide Fate of Tribunals
description: FORT MEADE, Md.  An Iraqi detainee at Guantnamo Bay, Cuba, was arraigned Wednesday on war-crimes charges before a military commission, setting in motion a case that could help determine whether the tribunals system will be used extensively in the future or wither away after the handful of cases before it are completed.

title: Thomas B. Morgan, Writer, Editor and Lindsay Press Aide, Dies at 87
description: Thomas B. Morgan, who combined a knack for writing and passion for public affairs to shape a heterogeneous career that included being press secretary to Mayor John V. Lindsay of New York, editor of The Village Voice and chief of the citys broadcasting operations, died on Tuesday in Westmoreland, N.H. He was 87.

title: Dubai, Once a Humble Refueling Stop, Is Crossroad to the Globe
description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates  The gimmicks to attract attention and passengers  a $1 million raffle, a chance to win a Porsche 911, or a monthlong shopping festival  are still there but are hardly needed anymore. Travelers from around the world no longer need to be lured to this parched former trading post on the edge of the Persian Gulf.

title: TCI Hedge Fund in Britain Ends Ties to Charitable Arm
description: When Christopher Hohn, the founder of one of Britains largest and most successful hedge funds, chose to structure his fund to automatically donate a portion of its fees to charity  specifically his wifes charity  people took notice.

title: Governor Plans to Cut Ties to Common Core in Louisiana
description: Gov. Bobby Jindal of Louisiana said Wednesday that he would seek to end his states enactment of the Common Core educational guidelines and plans to administer a test tied to them, but other officials immediately said that the governor had overstepped his authority and vowed to resist his moves.

title: Was This Student Dangerous?
description: The undergraduate who had been writing poems about killing people showed up for his appointment in my office carrying a black canvas backpack. He was slim and dark-haired, his mouth torqued into an uneasy smile. I had spoken several times about his violent ramblings to the campus police and to the universitys office of mental health, and this was what they came up with: I should invite the student to my office and calmly begin a conversation with the following question: Do you have a plan to harm yourself or anyone else?

title: John Devens, Valdez Mayor During Exxon Spill, Dies at 74
description: John Devens, whose tenure as the mayor of an obscure coastal town in Alaska was rocked by a stunning disaster on its shores  the wreck of the Exxon Valdez oil tanker in Prince William Sound  died last week at his home in Copper Center, Alaska. He was 74.

title: Up in Arms Over Soccer vs. Football
description: The letter writer was incensed, as so many people so often are, by Americas insistence on using its own special word to describe the game that almost everyone else calls football.

title: Should Restaurant Reservations Be for Sale?
Espaillat for Congress
description: After a humiliating censure by Congress four years ago for failing to pay taxes and other ethical lapses, Representative Charles Rangel has steadily lost power in Washington. After nearly 44 years in office, it is now time for him to yield to the next generation. In Tuesdays Democratic primary for New Yorks 13th Congressional District, we recommend Adriano Espaillat, a New York State senator, who will be a better representative of this district stretching from Upper Manhattan into parts of the Bronx.

title: Guns at the Airport
description: On June 4, a 32-year-old woman tried to get through security at San Antonio International Airport with a loaded .380 caliber Diamondback in her carry-on bag. This wasnt a freak occurrence. Transportation Security Administration officials intercepted 18 guns on that day alone  a single-day record in what looks to be a record-setting year. The T.S.A. found 1,320 guns in 2011, 1,556 in 2012, 1,813 in 2013  and has found roughly 900 so far in 2014.

title: Mighty Spain Goes Out of the World Cup Meekly
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  The chants at the game between Spain and Chile began slowly, first from one side of Estdio do Maracan, then from the other. By the time the final minutes had ticked off the clock Wednesday, tens of thousands of fans had joined in.

title: Maine Court Fight Pits Farmers Against State and One Another
description: BLUE HILL, Me.  When Dan Brown quit his job driving trucks and began to work on his wifes family homestead here about a decade ago, he was looking forward to a quiet life of farming. He began raising chickens and growing vegetables, and watched happily as a calf named Sprocket thrived. The Browns built a farm stand and began selling unpasteurized milk and eventually other products, like jam and salsa.

title: Amazon Fire Phones Missed Opportunities
description: SEATTLE  When Amazon invited the media and hundreds of its most loyal customers to witness the unveiling of a new device on Wednesday, everyone thought the company would introduce a smartphone made in the mold of its line of tablet computers: pretty good and really cheap.

title: This Isnt About Farmer Brown Anymore
description: Dan Brown is a Maine farmer who was sued by the state for selling milk without a license. On Tuesday, Mr. Brown lost an appeal he had made to the states highest court.

title: Courting Swing Vote in Harlem District: Whites
description: There was never a question that race would play a key role in Representative Charles B. Rangels re-election fight, a battle for a seat held by two black men since the 1940s, in a district where Hispanics recently became the majority.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for June 18, 2014
Ko Adds Another Weapon to Her Bag
description: PINEHURST, N.C.  Keeping up with the 17-year-old Lydia Ko has been a chore for the sexagenarian caddie Mike Cowan. After a nine-hole practice round on Wednesday in extreme heat, Cowan fell a few paces behind when he stopped to pose with another caddie who requested to have a photo taken with him.

title: Former Envoy Pipes Up in Conservative Chorus of Told You So on Iraq
description: WASHINGTON  The only thing that John R. Bolton has tamed is his mustache.

title: A King Refuses to Abdicate His Throne
description: It is a shirt-sticking-to-your-back 88 degrees along Gun Hill Road in the Bronx, and a few dozen union workers at Montefiore Medical Center have waited through their lunch hour and they are wilting.

title: Uneasy Alliance Gives Insurgents an Edge in Iraq
description: ERBIL, Iraq  Meeting with the American ambassador some years ago in Baghdad, Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki detailed what he believed was the latest threat of a coup orchestrated by former officers of Saddam Husseins Baath Party.

title: General Motors Receives Welcome News in Automotive Survey
description: DETROIT  While General Motors was under fire in Washington at a House hearing over its failure to recall defective cars, the automaker received some welcome news at home on Wednesday with a strong showing in the annual J.D. Power quality survey of new vehicles.

title: State Pressing Lopez to Pay Ethics Fine
description: The office of Attorney General Eric T. Schneiderman said on Wednesday that it would seek payment of $330,000 from former State Assemblyman Vito J. Lopez after he failed to pay a fine from a sexual harassment scandal that doomed his political career.

title: N.C.A.A. President Will Get His Say at Antitrust Trial
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  Sonny Vaccaro was here early on June 9, the opening morning of the Ed OBannon trial. A long line snaked out of the federal courthouse, but Vaccaro, 74, had flown in from Palm Springs, Calif., with his wife the night before. He was at the front.

title: Border Centers Struggle to Handle Onslaught of Young Migrants
description: NOGALES, Ariz.  In a 120,000-square-foot warehouse on the edge of this desert city, Border Patrol agents line up hundreds of children who may have never seen a doctor for basic vaccinations and other medical care, hand out snacks or join them for a game of basketball under a circuslike tent that doubles as a recreation room.

title: Mitt! Again! What?
description: Mitt Romney is back.

title: Decades Later, 17 Service Members Who Perished in Crash Will Be Laid to Rest
description: For more than six decades, a tombstone at the Sunnyside Cemetery in Caney, Kan., has marked Pvt. Leonard Kittles final resting place. On Saturday, he will at last be buried there as his family looks on.

title: Conflict in Iraq Adds New Angle to U.S.-Iran Nuclear Talks
description: VIENNA  The Iranian leadership had a message for Washington on Wednesday: If President Obama really wants some cooperation on stabilizing Iraq, he might first think about speeding forward with a permanent deal over Irans nuclear capability.

title: An Unusual Media Start-Up: A Local Newspaper
description: Kevin Boyle has done two stints as editor of The Wave, a 120-year-old weekly newspaper in the Rockaways that has long been a source of local news in its seaside Queens neighborhood.

title: On Iraq, Echoes of 2003
description: Is this 2014 or 2003?

title: New York Legislature Reaches Deal on More Laws to Fight Heroin Problem
description: For the second time in two weeks, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo gathered reporters on Wednesday to make an announcement about the states heroin problem, which has dominated discussions at the close of the legislative session in Albany. Last week, flanked by law enforcement officers, the governor was behind a lectern emblazoned with the words Heroin Epidemic.

title: Mormons Say Critical Online Comments Draw Threats From Church
description: Rock Waterman, a retired innkeeper in California, writes a blog called Pure Mormonism, which attracts Mormons so orthodox that they believe their church is not sufficiently adhering to its own doctrines.

title: Mentally Pooped
description: THURSDAYS PUZZLE  Im not sure if Ive ever seen a 15 x 16 crossword puzzle with 20-plus theme entries, but we have one today, and you really have to admire the sneaky way Timothy Polin got them in there. Instead of a set of a few long entries, he and Will Shortz have clued many of the shorter entries as trivia questions.

title: As Moderate Islamists Retreat, Extremists Surge Unchecked
description: TUNIS  Islamist politicians swept elections across the region in the aftermath of the Arab Spring, stepping close to power in Tunisia, Egypt, Libya and Morocco and undermining the thesis of Qaeda-style militants that violence offered the only hope for change.

title: T-Mobile Offers iPhone Tests and Unlimited Music Streaming
description: T-Mobile US, the fourth-largest American phone carrier, has spent the last year and a half introducing aggressive new offerings to lure customers. Late Wednesday, the company said it would add to those offerings with unlimited streaming music and the ability to test-drive an iPhone.

title: Family of Framed Man Sues City and Police
description: The family of a man wrongfully convicted in Brooklyn has sued the city and police officers, asking for $15 million  even though the man, David Ranta, had already reached a settlement with the city.

title: The Cost to Change the Redskins Name
description: With the Washington Redskins trademark now canceled, a look at the costs in both keeping and changing the teams name.

title: Hats Off
Horace Silver, 85, Master of Earthy Jazz, Is Dead
description: Horace Silver, a pianist, composer and bandleader who was one of the most popular and influential jazz musicians of the 1950s and 60s, died on Wednesday at his home in New Rochelle, N.Y. He was 85.

title: Slurs Dont Deserve Trademark Protection
description: There is no question that the term redskin has been used as a racial slur for American Indians for hundreds of years and is on par with offensive terms used to denigrate blacks and Hispanics. And it is also clear that federal law prohibits the Patent and Trademark Office from registering trademarks that disparage people or bring them into contempt, or disrepute.

title: Roaring on the Seas
description: Few aspects of Chinas dynamic emergence as a global power have generated as much insecurity and danger in its neighborhood as its mounting campaign to control the South China Sea, a vital waterway for international commerce. On Wednesday, at a high-level meeting in Hanoi, Chinas top diplomat scolded his Vietnamese hosts for complaining about an oil rig that Beijing planted in early May in waters that Vietnam claims, as its own.

title: Mexico: Governor of Michoacn Resigns
description: The governor of Michoacn, one of the countrys most violent states, where people have taken up arms to fight drug and organized crime gangs, has resigned because of poor health. The resignation on Wednesday of the governor, Fausto Vallejo, 65, injects political uncertainty in a state where officials failure to quell surging violence, giving rise to vigilante groups, led the federal government to take over security this year. Mr. Vallejo, whose four-year term expires in 2016, did not disclose his health problem, but he underwent a liver transplant last year. He returned Tuesday night from a checkup in the United States and informed President Enrique Pea Nieto of his decision Wednesday morning. The State Legislature will choose a successor to serve the remainder of the term.

title: Stuart Vaughan, Director and Shakespeare Expert, Dies at 88
description: Stuart Vaughan, who directed the first productions of the New York Shakespeare Festival and later seeded several regions of the country with classic works, starting repertory theaters in Seattle and New Orleans and another that toured community centers and colleges, died on June 10 at his home in High Bridge, N.J. He was 88.

title: A Struggling McCann Shows Some of the Pop He Was Signed to Provide
description: Much of the Yankees attention this season has been on their injury-ravaged rotation, their aging lineup and Derek Jeters retirement tour. There has hardly been time to worry about catcher Brian McCann, stuck in a slump after signing a five-year, $85 million contract in the off-season.

title: Battle Cries
description: The worlds best soccer players bring their own unique style to the game. So it is only fitting that the commentators react in kind  calling a goal with passion and personality.

title: U.S. Asserts Self-Defense in Benghazi Suspect Case
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration has told the United Nations that Ahmed Abu Khattala, the suspected ringleader of the 2012 attack on the American Consulate in Benghazi, Libya, was plotting additional attacks on Americans and that the United States conducted the weekend raid that seized him under its right to self-defense.

title: Olivia Bees Personal Images of Her Teenage Years
description: In this weekly series, Ts photo editors share the most compelling visual projects theyve discovered.

title: Who Can Speak for the Patient?
description: Our patient was never going to wake up. He had an unrecoverable brain injury. The prognosis had become clear over time. As the patients attending physician in the intensive care unit, I arranged a meeting with his sister, the only visitor wed seen for days, and explained. She was resolute. Hell wake up, she said. Hes a fighter. Do everything you can to keep him alive.

title: Smartphones Embracing Kill Switches as Theft Defense
description: By next summer, most new smartphones may no longer be quite so attractive to thieves.

title: Citigroup Names Head of Corporate and Investment Banking for Asia-Pacific Region
description: HONG KONG  Citigroup on Thursday appointed Mark Slaughter, a senior New York banker, as its head of corporate and investment banking for Asia-Pacific, filling a vacancy created last month when Farhan Faruqui left to join the Australia and New Zealand Banking Group.

title: Word of the Day | rampart
description: rampart \ram-prt, -prt\ noun

title: Indian Nurses in Iraqi Hospital Wait for Violence to Subside
description: Forty-six nurses from the southern Indian state of Kerala are secluded in a hospital in Tikrit, the Iraqi city that was captured by extremists on June 11, unable to leave amid the violence and chaos that have gripped the country.

title: Corrections: June 19, 2014
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Quotation of the Day for Thursday, June 19, 2014
description: These are unparalleled crimes that have no statute of limitations.

title: Tibetan Security Official Gunned Down in Sichuan
description: A Tibetan security official was shot and killed last week in western Sichuan Province as he was returning from policing the lucrative harvest of caterpillar fungus used in Chinese medicine, the state news media reported Thursday.

title: China Sentences Three Activists
description: BEIJING  Three activists in China who had demanded that public officials disclose their assets were sentenced on Thursday to prison, according to one of their lawyers and a daughter of one of the defendants.

title: The Slumdog Millionaire Architect
description: The offices of Hafeez Contractor, Indias most commercially successful architect, are on Bank Street, just around the corner from the Mumbai Stock Exchange. The prestige of the address, however, is undermined by the beleaguered state of the Raj-era building. In the reception area, a flat-screen displaying a loop of Contractors futuristic projects is mounted on a cracked, stained plaster wall. Upstairs, hundreds of designers sit shoulder to shoulder at long rows of computer monitors, packed in almost as mercilessly as on the commuter trains that ferry them to work each day. The office has struggled to keep up with the firms expanding work force and is perpetually under construction. Staff members were known to walk 15 minutes to the five-star Taj Mahal Palace Hotel rather than brave the employee-restroom line. Contractor has vastly increased his square footage by building a loft, but a day at the office now entails ducking through archways, dodging stray wires and ignoring the wail of power saws.

title: Student Crossword | Fairy Tales
description: Test your knowledge of fairy tales by playing our crossword (PDF). You can find the answers here.

title: Anticorruption Activist Sentenced to More Than 6 Years in Prison
description: Two years ago, Liu Ping, one of three anticorruption activists sentenced on Thursday to prison terms of up to six and a half years, said she wanted to change China one vote at a time.

title: Man Group to Buy Numeric Holdings of Boston
description: LONDON  The British hedge fund manager Man Group said on Thursday that it had agreed to acquire Numeric Holdings, an investment manager based in Boston, for up to $494 million.

title: 6 Qs About the News | The Fight Over the New Common Core Standards
description: This 6 Qs About the News is based on the above video, The Fight Over New Standards, produced by Reem Makhoul, that accompanies the article Common Core, in 9-Year-Old Eyes by Javier C. Hernndez. Feel free to pause the video as needed to help you answer the questions below.

title: Pulling Back the Veil, or Keeping It On
description: Boushra Almutawakel comes from a conservative, well-known family in Yemen. So when she was unable to find Yemini women who would pose for her series on the hijab, she and her daughter sat for the camera despite her apprehension.

title: Hypoglycemia Rising in Older People With Diabetes
description: Most of the time, the older woman seemed sharp. But increasingly, she became confused and disoriented  a case of intermittent dementia, one doctor speculated. Further tests were ordered, and then another diagnosis emerged.

title: Facebook Service Restored After Worldwide Cutoff
description: [ Updated, to include a statement from an analyst, as well as context of a previously notable Facebook failure. ]

title: New York Today: What Not to Do
description: Good Thursday morning to you.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Welcome to the Morning Briefing on NYT Now.

title: A Chorus of Goooooool, the Siren Song of Soccer
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Having caught his first big break on radio 50 years ago, Jos Carlos Arajo, who had honed his sportscasting skills by calling button soccer games in a neighbors backyard, figured he would have to tame his changing voice to avoid losing his pitch halfway through the effusively long cries of goooooool that are the hallmark and necessity of a Brazilian play-by-play announcers routine.

title: Morning Views
description: On June 4, a 32-year-old woman tried to get through security at San Antonio International Airport with a loaded .380 caliber Diamondback in her carry-on bag, The New York Times reports. This wasnt a freak occurrence. Transportation Security Administration officials intercepted 18 guns on that day alone  a single-day record in what looks to be a record-setting year. The editorial calls on state governments to introduce measures that would make any attempt to bring a firearm into an airport a felony. Unless states decide to classify bringing a gun into security as a felony, though, forgetful people will almost certainly continue to have the right to own, carry and misplace firearms because basic responsibility hasnt been made a prerequisite for gun ownership.

title: In New York, on the Hunt for Characters
description: Sara Ashley OBrien and Kimberly Ammiano, students at the Columbia University Graduate School of Journalism, followed Metropolitan reporter Corey Kilgannon as he interviewed people for his weekly Character Study column.

title: Keeping a Cash-Starved Start-Up on Track
description: In a start-up, theres always too much to do and not enough time or money to do it. There are never enough people to fix whats broken and never enough resources to develop the next strategic phase. For the first 12 months of Posse, I felt as if I was swimming as hard as I could, trying to avoid drowning. But I knew that if we were going to succeed I had to develop a rhythm to our development.

title: In Our Pages: June 20
description: 1939: Normandie Arrives Late

title: Opponents of Hong Kongs Occupy Central Envision Chaos
description: A group opposed to the Occupy Central movement, which has threatened protests in Hong Kongs Central financial district to press its case for electoral reform, has released a video saying such protests would create widespread traffic congestion that would leave the city dangerously mired in gridlock.

title: Iraqi Officials Claim Control of Major Refinery in Baiji
description: BAGHDAD  Iraqi government officials claimed on Thursday that Sunni militants had retreated from a major refinery in Baiji after intense fighting for more than two days, but it was still unclear who was in control and the facility remained shut down.

title: Spanish Soccer Teams Elimination Casts Pall Over New Kings Arrival
description: MADRID  It seemed unfair. The Catalans are threatening to break the country apart. Economically speaking, the patient is stable, but still in fragile health.

title: Why Were All Crony Capitalists, Like It or Not
description: If theres one thing that populists on the left and right can agree upon, it is disdain for crony capitalism. It is a distaste for the cesspool of Washington influence, in which big-business lobbyists canoodle with lawmakers to get their way. It is anger at corporate welfare enriching Americas biggest companies at the expense of the little guy.

title: A Somewhat Less Rebellious Rebel
description: Suddenly, Dave Chappelle, the great disappearing man of comedy, is everywhere.

title: In Germany, Ordeal Ends for Physicist Hurt in Cave
description: BERCHTESGADEN, Germany  Johann Westhauser, a 52-year-old physicist who was struck in the head by a rock 3,766 feet below the surface in Germanys deepest cavern on June 8, had only one wish as he was finally hoisted to the surface on Thursday  to personally thank all 728 people responsible for his rescue.

title: Polish Premier Says Scandal May Prompt Early Vote
description: Prime Minister Donald Tusk of Poland warned Thursday that he might be forced to call early elections if a scandal over secretly taped conversations of senior government officials continued to escalate.

title: Can Amazons New Phone Make It as a Fashion Accessory?
description: In all the hoo-ha around Amazons entry into the smartphone market Wednesday with its Fire phone, complete with 3D screen and the ability to drive users to the Amazon marketplace, one pretty important issue has been overlooked: Will it work as a fashion accessory?

title: Morning Agenda: Detroits New Pension Plan
description: In the face of Detroits tumultuous bankruptcy proceedings, the city and its unions have quietly negotiated a scaled-back pension plan that could serve as a model for other troubled governments, Mary Williams Walsh writes in DealBook. One of the most closely watched issues of the case is whether government pensions can be legally cut in bankruptcy. Now, Detroit has introduced a new plan with the cooperation of its unions, which have been among the most vocal opponents of cutbacks.

title: BlackBerrys Earnings Point to Signs of Stabilizing
description: OTTAWA  For BlackBerry, the smartphone company recently known for producing relentlessly grim financial results, the announcement on Thursday of a smaller-than-expected quarterly loss counts as good news. Although BlackBerrys management stopped well short of declaring a turnaround, the results suggested that severe cost-cutting and efforts to refocus the company might be at least stabilizing it.

title: Daily Report: Missed Opportunities With Amazons Fire Phone
description: When Amazon invited the media and hundreds of its most loyal customers to Seattle to witness the unveiling of a new device on Wednesday, everyone thought the company would introduce a smartphone made in the mold of its line of tablet computers: pretty good and really cheap.

title: First Data to Raise $3.5 Billion to Reduce Debt
description: The First Data Corporation, a payment processing company owned by the private equity firm Kohlberg Kravis Roberts, said on Thursday that it would raise $3.5 billion in a private sale of its stock.

title: As Military and Rebels Clash in Ukraine, Doubt Falls on Cease-Fire Prospects
description: SEVERSK, Ukraine  Fierce fighting raged here on Thursday between the Ukrainian military and pro-Russian separatist rebels, with hours of intense shelling casting grave doubts on the prospects of a unilateral cease-fire that was promised just a day earlier by the new Ukrainian president, Petro O. Poroshenko.

title: Mozilla to Develop Comments Platform With New York Times and Washington Post
description: The New York Times and The Washington Post announced on Thursday that they had teamed up with Mozilla to develop a new platform to better manage their readers online comments and contributions.

title: Jeremy Paxman Ends Run at Newsnight
description: After 25 years on the BBC, Jeremy Paxman presented his final edition of Newsnight on Wednesday.

title: A Grammar Lesson for the M.T.A.
description: Dear Diary:

title: For Dov Charney of American Apparel, an Abrupt Fall From Grace
description: Dov Charney was no ones idea of a button-down executive.

title: Q. and A. | Max Silvestri, Funnyman and Foodie
description: Is Brooklyn the epicenter of new comedy? To make such a claim would be to bait Internet controversy. But its safe to say that in 2008 a very good and very influential weekly comedy show, Big Terrific  hosted by Jenny Slate, Gabe Liedman and Max Silvestri  began on Wednesday nights in Williamsburg, eventually settling at Cameo gallery. Since then, its become a destination for pros to work out new material (famous names like Aziz Ansari, Zach Galifianakis, John Mulaney and Sarah Silverman have been known to drop by) and for up-and-comers to earn their stripes.

title: Analysts Say China May Try to Use Manmade Islands to Bolster Bid for Economic Development
description: China has been moving sand onto some reefs and rocks in the Spratly archipelago of the South China Sea to create islands that can support buildings, equipment and human habitation. The construction is stirring anxiety in the Philippines and Vietnam, which compete with China over territorial claims in the Spratly Islands, and raising alarms in the United States, which sees Chinas actions in the South China Sea as destabilizing.

title: Rouhani Vows to Protect Shiite Shrines
description: Speaking on Iranian television, President Hassan Rouhani said Tehran would defend Shiite holy sites in Iraq.

title: World Cup 2014: Colombia Defeats Ivory Coast, 2-1
description: Colombia came out on top in a rollicking game in Brasilia on Thursday, defeating Ivory Coast, 2-1, and almost certainly clinching a spot in the next round.

title: World Cup 2014: Uruguay Defeats England, 2-1
description: Luis Suarez scored twice for Uruguay, including the game-winning goal in the 84th minute, in a 2-1 victory against England, who is all but mathematically eliminated now.

title: World Cup 2014: Greece and Japan Play to a 0-0 Draw
description: Both teams both desperately needed a victory, but neither could score a goal on Thursday.

title: China Uses House of Cards as Illustration of Wests Corruption
description: Money, sex, power and scandal. Netflixs political thriller House of Cards, about a ruthlessly ambitious American politician, has drawn millions of Chinese viewers with these themes, which are largely prohibited on state television.

title: How Do You Take the Measure of a School Year?
description: As the school year draws to a close, teachers and parents are left wondering how to take its measure, to identify their successes, failures and lessons learned. For those who follow education news, 2013-14 has been The Year of Big Data, and conclusions from recently published studies and surveys have been released in the media like so many rubber balls from a dump truck. The resulting bouncy chaos has been difficult to subdue, let alone organize and interpret.

title: Colum McCann: By the Book
description: The author of TransAtlantic and Let the Great World Spin says choosing a favorite living novelist is like walking the plank: Inevitably you end up drowning, but at least its in a sea of heroes.

title: A Holy Space in More Ways Than One
description: Since 1964, a former Sunday school classroom on the second floor of St. Marks Church in the East Village has housed a theater. To find it, walk through a rusty gate, past a graveyard, up a narrow flight of stairs, across a cramped lobby and into new worlds.

title: Ed Sheeran, Lighter and Wiser, Releases x
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  Seven hours before Ed Sheeran was scheduled to perform at a taping of the show Austin City Limits here this month, three young women were sitting on a red blanket on the sidewalk outside the studio, braving 97-degree heat in hope of getting a ticket. Usual pop idol stuff.

title: 5 Things to Do This Weekend: Chapelles Shows, Plus Last Chance to See
description: Updated, 5:43 p.m. |

title: Brother of Aide to Former Chinese Leader Comes Under Investigation
description: The brother of a top aide to Hu Jintao, the former Chinese president, has been put under investigation by the ruling Communist Party, its internal discipline agency said on Thursday.

title: Women on the Board: Quotas Have Limited Success
description: This article appeared in June, but we resurfaced it because the German parliament on Friday, March 6, passed a law that mandates giving 30 percent of supervisory board seats in some of Europes biggest companies to women starting next year.

title: Wall Streets Reputation Still Badly Scarred by Financial Crisis, Executives Say
description: Wall Street companies blame new regulations and riskier markets for the slow recovery of the financial industrys reputation, according to a new report.

title: Richard Linklaters Leading Boy
description: In his new film, Boyhood, the director Richard Linklater takes a novel approach to the classic coming-of-age story  one thats both strikingly radical and entirely logical. Filmed in short installments over a period of 12 years, Boyhood details the journey from boyhood to adolescence of one Mason Jr., played by Ellar Coltrane, above, who blossoms on screen before our eyes from a pensive, tentative 6-year-old to a sensitive, freethinking young man of 18.

title: An End to Evenings on Tiptoe
description: The original plan Jeff Bobula and Caitlin Mennen-Bobula had was to buy a multifamily Brooklyn brownstone.

title: Challengers Emerge to Replace Divisive Maliki
description: BAGHDAD  Iraqi officials said Thursday that political leaders had started intensive jockeying to replace Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki and create a government that would span the countrys deepening sectarian and ethnic divisions, spurred by what they called encouraging meetings with American officials signaling support for a leadership change.

title: Threes a Trend | Striped Knits on the London Runways
description: Instead of the now ubiquitous nautical stripes, designers at the spring/summer 2015 London mens shows presented variegated striped knits in retro colorways, with a 70s-by-way-of-the-90s feeling. Theyre the kind of sweaters that the Blur frontman Damon Albarn might have worn circa Parklife, or Harmony Korine might have slipped into while he was writing Kids. At Topman, a mockneck was paired with bell bottoms (and alternately layered under a short-sleeve daisy-printed shirt). Pringle of Scotland offered a tailored version of the retro golf sweater, worn with suit pants. Meanwhile, continuing his exploration of gender boundaries, J.W. Anderson presented the throwback striped look in the form of a knotted boatneck.

title: Shares of Markit, a Financial Data Provider, Rise on Debut
description: Updated, 5:37 p.m. |

title: Why Did Amazon Make a Phone? A Conversation With Jeff Bezos
description: Shortly after he introduced the new Fire phone on Wednesday, I spoke with Jeff Bezos, Amazons founder and chief executive, about the device and Amazons goals in the smartphone business.

title: When Getting Laughs Annoys the Neighbors
description: THIS is the kind of show youre really going to appreciate if comedy is ever illegal, the comedian Sam Morril said, looking around a small basement in Williamsburg, Brooklyn. It was a rainy night, and about three dozen people were gathered in the downstairs of a duplex for Live @ the Apt, a regular stand-up show held in the home of its producers. Its a very Prohibition-era vibe, Mr. Morril added.

title: Colombia vs. Ivory Coast: World Cup 2014 Live Blog
description: Colombia came out on top in a rollicking game in Brasilia on Thursday, defeating Ivory Coast, 2-1, and almost certainly clinching a spot in the next round.

title: U.S. to Send Up to 300 Military Advisers to Iraq
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama said Thursday that he would deploy up to 300 military advisers to Iraq to help its struggling security forces fend off a wave of Sunni militants who have overrun large parts of the country, edging the United States back into a conflict that Mr. Obama once thought he had left behind.

title: 40 Indian Workers Kidnapped in Iraq Are Said to Have Been  Located
description: NEW DELHI  After an hours-long journey in a private bus from villages near the city of Amritsar, in Punjab State, the families of 13 of the 40 construction workers whom the Indian government announced had been kidnapped in the northern Iraqi city of Mosul arrived at the Gurdwara Rakab Ganj, a centuries-old Sikh shrine, on Thursday afternoon.

title: Astronomers Hedge on Big Bang Detection Claim
description: A group of astronomers who announced in March that they had detected space-time disturbances  gravitational waves  from the beginning of the Big Bang reaffirmed their claim on Thursday but conceded that dust from the Milky Way galaxy might have interfered with their observations.

title: G.E. Revises Bid for Alstom Business in Effort to Win French Support
description: Updated, 8:53 p.m. |

title: Memorial Concert Scheduled for Bitter End Owner
description: Friends of Paul Colby, the owner of the Bitter End folk club, will pay tribute to Mr. Colby, who died at 96 in February, in a memorial concert at the club on Monday evening. Among those scheduled to perform are Peter Yarrow, Eric Andersen, Josh White Jr., Tom Chapin, Ronee Blakley, Guy Davis and Aztec Two Step.

title: Today in Small Business: Why Traditional Retailers Should Fear the Amazon Phone
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today:

title: The Unsettled Politics of Foreign Policy
description: The conventional wisdom, such as it is, on the political impact of events in Iraq, Ukraine and elsewhere seems to be that they will empower the Republican Partys hawkish establishment at the expense of the partys libertarian/anti-interventionist wing strengthening the hawks critique of the Obama White House,bringing Bush-era voices back to the fore, and throwing new obstacles in Rand Pauls already-difficult path to the nomination. And when you combine this scenario with Hillary Clintons none-too-subtlepositioning of herselfas a more interventionist figure than the current president, you have the possibility of the return of a kind of 2004-style hawkish center in American presidential politics, in which both Clinton and her eventual G.O.P. rival (be it a Cruz, a Rubio, a Bush, a Christie, whomever) would compete to out-tough the other on terrorism, Syria, Iran, ISIS, Putin, and so forth.

title: Chelsea Handler Will Host a Late-Night Talk Show on Netflix
description: A late-night talk show on Netflix? That is what the company announced on Thursday as part of a deal with Chelsea Handler, the soon-to-exit star from the E! cable network.

title: Amazon Phone May Be a Tough Sell in Europe  When It Arrives
description: LONDON  People outside the United States hoping to get their hands on Amazons new smartphone will have to wait awhile.

title: Ruling on Argentina Gives Investors an Upper Hand
description: Hard cases, it has often been said, make bad law.

title: French Summer Castles in the Sand
description: Every spring, French campers stake out a stretch of shoreline where they can still build makeshift beach houses that sustain a community of thousands through the summer.

title: Justices Deny Patent to Business Methods
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court unanimously ruled on Thursday that basic business methods may not be patented, even if computers are used to apply them.

title: Raise Minimum Wage Past $10? Been Here Before
description: The Times has converted all of its 1964 issues into a digitized, searchable format. Each week, The Upshot will unearth an item from 50 years ago and put it in the light of today. $1.50 Wage Drive Is Opened in City appeared on June 19 and can be seen in its original format on TimesMachine.

title: Price of a Tony Wont Go Up for Prize Winners
description: Despite criticism and concerns raised by some theater artists, medallion-topped Tony Awards went on sale once again this week, for $2,500 to producers and investors who put significant sums of money into Tony-winning Broadway shows.

title: Drawing a Line Between Art and Abuse
description: Is Terry Richardson an Artist or a Predator? asks the headline of a recent New York Magazine profile of the fashion photographer. That question is getting nearly as much discussion as the article itself. Many argue that Mr. Richardson is able to get away with predatory behavior precisely because hes a male artist in a society that valorizes them.

title: In Push to Assert Rights, China Plans to Send 2nd Oil Rig to Waters Near Vietnam
description: HANOI, Vietnam  The day after tough talks between Vietnam and China that made no progress over a Chinese oil rig in the South China Sea, the Chinese government said Thursday it was sending a second rig to waters close to Vietnam.

title: Pursuing the Muse Against the Clock
description: Jan. 16, 1997, Eastern Standard Time.

title: 1907: Television, Imagined
description: This feature looks at the first time famous names or terms appeared in The Times. Have an idea for someone or something you would like to read about? Send a suggestion in the comments section.

title: Swiss Yodeling Festival Hits the High Notes
description: The centuries-old folk tradition of yodeling will get a showcase in the Swiss mountain village of Davos, which will host the 29th Jodlerfest from July 3 to 6.

title: Chances Lost in Dispute Over Opera
description: For an opera about such a horrific incident  the 1985 killing of a disabled Jewish American who was vacationing with his wife aboard the Achille Lauro cruise ship when Palestinian hijackers shot him in his wheelchair and threw him off the deck  The Death of Klinghoffer begins like a passion oratorio.

title: Nick Woosters Style
description: The many looks of Mr. Wooster.

title: Louisianan Extends His Rapid Rise in the House G.O.P.
description: WASHINGTON  Representative Steve Scalises victory in the race to become the No. 3 Republican in the House caps a rapid rise through his partys ranks since he won his seat in a special election in 2008.

title: No Comment Necessary: Brian Schweitzer on Effeminate Southern Men
description: Brian Schweitzer, the former Democratic governor of Montana, didnt mince words in an interview with the National Journal.

title: Clip: Jersey Boys
description: A scene from the film directed by Clint Eastwood.

title: That Monkey on Your Shoulder Isnt Mine
description: This interview with  Are Traasdahl, the chief executive of the advertising firm Tapad, was conducted and condensed by  Adam Bryant.

title: Youre Just Too Good to Be True
description: At the end of Jersey Boys, Clint Eastwoods likable, resolutely laid-back adaptation of the Broadway musical, the actors all freeze. Theyve just performed their last song on a set that looks so artificial that you half-expect the Sharks and the Jets to leap into the frame. Instead, that Jersey music man Frankie Valli and the other Seasons, along with a crowd of central-casting types, gather one last time and together warble and fancy-foot down a back-lot street. They finish big and then they all stop, staring straight ahead as sweat pops and bodies tremble under the now harsh lighting. Thats entertainment, baby, and it is hard work.

title: Image of the Day: June 19
Listen Up | A New Indie Label With an Old Soul
description: Few record label bosses have the distinction of also being their own first signee. But thats the case with the British soul artist Christian Gregory, who started Movement Records in London last year as a platform for emerging soul artists in the U.K. There were a few labels doing kind of throwback stuff, he says, but none that really cater to soul as an art form in itself. The child of classical musicians, Gregory started looking for his own musical direction at an early age. My parents record collection is mostly orchestral stuff, so I would hunt through and look for anything that was different, he says. The closest thing I could usually find was either jazz or swing. By his teens, his love for soul had taken hold.

title: Nick Wooster, One-Man Brand
description: FLORENCE, Italy  He is an Instagram idol, an object of veneration across social media platforms, the sole focus of blogs consecrated to charting his individual style. That style, which the fashion retailer and savant Nickelson Wooster spent decades retooling, has lately become influential enough in the age of image obsession that a cadre of street photographers tracks him wherever he goes.

title: Nick Woosters List of Five
description: Nickelson Wooster is a retailer, street style hero and brand ambassador for the Lardini Group. Here are his answers to his five most recent purchases, which designers are on his radar and what are his go to-items.

title: When We Were Young and Unafraid
description: Cherry Jones and Zoe Kazan in a scene from Sarah Treems new play at City Center Stage 1.

title: Wedding Q. & A.
description: Doing the Right Thing

title: Most Latino Workers Born in U.S., Study Says
description: Immigrants no longer make up the majority of Latino workers in the United States, according to a report released Thursday by the Pew Research Center.

title: Checker Cabs Return to Gotham
description: It is yellow and very boxy. It weighs two tons. It has a tanklike suspension and durability. It has folding jump seats. It has not regularly been driven on the streets of major cities in more than a decade, but it is still beloved.

title: Felipe VI Swears an Oath to Spain
description: Spains new king, Felipe VI, was proclaimed monarch at a formal ceremony in the countrys Parliament on Thursday.

title: David Brooks Responds to Readers: The Structures of Growth
description: David Brooks, Op-Ed columnist, answered a few questions posed by commenters about his latest column,The Structures of Growth.

title: G.E. Consumer Finance Unit Reaches Settlements
description: Synchrony Bank, the new name of GE Capital Retail Bank, settled claims of illegal credit card practices with the federal Consumer Financial Protection Bureau and the Justice Department on Thursday and agreed to pay $225 million to consumers.

title: Book of Comedy Interviews Coming From Judd Apatow
description: The producer, director and screenwriter Judd Apatows expansive ideas about comedy and how it works are evident in his films and television series, which include The 40-Year-Old Virgin, Knocked Up, Freaks and Geeks and Girls. But Mr. Apatow has always liked talking about comedy with others who practice it, and now Random House has signed him to produce Sick in the Head, a compilation ofinterviews he has conducted with many of his comedy heroes and colleagues over the last three decades. The book is due in 2015. Proceeds will go to 826LA, a nonprofit organization that teaches creative writing to students between 6 and 18.

title: Uruguay vs. England: World Cup 2014 Live Blog
description: Luis Suarez scored twice for Uruguay, including the game-winning goal in the 84th minute, in a 2-1 victory against England, who is all but mathematically eliminated now.

title: How to Give Skipping Town a Whole New Meaning
description: OF all the things from childhood I left behind, I never saw myself revisiting skipping. Not skipping rope, just the plain old Skip to My Lou variety. But thats what I did when I joined what may well be the citys only skipping club for the first skip of the 2014 season.

title: Angie Martinez Joins New Yorks Power 105.1
description: In a shake-up of the hip-hop radio world in New York, Angie Martinez, one of the longest-running and most popular D.J.'s on Hot 97, has left that station to join its biggest rival, Power 105.1.

title: An Over-Engineered Alstom Bid
description: Paris has forced General Electric into an over-engineered bid for Alstoms power businesses.

title: The Fed Faces Reality, Lowers Growth Forecast
description: The Federal Reserve faced reality on Wednesday, lowering it forecast for economic growth this year to 2.1 percent to 2.3 percent, down from a March projection of 2.8 percent to 3.0 percent.

title: Text of Obamas Remarks on Iraq
description: The following is the complete transcript of President Obamas press conference on the conflict in Iraq in Washington. (Transcript courtesy of Federal News Service.)

title: Excerpt: Holler if Ya Hear Me
description: An excerpt from the number California Love from the new Broadway musical based on the lyrics of the rapper Tupac Shakur,

title: Dining Without Borders
description: Here come the devils on horseback, that relic of dinner parties past: prunes and dates cowled in bacon and thrust onto skewers, chewy, crunchy, sweet and salty at once. Except that these devils are in Japanese garb, adorned with nitsume, the dark, sticky sauce that traditionally accompanies eel; squiggles of extra-tangy Kewpie mayonnaise; and translucent bonito flakes like blanched confetti.

title: Tick, Tick  Boom!
description: Lin-Manuel Miranda and Karen Olivo rehearse the number Therapy from the Encores! Off-Center production of the Jonathan Larson musical.

title: Colombia and Its Coach Bring Joy to Fans by Advancing
description: BRASLIA  After their first World Cup victory in 16 years last Saturday, Colombia fans expressed their appreciation by giving Coach Jos Pkerman more than 400,000 write-in votes in Sundays presidential election.

title: Redskins Isnt the Only Name the Patent Office Has Blocked
description: The United States Patent and Trademark Office blocked the trademark registration for the Washington Redskins on Wednesday on grounds that it disparaged an ethnic group, American Indians. While such cases are not common, they do pop up, reflecting the turbulent mixing bowl of American ethnicity.

title: Obama on New Military Advisers to Iraq
description: The president said the United States would send up to 300 military advisers to Iraq to train that countrys security forces, but he emphasized that America would not be returning to combat.

title: Wheelies: The Price of Fuel Edition
description: A roundup of motoring news from the web:

title: Command Performance
description: Before the Chitlin Circuit, before the Cotton Club and eons before Soul Train or Black Entertainment Television (BET) put black talent on display, there was Congo Square in New Orleans. During Louisianas 18th-century French and Spanish colonial era, slaves were allowed to convene near the square on their Sundays off from work to sing, dance and play music  a practice that continued beyond the Louisiana Purchase. Word spread of the spectacle, and soon the slaves began to draw crowds of whites. Later the attempted suppression of savage African music by the Protestants helped transform Congo Square into a phenomenon sought by visitors from far and wide. You could argue that in that square, located in what is now Louis Armstrong Park, the American black as an entertainer was born.

title: Italian Businessman Paolo Scaroni to Join Rothschild
description: LONDON  The British financial advisory firm Rothschild Group has hired Paolo Scaroni, an influential Italian businessman who was pushed out as chief executive of the oil company Eni this year by Italys prime minister, Matteo Renzi.

title: Food Networks
description: To start a food trend from agriculture is one of the riskiest things an entrepreneur can do, David Sax writes in The Tastemakers, his entertaining new excursion into, as his subtitle has it, Why Were Crazy for Cupcakes but Fed Up With Fondue. Yet every day, he adds, there are countless farmers, scientists and gardening dreamers with a trowel in their hand, digging in the dirt and planting the seed that they hope will one day change the way we eat.

title: New York Leaders Reach Deal on Medical Marijuana
description: ALBANY  Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and legislative leaders announced an agreement on Thursday for a pilot program to provide access to marijuana to sick New Yorkers, making the state one of the largest to embrace the drugs use as medicine.

title: Arms and the Men
description: The right of the people to keep and bear arms has been enshrined in the Second Amendment to the Constitution since 1792. In our day, the National Rifle Association and batteries of conservative jurists have fought so successfully to persuade people that the amendment guarantees Americans an individual right of self-defense that in 2008 the Supreme Court declared unconstitutional an outright ban on handguns for residents of the District of Columbia. Two years later, the court ruled that Chicago could not ban handguns, either  the right to own handguns applied all over the United States.

title: House Republicans Name McCarthy as Cantors Replacement
description: WASHINGTON  House Republicans reached for continuity and stability on Thursday in electing a new leadership team, promoting a Californian of moderate temperament to No. 2 and a more conservative Louisianian who has the loyalty of the Tea Party as No. 3 in an effort to quell dissent in their restive ranks.

title: A Deal-Making Touch Honed in the Minority
description: WASHINGTON  When he was the leader of Republicans in the California State Assembly  an ideologically diverse group of lawmakers often choleric toward both Gov. Arnold Schwarzenegger and the Democrats who controlled the Legislature  Kevin Owen McCarthy was known as the guy who could help bring a bill across the finish line. Gently, almost as if no one could see it.

title: Obama on What Iraqs Leadership Must Do
description: President Obama said the fate of Iraq hangs in the balance and discussed whether Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki could unify his country given the sectarian divisions.

title: Disenchantment in France With Fickle National Team
description: Four years ago, Les Bleus, the French national soccer team, went on strike in South Africa. The incident capped the teams self-destruction in the 2010 World Cup. In the aftermath, the players were called undereducated PlayStation junkies who were too individualistic to serve the nation.
