description: BANNU, Pakistan  The man waited for hours in the sweltering heat at a security checkpoint near here as his family struggled to leave Miram Shah, fleeing the military offensive the Pakistani military had announced against militants in North Waziristan.

title: Friday Not Music: British Accents
description: Sorry about late posting  I just heard Lake Street Dive live in Prospect Park, which was wonderful. But instead of music, heres a great guide to how they pronounce things over there:

title: For Yankees Pineda, Return to Throwing Hinges on Results of M.R.I.
description: The Yankees are awaiting the results of a precautionary magnetic resonance imaging test on starting pitcher Michael Pinedas injured right shoulder, the final hurdle before he can begin a throwing program.

title: Matt Harvey and Mets Achieve Dtente
description: MIAMI  During batting practice Thursday, Matt Harvey approached Jose Fernandez near the Miami Marlins dugout. Two of the best young pitchers in baseball were relegated to the periphery as they recovered from Tommy John surgery.

title: Pakistans Hot Spots at a Glance
description: Main theaters of conflict in northwestern Pakistan.

title: Linesman Is Replaced After Two Curious Offside Calls
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  FIFA dropped an official from his crews next assignment at the World Cup after he made offside decisions that denied Mexico two potential goals in the teams opening game, against Cameroon.

title: Two Plays at Plate Doom Mets Rally Against Marlins
description: MIAMI  The Mets had the tying run on third with one out in the top of the ninth when Chris Young lifted a high fly ball to left field. Marcell Ozuna drifted back, about 10 yards behind where he thought the ball would land, as if he were winding himself up, and then ran forward, building momentum.

title: U.N. Reports Sharp Increase in Refugees
description: The total number of people displaced by violence reached more than 51 million by the end of 2013, according to the United Nations.

title: Beltrans Homer Rescues Yankees After Kuroda Shines, Then Stumbles
description: Carlos Beltrans career has been full of extraordinary moments, but his first few months as a Yankee had been rather average. He sustained an elbow injury that kept him out of the lineup for 21 games. His batting average had hovered around .200 for most of the season. The three-year, $45 million contract he signed this past off-season was appearing to be another regrettable decision the Yankees had made with an aging player.

title: Four Contenders to Replace Maliki
description: Iraqi politicians have begun to position themselves as possible replacements for the embattled Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki. These are the four contenders.

title: China: Police Kill 13 in Attack in Xinjiang Region
description: Police officers shot dead 13 attackers on Saturday who rammed a vehicle into the main police station of Yecheng County, in the region of Xinjiang in far western China, according to state news media reports. Three police officers were lightly wounded in the attack, which also involved the detonation of explosive devices, the reports said. Violent episodes in Xinjiang have become more frequent in the last couple years, and attacks on police stations appear to be on the rise. Yecheng County is an area that is heavily populated by Uighurs, a Turkic-speaking ethnic group who in in recent years have often clashed in Xinjiang with ethnic Han, the dominant group in China. Many Uighurs say they face discrimination, and some call for an independent Uighur state to be carved from in Xinjiang and called East Turkestan. In recent months, there have been attacks across China that state news media reports have attributed to Uighur militants.

title: Seafood, Shipped In
description: The United States imports seafood in increasing numbers, even for salmon, which it has in abundance.

title: Whats on Saturday
description: 8 P.M. (HBO) THE WOLVERINE (2013) This sixth installment in the X-Men film franchise finds Logan (Hugh Jackman) living as a hermit in the great white north and tormented by the memory of being forced to kill Jean Grey (Famke Janssen). Then the warrior pixie Yukio (Rila Fukushima) spirits him back to Tokyo to meet with Yashida (Haruhiko Yamanouchi), who is intent on repaying his life debt to Logan, who saved him during the bombing of Nagasaki  and alleviate Logan of his immortality, which he now considers a curse. Mr. Jackman, for all his growling, flexing and macho wisecracking, keeps our attention focused on Logans feelings, A. O. Scott wrote in The New York Times. So does the director James Mangold, he said, adding, A modest superhero picture may sound like a contradiction in terms, but really it is a welcome respite.

title: Quotation of the Day for Saturday, June 21, 2014
description: We no longer have to imagine a terror state. We have one.

title: Conflicting Gestures From Putin to Ukraine Leaders
description: MOSCOW  President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia proffered both a carrot and a stick to Ukraine on Saturday, issuing a qualified acceptance of a peace plan proposed by the Ukrainian leadership to quell a separatist uprising in the southeast, but simultaneously putting troops across central Russia on combat alert and mounting surprise military drills.

title: Corrections: June 21, 2014
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Analytics: Brazils Boogeyman
description: The following Analytics appears on the letters page in the June 22 issue of the magazine.

title: Todays World Cup Matches
description: Argentina vs. Iran, 12 p.m.: Look for Argentina to iron out the kinks in its game  perhaps Lionel Messi improving his interactions with attackmate Sergio Agero  because Iran does not figure to offer much in the way of competition. It barely hung on to a 0-0 draw with Nigeria in (so far) the most dreary game of the tournament.

title: New Offering for Job Seekers: Fewer Embarrassing Social Media Photos
description: Before a college graduate goes job hunting, he or she will probably do a few things: prepare a good rsum, be ready to answer some key questions about his or her skills and qualifications, buy some nice clothes.

title: World Cup 2014: Argentina Defeats Iran, 1-0
description: Iran fought hard and really neutralized some of the worlds finest players. But they couldnt contain Lionel Messi, who scored in the final minutes to lift Argentina.

title: World Cup 2014: Germany and Ghana Play to a 2-2 Draw
description: The result leaves Germany at the top of Group G with four points from two games; a win for the United States against Portugal in Manaus tomorrow would give the Americans sole possession of top spot.

title: World Cup 2014: Nigeria Defeats Bosnia-Herzegovina, 1-0
description: The officiating in this game will be questioned for a long time, as Bosnia had a goal called back on an offside call. Nigeria wins its first World Cup match since 1998.

title: Ermenegildo Zegna: Spring 2015 Menswear
description: Milan

title: Sunnis in Iraq Make Some Gains in Fighting in the North and West
description: BAGHDAD  The violent struggle over Iraq on Saturday consumed cities and towns widely spread over the north and west of the country, with Sunni militants making some gains near a strategic border crossing with Syria..

title: The Chatter for Sunday, June 22
description: Guess what  one of the things people want to do with their phones is buy stuff, from Amazon and in general.

title: For Michael Passaro, All the Working World Is a Stage
description: This interview with  Michael J. Passaro, production stage manager for Pippin on Broadway and head of the stage management concentration at the Columbia University School of the Arts, was conducted and condensed by  Adam Bryant.

title: In Digital Marketing, the Sociology of the Sale
Espousing Equality, but Embracing a Hierarchy
description: People never say they want to grow up to be a middle manager, and some company founders aspire never to hire one.

title: Held Captive by Flawed Credit Reports
description: When companies are found to have violated the law and harmed consumers, they typically pay a penalty to regulators and agree to reform their practices.

title: Merger Fever Can Be a Menace for Shareholders
description: Shareholders beware: M.&A. mania is back.

title: How Inherited Wealth Helps the Economy
description: Is inherited wealth making a comeback?

title: Argentina vs. Iran: World Cup 2014 Live Blog
description: Argentina can wrap up its expected second round berth. An Iran win, or even a draw, would rank at the top of the list of its greatest soccer achievements.

title: Urban Hurly-Burly of a Bumptious Era
description: The great street photographer Garry Winogrand once said, I photograph to find out what something will look like photographed. That curiosity led him to make some of the most indelible photographs of life in the United States during one of its most turbulent decades, the Sixties, with extraordinary avidity. In crowded off-kilter pictures that seemed haphazard and badly composed to critics at the time, he captured urban pedestrian traffic, people and animals at zoos and political demonstrations and altercations.

title: Hes an Old Soul, In a Young Way
description: In jazz, there are young people who sound old, old people who sound young and, very occasionally, young people who sound like old people who sound young. Pay attention to those people. The tenor saxophonist Bill McHenry has been such a person, with a full tone, slow and songlike phrasing and a totally in-the-present disposition equally indebted to free jazz and, say, Lester Young. Hes unpredictable, open to the ideas of his band members and to creating benign mischief.

title: Tyrannical Captor of Under-Age Wives
description: Talk about scandalous. In Outlaw Prophet: Warren Jeffs, on Saturday night at 8 on Lifetime, Tony Goldwyn channels Mr. Jeffs, the president and prophet, seer and revelator, of the Fundamentalist Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints  who in 2006 joined Osama bin Laden on the F.B.I.s 10 Most Wanted list for having arranged illegal marriages between his adult male followers and under-age girls. Hes a far cry worse than playing President Fitz, Mr. Goldwyn said in a phone interview, alluding to his role in the ABC drama Scandal. You have a guy who was essentially disenfranchised in this very strange community, and who usurped power and became a complete dictator in his world.

title: A Verdant Treat, and a Period Viola
description: Fresh air, proud history: The Naumburg Orchestral Concerts in Central Park has both. A perfect setting, then, for the Knights, a collective that brings equal doses of meticulous musicianship and fun to its performances. In the opening concert of the series on Tuesday, the conductor Eric Jacobsen leads the Knights in a typically eclectic program, including an arrangement of Boccherinis Quintet in C (Op. 30), set in nighttime Madrid, alongside two newer works by composers with a strong sense of place: Andrew Normans Light Screens and Ivess Three Places in New England. The composer-pianist Timo Andres joins in for his own take on Mozarts Coronation Concerto. (7:30 p.m.; naumburgconcerts.org.)

title: Gently Dissecting a British Milieu
description: With three features under her belt, the British auteur Joanna Hogg has carved out a niche in British cinema, gently anatomizing the habits and humors of the English middle class. (ric Rohmer is a rough analogue.) Now, New Yorkers will get a chance to see all of her films.

title: Blending Beauty With Sharp Edges
description: Since its founding 50 years ago by E. Virginia Williams, one of the pioneers of American regional ballet, the Boston Ballet has steadily broadened its outlook. Now, under the direction of Mikko Nissinen, it comes to Lincoln Center with two programs that reflect its diversity.

title: Cyberattack on Hong Kong Vote Was Among Largest Ever, Security Chief Says
description: The online voting platform for the unofficial referendum now underway on Hong Kongs political future has been subjected to one of the most severe cyberattacks of its kind ever seen, according to the head of the Internet security company tasked with protecting it.

title: Dolce & Gabbana: Spring 2015 Menswear
description: Milan

title: Again at the Office, Im a Player Without a Team
description: Everybody seems to be following the World Cup. Im not, and its making me feel a little left out at work. Whats all this talk about yellow cards?

title: Yahoo Wants You to Linger (on the Ads, Too)
description: Four editors were deep in debate at Yahoo Foods offices in Manhattan: Would Yahoo visitors click on a feature about foods of the ancient Silk Road, or would they prefer a guide to cheese fries and other snacks that go well with ranch dressing for the Final Four basketball games?

title: Bike Storage Needed
description: Ask Real Estate is a weekly online column that answers questions from across the New York region. Submit yours to realestateqa@nytimes.com.

title: A Job Seekers Desperate Choice
description: On the morning of March 20, Shanesha Taylor had a job interview. It was for a good job, one that could support her three children, unlike the many positions shed applied for that paid only $10 an hour. The interview, at an insurance agency in Scottsdale, Ariz., went well. Walking out of the office, you know that little skip thing people do? she said, clicking her heels together in a corny expression of glee. I wanted to do that.

title: A Leadership Lesson for Goodell, From Goodell
description: In late 2011, N.F.L. Commissioner Roger Goodell paid a visit to my barbershop in Harlem, where we enjoyed an informal conversation about a variety of issues centering mainly on player safety and whether the game was becoming too soft.

title: Variety: A Delicious Diagramless
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  Its summer and grilling season is here, as far as Fred Piscop is concerned. Today, were not only going to build a puzzle with him, but were also going to build the ultimate burger.

title: A Misguided Departure From the Serve-and-Volley
description: The art of the serve-and-volley, many tennis experts argue, has no place in todays game. It is a common refrain that the speed of the courts, modern string technology and even the size of the athletes have made that style of play obselete.

title: Unblinking Eyes Track Employees
description: A digital Big Brother is coming to work, for better or worse.

title: The Anchor on an Evolving Team
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  Tim Howard did not always like what Jurgen Klinsmann was doing to Howards closest friends. He actually hated it. One by one, all of the veteran players on the United States national team had their moments with Klinsmann, the coach from Germany, who had made clear since the moment he was hired in 2011 that history and past performance meant nothing to him.

title: Workplace Surveillance and the Transparency Paradox
description: Jim Sullivan, general manager of a Dallas restaurant, embraces digital monitoring in the workplace. Software, sensors and data make it increasingly possible, and Mr. Sullivan, as noted in an article I wrote, is a beneficiary of the improved measurement techniques. His data showed he was a highly productive worker, a prime candidate for the promotions he received.

title: You Can Do It, Shirley
description: Martin Luther King Addo, a 44-year-old bodybuilder who was twice crowned Mr. Ghana, opened a storefront gym in a N.O.R.C.  a naturally occurring retirement community  in Lower Manhattan. His clients, many of them older women, are glad he did. Read the full story, and watch the video, above.

title: Juli Inkster Leaves a Legacy as a Master Multitasker
description: PINEHURST, N.C.  Take a long look at Juli Inkster, who carded a four-under-par 66, the lowest round of the week, on Saturday. Admire her the way you might the Yankees consummate contact hitter, Ichiro Suzuki, or any other favorite relic. She is easy to spot on the driving range, with her short hair and her skirt so long the hem nearly reaches her knees.

title: South Korea Hunts for Army Shooter
description: SEOUL, South Korea  A South Korean Army sergeant killed five of his fellow soldiers and wounded five others on Saturday when he opened fire along the border with North Korea, military officials said. A hunt for the soldier was underway late Saturday.

title: Baptism by Fire: A New York Firefighter Confronts His First Test
description: Jordan Sullivans decade-long dream of joining the Fire Department had come true. Now he had to prove himself.

title: Are You a Firefighter? Tell Us About Your First Fire
description: To a firefighter, the first fire is like a police officers first collar, a lawyers first jury trial, a fishermans first tuna. It becomes chiseled into your memory in big block letters, rolled out and dusted off for reminiscence over a lifetime, N.R. Kleinfield wrote in an article about Jordan Sullivan, a New York City firefighter with Ladder Company 105 in Brooklyn.

title: In Todays Power Game, Shorter Players Thrive With Quick Wits and Feet
description: The womens final of the 2014 French Open was about to begin, and Maria Sharapova and Simona Halep posed for pictures at the net.

title: Making Headlines With Their Vows
description: Katie Couric and John P. Molner were married Saturday at Ms. Courics home in East Hampton, N.Y. John Ellis, a friend of the couple who is a Universal Life minister, officiated.

title: Rite of the Sitting Dead: Funeral Poses Mimic Life
description: NEW ORLEANS  All last week, people were calling Louis Charbonnet to find out how they might avoid lying down at their funerals. Funeral directors have called; so have people with their own requests, such as the woman who wanted to be seen for the last time standing over her cooking pot.

title: Iraqi Shiites Mobilize Against Extremists
description: A mass popular mobilization, spurred by a clerics urging, is sweeping through large sections of Baghdad and southern Iraqs Shiite heartland.

title: Six Who Have a Chance to Figure Prominently in London
description: A look at some of the players to keep a close eye on when Wimbledon starts on Monday.

title: Ballot Counting Continues as Some Afghans Protest
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  A day after the United Nations agreed to play a role in settling disputes over the vote for a new Afghan president, protesters demonstrated across Kabul, blocking streets in parts of the city and demanding that the government address their accusations of ballot stuffing.

title: Answering a Clerics Call, Iraqi Shiites Take Up Arms
description: BAGHDAD  The long lines of Shiite fighters began marching through the capital early Saturday morning. Some wore masks. One group had yellow and green suicide explosives, which they said were live, strapped to their chests.

title: Can U.S. Contain Ronaldo? Germany Found a Way
description: How Germany shut down Ronaldo and what the U.S. needs to do when they face him on Sunday.

title: Ghana vs. Germany: World Cup 2014 Live Blog
description: Ghana probably has to win, but at the bare, bare minimum must draw. That will be a tall order against a German team that has one foot in the second round already.

title: The Scene | Milan Mens Fashion Week: Ermenegildo Zegna Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the mens fashion week photo diary of Filippo Mutani.

title: Brazils Other Team, or So Portugal Hopes
description: BRASLIA  In 1500, Portuguese explorers arrived on the shores of what is now Brazil seeking, among other things, gold. Today, Portuguese adventurers have come here seeking merely goals.

title: My Mother, My Writing Student
description: On the first day of a weeklong creative-writing workshop, I sit across from a group of serious-minded first-time novelists, people who have come to me, their teacher, to make their books better. Ive just been going over the schedule, a series of craft talks, workshops and one-on-one conferences. Are there any questions? I ask.

title: In Shiite Heartland of Iraq, Volunteers Get Set for a Defensive Jihad
description: NAJAF, Iraq  It had been quite the morning for Jamli Umm Saif, a mother of four. After morning prayers on Saturday, she sent off her husband and eldest son to join a military parade by the Mahdi Army, a Shiite militia run by the populist cleric Moktada al-Sadr.

title: Immigration Reforms Open Invitation to Children
description: FOR years now, one side of the immigration debate  the side of billionaires, professional bipartisans, and all the great and good  has argued that an amnesty of some kind for illegal immigrants isnt just a sensible policy choice but a crushingly obvious one: self-evidently wise, morally farseeing and a win for almost everyone, from corporations to labor unions to Republican politicians to the immigrants themselves.

title: Postpartum Depression
description: Readers react to articles on the various ways that mental disorders can afflict new moms.

title: Ed Lu
description: Ed Lu is a physicist and former NASA astronaut who is currently the chief executive of the B612 Foundation, a nonprofit organization on a mission to save the world from a possible asteroid apocalypse. The group is in the process of building an infrared telescope that, once launched into space, will search the solar system for monster asteroids on a collision course with Earth.

title: So Similar, So Different
description: READERS often ask: Why do I travel to places like Sudan or Myanmar when we Americans have so many challenges at home to worry about?

title: Inside Firefighter School
description: Jordan Sullivan, a rookie New York City firefighter, recalls his training at the Fire Academy on Randalls Island, known as the Rock, where one of the most challenging exercises is search and rescue.

title: The Coming Climate Crash
description: THERE is a time for weighing evidence and a time for acting. And if theres one thing Ive learned throughout my work in finance, government and conservation, it is to act before problems become too big to manage.

title: Neil Barrett: Spring 2015 Menswear
description: Milan

title: How My Wine Turned to Water
description: TRURO, Mass.  MY email inbox startled me with the subject line: A Voice from the Past. The last email I received with that heading was from Peanuts LoBianco, a deranged former high school classmate who claimed he had learned to walk on water, change water into wine and then walk on the wine. For all that, he still needed money from me.

title: An Ace Agent Finally Has a Hall of Famer
description: For most of the last three decades, few people have had more influence on baseball, or been more ubiquitous, than the agent Scott Boras. When you flip on a game taking place in Anaheim, Calif., chances are he is looking back at you from his suite behind home plate. When you wonder whether your team will sign, or retain, a prominent star, quite often it is Boras handling the negotiations.

title: Baltimore Joins Cities Toughening Curfews, Citing Safety but Eliciting Concern
description: BALTIMORE  To beat the summer heat, Isaiah Jackson waits until the sun goes down to play basketball in an alley near his home.

title: Sunday Breakfast Menu, June 22
description: As unrest and violence continues in Iraq, President Obama announced Thursday that he would send 300 military advisers to the country to aid struggling security forces to fight off Sunni militants. Insurgents with the Sunni militant group Islamic State in Iraq and Syria have swept through northern cities, often seizing money from banks along the way.

title: Death Threats, Then Red Tape
description: ON June 20, 2011, in Veracruz, Mexico, Miguel ngel Lpez Solana arrived home to find that his brother, mother and father had been murdered. Both sons were photojournalists at the newspaper where their father was a columnist, writing about crime and political corruption. Within a month, another journalist at the paper was decapitated. A year later, four more journalists were murdered there in a single week. Its not clear why they were killed, but Mr. Lpez wasnt going to wait around to find out.

title: Two-Parent Households Can Be Lethal
description: AFTER spending two years studying services for domestic violence survivors, I was surprised to realize that one of the most common barriers to womens safety was something I had never considered before: the high value our culture places on two-parent families.

title: Hacker Tactic: Holding Data Hostage
description: THE perpetual cat-and-mouse game between computer hackers and their targets is getting nastier. Cybercriminals are getting better at circumventing firewalls and antivirus programs. More of them are resorting to ransomware, which encrypts computer data and holds it hostage until a fee is paid. Some hackers plant virus-loaded ads on legitimate websites, enabling them to remotely wipe a hard drive clean or cause it to overheat. Meanwhile, companies are being routinely targeted by attacks sponsored by the governments of Iran and China. Even small start-ups are suffering from denial-of-service extortion attacks, in which hackers threaten to disable their websites unless money is paid.

title: Superstitious Soccer Fans
description: Some Brazilian soccer fans say their personal rituals have a direct impact on their teams success.

title: With Salary Choice, Anthony Will Show How Much Value He Places on Winning
description: Carmelo Anthony will soon be making a choice on how much he is willing to sacrifice, in terms of salary, to be part of a winning team.

title: Fear Not the Coming of the Robots
description: JUST over 50 years ago, the cover of Life magazine breathlessly declared the point of no return for everybody. Above that stark warning, a smaller headline proclaimed, Automations really here; jobs go scarce.

title: Atlanta Summons the Past to Showcase the Present
description: ATLANTA  Far from his typical Broadway haunts, the director George C. Wolfe was walking through a construction site here this spring when, amid a cacophony of saws and drills, he stopped and stood before what was to become a replica of a lunch counter that he said would claw visitors back into history.

title: Gaming the Poor
description: In a referendum in November, voters approved as many as seven new casinos to join New York States existing nine gambling facilities. And New York is hardly alone. In recent years, 23 other states have legalized and licensed commercial (as opposed to Native American) gambling facilities. In the casino-dense Northeast and mid-Atlantic regions, where 26 casinos have opened since 2004 and at least a dozen more are under development, most adults now live within a short drive of one.

title: But I Want to Do Your Homework
description: MY son and I are shouting at each other, and crying. He is holding his essay between his fingertips as if its a dead cockroach. Im sorry, I said. I just made a few corrections...

title: Mass Surveillance in Britain
description: European officials have often acted as though excessive government surveillance was solely an American problem. The recent release of a  legal statement from a senior British counterterrorism official, Charles Farr, shows that the United States government is certainly not alone in justifying such practices.

title: Sentencing Reform Runs Aground
description: Criminal justice reform is one of the rare issues on which there has been bipartisan support in Congress and significant progress toward a legislative solution. Until recently, anyway.

title: Slavery and the Shrimp on Your Plate
description: Shrimp and other seafood fishing is a big business in Thailand. The industry employs more than 650,000 people and annually produces more than $7 billion in exports that show up on dinner tables all over the world, including in the United States. It also has a horrific dark side. Its reliance on slave labor is so pervasive and ugly that the State Department now lists Thailand as one of the worst violators among 188 countries judged every year on how they deal with human trafficking.

title: Despite Recent Early Exits, Federer and Williams Like Their Chances
description: WIMBLEDON, England  A couple of 32-year-olds who have each won 17 Grand Slam titles weighed in Saturday on the prospects of reaching No. 18 by the end of the Wimbledon tournament, which begins Monday. While Roger Federer was talkative, Serena Williams was terse.

title: A Largely Indian Victory in World War II, Mostly Forgotten in India
description: KOHIMA, India  Soldiers died by the dozens, by the hundreds and then by the thousands in a battle here 70 years ago. Two bloody weeks of fighting came down to just a few yards across an asphalt tennis court.

title: Iraqi-Americans Watch Chaos in Alarm
description: WASHINGTON  Every mile Iraqi militants log on their warpath toward Baghdad is another reason for Majid al-Bahadli to worry.

title: Letters to the Sports Editor
description: To the Sports Editor:

title: With Job in Peril, Yankees Nuno Wobbles Through a Start
description: Vidal Nuno had only a tenuous hold on his spot in the Yankees pitching rotation when he took the mound Saturday against the Baltimore Orioles. He hardly strengthened his position in the Yankees 6-1 loss, allowing five runs, four of them earned, in six and a third innings while giving up three home runs.

title: Should America Solve its Own Problems First?
description: Whenever I write about international issues, I always get pushback from readers who say that we should solve our own domestic problems before worrying about the rest of the world. As House Majority Leader Tom DeLay put it years ago, international humanitarianism puts Ghana over Grandma. I dont buy that, and my Sunday column is a response to that way of thinking. But as my column notes, I think theres sometimes also the opposite tendency, especially among university studentsthat is to think that its glamorous to fight illiteracy in Tanzania, but not to mentor at-risk students on the wrong side of the tracks in ones own city. As far as Im concerned, there are important needs both at home and abroad, and we neednt solve one before beginning to tackle the other. The story I tell in this column is why I think that. So read the column and post your thoughts below.

title: Big Ten Commissioner Testifies for a Simpler Time
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  Mark Emmert, the N.C.A.A. president, drew a crowd to federal court here last week, as journalists and lawyers packed a courtroom and a second overflow room to witness his defense of amateur college sports. When Emmert finished his testimony early Friday, much of the crowd was gone.

title: American Apparel Ousts Its Founder, Dov Charney, Over Nude Photos
description: The founder and chief executive of American Apparel, Dov Charney, was fired this week because an internal investigation found that he had misused company money and had allowed an employee to post naked photographs of a former female employee who had sued him, according to a person with knowledge of the investigation.

title: Bosnia-Herzegovina vs. Nigeria: World Cup 2014 Live Blog
description: Vedad Ibisevic of Bosnia did manage to score against Argentina, but it was largely because of keeper error. Bosnia will be looking to do better, with forward Senad Lulic a key man.

title: Alstom Board Backs Offer From G.E., Ending Battle
description: PARIS  The board of the French industrial conglomerate Alstom said Saturday that it had unanimously backed General Electrics offer to acquire most of its energy business for $13.5 billion, essentially ending the battle for the company. A final deal was still awaiting the successful outcome of negotiations between the government and Alstoms largest shareholder over the sale of a stake to the state.

title: Dime Store
description: SUNDAYS PUZZLE  Well, this was just brilliant on a few levels. We saw something like this nearly a year ago, by Daniel Finan, but even so, this is a delicious Aha! moment.

title: Carlton A. Sherwood, Reporter Behind 2004 Kerry Film, Dies at 67
description: Carlton A. Sherwood, an investigative journalist and former Marine who lurched between accolades and controversy, most prominently with a 2004 film about the chagrin of Vietnam War veterans over John Kerrys turning against the war as a naval officer, died on June 11 in Philadelphia. He was 67.

title: Vows | When the Beat Works
description: As musicians, Rachel Elmer and Gabriel Hernandez know when they have a song right. That has not always been the case in their relationship. (Correction: An earlier version of a capsule summary with this video misstated the given name of the groom. He is Gabriel Hernandez, not George.)

description: GENEVA, Ill.  The 15-year-old was perched on his bed, smoking a cigarette, when his mother came in. She demanded he put it out; he refused; she reached to take it from his mouth.

title: A Christian Convert, on the Run in Afghanistan
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  In a dank basement on the outskirts of Kabul, Josef read his worn blue Bible by the light of a propane lantern, as he had done for weeks since he fled from his family in Pakistan.

title: Dr. Arnold Relman, 91, Journal Editor and Health System Critic, Dies
description: Dr. Arnold S. Relman, who abandoned the study of philosophy to rise to the top of the medical profession as a researcher, administrator and longtime editor of The New England Journal of Medicine, which became a platform for his early and influential attacks on the profit-driven health care system, died at his home in Cambridge, Mass., on Tuesday, his 91st birthday.

It was the same spot where he had made the decisive play the night before, and he re-enacted it for his Miami Marlins teammates in slow motion. He retreated a few steps, came forward under an imaginary ball, reached out his glove and wound his arm.

title: Project Tests New Storage for Energy
description: LANCASTER, Tex.  No one at the equipment lot here would blame you for failing to notice the drab green box sitting across from the spare transformers. But the lithium ions inside that refrigerator-size container are part of a wave of energy storage technology that could help Texas revolutionize its electric grid.

Todays World Cup Matches
description: Belgium vs. Russia, 12 p.m.: Belgium hopes to get its offense cranked up a bit earlier in this game, before the substitutes start coming in late in the second half. Two of them, Marouane Fellaini and Dries Merten, provided the goals that lifted Belgium over Algeria. Russia also got its only goal in a draw against South Korea from a sub, Alan Dzagoev. A draw may be enough for these two teams to advance.

title: Mastering the Art of Three-Dimensional Graffiti

Carlos Mare sweated and huffed as he bent a stainless steel arrow over his knee. He tucked it into a mirror-shiny tangle of curves and lines that hung from a wall, stepped back and waved his arms, as if he were conducting an orchestra.

title: Understanding the Land Where Kafkaesque Was Born

Hes a Polish writer and journalist, looking with a kind of appalled fascination at his countrys southern neighbor and finding that life there can often be, well, Kafkaesque.

description: The United States claimed a morale-boosting win over Ghana, but the hard work starts here against a Portugal team that is licking its wounds over a 4-0 thrashing by Germany.

title: Next House Leader Says He Would Let Trade Bank Expire
description: WASHINGTON  Representative Kevin McCarthy, the next House majority leader, said Sunday that he would allow the Export-Import Bank of the United States to expire when its authority was up for reauthorization in the fall.

title: Last Barrier Is Cleared in G.E.s Deal With Alstom
description: PARIS  The last major obstacle to General Electrics $13.5 billion acquisition of Alstoms energy assets fell on Sunday, when the French government agreed to buy a stake in the French industrial conglomerate from the billionaire Bouygues family.

title: Whirling White Towels Signal All Is Well With Mets
description: MIAMI  As the ball Daniel Murphy had just crushed sailed over the wall in center field, about a half-dozen Mets waved white towels above their heads in the dugout.

title: Telling a Temples Tale From the Nile to the Met
description: The tranquil, soaring space in the Metropolitan Museum of Art that has housed the Temple of Dendur since 1978 is so beloved that New Yorkers could be forgiven for thinking that the temple itself is beside the point, merely an excuse for the glamorous room, with its sweeping wall of glass.

title: Googles European Antitrust Woes Are Far From Over
description: BRUSSELS  Google has struggled for years to settle an antitrust investigation in the European Union, to avoid a huge fine and the stigma that would come with breaking the law.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of June 23
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday. There will be additional auctions of one-year bills and two-year notes on Tuesday, five-year notes and two-year floating rate notes on Wednesday and seven-year notes on Thursday.

title: Clock Ticking, Anthony Is Set to Test Free Agency
description: Countless possessions for the Knicks last season ended with Carmelo Anthony cradling the basketball as he looked for an angle against a defender. With the shot clock winding down, Anthony would be operating in an isolation set, the crowd at Madison Square Garden awaiting his next move.

title: The Harmony of Liberty
description: ATLANTA  It isnt that great a distance from the birthplace of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. on Auburn Avenue here to the $68 million, 42,000 square-foot National Center for Civil and Human Rights that is opening on Monday near Centennial Olympic Park. The two sites, though, seem as if theyve emerged not just from different time periods, but from different and incompatible universes.

title: The Week Ahead: AT&T-DirecTV Hearing, and First-Quarter Growth
description: ANTITRUST HEARING IS SET FOR AT&T AND DIRECTV

title: A Hybrid Star Expresses the Currents and Crosscurrents in the Europe of Today
description: Stromae dances to a continents disquiet. Hes a Belgian songwriter who performed on Friday night for an adoring full house at the Best Buy Theater. Hes also a pop-star embodiment of a contemporary Europe thats smart, increasingly heterogeneous, historically aware, anxious about the future, sleekly charming and unfailingly stylish.

title: Digging Deep, a Singer Gives Signature Songs Her Own Stamp
description: Conventional cultural wisdom has it that Billie Holiday, who wrote God Bless the Child with Arthur Herzog Jr. in 1939 and first recorded it two years later, is the ultimate interpreter of this devastating reflection on poverty and humiliation. In Holidays performances, her voice curled around the song and enfolded it as though she were trying to comfort a wounded stray animal she found on the street and brought home to care for: perhaps her own inner child.

title: Writhing Upon the Shoulders of Giants
description: Some choreographers seem to know exactly what they want to say before they say it. Why express through movement what you can articulate just as clearly, if not more, in a program note?

title: Kerry on the Iraq Crisis
description: In a news conference with Egypts foreign minister, Secretary of State John Kerry said that Islamist militants seizing control of parts of Iraq were a threat to the entire region.

title: The Amazing Adventures of Pencil Man
description: King Kirby, now at the Brick in Brooklyn as part of the Comic Book Theater Festival, opens with a scene that prompts knowing eye rolls to those familiar with the shows subject: In 1994, a Sothebys auctioneer, hawking work by the comic book artist Jack Kirby, dismissively confuses Spider-Man with Iron Man. Of course she does; after all, this is comic book art, not fine art, and the cultural elite, like countless parents, have sneered at comics since time immemorial. Even comic publishers, as this show demonstrates, were once happy to shortchange their own creators.

title: Croatia Hosts European Championships
description: The European Team Championships have just started in Opatija, Croatia, and will run until July 1. Details are at eurobridge.org.

title: Leaping From Marvel to DC in a Single Bound
description: On Wednesday, readers of Superman will be introduced to two men new to DC Comics: Ulysses, a strange visitor from another dimension; and the illustrator John Romita Jr., a decades-long veteran of Marvel Comics, making his DC debut.

title: A Womans Leadership May Steel Murrays Nerve
description: WIMBLEDON, England  England could use an encore.

title: Goodness Had Nothing to Do With It
description: MONDAYS PUZZLE  I never learned how to do many YO-YO TRICKS myself, mainly because I wasnt even very good at the basic up-and-down motion. And for reasons that were never clear to me, the string always wound up with knots in it.

title: With a Resolve Years in the Making, Wie Wins the U.S. Womens Open for Her First Major Title
description: PINEHURST, N.C.  Michelle Wies strategy for the 69th United States Womens Open was to laugh in the face of disaster. She made it her mantra. When bad shots happen, smile and move on.

title: European Regulators Seek to Tighten Rules for Airliner Tracking and Safety
description: BRUSSELS  More than three months after the disappearance of Malaysia Airlines Flight 370, regulators in Europe are pressing for new ways that would make it impossible to disable safety and communications systems on commercial airliners.

title: On the Hoof in the City for a Day of Music
description: It was lovely to be out and around in New York on Saturday, the first day of summer, warm, sunny and dry. And if you were out, you may well have tripped on a concert or two.

title: Cole Porters Lost Show Unearthed
description: The bandleader Vince Giordano said that when he dialed the number, he figured it was little more than a Hail Mary pass. But that simple phone call solved the mystery.

title: The Cold War Brews Anew in Prime Time
description: Vladimir V. Putin is great for television.

title: A Most Rare Vision: Shakespeare in China
description: BEIJING  On the final night recently of the Actors Gang production of A Midsummer Nights Dream here, theatergoers were treated to an unexpected  and rather meta  performance.

title: Man Dies in Las Vegas at Electric Daisy Carnival
description: A 24-year-old California man died after attending opening night of the Electric Daisy Carnival in Las Vegas on Friday. The Las Vegas Sun reported that the man, Montgomery Tsang of San Leandro, collapsed in the parking lot of the Las Vegas Motor Speedway, where the festival was being held. He was taken to a hospital, where he died early Saturday morning. No cause of death had been determined as of Sunday afternoon, Jennifer Jacobs, senior coroner investigator at the Clark County Coroners Office, said. The festivals organizers, Insomniac Events, estimate that approximately 134,000 people attended on Friday. About 250 medical calls were made that night, five of which resulted in trips to the hospital, according to the Las Vegas police. A spokeswoman for Insomniac, Jennifer Forkish, said in a statement on Saturday that one death is one too many, and asked festivalgoers to help keep one another safe on the remaining two nights. Saturdays was not the first death tied to an Electric Daisy event. In 2010, a 15-year-old girl died of a drug overdose at the festival in Los Angeles. The next year, a 19-year-old man died at an Electric Daisy event in Dallas, and in 2012 two people died off site after attending the festival in Las Vegas.

title: Whats On Sunday
description: 8 P.M. (13) THE ESCAPE ARTIST Everyone deserves a defense, says Will Burton (David Tennant, above), who is Londons top-ranked junior barrister, according to a recent poll, and well up the ladder toward Queens Counsel because of his ability to win any case. But his invincible legal acrobatics backfire when a handshake denied sends his latest client, the reclusive bird lover and psychopath Liam Foyle (Toby Kebbell), into a rage  leaving Will, his wife (Ashley Jensen) and their son (Gus Barry) the targets of revenge. Enter Wills nemesis, Maggie Gardner (Sophie Okonedo), frothing to overtake her rival. David Wolstencroft, the mastermind behind the BBC spy series MI-5, wrote this two-part Masterpiece Mystery! thriller, shown here in its entirety. (Part 2 will be broadcast on Channel 49 at 9.) For the Tennant completist, its mandatory viewing, Mike Hale wrote in The New York Times.

title: Is Real Inclusiveness Possible?
description: Like many institutions that have become more concerned with equality in the past few decades, academic philosophy today aims to be more inclusive. In general, university departments are now striving to consider the experiences and concerns of a broader range of people than have traditionally played the social and professional role of the philosopher. This makes sense. In an increasingly global intellectual landscape, the removal of barriers to entry for previously excluded groups of people and schools of thought is productive and fair.

title: Yankees Offense Cant Capitalize on Another Solid Outing from Tanaka
description: Sunday afternoon at Yankee Stadium began with the traditional Old-Timers game. With each hit, each strikeout and each introduction, the former Yankees stars earned thunderous applause.

title: A Divided Nation?
description: To the Editor:

title: Peace and Prosperity: Achieving Growth Without War
description: To the Editor:

title: Mayors Put Focus on How to Raise Wages for Lowest-Paid Workers in Cities
description: DALLAS  About one in five people in Hallandale Beach, Fla., live below the poverty line. Though it is a small city  37,000 people, a horse track and a greyhound track  its mayor, Joy Cooper, bellied up to the table during a jobs committee discussion on Saturday among the nations mayors and fired off a few questions about raising the minimum wage, if not for the whole city, at least for businesses with city contracts.

title: For Women, a Full Range of Reproductive Services
description: To the Editor:

title: Our Children and the Common Core
Curlers Aim: Sweep to a Win Over the Heat
description: TEMPE, Ariz.  As the temperature dipped to a stultifying 106 degrees one recent evening, members of the Coyotes Curling Club showed up at their clubhouse in a factory district near the airport ready to unwind, work out and cool off.

title: Late Shock Interrupts U.S. Party
description: MANAUS, Brazil  The ball was barely past United States goalkeeper Tim Howard, and already he had put his hands to his head. On the bench, Jurgen Klinsmann spun away as if he had seen a ghost. Up the field, not far from where he lost the ball, Michael Bradley could only stare.

title: Quirky to Create a Smart-Home Products Company
description: The repurposed red brick warehouse in Manhattans Chelsea neighborhood is a bustling hub of modern industrial activity. Skilled young workers are hunched over pristine machine tools and 3-D printers that churn out prototype products.

title: Creating Unexpected Opportunities in a Recovering Economy
description: In New York Citys burgeoning tech world, the start-ups and corporate behemoths are all hungry for talented coders and programmers. But Jahmil Eady never envisioned a career in technology. That was for math geeks, science nerds, white guys.

title: African Teams Band Together in Spoiler Role
description: BRASLIA  It is Sunday in Braslia. The nations capital has the air of a city that was out of date even as it was being built. This may have been the city of the future, but now it looks as if it belongs to the past. In the afternoon sun, many of the older, concrete high-rises look shabby compared with their new, glass-fronted neighbors.

title: Bergdahl Begins Outpatient Treatment
description: Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl, the American prisoner of war freed in exchange for five Taliban detainees held at Guantnamo Bay, has been moved from a military medical center in Texas to begin outpatient treatment, the Pentagon said Sunday.

title: De Blasio Brings Back a Mayoral Tradition: Performing Marriages
description: On Inauguration Day, Mayor Bill de Blasio promised to fulfill a campaign pledge to unite the people of New York City.

title: 3 Who Escaped Prison by Helicopter Are Caught in Montreal
description: OTTAWA  Three men who made a dramatic escape by helicopter from a Quebec detention center two weeks ago were captured in a tourist section of Montreal by a police tactical squad early Sunday morning.

title: Honolulu Shores Up Tourism With Crackdown on Homeless
description: HONOLULU  It was just before 7 a.m. and the streets of Waikiki were filled with tourists, surfers, early morning joggers  and Ronnie Cruz, a 34-year-old homeless man getting a ticket from a Honolulu police officer for pushing a shopping cart piled high with his belongings along the sidewalk.

title: What the U.S. Must Do Now to Advance
description: After a brutally disappointing tie Sunday night, the United States faces a dizzying array of possibilities heading into its final match in the World Cups group stage. Here are the basic facts to keep in mind:

title: Braslia, a Capital City Thats a Place Apart
description: BRASLIA  The Brazilian flag reads, Ordem e Progresso  Order and Progress  which is somewhat curious in this wonderfully jumbled and beautiful country. For an outsider who has visited the samba-infused nightclubs of Riode Janeiro, the Amazonian jungle or So Paulo, with its ramshackle favelas and snarled traffic, order is not what springs to mind.

title: Elite, Separate, Unequal
description: WASHINGTON  NEW YORK CITYS elite public high schools were always meant to provide a quintessentially American blend of academic excellence and democratic accessibility. Unlike the citys expensive private schools, they would be free and open to all who were academically qualified, irrespective of pedigree.

title: A Brand Highlights Its Natural Bona Fides, and Taste
description: PARENTS who dread walking down the breakfast cereal aisle because their children will demand sugary brands were given more to worry about by a recent Cornell University study that found characters on cereal boxes tend to direct their gazes downward at youngsters.

title: McCarthys Role Is Debated in His Land of Immigrants
description: BAKERSFIELD, Calif.  The diner on 24th Street serves salsa as well as homemade jam, and cactus-leaf scrambles share a place on the menu with chicken-fried steak and eggs. Over the clatter of coffee cups, its difficult to tell which tables are chatting in Spanish and which in English.

title: At School, Turning Good Food Into Perfectly Good Compost
description: One by one, the children at Public School 30 on Staten Island dumped their uneaten bananas into a bin in the back of their raucous cafeteria, each greenish-yellow missile landing with a thud. Thud. Thud.

title: Croatia Talks Good Game but Will Have to Play One vs. Mexico to Advance
description: RECIFE, Brazil  Luka Modric heaped superlatives upon the Mexican team. Then he said his Croatian team was better in every way.

title: Putin Attempts to Straddle a Divide He Helped to Pry Open in Ukraine
description: MOSCOW  Russias charged balancing act in its policy toward Ukraine was evident on Sunday, with President Vladimir V. Putin both endorsing a peace plan outlined by the Ukrainian president and rebuking Kiev for the shaky cease-fire.

title: Nielsen Rewards Innovations of Successful New Products
description: Its tough being a consumer products company.

title: Here Lies Progress: Asian Actors Fill the Playbill
description: After decades of inching toward center stage, Asian-American theater actors are facing something that theyve rarely enjoyed in New York: demand.

title: Fate of 3 Kidnapped Israelis Raises Tensions on Many Fronts
description: JERUSALEM  Three Israeli teenagers kidnapped from the West Bank have been missing for more than 10 days now, their names  Naftali, Gilad, Eyal  becoming staples of synagogue prayers and cafe chatter across this tiny country. Four Palestinians, one of them 15, have been killed by Israeli troops, their photos hoisted at mass funerals as martyrs in the liberation struggle.

title: The Frustration Doctrine
description: Americans confidence in American leadership is flagging to such a degree that it poses a critical threat to our democracy, particularly as moneyed interests seek to manipulate the malaise and stir policy and politician away from principle and toward profit.

title: Despite a Hex, Ronaldo Works Magic
description: MANAUS, Brazil  The World Cup arrives every four years, and without fail it brings a good and possibly even true story about a witch doctor.

title: Conservatives Plan to Use Poll Watchers in Mississippi
description: WASHINGTON  As Senator Thad Cochran, the veteran Republican, fights for his political life in Mississippi by taking the unexpected step of courting black Democrats, conservative organizations working to defeat him are planning to deploy poll watchers to monitor his campaigns turnout operation in Tuesdays runoff election.

title: Yahoo Hires Michael Isikoff as Chief Investigative Correspondent
description: Michael Isikoff, the investigative reporter who recently left NBC News, is joining Yahoo News as its chief investigative correspondent. He will start in August.

title: The Big Green Test
description: On Sunday Henry Paulson, the former Treasury secretary and a lifelong Republican, had an Op-Ed article about climate policy in The New York Times. In the article, he declared that man-made climate change is the challenge of our time, and called for a national tax on carbon emissions to encourage conservation and the adoption of green technologies. Considering the prevalence of climate denial within todays G.O.P., and the absolute opposition to any kind of tax increase, this was a brave stand to take.

title: Iraqs Military Seen as Unlikely to Turn the Tide
description: BAGHDAD  As Iraqi Army forces try to rally on the outskirts of Baghdad after two weeks of retreat, it has become increasingly clear to Western officials that the army will continue to suffer losses in its fight with Sunni militants and will not soon retake the ground it has ceded.

title: Fouad Ajami, Commentator and Expert in Arab History, Dies at 68
description: Fouad Ajami, an academic, author and broadcast commentator on Middle East affairs who helped rally support for the United States invasion of Iraq in 2003  partly by personally advising top policy makers  died on Sunday. He was 68.

title: The Real Drama at the Met
description: Over its 131 years, the Metropolitan Opera has drawn virtually all the major stars onto its massive stage  from the days of Enrico Caruso to the time of Anna Netrebko. The company presents more than 20 operas each season, drawing about 800,000 people to more than 200 performances. Its live broadcasts in movie theaters around the world give 2.5 million people a chance to enjoy opera up close and in real time.

title: Diapers.com Co-Founder Launches Online Publication
description: Vinit Bharara made his fortune selling Pampers and Huggies. Now he wants to capitalize on a business fast becoming as commodified as diapers: digital content.

title: Japans Historical Blinders
description: At a time when constructive relations between Japan and South Korea are more important than ever to Asian security, the two countries, allies of the United States, have been unable to put a difficult history behind them. Unfortunately, that seems unlikely to change soon given the release on Friday of a Japanese report on World War II sex slaves.

title: Vanity Fairs Fall Conference Taps Power of the Rolodex
description: Vanity Fair magazine will host a conference in San Francisco this fall, becoming the latest publication to enter the potentially lucrative  and increasingly crowded  field of live events.

title: The Hidden Cost of Trading Stocks
description: Theres no escaping the conclusion that the stock market is not a level playing field where all investors, large and small, have an equal shot at a fair deal.

title: Facing Pressure From Tenant Groups, Board Is Set to Vote on Rent Freeze
description: The board that decides how much landlords can raise rents for New York Citys nearly 1 million regulated apartments is scheduled to vote on Monday whether to forgo increases for the first time in history.

title: British Prime Minister to Undertake a Calculated Risk in Bucking Brussels
description: LONDON  Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain, recently described by a former adviser to his Conservative Party as a sphinx without a riddle, has set himself up for a highly public failure this week, as other European leaders look set to ignore his strident opposition and select an old Brussels hand, Jean-Claude Juncker, as the next head of the powerful European Commission.

title: Suspicious of Professional-Looking Women
description: Dear Diary:

title: Chinese Conglomerate to Finance Former Warner Bros. Executive in Studio Deal
description: LOS ANGELES  Jeff Robinovs effort to assemble a company with significant enough funding to make new movies took a major step forward on Sunday, as Fosun International Ltd., a conglomerate with interests in insurance and financial businesses, advised securities authorities in Hong Kong that it was planning to back a company to be run by Mr. Robinov.

title: True Blood Recap: Back to the Beginning
description: Season 7, Episode 1

title: Relief Over U.S. Exit From Iraq Fades as Reality Overtakes Hope
description: WASHINGTON  Standing in Al Faw palace in Baghdad, surrounded by an artificial lake and the ragged remnants of eight years of war, Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. felt a surge of emotion on that day in December 2011.

title: Nickelodeon Opens a Talent Search Even Wider
description: Two years ago, Viacoms Nickelodeon announced an annual competition as it battled a ratings drop. Rookie animators could vie for the chance to create an 11-minute cartoon. With any luck, Nickelodeon would find fresh creativity.

title: Beachfront Access
Judge Upholds Policy Barring Unvaccinated Students During Illnesses
description: In a case weighing the governments ability to require vaccination against the individual right to refuse it, a federal judge has upheld a New York City policy that bars unimmunized children from public school when another student has a vaccine-preventable disease.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for June 22, 2014
Vice Has Many Media Giants Salivating, but Its Terms Will Be Rich
description: A black S.U.V. recently rolled through the streets of Williamsburg, Brooklyn, and stopped in front of the converted warehouse that is the global headquarters of Vice Media. Out of the vehicle stepped the media mogul Rupert Murdoch.

title: A Novel Lays Bare Media Ills
description: At first glance, The Last Magazine: A Novel by Michael Hastings would appear to lack relevance in the current media age. A fictional account of life inside a failed magazine  Newsweek  in a dying industry  print  written by a now-dead journalist, the book seems very much beside the point. And the march of history aside, does the world need another roman  clef from inside the world of Manhattan media, whose bottomless interest in itself is not generally shared by the public?

title: Second Teenager Pulled From the Bronx River Dies
description: The second of two 13-year-old cousins pulled from the Bronx River by emergency workers died Sunday, a pastor who has been acting as a family spokesman said.

title: The Iraq Crisis is Worse Than it Seems for the Kurds
description: It seems that some who support the Kurdish cause see an opportunity in the mayhem in Iraq. Commentators from abroad see the Iraqi armys meltdown and retreat from the Sunni Arab heartland north of Baghdad as a sign that things might finally fall into place for the Kurds. Here in Erbil, people were positively elated when the Kurdish armed forces, called pesh merga (meaning those who face death), consolidated their grip on oil-rich Kirkuk, after the Iraqi army gave up on the region this week.

title: Candidate Says Recordings Show Afghan Election Was Rigged
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  One of the candidates in Afghanistans disputed presidential election released on Sunday what his campaign said were recordings of phone calls in which a top election official, other election officials and aides of a rival candidate speak about stuffing ballot boxes and rigging the vote.

title: G.M. Prepares to Count Cost of Suffering
description: Mykia Jordan has no memory of the car accident that put her in a coma for three weeks, left a large scar across her jaw and caused the limp that forces her to walk with a cane at 23.

title: Gerry Conlon, 60, Imprisoned in I.R.A. Attack and Freed After 15 Years, Dies
description: Gerry Conlon, who spent a quarter of his life in prison for Irish Republican Army bombings in which he was later found to have had no involvement  and whose case inspired an Oscar-nominated film  died on Saturday at his home in Belfast, Northern Ireland. He was 60.

title: An Employee Dies, and the Company Collects the Insurance
description: Employees at The Orange County Register received an unsettling email from corporate headquarters this year. The owner of the newspaper, Freedom Communications, was writing to request workers consent to take out life insurance policies on them.

title: Popular Demand
description: The popularity and rank of mobile games changes daily, as developers battle for the interest and relative loose change of people buying apps for their smartphones and tablets.

title: As Primary Nears, Candidates Retreat to Their Campaign Comfort Zones
description: On the last Saturday before the primary for the seat he has held for 43 years, Representative Charles B. Rangel and his top rival, State Senator Adriano D. Espaillat, spent hours shaking the hands of black, white and Hispanic residents, seeking broad coalitions in a hotly contested election where accusations of racial and ethnic divisiveness have dominated debates.

title: Halt and Catch Fire Recap: Enter Donna, for Sanitys Sake
description: Season 1, Episode 4

title: Penny Dreadful Recap: Whats the Matter With Ethan?
description: Season 1, Episode 7

title: Reading, Writing and Allegations: Muslim School at Center of Debate
description: BIRMINGHAM, England  When the three government inspectors came to Park View School to look for evidence of a purported takeover by Islamists, one of them joked about the many beards among the teachers there. They looked at the loudspeakers, the ablution rooms and the prayer mats in the gym behind the volleyball net. And, according to accounts by school officials and students, the inspectors asked teenage girls in white hijabs:

title: Quotation of the Day for Monday, June 23, 2014
description: I would like to see a settlement. I was out of work. I missed so much of my sons developmental growth while I was in the hospital. I had to have my face reconstructed. And my leg just hurts.

title: China Manufacturing Hits 7-Month High
description: HONG KONG  Chinas manufacturing sector rebounded in June, showing signs of growth for the first time this year, according to a purchasing managers index released on Monday.

title: Early Results Arrive on Weight-Loss Pills That Expand in the Stomach
description: It is a tantalizingly simple idea for losing weight: Before meals, swallow a capsule that temporarily swells up in the stomach, making you feel full.

title: Too Hot to Handle
description: Hot weather kills more Americans than all other natural disasters combined, and the casualties continue to climb despite decades of warnings about how to recognize the signs of heat stress and take prompt corrective action.

title: Word of the Day | swarthy
description: swarthy \swor-the, -the\ adjective

title: Lewis Rallies at U.S. Open but Falls Short of the Title She Covets Most
description: PINEHURST, N.C.  Stacy Lewis rallied Sunday in the final round of the United States Womens Open with a red-hot four-under-par 66 in a formidable chase, but the eventual champion, Michelle Wie, proved impossible to catch.

title: World Cup 2014 Player Ratings: United States (2) vs. Portugal (2)
description: The United States appeared headed for a golden 3 points and a secured spot in the World Cups Round of 16, but that all changed after Portugal scored an equalizer in the final minute to earn a 2-2 draw Sunday.

title: Whats On Monday
description: 10 P.M. (OWN) OPERATION CHANGE Former President Bill Clinton (above, in Zambia), Richard Branson, Elton John, the Dalai Lama, Harry Connick Jr. and other celebrities join Bill and Tani Austin and their son Steven Sawalich of the Starkey Hearing Foundation as they take on projects intended to improve lives in some of the worlds poorest regions. This 10-part documentary series begins in Haiti, where the fashion designer Donna Karan, the actress Maria Bello and the entrepreneur Bill Rancic work with organizations including World Wide Village, We Advance and Urban Zen to help survivors of the 2010 earthquake. (The Starkey Hearing Foundation distributes free hearing aids to people in need.)

title: Treaty Is Making Land Mines Weapon of Past, Group Says
description: Despite the conflicts in Syria, Iraq and Afghanistan, the armed uprising in Ukraine and turmoil in other hot spots in the Middle East and Africa, one of wars most insidious weapons  antipersonnel land mines  have been largely outlawed and drastically reduced, a monitoring group said in a report released Monday.

title: China State Media Calls Hong Kong Vote Mincing Ludicrousness
description: However many people take part in Hong Kongs illegal public vote, there will never be as many as 1.3 billion, the headline in the state-run newspaper Global Times declared on Monday.

title: Corrections: June 23, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Kerry Says ISIS Threat Could Hasten Military Action
description: BAGHDAD  Winding up a day of crisis talks with Iraqi leaders, Secretary of State John Kerry said on Monday that the Sunni militants seizing territory in Iraq had become such a threat that the United States might not wait for Iraqi politicians to form a new government before taking military action.

title: The Multimillion-Dollar Minds of 5 Mathematical Masters
description: Mathematics has turned into an unusually lucrative profession for Maxim Kontsevich. First, Dr. Kontsevich, 49, who works at the Institute of Advanced Scientific Studies outside Paris, won the 2012 Shaw Prize in Mathematical Sciences, an honor accompanied by a $1 million award. Then a couple of months later, he was among nine people who received a new physics prize  and $3 million each  from Yuri Milner, a Russian who dropped out of graduate studies in physics and became a successful investor in Internet companies like Facebook.

title: Student Crossword | The 1960s
description: Test your knowledge of the 1960s by playing our crossword (PDF). You can find the answers here.

title: Soldier Accused of Killing 5 Is Captured in South Korea
description: SEOUL, South Korea  A South Korean Army sergeant accused of fleeing his unit on the border with North Korea after killing five fellow soldiers was caught alive with a self-inflicted wound on Monday, ending a manhunt that involved a shootout and shocked the country over the weekend.

title: British Roadside Assistance Company AA Raises $2.36 Billion in I.P.O.
description: LONDON  The AA, the British roadside assistance provider, raised 1.39 billion pounds, or about $2.36 billion, in its initial public offering in London on Monday.

title: Yulin Dog Meat Festival Proceeds Despite Protesters
description: A dog meat festival in southern China went ahead over the weekend even as the local government tried to lower the profile of the controversial event. Animal rights advocates protested dog meat vendors, including one who demanded that protesters meet his price for a live dog or he would strangle it, according to Chinese news reports.

title: Marilyn Monroes Photo Caper in Poland
description: In July of 2012, two wooden crates arrived in Warsaw. Nestled inside were smaller boxes: Some were labeled Pulling off Stockings, or Legs Spread  Hat in Lap. Some simply said M.M.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Funeral Poses Mimic Life
description: In Rite of the Sitting Dead: Funeral Poses Mimic Life Campbell Robertson and Frances Robles write about a small but growing trend in the funeral ritual known as the viewing.

title: Santander to Buy G.E.s Nordic Banking Business
description: LONDON  The Spanish lender Banco Santander said on Monday that it would pay about 700 million euros for General Electrics Scandinavian consumer finance business.

title: Egypt Convicts 3 Journalists; U.S. Is Critical
description: CAIRO  Secretary of State John Kerry came to Egypt this weekend to renew its important partnership with Washington and to offer its new president, Abdel Fattah el-Sisi, assurance of the swift restoration of military aid.

title: Behind the Cover Story: Adam Davidson on a Changing Job Market, Student Debt and Why Boomerang Kids Are Here to Stay
description: Adam Davidson, who writes Its the Economy for the magazine, is the author of the June 22 cover story about young adults who move back in with their parents. Davidson is a founder of NPRs Planet Money, a podcast and blog.

title: Jailed Womans Daughter Also Accused of Stirring Up Trouble
description: Just one day after a court sentenced her mother, a rights campaigner, to six and a half years in prison, the police told Liao Minyue to surrender her passport because she was provoking quarrels and stirring up trouble, Ms. Liao said by telephone, stirring fears she was being targeted next.

title: Health Minister Questions Stress on Condoms in AIDS Fight

Spains older stars, like Iker Casillas, Xavi and Xabi Alonso, will be playing a final game after winning two European championships and a World Cup, so take a good last look at tiki-taka. The start-up fields 4,000 new product ideas a week, picks three winners and then takes over all aspects of production, from making blueprints to marketing the goods through big-box retailers like Home Depot and retail websites, including Amazon, Steve Lohr reports.

title: Morning Views
description: Theres no escaping the conclusion that the stock market is not a level playing field where all investors, large and small, have an equal shot at a fair deal, writes The New York Times editorial board. The Senate Permanent Subcommittee on Investigations recently held a hearing on maker-taker pricing in which stock exchanges pay rebates to brokers for sending them buy-and-sell orders. The practice has been around for years, as a growing number of exchanges  there are now 11 public exchanges in the United States  have battled for business. What is new is the compelling evidence that the rebates are corrupting. Brokers are technically supposed to find the best stock prices for their clients, but new research shows that they are routinely sending orders to venues that paid the highest rebates. The board calls on financial regulators to monitor executions, for the good of the American economy and maintaining fair competition: Securities regulators clearly need to better enforce the best execution requirements on brokers, combined with better disclosure on brokers routing decisions and the rebates they earn. If Congress wont provide more resources for enforcement, rebates need either to be passed along to the customer or eliminated altogether.

Alstoms board said on Saturday that it had unanimously backed G.E.s offer, contingent on the French state buying Alstom shares. On Friday, Frances economy minister, Arnaud Montebourg, blessed G.E.s bid over a rival offer from Siemens and Mitsubishi Heavy Industries.

description: Former President Bill Clinton, in a video message to be broadcast this week, says he was honored and grateful to be among the voices urging the overturning of the Defense of Marriage Act, the measure he signed into law in 1996 that barred federal recognition of same-sex marriages.

description: Raymond Felton has reached a plea bargain with prosecutors that allows him to avoid jail, agreeing to plead guilty to a felony gun possession charge in return for a $5,000 fine and 500 hours of community service, his lawyer, Jim Walden, said.

title: Monday Quandary: When a Childs First Friends Fade Away
description: This post kicks off a new Motherlode feature: the weekly quandary. Well pull a question from the comments, the weekly open thread, or email that we know (or at least suspect) plagues more than just that one parent. You  the readers  provide the advice: How have you made this work better in your family?

title: Image of the Day: June 23
Stephens Loses Match, and Could Lose Ground to Other U.S. Phenoms
description: WIMBLEDON, England  The pity of it all for Sloane Stephens is that for one seemingly momentum-changing game, she played like a fierce and resolute survivor. Dangling on the edge of elimination, she saved five match points against Maria Kirilenko to force a second-set tiebreaker, where she proceeded to hold double set point.

title: Monday Motorsports: Rosberg Wins Another Mercedes Duel
description: Nico Rosberg scored his third victory of the year, winning the Austrian Grand Prix on Sunday and holding off his teammate, Lewis Hamilton.

title: Spicy Quinoa Salad With Broccoli, Cilantro and Lime
description: I love the versatility of quinoa. It can be the building-block ingredient for a salad, as it is in this main-dish salad, or it can be added to salads in smaller amounts, almost as a garnish. Its grassy flavor marries well with cilantro, itself an herb with a grassy, though more pungent, taste. I added sieved hard-boiled eggs for protein  though you could leave them out if you want to make a vegan version of this dish, and toasted pumpkin seeds for crunch.

title: Long Unarmed, 2 Generals Will Be Reunited With Their Swords
description: The pen might be mightier than the sword for a politician or a journalist, but, except for when it ends a war, not for a general  even for two solitary Civil War sentinels who have been left unarmed in New York City parks for decades.

title: Chickpea, Quinoa and Celery Salad With Middle Eastern Flavors
description: Its the sumac (available in Middle Eastern markets) and the herbs  dill, mint, chives  that give this salad its Middle Eastern accents. I love the texture and flavor of the chickpeas, which make for a substantial and comforting dish. Its all you need for lunch and makes a delicious light supper. I love abundant, thinly sliced celery in just about any lemony salad; you will appreciate it for its texture as well as its flavor. Of course, you can use canned chickpeas, but if you have the time, try cooking some dried chickpeas to see how good they taste.

title: Jazz-and-Constitution Diet Can Keep a Mind Sharp
description: Early in The Pleasures of Being Out of Step, a documentary about the writer, critic and record producer Nat Hentoff that opens on Wednesday, Mr. Hentoff declares that the Constitution and jazz are my main reasons for being. That may seem an odd pairing to anyone unfamiliar with the man or his work, but Mr. Hentoff has nurtured those twin passions since the 1940s.

title: Red Quinoa Salad With Walnuts, Asparagus and Dukkah
description: I had initially envisioned a salad in which the asparagus was cut into short lengths and tossed with the quinoa. But the colorful asparagus got lost in the quinoa, and since I love the look of the bright green asparagus against the red grain (O.K., pseudograin), I remade this and garnished it with the steamed asparagus. The quinoa, tossed with chives, parsley, walnuts and a lemony vinaigrette, is sprinkled with dukkah before serving, a surprising touch.

title: New Hurdle in Investors Class Actions
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Monday made it harder for investors to band together to pursue claims that they were misled when they bought or sold securities. But the justices did not accept a broader challenge, one that could have put an end to most class actions for securities fraud.

title: Sketching Supermans Power
description: The illustrator John Romita Jr., a decades-long veteran of Marvel Comics, is now making his DC Comics debut. His first assignment: Drawing Superman.

title: Unesco Panel Taps Incan Road, Other Sites, as Worthy of Protection
description: At its annual meeting, the World Heritage Committee under the United Nations has so far designated 29 new sites as being natural or cultural wonders worthy of special protection, including the Qhapaq an, or the Andean road system of the Incas.

title: In Japan, Hundreds of Shareholder Meetings on Same Day
description: Investors who own shares in Japanese corporations might want to clear their calendars next Friday.

title: A Candidate for Governor Has Both Parties on Alert
description: DENVER  Tom Tancredo, the firebrand former congressman, Harley-Davidson biker and perennial headache for Colorados Republican leaders, was taking fire from all sides last week in the final days of his primary campaign for governor. His rivals were slamming him on the airwaves. Moderate Republicans were warning that Mr. Tancredos name on the ballot could doom their chances in crucial races across this swing state.
