description: Looks from Milan Mens Fashion Week.

title: Were actually a unique race of people. And if you go down about the third definition, thats a people that are bound together that have a common sense of unity, a common sense of history, a common language.
description: TK

title: Wies Win Advances Surge by American Women
description: PINEHURST, N.C.  The mens and womens United States Opens, held in consecutive weeks at Pinehurst No. 2, could not have produced a more fitting finale. After Martin Kaymer won the mens title June 15, the last woman standing Sunday was Michelle Wie, the only player in the field to have competed in multiple professional mens events.

title: Missonis Summer Surf Safari
description: MILAN  Mamma mia, cowabunga. Angela Missoni is in the grips of surf mania. Following the surfer stylings of her fall Missoni collection, the designer continued the theme for spring. We started in winter, why not follow him in summer? she asked.

title: Pro-Russian Rebels in Ukraine Match Government Cease-Fire
description: DONETSK, Ukraine  Pro-Russian separatists declared a cease-fire Monday in a surprise move that they said they hoped would lead to a settlement of the conflict in eastern Ukraine.

title: Stanley Marsh, Cadillac Rancher, Dies at 76, Shadowed by Charges
description: Stanley Marsh, the proudly eccentric and locally prominent millionaire who was best known for commissioning the public art project known as the Cadillac Ranch outside his hometown, the Texas Panhandle city of Amarillo, but whose reputation was badly tarnished by accusations that he had sexually abused teenage boys, died on June 17 in Amarillo. He was 76.

title: Homer Happiness Lives Only in Memory
description: OMAHA  At the College World Series, where home runs are nearing extinction, the soft clink of baseballs bunted off metal bats is again the predominant sound. And that sound is wearing on coaches, players, fans and N.C.A.A. officials.

title: When Advertising on Facebook Can Be a Waste of Money
description: In January, we published an interview with a social media marketer, Jeff Gibbard, asking him to assess Facebooks revamped ad platform. While Mr. Gibbard questioned the value of advertising on Facebook, a reader went even further, commenting: Until Facebook allows independent third-party auditing of its ads and takes the necessary technical procedures to block ad bots, the Facebook platform is valueless and we are staying away from it.

title: Official on Korean Soldier Who Killed 5
description: Kim Min-Seok, the South Korean defense ministry spokesman, said the armed soldier attempted suicide as his family pleaded with him to surrender after he killed five colleagues.

title: Polands Prime Minister Says He Wont Dismiss Officials Caught on Leaked Tapes
description: WARSAW  Prime Minister Donald Tusk of Poland said Monday that he would not dismiss any of the ministers whose bluntly political and occasionally profane conversations were caught on tape in the back rooms of expensive Warsaw restaurants, unless they are caught engaging in illegal behavior.

title: American Indians in Confederate Territory
description: On the morning of June 18, 1864, Pvt. Payson Wolf trudged through the streets of Petersburg, Va., with other battered and bloodied Union prisoners of war. The captives were herded into an old tobacco barn with hundreds of other bluecoats to await their fate in the hands of Confederate military authorities.

title: Finding Old Posts on the Facebook Timeline
description: Q. I was scrolling back through my Facebook Timeline in my web browser and noticed some of my previous posts and photos werent there. How do I get them all back?

title: Oracles Deal Wont Do Much for Its Cloud Computing Efforts
description: Oracles $5.3 billion deal for Micros Systems provides an uncertain forecast for shareholders in the database giant. Even if its the start of a new deal binge by Oracles chief, Lawrence J. Ellison, its not at a crazy valuation. But Mircos, a longtime partner, is more of an add-on than a way to supercharge Oracles effort in cloud computing.

title: Milan Mens Fashion Week: Canali Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the mens fashion week photo diary of Valerio Mezzanotti.

title: A Mystery Character in the Story
description: As the immortal Sherlock Holmes remarks to Dr. Watson in A Scandal in Bohemia, it is a mistake to theorize from incomplete data: Insensibly one begins to twist facts to suit theories, instead of theories to suit facts. This wise caution applies equally to world-class scientists and ambitious writers hoping to trim a complicated historical era to fit the standard-issue best-seller mold.

title: Heartbroken, but Hardly Hopeless
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Forget about that last goal. Pretend it never happened, as if that soccer ball never ricocheted off the head of a perfectly positioned Portuguese player and into the United States net. Do not dwell on those last 30 seconds of that game on Sunday night in the Amazon that stomped on the throat of an otherwise sublime night.

title: Scaring Away Black Voters in Mississippi
description: Several right-wing groups have banded together to form a voter integrity project in response to the news that Republican Senator Thad Cochran is courting black Democratic voters in his runoff with the Tea partier Chris McDaniel.

title: Kerry on Iraq Crisis
description: Secretary of State John Kerry spoke at a news conference in Baghdad about the future of Iraq, imploring its leaders to unite against ISIS.

title: How to Make Perfect Burgers Indoors
description: Sam Sifton shows you how to make juicy hamburgers by cooking in rendered fat in a cast-iron pan.

title: Deconstructing the Perfect Burger
description: How to make a great hamburger is a question that has bedeviled the nation for generations, for as long as Americans have had griddles and broilers, for as long as summertime shorts-wearing cooks have gone into the yard to grill.

title: Brazil vs. Cameroon: World Cup 2014 Live Blog
description: To get first place in the group, Brazil must win, preferably by a few goals to be absolutely certain.

title: Mosquito Bait
description: Q. Is there anything people can eat or drink to cut the odds of mosquito bites?

title: Criticism for Detroit Article With No Black Presence
description: Since Monica Drake became The Timess travel editor about a year ago, she has tried to broaden and diversify the sections offerings.

title: Weekly News Quiz | June 17-23, 2014
description: How well did you follow the news this week?

title: Mexico vs. Croatia: World Cup 2014 Live Blog
description: Mexico needs a win or draw to be sure to advance. Croatia must win.

title: What Were Reading Now
description: A new painkiller is about to hit the market that the F.D.A. approved despite the recommendations of an agency panel, and doctors are afraid it will be the latest gateway to doctor-sanctioned opioid abuse.

title: Gallery | An Exhibit of Instagram Photos of Kimye with LiLo, Lorde, Damien Hirst and More
description: In this new era, in which a picture is worth a thousand likes (or in the case of Kim Kardashian and Kanye Wests wedding photo, more than two million), its easier than ever to peer into the lives of others, even those in the public realm. Now, Liberatum, the self-described cultural diplomacy organization, has invited a few big names from the world of New York nightlife to contribute exclusive personal snaps to a monthlong exhibition that opens this Thursday at the recently renovated salon at the W New York, the Living Room. Titled Tagged, the show sets out to explore the new cultural etiquettes that technology has put on the New York scene, according to Liberatum founder Pablo Ganguli. With some venues banning photos and others encouraging it, people are still treading the water lightly to determine what is and isnt appropriate when it comes to mixing social life, photography and technology.

title: A High-Living Idealist, Running Guns in 1938
description: The title of Alan Fursts latest World War II novel, Midnight in Europe, could apply to any of them. But dont be fooled by its generic sound: Mr. Furst, who has by now approached that era and the dread preceding it from so many different cultural and geographical perspectives, remains at the top of his game. This is another fine addition to his elegant, gripping, interwoven set of novels that will someday form a kaleidoscopic map of European powers forced into desperate alliances as they fight for their lives.

title: Examining a Scandal Within a Scandal About Emails at the I.R.S.
description: WASHINGTON  The commissioner of the Internal Revenue Service, John Koskinen, testified before the House Oversight Committee on Monday to answer questions about how two years worth of emails sent and received by Lois Lerner, the former official at the center of a growing I.R.S. scandal, could have been destroyed, and why the agency waited until just recently to tell Congress.

title: In G.E.s Deal for Alstom, French Interventionism Wins Out
description: PARIS  After nearly two months of battle, both the French government and General Electric can finally declare victory.

title: Review of Handling of Sandusky Case
description: The Pennsylvania special deputy attorney general, H. Geoffrey Moulton Jr., said a review of the handling of the Jerry Sandusky sex abuse case found no evidence that politics had affected the inquiry.

title: Preacher Challenges Pakistani Leaders
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  All the makings of a grand entrance were in place when the preacher and political dramatist Muhammad Tahir-ul Qadri boarded an Emirates jet bound for Islamabad: Thousands of his followers awaited his return on Monday, ready to reignite a protest movement that riveted Pakistan for weeks last year.

title: Milan Mens Fashion Week: Gucci Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the mens fashion week photo diary of Sonny Vandevelde.

title: Bigger Than Baseball: 25 Million Watch U.S.-Portugal World Cup Match
description: With an audience of 25 million viewers for Sundays game between the United States and Portugal, the World Cup is moving into elite territory as a sports property on American television. Ratings for the game were the highest for any soccer game telecast in America and reached more viewers than events like the N.B.A. finals or the World Series.

title: Cool at 13, Adrift at 23
description: At 13, they were viewed by classmates with envy, admiration and not a little awe. The girls wore makeup, had boyfriends and went to parties held by older students. The boys boasted about sneaking beers on a Saturday night and swiping condoms from the local convenience store.

title: Dov Charney, American Apparel Founder, Fights to Get His Job Back
description: Dov Charney, the founder and longtime chief executive of American Apparel who was ousted last week by the companys board, filed a formal notice on Monday indicating that he did not plan to leave quietly.

title: Stunning New Video View of Swimming Polar Bears
description: Lest you wonder why federal wildlife conservation agencies include polar bears under the Marine Mammal Protection Act, have a look at this video.

title: Box Office Boom For All the Way as Closing Nears
description: All the Way, the Broadway drama about President Lyndon Baines Johnson that won Tony Awards this month for best play and best actor for its star, Bryan Cranston, set an all-time record last week for gross ticket sales by a new play.

title: Barack Obama in 2001
description: In a 2001 interview, a young Barack Obama considers his legacy.

title: When Ruby Dee met Ossie Davis
description: In an interview from 2002, Ossie Davis and Ruby Dee reflect on how they first met acting in a play together.

title: Maya Angelous Earliest Memory
description: In an interview from 2010, Maya Angelou describes her earliest childhood memory and how her older brother, Bailey, was her greatest hero.

title: Library of Congress to Display Interviews With Blacks, Noted and Unsung
description: Maya Angelous earliest childhood memory took place on a train when she was 3 years old. When her brother, Bailey, whom she described as my black kingdom come, went to the bathroom, Ms. Angelou thought he had been taken away by a porter. It scared me to death, she recounted in a video interview recorded in 2010. I wasnt afraid that my mother wouldnt come back or my father or anyone else. It was always Bailey.

title: JetBlue Adds Flat-Bed Seats
description: LOS ANGELES  For the well-heeled traveler flying between New York and Los Angeles, for whom onboard Wi-Fi, roomy leather seats, a Zagat-approved meal and a piping hot washcloth are not enough, airlines have an announcement.

title: Annoyed With Flying? Dont Get Mad, Get Advice
description: THE list of things that annoy me when traveling is lengthy.

title: Pictures of the Day: Egypt and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Egypt, Iraq, Afghanistan and India.

title: Challenged to Tetris by Pint-Size Rivals, and Sparing None
description: IM the guy you want to meet at the airport, since I get all kinds of free drink coupons. I get so many of these things I just give them to fellow passengers. Im a friendly person, but thats about all I do to connect with other fliers.

title: U.S. Tie Leaves Emotions Unsettled
description: MANAUS, Brazil  Andy Smith stood among a throng of American fans Sunday night, checking the stopwatch on his smartphone, thinking surely this game would end in ecstatic victory.

title: Reform Conservatism and Immigration
description: This will hopefully be the week in which I settle all family business  by which I mean that I intend to write the responses to liberal critics of reform conservatism than Ive been promising since long before World Cup season. Having discussed immigration policy in yesterdays column, Ill start with that issue, and with William Galstons Wall Street Journal essay from late last month, which offered praise for the recent reformocon manifesto Room to Grow but also suggested that reform conservatives were too often coloring within the lines and in particular, that if immigration is to todays Republicans as welfare was to the Democrats of the early 1990s, someone will have to go further.

title: Church Rethinks Development Plan; Legal Fight Ensues
description: Seven stained-glass windows more than a story high surround the apse of St. Michaels Episcopal Church at the corner of Amsterdam Avenue and 99th Street in Manhattan. The panels, created a century ago by Louis Comfort Tiffany, depict in vivid hues the celestial triumph of the archangel for whom the 206-year-old church is named.

title: Mormons Expel Founder of Group Seeking Priesthood for Women
description: Kate Kelly, who unsettled the Mormon Church by founding a movement to advocate opening the male-only priesthood to women, was excommunicated by her bishop and his two counselors in Virginia on Monday.

title: I Had Alice in Wonderland Syndrome
description: A few months ago, my 10-year-old daughter, Paulina, was suffering from a bad headache right before bedtime. She went to lie down and I sat beside her, stroking her head. After a few minutes, she looked up at me and said, Everything in the room looks really small.

title: In Performance | Margo Seibert
description: Margo Seibert, with Chris Fenwick on piano, sings Raining from the Broadway musical Rocky, at the Winter Garden Theater.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Welcome to NYT Now, the new app from The New York Times.

title: Happenings | A Secret Chalet Off Hollywood Boulevard Where the L.A. Art World Gathers
description: Around the corner from a blighted stretch of the Hollywood Walk of Fame, through a back entrance that opens onto a seedy parking lot, theres a space that feels rather like an alpine chalet. Created by the artist Piero Golia, the unlikely oasis is a salon for those in the know located in the storage of L.A.C.E. (Los Angeles Contemporary Exhibitions), an artist-run space that has been operating since the late 1970s.

title: Vitamin D Screening Not Backed by Expert Panel
description: A government health panel on Monday chose not to endorse widespread screening for vitamin D levels in healthy adults, despite research suggesting that a majority of Americans may be deficient in the vitamin.

title: A Win for Latin Americas Middle Class
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  To fulfill his dream of watching Colombia play in the World Cup, Marco Triana Lozada, an engineer from Bogot, cobbled together savings to travel to Brazil this month. But to avoid spending money on hotels, he and his friends have traversed the country at night on buses to watch Colombia play, even opting to stay in tents at campsites.

title: Oral Vaccine for Cholera Found Effective in Africa
description: A new, inexpensive, easy-to-use cholera vaccine that is stockpiled for emergencies worked very well during a cholera outbreak in Africa, Doctors Without Borders reported recently.

title: In Performance: Margo Seibert of Rocky
description: This weeks video features the actress Margo Seibert, with Chris Fenwick on piano, singing the number Raining from the Broadway musical adaptation of the 1976 movie Rocky, about a Philadelphia boxer.

title: Shire Said to Hire Goldman Sachs as an Adviser
description: Goldman Sachs has been hired by Shire as the London-listed drug maker confronts a takeover offer, according to people briefed on the matter.

description: The Sothebys International Realty brand presents Extraordinary Angles the lifestyle video series showcasing unique properties and lifestyles from around the world. In this episode, host Mark Thomas takes viewers through some of the worlds finest cooking environments.

description: The Sothebys International Realty brand presents Extraordinary Angles the lifestyle video series showcasing unique properties and lifestyles from around the world. In this episode, host Mark Thomas visits the most exquisite estates for ski enthusiasts.

description: The Sothebys International Realty brand presents Extraordinary Angles the lifestyle video series showcasing unique properties and lifestyles from around the world. In this episode, host Mark Thomas showcases the most breathtaking ocean front properties from Florida to Thailand.

description: To the Editor:

title: The Exquisite Villa LaBarba in Rancho Palos Verdes
description: Entering through custom gates, a private driveway leads you to the inspiring Italian villa that is surrounded by lush gardens, beautiful Venetian fountains and an impressive Merlot grape vineyard.

title: Generation Z: The Latest Branding Opportunity?
description: The agency Sparks & Honey fascinated and disgusted observers in equal measure last week with a presentation thatcatalogued the interests and values of Generation Z, whose members were born after 1995. But more than anything about these youths themselves, the latest foray into generational forecasting shows that generations are often essentially marketing opportunities.

title: U.S. Military Deaths in Afghanistan
description: The Department of Defense has identified 2,320 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It confirmed the deaths of the following Americans recently:

title: Three Traders Leave Steven Cohens Office in Boston
description: Three technology stock traders have left the Boston office of Steven A. Cohens nearly $10 billion family office over the last week in a new round of defections at a firm that is still dealing with the fallout from a significant insider trading investigation.

description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

title: Good Night, Margaret
description: When Margaret Muffi Lavigne and Chris Plum, both with muscular dystrophy, met at the Hospital for Special Care in New Britain, Conn., their lives took an unexpected turn.

title: Integrity of the I.R.S. Chief
description: To the Editor:

title: Food Ads and Obesity
description: To the Editor:

title: In Kodaks Hometown, Memory and History
description: Alex Webb and Rebecca Norris Webb went to Rochester to document the fabled, if worn, home of Kodak. They returned to explore a city with a rich history and culture.

title: Extraordinary Angles Inspired by Wine Cellars
description: The Sothebys International Realty brand presents Extraordinary Angles the lifestyle video series showcasing unique properties and lifestyles from around the world. In this episode, host Mark Thomas explores impressive wine cellars with Wine expert Eli Rodriguez from Sothebys Wine in New York City.

title: A Duo, Dynamism and a Dead Body
description: And now lets raise a cold one  a double vodka, I think  to the wackiest bromance in summer comedy. No, not Jonah Hill and Channing Tatum in 22 Jump Street. Thats kid stuff. I mean Mikhail Baryshnikov and Willem Dafoe.

title: Songs Stamped With Casual Authority
description: Near the midpoint of a no-nonsense show at the Highline Ballroom on Friday night, Brandy Clark dismissed her backing band and got down to basics: her voice, her guitar and what she called songs that Ive written for other people.

title: Timeless Deer Valley Ski-In Ski-Out Retreat in Park City, Utah
description: Located in the exclusive gated Bald Eagle community, this residence offers an elegant architectural design and layout along with charming private interior and exterior living spaces.

title: The Family Business Is a Country
description: If one of Saddam Husseins two sons, Uday and Qusay, had turned against dictatorship and emigrated to the United States, the history of Iraq might have taken a different turn. Maybe.

title: New Albums by Riff Raff, Black Bananas and Phox
description: RIFF RAFF

title: Supreme Court Tinkering With Securities Class Actions
description: The plaintiffs lawyers will live to sue another day.

title: The Collections | The Top 10 Attractions at Design Miami/Basel
description: The Design Miami/Basel fair  the annual European companion to Design Miami in Basel, Switzerland  has a single objective: facilitating the sale of expensive design objects to wealthy collectors. Yet much like its neighbor, Art Basel, the show can also serve as a resource for enthusiasts and curious window shoppers, who come to see and enjoy the works on view, or survey whats happening in design now (lots of experimentation with everyday materials, apparently). Without the placards or checklists one would normally find in a gallery or museum, though, it would have been entirely possible for non-experts to meander in and out of the fairs 50-something booths this year without knowing for sure whats old and whats new, or which pieces represent real breakthroughs in materials and process. There were many more novel contemporary works on view than ever before, balancing out the usual glut of 20th-century icons, but it wasnt necessarily obvious unless you scoured the $30 show catalog.

title: From Roars to Rhythmic Mallets, a Day for Savoring Exploration
description: Displaced last year by construction, the annual Bang on a Can Marathon was back at the glass-enclosed Winter Garden at Brookfield Place on Sunday. This meant the events singular vibe was back, too: both attentive and easygoing, art and commerce.

title: Microsoft Makes Bet Quantum Computing Is Next Breakthrough
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif.  Modern computers are not unlike the looms of the industrial revolution: They follow programmed instructions to weave intricate patterns. With a loom, you see the result in a cloth or carpet. With a computer, you see it on an electronic display.

title: Longing Far Above Her Station, Simply but Achingly
description: American Ballet Theaters performances of Giselle at the Metropolitan Opera House last week featured several debuts in the title role and saved the best for last, with Saturdays return of Alina Cojocaru (who stars in Swan Lake this week at the Met). In every case, the interpretation was simpler than the ornate, fervent, virtuosic rendition of Diana Vishneva on opening night. But there are different ways of being simple.

title: If Its Broke, Reality TV Can Fix It
description: Watch enough reality television, and one conclusion is inescapable: We cant do anything right. Run a restaurant. Operate a bar. Manage a hotel.

title: Neymar Is Making the Most of His Chances
description: Neymar scores his fourth goal of the tournament, putting Brazil up, 2-1.

title: Early Music and Its Future
description: The new Early Music Festival: NYC, which ended last week, gives reason for cautious hope. You cant be categorical about its prospects one way or the other, because several more or less similar ventures have come and gone in recent years.

title: At These Hospitals, Recovery Is Rare, but Comfort Is Not
description: NEW BRITAIN, CONN.  Propped up in a hospital bed, a 75-year-old man with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, or Lou Gehrigs disease, must make an agonizing decision. Should he keep struggling until the illness inevitably kills him, dependent on a ventilator, unable to walk or eat or move? Or should he choose a day and a time to have the ventilator disconnected, and die?

title: A Few Hot Months of Solidarity and Violence
description: The PBS documentary Freedom Summer wont make many lists of the top television programs of the year, but its hard to imagine two hours better spent in front of a screen.

title: Milan Mens Fashion Week Spring 2015 Accessories
description: Standout accessories from Roberto Cavalli, Giorgio Armani, DSquared2 and more.

title: A Sunken Kingdom Re-emerges
description: BORTH, WALES  There is a poem children in Wales learn about the sunken kingdom of Cantrer Gwaelod, swallowed by the sea and drowned forever after. On a quiet night, legend has it, one can hear the kingdoms church bells ringing.

title: Diplomatic Note Promises Immunity From Iraqi Law for U.S. Advisory Troops
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration said on Monday that it has accepted from the Iraqi government the same sort of immunity agreement for newly dispatched Special Operations troops that it refused to accept in 2011, when it opted to withdraw all American troops from Iraq rather than keep a residual force behind.

title: Herpes Infected Since Before We Were Human
description: About two-thirds of people are infected with one of two herpes simplex viruses, oral (HSV-1) or genital (HSV-2). New research says both viruses have been infecting humans and our ancestors for longer than previously thought. HSV-1 has been infecting hominids since before they split from the chimpanzee lineage six million years ago, a new study says. HSV-2 was introduced more recently, the researchers said, making the jump from chimpanzees to human ancestors about 1.6 million years ago.

title: Brazil Romps Past Cameroon and Into Knockout Rounds
description: BRASLIA  An anxious nation and its capital exhaled on Monday. Their beloved national soccer team, which has not played with the precision and dominance that many had hoped for in the World Cup, nevertheless moved on to the next round with a convincing win.

title: Girl, 14, Is Stabbed Near a Bronx School
description: A 14-year-old girl was stabbed and seriously wounded on Monday afternoon near a junior high school in the Bronx, the authorities said.

title: Still Exerting a Hold on Science
description: Not long after the bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki, while the world was reckoning with the specter of nuclear energy, a businessman named Roger Babson was worrying about another of natures forces: gravity.

title: Support for New Mothers
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Where Personal Memories Take Root
description: When it comes to forming memories that involve recalling a personal experience, neuroscientists are of two minds. Some say that each memory is stored in a single neuron in a region of the brain called the hippocampus. But a new study is lending weight to the theory of neuroscientists who believe that every memory is spread out, or distributed, across many neurons in that part of the brain.

title: The Neanderthal Inside Us
description: Svante Paabo is a Swedish biologist who studies evolutionary genetics.

title: Monets Nympheas Kicks Off Summer Sales in London
description: LONDON  One of Monets dreamy paintings depicting the water lily pond in his fabled garden at Giverny that failed to sell at Christies four years ago, caused a bidding war at Sothebys here on Monday night.

title: Sounds of Danger Disrupt Crabs Dinner
description: Mud crabs dont have ears, but they can still detect and react to noises. When exposed to sounds made by preying fish, the crabs were less likely to feed on their own meals, researchers at Northeastern University reported last week in The Proceedings of the Royal Society B. Listening for danger is a critical part of the crabs survival strategy that could be hindered by increasing ocean noise, the scientists concluded.

title: Dont Turn Up Your Nose at the City in Summer
description: NEW YORK CITY has always had a challenging relationship with odor, which given its density, could hardly be otherwise. And as summer gets going, so does the season of smell.

title: Full Poll Results
description: The New York Times/CBS News poll of 1,009 adults was conducted June 20 to 22 on landlines and cellphones.

title: Generic Versions of Toprol XL, a Heart Drug, Are Recalled
description: For years, Dr. Harry Lever, a cardiologist at the Cleveland Clinic, has been warning nearly anyone who would listen of his growing suspicions about generic versions of a widely used heart drug, Toprol XL.

title: How the Poll Was Conducted
description: The latest New York Times/CBS News Poll is based on telephone interviews conducted June 20 to June 22 with 1,009 adults throughout the United States.

title: Poll Finds Dissatisfaction Over Iraq
description: Dissatisfaction with President Obamas conduct of foreign policy has shot up among both Republicans and Democrats in the past month, even though a slim majority supports his recent decision to send military advisers to Iraq to confront the growing threat from militants there, according to the latest New York Times/CBS News poll.

title: College Group Run for Profit Reaches Deal for U.S. Cash
description: Moving to head off a cash shortfall that would disrupt classes for its 72,000 students, Corinthian Colleges announced on Monday that it had reached an agreement with the federal Department of Education that would allow it to continue operating, at least temporarily.

title: Palestinian Freed in 2011 Is Charged by Israel in a Killing
description: JERUSALEM  A Palestinian man who was among the prisoners released in 2011 in exchange for an abducted Israeli soldier was charged Monday along with his son in the April killing of an Israeli police commander as he drove to a Passover Seder in a West Bank settlement.

title: In Wimbledon Lottery, Lucky Losers Win a Second Chance
description: WIMBLEDON, England  Luck in tennis is most commonly associated with balls that hit the net cord and dribble over, or shots that hit the racket frame and land square on the line. But there is no luck in tennis quite as important as the luck of the draw.

title: A Fired Banker and Monroe Capitals Public Suit
description: When Warren Woo, a deal maker at UBS, left the Swiss bank in 2007 to start his own firm, he named his family office Breakaway Capital.

title: Mavericks Could Fracture a G.O.P. Senate Majority
description: WASHINGTON  Fear of losing a seat to a Democrat because of a Tea Party upset is one reason congressional Republicans are warily watching Tuesdays Mississippi Senate runoff and other primary challenges to incumbents. But it is not the sole reason, and perhaps not the most important one, for Republicans this election cycle.

title: Felix Dennis, 67, Flamboyant Builder of Magazine Empire, Dies
description: Felix Dennis, a flamboyant, boastfully profligate, immensely successful British businessman who built a publishing empire that included Maxim, Americas most successful young mens lifestyle magazine, died on Sunday at his home in Dorsington, Stratford-upon-Avon, England. He was 67.

title: F.B.I. Cracks Down on Sex Trafficking
description: The F.B.I. director, James B. Comey, on Monday said that in the past week law enforcement authorities had arrested 281 pimps and recovered 168 child prostitutes in a nationwide sex trafficking sting. The arrests and recoveries were made in 106 cities, and roughly 10 percent of the prostitutes had been missing from child protective services, the authorities said. In Phoenix, 21 pimps were apprehended, and in Denver 18 prostitutes were recovered, the highest numbers in the operation. More than a dozen children were recovered in other cities, including Chicago and Cleveland.

title: A Rockefeller Known Not for Wealth but for His Efforts to Help
description: POCANTICO HILLS, N.Y.  As a late afternoon sun tinted the room in gold, the children and grandchildren of David Rockefeller, the banker and philanthropist, gathered around a long table this month for a dinner of scallops and vegetables and toasted his 99th birthday.

title: Massachusetts: Men Get 3 Years for Theft From Marathon Fund
description: Two brothers convicted of filing a false $2 million claim to the Boston Marathon victims compensation fund were sentenced Monday to three years in jail plus 468 hours of community service to help amputees and people with brain injuries. Judge Jeffrey A. Locke of Suffolk County Superior Court gave Branden Mattier, 23, and Domunique Grice, 28, a choice of six years in jail or three years in jail, after which they would serve six hours of community service every other Saturday for three years. The judge said the service could include building ramps for people who are handicapped, serving as an aide in a rehabilitation facility or changing bedpans.

title: On Balance, a Good Ruling on Emissions
description: The Clean Air Act is a complex and often confusing piece of legislation, especially when it comes to confronting the challenges of global warming, which were not fully understood when the original law was passed in 1970.

title: Dean Foods Receives a Subpoena in an Investigation Into Mickelsons Trades
description: Federal authorities are seeking information from Dean Foods as part of an investigation into well-timed trades placed by the championship golfer Phil Mickelson and the well-known sports gambler William T. Walters.

title: Bedouin Trackers Hunting for Clues to Kidnapped Boys
description: BEIT KAHIL, WEST BANK  Maj. Mohammed Mazarib of the Israel Defense Forces ducked into an old stone hut on a hillside above a riverbed here Monday afternoon, quickly determining that footprints inside belonged to soldiers who had beat him there. He nonetheless drew his rifle and shone its spotlight into a hole on the far side of the hut, then grabbed a stick to poke around.

title: Gnarly in Pink
description: This short film celebrates the Pink Helmet Posse, three 6-year-old girls who share an unusual passion: skateboarding.

title: Mississippi Race Points to Appeal of Partisanship
description: FLOWOOD, Miss.  Regardless of who wins Tuesdays unpredictable Republican Senate runoff in Mississippi, the fracas has sent a message to incumbents in Congress: It is no longer enough to be a diligent member, quietly representing your constituents interests. You have to join the partisan fray.

title: A Fired Banker and a Firms Public Suit
description: When Warren Woo, a deal maker at UBS, left the Swiss bank in 2007 to start his own firm, he named his family office Breakaway Capital.

title: Transit Hub and Work on No. 7 Line Face Delays
description: Two of the biggest transit projects in New York City are poised to miss approaching deadlines, the latest in a string of delays involving Metropolitan Transportation Authority capital projects.

title: Gnarly in Pink
description: Last fall, when passing by a skate park in Encinitas, Calif., near San Diego, we were delighted to find three little girls skateboarding in pink tutus and helmets. We immediately decided to tell their story  in a documentary style as playful and eclectic as our subjects.

title: In Iraqs Sectarian Violence, a Show of Each Sides Worst
description: BAGHDAD  Sectarian violence in Iraq on Monday showed both sides in the conflict at their brutal worst, as Iraqi police officers were reported to have killed scores of Sunni insurgent prisoners along a highway in the south, and militants in the north turned over the bodies of 15 Shiite civilians they had killed, including women and children, only to bomb the cemetery during their funerals, according to one account.

title: Neil Barofsky, Old Foe of Bank Bailouts, Said to Be a Monitor for Credit Suisse
description: Neil Barofsky was a government gadfly who made a career of needling, and at times pillorying, Wall Street and Washington over the 2008 bank bailouts.

title: Realizing the American Apparel Chief, Dov Charney, Isnt Wearing Any Clothes
description: Dov Charney is completely naked. He is dancing in what looks like an office or studio, talking on his cellphone while he jams to This Must Be the Place by Talking Heads. Two women are there with him, possibly employees.

title: A Thin Rationale for Drone Killings
description: The Obama administration on Monday reluctantly released its justification for killing an American citizen, Anwar al-Awlaki, whom it considered a terrorist, in a 2011 drone strike in Yemen. But the rationale provides little confidence that the lethal action was taken with real care.

title: Obama Meets Working Families at Chipotle
description: President Obama talked with working parents at a Washington Chipotle restaurant ahead of his White House meeting on working families.

title: Rhapsody in Realism
description: A few years ago, I came across an article on a blog that appealed tremendously. It was on a subject that obviously I have a lot to learn about. But it was actually the tone and underlying worldview that was so instructive, not just the substance.

title: Personal Tack by Obama in an Effort to Aid Parents
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama, to hear him tell it, is just another dad trying to juggle the demands of work and family.

title: New Leader, New Attack on Exports
description: In the real world, markets arent perfect.

title: Alabama: Police Chief to Step Down
description: Mayor Todd Strange of Montgomery said Monday that Chief Kevin J. Murphy of the police would retire amid allegations of mismanagement. Mayor Strange said officials had received complaints about Chief Murphy, and a city inquiry found evidence of abusive supervision. Chief Murphy acknowledged that he was strict but denied mistreating employees. Chief Murphy will remain on administrative leave for several months before retiring. He has been on leave for much of June after his twin brother, who was facing a felony charge following an automobile accident, committed suicide.

title: More Egyptian Injustice
description: The conviction of three journalists by an Egyptian court on Monday for doing their jobs is the latest effort by the countrys military-backed rulers to crush all dissent. The alarming verdict sends a chilling and intimidating message not just to other journalists working in the country but to Egyptian citizens as well.

title: Mexico Finds Itself Knee-Deep in Victory
description: RECIFE, Brazil  When Andrs Guardado of Mexico finally freed himself from a swarm of teammates Monday and emerged back under the floodlights of the crammed stadium here, he crouched along the sideline, pointed a finger down to his knees as he comically wiggled his legs, and vigorously shook his head from side to side.

title: Lofty Salaries in the Ivory Towers
Rifts Among Shiites Further Threaten the Future of Iraq
description: NAJAF, Iraq  From his modest office in the shrine city of Najaf, Iraqs highest religious authority, Grand Ayatollah Ali al-Sistani, leader of the countrys Shiite establishment, issued a call to arms asking his followers to join with the government military to stop the blitzkrieg by the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria.

title: In Time Warp of Soccer, It Aint Over Till ... Who Knows?
description: MANAUS, Brazil  Imagine if an N.F.L. coach never knew when to call for the last-second pass, or an N.B.A. star had to guess when to throw up his desperation half-court shot.

title: The President and the Situation in Iraq
description: Based on nationwide telephone and cellphone interviews conducted June 20-22 with 1,009 adults.

title: Officers Are Targeted in Contraband Sweep at Rikers Island
description: The authorities fanned out across one of the largest jail facilities on Rikers Island and searched over 100 correction officers for contraband on Monday as part of a large scale investigation into drug trafficking and other criminal activity inside the complex.

title: Brazil: Polio Virus Detected in Sewage
description: For the first time since 1994, the polio virus has been detected in Brazil, the World Health Organization said Monday. The virus  minute amounts of which can be detected  was found in a sewage sample from an airport near Campinas, in southeastern Brazil. It was collected in March and matched a strain recently found in Equatorial Guinea on the central African coast. There are no reports of any cases of paralysis; for every child paralyzed by polio, health authorities estimate that 200 more are carrying and shedding the virus with few or no symptoms. Because about 95 percent of Brazilian children are immunized against polio, the W.H.O. says it is very unlikely that the virus will spread widely and has not suggested any restrictions on travel to or from the country.

title: Egypt: Conviction in Sectarianism Case
description: A court in the city of Minya on Monday convicted a Christian reporter of promoting sectarianism and sentenced him to five years in prison. Egypts flagship state newspaper Al Ahram said that the reporter, Bishoy Armia, was charged with communicating with an American television station in order to depict Egyptian Christians as victims of discrimination and thus instigate sectarianism. The newspaper said that the reporter had converted to Christianity and that his former name was Mohamed Hegazy el-Sayed.

title: Secret Military Mission
description: TUESDAYS PUZZLE  Heather Valadez makes her New York Times debut and, I believe, her constructing debut today with an early-week puzzle that got the Mission Impossible theme song playing in my head.

title: Union Square Cafe Joins Other Victims of New York Citys Rising Rents
description: It is one of the hard truths of New York real estate: Restaurants help revitalize neighborhoods, then are forced to close when their rents skyrocket.

title: High-Scoring Netherlands Avoids a Matchup With Brazil
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  The Dutch have been here before in a World Cup. In South Africa four years ago on their way to the final, they also swept all three of their games in the first round.

title: San Francisco Plans to Ban Certain Parking Apps
description: A few weeks ago I arranged to meet a friend for dinner at 8 p.m. in the Panhandle neighborhood of San Francisco, just about in the geographic center of the city. My girlfriend and I left the house around 7:40 p.m. and arrived at the restaurant 15 minutes later.

title: Panel Backs Rent Increase of One Percent
description: The board that regulates rents for nearly one million apartments in New York City voted on Monday night to allow the lowest percentage rent increase in its 45-year existence, though it rebuffed calls from Mayor Bill de Blasio for a freeze.

title: Murray and Djokovic Have Little Trouble in Wimbledons First Round
description: It is not easy to play the man when all you can see is the legend.

title: An Activity Tracker With More Than a Hint of Style
description: Withings, the French electronics company, introduced on Monday its second step-counting activity tracker, the Activit, a sleek wrist-worn device.

title: 2nd Bridge Inquiry Said to Be Linked to Christie
description: Investigations into the Christie administration and the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey have zeroed in on possible securities law violations stemming from a $1.8 billion road repair agreement in 2011, according to people briefed on the matter.

title: For Rangers Moore, Sense of Mission Remains Intense in Off-Season
description: Dominic Moore contributed crucial goals and valuable minutes as the Rangers reached the Stanley Cup finals for the first time in 20 years. He was a leader and the kind of inspirational force that every winning squad needs amid the crucible of playoff pressure. On Tuesday, he will be at the N.H.L. award ceremony in Las Vegas, where he is a finalist for the Masterton Trophy, presented to the player who most exemplifies perseverance, sportsmanship and dedication to hockey.

title: Testy Exchange Erupts as I.R.S. Chief Is Questioned on Messages
description: WASHINGTON  Representative Darrell Issa of California, the Republican who is leading one of the investigations into the Internal Revenue Services scrutiny of Tea Party groups, accused the I.R.S. commissioner on Monday of lying, an allegation that only deepened the partisan mistrust about the motivations behind the numerous congressional inquiries into the matter.

title: For Women in Midlife, Career Gains Slip Away
description: Tracy Murphy was managing a nonprofit agency five years ago when her mother became seriously ill with heart problems. She promptly left her job to care for her, a task that has consumed Ms. Murphy ever since.

title: Blue Jays Big Inning Helps Keep Yankees at a Distance
description: TORONTO  The Yankees came to Toronto on Monday for the first of three games with the Blue Jays aware that they could return home in a few days as the new leaders in the American League East.

title: New Lead in 1909 Killing of a Star Officer
description: It was not long after the turn of the 20th century when Giuseppe Petrosino, the New York Police Departments most effective weapon against organized crime, was sent to Italy to attack the problems roots.

title: Searching for Answers in Very Old DNA
description: As he puts it in the subtitle of his memoir, Neanderthal Man, Svante Paabo goes in search of lost genomes. Dr. Paabo, a 59-year-old Swede who leads his own laboratory at the Max Planck Institute for Evolutionary Anthropology in Leipzig, Germany, was the first to extract and sequence the genomes of the ancient humans called Neanderthals and Denisovans, and to compare them with those of modern humans. Genes, and the stories they tell, are texts he reads.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for June 23, 2014
Feud in Hackensack Pits an Official Against the City
description: The city government in Hackensack, N.J., is embroiled in a not-so-civil war, judging by a lawsuit its top administrator filed on Monday.

title: China Activist to Stand Trial, Lawyer Says
description: HONG KONG  Prosecutors in southern China have decided to put on trial a well-known human rights campaigner, Yang Maodong, on charges of disrupting public order, his lawyer said on Tuesday.

title: Googles Nest Labs Joins Race to Define Platform for the Internet of Things
description: Google did not pay $3.2 billion for Nest Labs this year just because it designed a smart thermostat that has redefined that humble household device.

title: The Reality of Student Debt Is Different From the Clichs
description: The deeply indebted college graduate has become a stock character in the national conversation: the art history major with $50,000 in debt, the underemployed barista with $75,000, the struggling poet with $100,000.

title: Word of the Day | delusion
description: delusion \di-l-zhn, de-\ noun

title: Rangel and Espaillat Make Final Push on Eve of Primary
description: On the eve of the Democratic congressional primary, Representative Charles B. Rangel and State Senator Adriano D. Espaillat, who is trying to unseat him, held dueling news conferences on Monday a block apart in Washington Heights  a proximity that helped set off a shouting match between their supporters.

title: Pediatrics Group to Recommend Reading Aloud to Children From Birth
description: In between dispensing advice on breast-feeding and immunizations, doctors will tell parents to read aloud to their infants from birth, under a new policy that the American Academy of Pediatrics will announce on Tuesday.

title: Bipartisan Report Tallies High Toll on Economy From Global Warming
description: More than a million homes and businesses along the nations coasts could flood repeatedly before ultimately being destroyed. Entire states in the Southeast and the Corn Belt may lose much of their agriculture as farming shifts northward in a warming world. Heat and humidity will probably grow so intense that spending time outside will become physically dangerous, throwing industries like construction and tourism into turmoil.

title: Todays World Cup Matches: June 24, 2014
description: What to watch for today as the teams from Groups D and C fight to advance. Check out The Upshot for all the possibilities for how teams can advance.

title: Whats On Tuesday
description: 10 P.M. (TruTV) MOTOR CITY MASTERS Ten car designers show off their expertise and creativity as they divide into teams to build two fully functional (though not street-legal) concept cars in each episode; challenges focus on technology, interiors, body trim and functionality. Each round will be judged by Jean Jennings, former editor in chief of Automobile Magazine; the car designer Harald Belker; and a celebrity, with designers eliminated one by one until only two remain for the final build-off. The winner will receive a 2014 Camaro Z28 and $100,000, and be named a brand ambassador for General Motors. Brooke Burns (above, far left, with Ms. Jennings and Mr. Belker) hosts; Jesse Metcalfe is the guest judge in this series premiere.

title: Mapping the Risk of Bird Flus Spread
description: A strain of bird flu that has infected at least 367 people in mainland China over the past year poses a threat to several other parts of Asia, including the Philippines, Indonesia, Vietnam, Bangladesh and India, according to a new study mapping the risk posed by the H7N9 strain.

title: Death Penalty Overturned for Wife Who Killed Abuser
description: The Chinese Supreme Peoples Court has overturned a death sentence imposed on a woman who killed her husband after years of abuse, in a decision womens rights advocates and death penalty opponents hailed as a major step forward for women and the rule of law in China. The court ruled that the case must be retried.

title: Green Bean Salad With Lime Vinaigrette and Red Quinoa
description: This is a green bean salad with quinoa as opposed to a quinoa salad with green beans. Red quinoa is secondary to the green beans here. The two ingredients provide a colorful contrast. The salad is alive with texture, the crisp-tender green beans with the crunchy almonds and the chewy, comforting quinoa. The flavors here are Mexican: lime juice, chile, cilantro, white or red onion. Its simple to put together but the sum is complex.

title: Mediterranean Cucumber and Yogurt Salad With Red or Black Quinoa
description: The idea of embellishing a yogurt soup or salad with quinoa comes from Deborah Madison, who uses black quinoa in a brilliant recipe for a soup in her book Vegetable Literacy. I used red quinoa to add texture, color and substance to this typical Mediterranean combination  finely diced cucumber, garlic, and thick plain yogurt. Use mint or dill, or a combination, and make sure to dice the cucumber very small.

title: Poll Watchers Must Stay Outside, Mississippi Officials Say
description: JACKSON, Miss.  Conservative groups election monitors must remain outside polling places during the Republican Senate runoff in Mississippi on Tuesday unless one of the two campaigns authorizes a representative to be inside, state election officials said.

title: Quotation of the Day for Tuesday, June 24, 2014
description: I always felt like I can find another job eventually  but I only have one mother.

title: Corrections: June 24, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Student Crossword | Dance
description: Test your knowledge of dance by playing our crossword (PDF). You can find the answers here.

title: Kerry Implores Kurdish Leader to Join a Government and Not Break Away
description: ERBIL, Iraq  Secretary of State John Kerry urged the president of Iraqs Kurdish autonomous region on Tuesday not to seek his own state and instead help form a government in Baghdad.

title: Nominee for South Korean Premier Exits Over Colonization Remarks
description: SEOUL, South Korea  President Park Geun-hye, whose approval ratings have fallen since an April ferry disaster that left hundreds dead, suffered a new political blow on Tuesday as her second consecutive nominee for prime minister stepped aside, amid an uproar over his suggestion that Koreas colonization by Japan had been Gods will.

title: K.K.R. to Invest in Accionas Renewable Energy Arm
description: LONDON  Kohlberg Kravis Roberts has agreed to pay 417 million euros, or about $567 million, for a stake in the international renewable energy business of Acciona, the Spanish infrastructure conglomerate.

title: Longtime Politician and Veteran Actor Receive Lincoln Medals
description: WASHINGTON  Representative John D. Dingell started his career as a congressional page, shuttling mail from one legislator to another and watching Franklin D. Roosevelt give speeches from the House floor. On Sunday, Mr. Dingell, the longest serving congressman in United States history with nearly 60 years in the House, was awarded the Lincoln Medal for exemplifying the legacy of the nations 16th president.

title: 6 Qs About the News | A Chiseled Bodybuilder, Frail Clients and a Fitness Story for the Ages
description: In A Chiseled Bodybuilder, Frail Clients and a Fitness Story for the Ages, Louie Lazar writes about a former champion bodybuilder from Ghana who opened a small gym in an affordable housing development in Lower Manhattan.

title: In Kodaks Hometown, Memory and History
description: Alex Webb and Rebecca Norris Webb, a husband and wife photography team, documented Rochester after Eastman Kodaks bankruptcy in their new book, Memory City,published byRadius Books. Previously they published Violet Isle, a volume on modern-day Cuba. Ms. Norris Webbs book My Dakota was featured on Lens in 2012, while Mr. Webbs book The Suffering of Light was featured on Lens in 2011. He is a member of Magnum Photos. Their conversation with James Estrin has been edited.

title: When Advance Directives Are Ignored
description: In the final two years of her mothers life, Lisa McAllister started carrying copies of her mothers do-not-resuscitate and power-of-attorney forms in her purse and her car. Her mother was cycling between the hospital, assisted living and rehab  a round robin of craziness, said Ms. McAllister, a retired copy editor  and was clear about not wanting to be kept alive with substantially diminished quality of life.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Welcome to the Morning Briefing on NYT Now.

title: Broadcast Ads Not the Only Game in Mississippi Senate Race
description: The Mississippi Senate runoff on Tuesday has attracted an unusual number of outside groups, and they are spending heavily on direct voter contact and get-out-the-vote efforts.

title: New York Today: Primary Day
description: Good Tuesday morning to you.

title: Dsquared2: Spring 2015 Menswear
description: Milan

title: Italian Credit Rating Agency Cerved Down 5% in Debut
description: LONDON  The Italian credit rating agency Cerved Information Solutions declined about 5 percent in its debut on the Borsa Italiana on Tuesday.

title: Morning Views
description: The Obama administration made public a memo explaining the rationale behind a 2011 drone strike that killed an American citizen, Anwar al-Awlaki, in Yemen, The New York Times reports. But the rationale provides little confidence that the lethal action was taken with real care, the editorial board writes. Instead, the memo turns out to be a slapdash pastiche of legal theories  some based on obscure interpretations of British and Israeli law  that was clearly tailored to the desired result. The board remains unpersuaded that Mr. Awlakis due-process rights were given proper consideration. More documents must be made public. The public is still in the dark on too many vital questions.

title: In Our Pages: June 25
Support Is Thin for Tea Party, but It Retains Its Muscle
description: An upstart challenger wrestles a Republican primary victory from the House majority leader Eric Cantor. Senator Thad Cochran of Mississippi faces a vigorous challenge for his seat in a runoff election Tuesday. The pressure on established candidates has many people asking: Is the Tea Party having another moment?

title: How We Picked a Format for Employee Reviews
description: This series of posts started with an explanation of why I decided to reinstitute employee reviews.

title: Vertexs 2-Drug Cystic Fibrosis Pill Shows Promise
description: Vertex Pharmaceuticals said on Tuesday that a combination of two of its drugs had successfully treated cystic fibrosis in closely watched clinical trials, potentially clearing the way for approval of a new option for nearly half the patients with the genetic disease.

title: Ex-Tabloid Executive Acquitted in British Phone Hacking Case
description: LONDON  She rose from being a secretary in Rupert Murdochs British newspaper empire to running it. She called prime ministers her friends. Then she found herself in the middle of one of the most riveting trials in years, accused of illegally intercepting voice mails and other crimes, alongside her husband and her former deputy, who it turned out, was also her lover.

title: Giorgio Armani: Spring 2015 Menswear
description: Milan

title: Q. and A.: Michael Tien on Why He Thinks Occupy Central Is a Mistake
description: Hong Kong democracy activists and many pan-democratic lawmakers are pushing for new rules for the 2017 election for the territorys leader, the chief executive, under which any candidate who collects a certain number of signatures can get on the ballot. In the face of opposition from the central government in Beijing, theyre putting their support to the test this month, conducting an informal referendum to gauge public support. So far more than 730,000 votes have been cast in the 10-day poll, and its organizers have vowed to occupy Hong Kongs central business district in protest if Beijing insists on an electoral system that limits the ballot to its approved candidates.

title: Daily Report: Microsoft Sees Quantum Computing as Technologys Next Frontier
description: Modern computers are not unlike the looms of the industrial revolution, John Markoff reports: They follow programmed instructions to weave intricate patterns. With a loom, you see the result in a cloth or carpet. With a computer, you see it on an electronic display.

title: Fear or Ignorance Drives Confucius Institutes Critics, Xinhua Says
description: Chinese state media on Tuesday defended the spread of Confucius Institutes worldwide, lashing back at a recent call for North American universities to rethink their links with the cultural and language programs, which are backed by the Chinese government.

title: World Cup 2014: Uruguay Defeats Italy, 1-0, to Advance Out of Group D
description: Uruguay advanced to the Round of 16 with a 1-0 victory over Italy, but the victory was overshadowed by the alleged biting of a player by Uruguays Luis Suarez.

title: World Cup 2014: Costa Rica and England Play to a 0-0 Draw
description: Costa Rica conquered mighty Uruguay and Italy and clinched the Group of Death by tying England.

title: World Cup 2014: Colombia Defeats Japan, 4-1
description: Japan needed a victory, and help, in order to advance. Instead, Colombias late goal-scoring surge ended any hope the Japanese had.

title: Bank Analysts Say Pfizer-AstraZeneca Merger Still Makes Sense
description: LONDON  Analysts at BNP Paribas think a potential merger between AstraZeneca and Pfizer may not be dead despite AstraZenecas repeated rejections of a deal between the drug makers.

title: Match Recap: Greece Overcomes Ivory Coast in Added Time, 2-1
description: Ivory Coast was a minute away from moving on to the knockout stage, when Greece was awarded a penalty kick, which it deftly converted.

title: Egypts Leader Says He Wont Intervene in Case of Jailed Journalists
description: Brushing aside protests from the governments of Western countries, including the United States, President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi of Egypt said Tuesday that he would not interfere in the case of three journalists from Al Jazeeras English-language service who have each been sentenced to at least seven years in prison.

title: DirecTV and AT&T Make Case to Congress
description: WASHINGTON  AT&T and DirecTV told members of Congress on Tuesday that their proposed $48.5 billion merger would be so good for competition that it would do something that has rarely, if ever, happened: pressure cable companies to lower prices.

title: Consumers Will Spend More on Health Care in 2015, Report Predicts
description: Growth in health care spending is expected to tick upward next year, in part because consumers who delayed treatment during the economic downturn are now seeking care they postponed, according to a report released on Tuesday.

title: Tangled Passages
description: As weve often noted, long, convoluted sentences are a disservice to harried readers, who may be scanning the paper on the subway or checking their phone in the checkout line. We dont have to use See-Spot-run syntax, but we should do the hard work of ironing out our sentences so readers dont have to.

title: Morning Agenda: Monitor for Credit Suisse Named
description: Neil Barofsky, an old foe of the 2008 bank bailouts, has managed to secure a familiar role: watchdog for one of the worlds biggest banks, Ben Protess and Jessica Silver-Greenberg write in DealBook. New York States financial regulator is said to be close to picking Mr. Barofsky, a former federal prosecutor, as the corporate monitor for Credit Suisse after the banks guilty plea to helping American clients evade taxes. Credit Suisse agreed to hire a monitor as part of a related settlement. Separately, a monitor was also installed late last year at BNP Paribas, the giant French bank suspected of violating sanctions provisions.

title: Middle Americas Take on the Middle Easts Wars
description: A poll shows disapproval of Obamas foreign policy, but a majority of respondents supported the possibility of drone strikes in Iraq.

title: Boko Haram Suspected of New Kidnappings in Nigeria
description: Militants are suspected of having abducted dozens more girls and women in northeastern Nigeria, news reports said on Tuesday, reviving concerns about hundreds of schoolgirls who were kidnapped in the same region in April and have yet to be rescued.

title: Norways Sovereign Wealth Fund Ramps Up Investment Plans
description: LONDON  Norways giant sovereign wealth fund said on Tuesday that it would manage its $884 billion portfolio more aggressively over the next three years, taking larger stakes in companies and increasing its real estate portfolio.

title: World Traveler Meets a MetroCard
description: Dear Diary:

title: Putin Presses Extension of Cease-Fire in Ukraine
description: MOSCOW  President Vladimir V. Putin said Tuesday that a temporary cease-fire in Ukraine should be extended, just hours after he called on the upper house of Russias Parliament to rescind a March resolution authorizing the use of his countrys armed forces there.

title: Fast Fashion Manufacturing Takes Another Hit
description: Much talk in Britain today about the news that a customer bought a summer dress at Primark  a low-priced high street chain  containing a label with the words forced to work exhausting hours stitched onto it.

title: Mother Seeks U.N.s Help to Return Israeli Youths
description: GENEVA  Nearly two weeks after  three Israeli teenagers were abducted as they tried to hitchhike home from the West Bank, the mother of one of them appeared before the United Nations Human Rights Council here to ask for more international efforts to secure their release.

title: Whats News in Washington: Summers Super Tuesday
description: Good morning from sunny and humid Washington. It is the summers first superTuesday, with primary elections taking place in seven states.

title: A Start-Up With a Way to Filter Botnet Traffic Gets Funding
description: Botnets, networks of infected zombie computers that operate at the whim of their controller, are arguably one of the nastiest scourges of the Internet.
