description: Scenes from the mens fashion week photo diary of Sonny Vandevelde.

title: German Publishers Seek Amazon Inquiry
description: BERLIN  German book publishers have filed a complaint with the countrys antitrust authority against Amazon, accusing it of violating competition laws and asking the government to investigate.

title: If You Work Hard, You Get Good Things In Life
description: tktk There may not need to be text here. tktk

title: Tensions High at Delhi University After Four-Year Program Is Canceled
description: NEW DELHI  Delhi University, Indias prestigious network of colleges, has become immersed in tensions after its four-year undergraduate program was eliminated by a higher education regulatory body on Sunday.

title: HSBC to Sell Some Swiss Private Bank Assets to Liechtenstein Group
description: LONDON  The British bank HSBC said on Tuesday that it had agreed to sell a portfolio of Swiss private banking assets to a unit of the LGT Group Foundation of Liechtenstein.

title: Kerry Meets With Kurdish Leader
description: Amid ongoing conflict in Iraq, Secretary of State John Kerry meets with the president of Iraqs Kurdish region, Massoud Barzani, in Erbil.

title: Highlights From the Mississippi Senate Primary Runoff
description: Voters head to the polls Tuesday in a Republican Senate primary runoff between Senator Thad Cochran, a six-term incumbent, and State Senator Chris McDaniel, his Tea Party-backed challenger. The Times is on the ground across the state and will provide updates throughout the day.

title: No Comment Necessary: Thanks, Mom, for Financing My Congressional Bid
description: Twenty-seven-year-old Mike Turner is running for Congress in Oklahoma, with a little family assistance.

title: Italy vs. Uruguay: World Cup 2014 Live Blog
description: These teams might have expected to be fighting for first place in the group in this game. Instead they both lost to the astounding Costa Rica and are fighting for survival. The men to watch will be the teams controversial strikers: Mario Balotelli of Italy and Luis Suarez of Uruguay.

title: Intersection | Haut Marais, Paris
description: In the Haut Marais neighborhood of Paris, locals turn to polo, Vanessa Bruno, and Serge Gainsbourg for inspiration.

title: Costa Rica vs. England: World Cup 2014 Live Blog
description: Costa Rica conquered mighty Uruguay and Italy and is on course to win this Group of Death. Its joyous play has made it many fans new favorite, and striker Joel Campbell has emerged as a breakout star. By contrast, Englands fans are morose. The team has not been flat out horrible, but is 0-2 and out of the Cup. Wayne Rooney and company will want a win to salvage some pride.

title: Roberto Cavalli: Spring 2015 Menswear
description: Milan

title: Endo International to Pay Up to $600 Million for Dava, a Generic Drug Maker
description: LONDON  Endo International said on Tuesday that it had reached an agreement to acquire the generic drug maker Dava Pharmaceuticals for up to $600 million.

title: Seen on the Street | Outside the Spring/Summer 2015 Milan Shows
description: A peek at what some of the peacocks in Milan were wearing.

title: Cochran Holds Off Tea Party Challenger in Mississippi
description: HATTIESBURG, Miss.  With an unusual assist from African-American voters and other Democrats who feared his opponent, Senator Thad Cochran on Tuesday beat back a spirited challenge from State Senator Chris McDaniel, triumphing in a Republican runoff and defeating the Tea Party in the state where the movements hopes were bright.

title: Orange Is the New Black Recap: Its Valentines Day at the Litch
description: Season 2, Episode 6 Its Valentines Day, and love is in the air at the Litch. Crazy, complicated prison love, making it not so much different from love everywhere else. This episode has an almost giddy looseness to it, with dialogue and scenes bleeding into one another  from prison staff into inmates, from Litchfield into Larrys Brooklyn (Larry  my sweet, kind, unfocused fianc, as Piper describes him). The looseness conveys the messiness of the business at hand  as do the closeups of inmates giving their definitions of love to an off-camera interviewer. (Who turns out to be Piper, with an interest in interviewing that is somewhat duplicitous. More on that below, and while its not really much of a spoiler, this is probably a good place to issue the standard spoiler alert.)

title: Cameron Apologizes for Hiring Coulson
description: David Cameron, the prime minister of Britain, said he was extremely sorry for employing Andy Coulson, the former tabloid editor who was convicted of phone hacking.

title: Read to a Tiny Baby? Yes
description: Future well-baby visits to the pediatrician should include a new prescription: reading. The American Academy of Pediatrics now recommends that its members, and all doctors, tell parents they should be reading together as a daily fun family activity from infancy.

title: Milan Mens Fashion Week: No. 21 Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the mens fashion week photo diary of Kevin Tachman.

title: When We Read Fiction, How Relevant Is the Authors Biography?
description: Each week in Bookends, two writers take on questions about the world of books. This week, Thomas Mallon and Adam Kirsch discuss whether knowing about an authors life deepens or detracts from the pleasures of reading fiction.

title: 11 Consumer Groups Ask F.T.C. to Investigate CarMax Over Unfixed Recalled Cars
description: Saying that advertisements by CarMax, the nations largest used-car retailer, are deceptive, a coalition of 11 consumer groups has asked the Federal Trade Commission to investigate.

title: Sperm Donation Puts a New Layer on an Old Friendship
description: For years, my friend Tori and I have had a standing weekly dinner date. Weve been known to close down a restaurant or two during these epic evenings, gabbing about nothing and everything, all over a glass or three of wine. Toris wife, Kelly, often joins us too but I suspect these are mostly on the nights she would like her partner home at a reasonable hour.

title: Improving Article Accessibility
description: Update: We have moved from Less to Sass and have edited the code in this post to reflect this.

title: You Should Have Been a Doctor?
description: Earlier this week, a user named Dan Lin posted this chart to Reddit. It depicts the average yearly salary for 820 different jobs in America, based on 2013 data. The chart quickly made the media rounds  and the way its been interpreted may tell us something about how we look at jobs and the economy today.

title: Rise in Home Prices Is Slowing, and Thats a Good Thing
description: The latest readings on United States home prices are the latest confirmation of a slowdown in that area: Prices are still rising in most cities, but much more slowly than they were a few months ago. And thats news we should cheer.

title: Beijing Company Drops Objection to Transformers Film
description: LOS ANGELES  Beijings Pangu Investment Company said it had dropped its demand that Paramount Pictures remove scenes representing one of its properties from Transformers: Age of Extinction, which is set to open in China on Friday. Instead, it said it was now blaming a third party.'

title: At Heart of Christie Inquiry, a Law Feared on Wall Street
description: The Christie administration and the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey are feeling the pressure of a prosecutorial tool that is feared on Wall Street.

title: On Wellness | A Summer Workout From a Personal Trainer to the Fashion Set
description: Squats, push-ups, lunges, sit-ups: these are the physical drills most of us have been familiar with since elementary school gym class. And according to Will Torres  the personal trainer behind Willspace whose clientele includes Calvin Klein, Julia Restoin-Roitfeld, Andy Cohen and the model Ashley Smith  theyre the basis to achieving your ideal body. That may sound like an overly simplistic notion, especially in this era of hybridized fitness routines, but at Torress intimate West Village studio, its the focus on precision and consistency that render these timeless workouts effective. Theres no point in progressing to a new exercise if you havent perfected fundamental movements like hinging and torque, Torres says. And you dont need a lot of equipment.

title: Today in Small Business: Starting Up in Cuba
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: Johnny Mann, Leader of Easy-Listening Singers, Dies at 85
description: Johnny Mann, who won two Grammy Awards as leader of the clean-cut easy-listening vocal group the Johnny Mann Singers, died on June 18 at his home in Anderson, S.C. He was 85.

title: DOJ White Paper on Killing Citizens Deemed Terrorists
description: Unclassified Justice Department white paper about the legality of targeting American citizens deemed terrorists for killing, derived from classified Office of Legal Counsel memos about Anwar Al-Awlaki.

title: New Yorkers Cast Votes in Rematch of Rangel vs. Espaillat
description: During the spirited Democratic primary to represent New Yorks 13th Congressional District, State Senator Adriano D. Espaillat has taken aim at the long tenure of Representative Charles B. Rangel, arguing that, after 43 years in Congress, his main opponent was too old, too scarred by scandal and too entrenched in the ways of Washington.

title: Sympathy for the Trustafarians
description: A number of people have asked me to comment on Greg Mankiws defense of inherited wealth. Its a strange piece, oddly disconnected from the real concerns about patrimonial capitalism. But let me focus on two key problems with Mankiws analysis  one purely economic, one involving political economy.

title: Scoop Shops, Snack Bars, Soda Fountains: Share Your Ice Cream Photos
description: Ice cream has the power to evoke to memories of childhood. As part of the Dining sections coming ice cream issue, were asking readers to share memories of their favorite ice creams.

title: Image of the Day: June 24
Free-Agent Axis Tilts From Anthony to James
description: Carmelo Anthony enjoyed the unique privilege of being the N.B.A.'s most coveted free agent for a little more than 36 hours. That ended Tuesday morning when it was revealed that LeBron James had informed the Miami Heat through his agent, Rich Paul, that he intended to exercise the early termination option on his contract and become a free agent July 1.

title: Daunting Path to Publication
description: Kevin Birminghams new book about the long censorship fight over James Joyces Ulysses braids eight or nine good stories into one mighty strand. Its about womens rights and heroic female editors, about World War I, about anarchism and modernism, about tenderness and syphilis, about how literature can bend an eras consciousness, about moral panic and about the Lost Generation and the tent it pitched at Sylvia Beachs Paris bookstore. It isolates a great love story, that of Joyce and Nora Barnacle, one that comes with a finger-burning side order of some of the most cheerfully filthy correspondence in literary history.

title: American Idol Keeps Jennifer Lopez, Keith Urban and Harry Connick Jr.
description: Fox announced on Tuesday morning that Jennifer Lopez, Keith Urban and Harry Connick Jr. would return as judges for the 14th season of American Idol, along with the shows host, Ryan Seacrest.

title: Methodists Reinstate Pastor, Deepening Churchs Rift Over Gays
description: A Methodist pastor who was defrocked because he presided at the wedding of his gay son is being reinstated in a startling reversal by a large Protestant denomination that, like many, is riven by disagreements over same-sex relationships.

title: Islamic Extremists Pose New Risks for Religious Minorities in Iraq
description: The incursion of Islamic extremists in Nineveh province, in northern Iraq, is bad for a lot of people, but perhaps no group has more to lose than a minority religious group known as the Yazidis.

title: M. Patmoss Sustainable Shades for Selima
description: Marcia Patmoss womens wear line M.Patmos may be known for its innovative cashmere knitwear and casual-chic separates, but the brand is equally noteworthy for its commitment to sustainability: Patmos sources organic fibers when possible and employs womens artisan collectives around the globe. Now, the designer has joined forces with the eyewear mainstay Selima Optique for a limited-edition frame shape  available in an optical or sunglass version  made with water buffalo horn that has been naturally shed by the animals. Each pair is hand-cut in a family-owned atelier in Paris.

title: Board Cites Confusion by Crew in Air Crash
description: WASHINGTON  A Boeing 777 arriving in San Francisco on a clear, bright day hit the sea wall just short of the runway because the crew did not understand crucial details of the cockpit automation, the National Transportation Safety Board said Tuesday, recommending changes in training and flight manuals and in the airplane itself.

title: Invitation to a Dialogue: Talking About Obesity
Wheelies: The Better Bimmer Edition
description: A roundup of motoring news from the web:

title: Renovations Slated for Smithsonians Renwick Gallery
description: The Smithsonian Institutions Renwick Gallery, which was built by the same architect who designed the Smithsonian Castle in Washington and St. Patricks Cathedral in New York, will be getting a face-lift, thanks in part to a $5.4 million gift from David M. Rubenstein, co-founder of the Carlyle Group.

title: Gold Touches Up Sullied Band Shell in Central Park
description: The gift has fallen apart over the years.

title: Why Some Sources Dont Sweat the Chilling Effect
description: A reader, Dale Kelberman of Annapolis, Md., emails with what I like to call a Perfectly Reasonable Question.He writes:

title: Sudan Said to Revive Notorious Militias
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  The Sudanese government has reconstituted the janjaweed, notorious militias that terrorized the restive Darfur region for years, making them an official, uniformed force that has recently burned down huts and attacked civilians, according to a new report prepared by the Enough Project, an activist group that aims to prevent genocide.

title: On a Day of Few Surprises, Nadals Victory Restores Natural Order
description: WIMBLEDON, England  It is not often that intrigue and doubt accompany the top-ranked mens tennis player to the opening round at Wimbledon. It was as if they were stored in the racket bag that Rafael Nadal had slung over his shoulder as he entered Centre Court on Tuesday.

title: Internet Shares Mexico Coach Miguel Herreras Joy and Emotion
description: RECIFE, Brazil  He is one of the most visually delightful characters at this World Cup. He is a charismatic, savvy leader. He is competitive mania personified.

title: Rebekah Brooks Acquitted in Hacking Case
description: Rebekah Brooks, the former head of Rupert Murdochs newspaper holdings in Britain, was acquitted of phone hacking, and the lawyer for her former assistant spoke after his client was acquitted as well.

title: At the La Brea Tar Pits, A Gala Event Celebrating Flintstones-Style Hair
description: Scenes from the photo diary of Angie Smith.

title: Tysons, a Northern Virginia Crossroads, Waits Impatiently for the Train
description: It was known as Tysons Corner, a rural crossroads 13 miles from downtown Washington.

title: Uruguays Surez, Known for Biting, Leaves Mark on World Cup
description: NATAL, Brazil  The most ruthless soccer players often use their hands or elbows or knees to rough up opposing players. The most reckless  or dirtiest  might even use their cleats. Then there is Luis Surez.

title: The South American World Cup Bracket
description: Tuesdays later World Cup matches created a fascinating dynamic for the rest of the tournament: Colombia won Group C, creating an all-South American portion of the bracket.

title: Hachette Adds Heft to Combat Amazon
description: Hachette Book Group is bulking up and diversifying, steps that could improve its long-term negotiating position with Amazon, the giant online retailer.

title: Dylans Like a Rolling Stone Manuscript Sells for More Than $2 Million
description: Bob Dylans handwritten, working manuscript for his 1965 hit Like a Rolling Stone was sold at Sothebys auction on Tuesday for $2,045,000, just over the maximum estimated bid of $2 million.

title: A Celebrity Steps Back Into the Spotlight
description: Restaurant critics are supposed to be impartial, but I cant help feeling some proprietary interest in Tavern on the Green. Not a financial interest, except insofar as a profitable Tavern is good for the citys budget, which, in a fractions-of-pennies way, is good for me as a grumpy taxpayer. Its more like a civic interest. Tavern on the Green belongs to the city and sits inside the most beautiful public park in which Ive ever rowed, cycled, struck out in softball, misidentified a confusing fall warbler and illegally consumed alcoholic beverages. Id let the city keep those fractional pennies if that helped Tavern on the Green live up to its setting.

title: Colombia vs. Japan: World Cup 2014 Live Blog
description: Like many Western Hemisphere nations, Colombia has had a strong start to the Cup. Expect Juan Cuadrado to send in dangerous crosses that bother Japans defense. Japan has just one goal at the Cup and could only draw woeful Greece. This will be a tough spot.

title: Getting a 9-Year-Olds View of the Common Core
description: Last week, Javier Hernndez explored the Common Core program, a recommended set of academic standards, through the eyes of a 9-year-old student. The piece struck a chord with readers. It drew over 500 impassioned comments and many letters to the editor, several of which were published yesterday. Here, Javier answers questions about the origins of the story and what the reporting was like.

title: A Year After the Chaos, Many Ranking Points to Defend
description: WIMBLEDON, England  A year after one of the most turbulent Wimbledons in memory, the unexpected stars of an edition of the tournament nicknamed Wimbleweird returned with hopes of rekindling that same feeling.

title: Greece vs. Ivory Coast: World Cup 2014 Live Blog
description: After two noble failures at the World Cup, Ivory Coast is on the cusp of finally making the knockout stages. Gervinho has been outstanding and he could well run riot against Greece.

title: Order denying habeas to Shaker Aamer
description: Order denying request for habeas relief to Shaker Aamer on health grounds.

title: United Methodists Decision to Overturn Defrocking of Frank Schaefer
description: A United Methodist Church appeals committee  a nine-member panel made up of laypeople and clergy  issued this ruling Tuesday. The panel decided to overturn the punishment of Frank Schaefer on the grounds that it was too harsh.

title: Petition for habeas corpus on health grounds
description: Shaker Aamer, a Saudi citizen and former British resident detained at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba, asked a Federal District Court judge to order his release on grounds of poor health.

title: A Harlem Cultural Connector Makes Her Artistic Debut
description: A chance meeting with an old friend on a subway platform leads to a creative epiphany: its one of those only-in-New-York stories, the type that seems more rom-com plotline than real life. But thats exactly what happened to Felicia Gordon, the founder of the Sugar Hill Culture Club (a loosely knit group of creatives from Harlem to Berlin that has collaborated on everything from short films to a line of sweatshirts worn by Rihanna), who has her first-ever show as an artist in a Harlem pop-up gallery this week.

title: Guantanamo Detainee Disposition List
description: A 2009-2010 inter-agency task force that reviewed each detainee still at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba, when President Obama took office came up with this list of disposition recommendations.

title: A Contemporary Design Yields to the Demands of Prehistory
description: LOS ANGELES  The Swiss architect Peter Zumthor has modified his grand plans to transform the campus of the Los Angeles County Museum of Art, altering the shape of his building to stretch across bustling Wilshire Boulevard and away from the neighboring La Brea Tar Pits, according to renderings provided by the museum on Tuesday. Critics of the original design had raised environmental concerns, saying it would have cast a shadow over tar pits rich with Ice Age fossils.

title: I.R.S. Hearing Over Lost Emails
description: John Koskinen, the Internal Revenue Service commissioner, defended himself against Republicans accusations of a cover-up over lost emails.

title: Excerpt: Taxi Brooklyn
description: The new NBC series is about a cop who partners with a cabby.

title: New York Is Star in Video Pitch for Democratic Convention
description: New York Citys bid to make Brooklyn the home of the 2016 Democratic National Convention has attracted all manner of buzz. But with five other cities contending for the event, it is up to Mayor Bill de Blasios team to seal the deal with party leaders.

title: Odd Couple, Chic Borough
description: Leo Romba (Jacky Ido) is an expert body-language reader and a stunning tactical driver, can tell which part of Peru a dab of cocaine comes from, and can throw a perp up against a wall without wrinkling his shirt. In Taxi Brooklyn, a goofy tale of an unlikely alliance between cop and cabby, he is the seer and the center of all power, a hero for a troubled borough.

title: Siemens May Seek Another Alstom Tie-Up
description: Once the dust settles over the Alstom bidding war, Siemens and its French rival may want to revisit the most compelling aspect of the German companys losing bid: a merger of both groups train-making units. Such a union would create the train equivalent of Airbus, the European aircraft maker.

title: Apologies Become a Tool, Not a Goal
description: In 35 years as a corporate insider, adviser and critic, Ive been on both sides of dozens of apologies played out in the public domain  and the most striking common denominator is how few of those apologies were either genuinely given or received. In fact, Id suggest that one reason for supporting Dov Seidmans call for an apology cease-fire is that the modern apology has strayed far from its purpose  acknowledgment and redress of a wrong  and is simply a tactic played out in a larger zero-sum game of winners and losers.

title: Reform Conservatism and Climate Change
description: When the Room to Grow collection of reform conservative essays dropped last month, some of the most frequent criticisms from liberals focused on topics that the book did not address: In particular, comprehensive immigration reform (the subject of my last post) and climate change legislation. Voxs Matt Yglesias, for instance, thought it noteworthy that a book hailed as representing the best, freshest conservative thinking on the pressing issues of the day has nothing to say on how American policymakers should tackle climate change, and he offered the following theory as to why:

title: Bain Capitals Andrew Balson Starts New Private Equity Fund
description: Andrew B. Balson, a longtime managing director at the Boston-based private equity firm Bain Capital, has left to start a new investment fund.

title: Five Things to Ponder About the Mississippi Runoff
description: The polls in Mississippi closed at 8 p.m. Eastern as voters chose whether Senator Thad Cochran or State Senator Chris McDaniel should be the Republican nominee for the Senate in November. We are analyzing vote returns live here. Meanwhile, here are the five outstanding questions to watch this evening.

title: David Waltuck Is Back in the Kitchen
description: Headliner

title: 3-D Mammography Test Appears to Improve Breast Cancer Detection Rate
description: Adding a newer test to digital mammograms can increase the detection rate for breast cancer and decrease nerve-racking false alarms, in which suspicious findings lead women to get extra scans that turn out normal, a study found.

title: Federal District Court Ruling on No-Fly List
description: A Federal District Court judge in Oregon struck down redress procedures for people put on the so-called no-fly list who seek to regain a right to board airplanes.

title: Federal District Court ruling Upholds FISA Amendments Act
description: A Federal District Court judge in Oregon rejected a request to throw out a conviction because of evidence derived from the FISA Amendments Act of 2008.

title: Turk Who Killed Staten Island Tourist Gets Life Sentence
description: ISTANBUL  A Turkish man who admitted killing a tourist from Staten Island last year, after, he said, she resisted his kiss, was found guilty of murder on Tuesday and sentenced to life in prison.

title: Smiles in Distress
description: A wedding procession inside a Muslim concentration camp in Myanmar.

title: Climbing for Coconuts
description: A villager climbed a coconut tree inside a confined Muslim village in Myanmar. He gave the coconut to some thirsty reporters from The Times.

title: Myanmar Hospitality: A Rescue Boat
description: A rescue boat appeared for two Times reporters as sun was falling, a cyclone was approaching and a curfew for foreigners was just 20 minutes away.

title: European Banks Balk at Cheap Loans, Worried About Strings Attached
description: FRANKFURT  It sounds like an offer too good to refuse: nearly unlimited loans at an annual interest rate of only 0.25 percent.

title: There May Not Be a There There, or Gold
description: Psst! Wanna buy some collateralized debt obligations? How about a nice credit default swap? Wait! Ive got just the thing: shares in a plan to exploit the gold reserves of Donogoo-Tonka, that lush South American Eden.

title: Helped by Federer, and Now Surpassing Him
description: WIMBLEDON, England  Once in a lifetime, everyone should have a Stan Wawrinka experience, the chance to step out of the shadow, take the baton from a world-renowned maestro and say, Step aside, partner, let me show you how to lead this concerto.

title: Milan Mens Fashion Week: Giorgio Armani Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the mens fashion week photo diary of Alfredo Piola.

title: ExIm Irony
description: So it looks quite likely that the Tea Party will claim a scalp from the business lobby, and kill the Export-Import Bank. And there is a case for doing away with the lender  except that this is the worst possible time for it.

title: A Rarity Bursts Into Bloom
description: BOSTON  Dont be afraid to love ballet, William Forsythe called out as a quartet of Boston Ballet dancers stepped into fifth position on point  feet tight together, arms high  their hips twisting and their heads tilted up toward delicately curved hands. Show us why you love it!

title: British Tabloids After Brooks Verdict
description: Ravi Somaiya, a Times media correspondent, on the fallout from the acquittal of Rebekah Brooks, the former Murdoch newspaper editor, on charges of phone hacking.

title: In Vermont, a Festival of Cheese
description: More than 40 Vermont cheesemakers and dozens of specialty food, beer, wine, and spirits producers will gather on July 20 for the sixth annual Vermont Cheesemakers Festival in Shelburne, presented by the Vermont Cheese Council.

title: Enigmatic Moves and Flashes of Drama Against a Towering Cityscape
description: The incongruity of dancing in the financial district is something to which many New Yorkers have grown accustomed. Over the years, dancers have performed in many of the spaces there. At 1 p.m. on Monday, Michael Ingle and Silas Riener, modern dancers of distinction, performed a 30-minute duet by the choreographer Tere OConnor on a lawn at the Elevated Acre on Water Street.

title: Pictures of the Day: Iraq and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Iraq, Lebanon, England and New York.

title: NBC Completes Upfront Sales as CW Nears Finish Line
description: Two additional big English-language broadcast networks  NBC and CW  have declared that they have finished, or largely finished, the sale of commercial time before the start of the 2014-15 television season in what is known as the upfront market.

title: A Prime Portfolio in Manhattan, Coming Back to Life
description: In a city that can seem to be wringing every last drop of value out of its real estate, while giving block after block a squeaky-clean gloss, a Manhattan loft building at 13 West 27th Street stuck out glaringly on a recent tour.

title: A Luxe Throwback Timepiece From Baume & Mercier
description: In this weekly series, the mens fashion editors of T invite creative personalities to put their own aesthetic spin on a new watch. Here, the photographer Rob Kulisek captures a timepiece from Baume & Mercier.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Welcome to NYT Now, the new app from The New York Times.

title: Crisis in Greece and at Home
description: Nikos Pilos specializes in covering crisis. For the last 10 years, that has kept him busy chronicling his homelands economic and social problems.

title: Readers Divided on the Legality of Drone Strikes
description: For many readers who commented on our editorial this morning about the legal underpinning of a fatal drone strike, the issue is an easy one: Anwar al-Awlaki may have been an American citizen, but he was obviously a terrorist, because he had aligned himself with a branch of Al Qaeda. Thus the United States was right in 2011 to kill him (and his son) in a drone strike in Yemen.

title: Big Ten Joins Pac-12 in Pressing the N.C.A.A. to Make Changes
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  For the second time in a month, every university president belonging to an athletic conference has jointly issued a public letter calling for change within the N.C.A.A.

title: Nostalgia on the Air
description: Its 90s teenage-show nostalgia week on Walt Disney Company networks, where a pair of new shows are built on memories of series that went off the air just as the current century was starting.

title: Everything You Need for the Perfect Picnic
description: To Share: Theyll Even Let You Borrow the Basket

title: A Hunt to Find the Next Generation of Financial Advisers
description: Joseph H. Clinard Jr. is 76 and spends his days planning for retirement  just not his own.

title: The Life Behind a Fashionable Front
description: More dutiful than elegant, Yves Saint Laurent is one of two new dramas about that beatified French fashion designer. The other feature, Bertrand Bonellos Saint Laurent, had its premiere at the Cannes Film Festival last month and posits, with flair and humor, a certain sensual mystery about the shy but passionate couturier and his work. Jalil Lesperts authorized biopic is the first out of the gate in the United States, however, and it trots out a polite recounting of Saint Laurents life in its prime.

title: Archivist Faults I.R.S. for Not Reporting Loss of Emails
description: WASHINGTON  The Internal Revenue Service did not follow the law when it failed to report a hard drive crash that destroyed emails belonging to a senior official at the center of a scandal over the agencys treatment of conservative-leaning political groups, the nations top archivist said Tuesday.

title: From Liner Notes to Front Lines of Advocacy
description: The Pleasures of Being Out of Step: Notes on the Life of Nat Hentoff is very much in step with the enthusiasms of its nobly bearded 89-year-old subject, the critic Nat Hentoff. The director David L. Lewis presents a man whos all about the voice  letting it sing, as in the instrumental improvisations of the jazz he loves, and keeping it alive, through his dogmatic defense of the First Amendment.

title: Ford Expands Truck Recall After Supplier Reviews Records
description: Ford said Tuesday that it was increasing the number of 2014 F-150 pickups it was recalling for a possible steering loss problem from the 372 announced earlier this month to almost 5,700, including about 4,600 in the United States.

title: Gentlemen Take a Bow in a Theater Tribute
description: The good Lord created black people, and black people created everything else!

title: The Self-Promotion Backlash
description: From building your personal brand to stepping up your social media presence, were constantly inundated with advice about how to promote ourselves. But some are saying that the pressure to self-promote could, ultimately, be hurting us.

title: Still Together, but Prickly
description: At Rockwood Music Hall on Monday night, Alex Kinsey and Sierra Deaton told a story of how reality television works to create its own reality. As a duo, Alex & Sierra, they were contestants, and eventual winners, on last years season of The X Factor, the shows last. A couple, they were visibly enamored of each other. The notoriously sour Simon Cowell was their mentor.

title: What Were Reading
description: Recommended reads from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading is an exclusive benefit for home delivery and digital subscribers that is sent twice a week as an email. Sign up

title: Mediations and Mutiny Backstage
description: The open, empty violin case backstage at Avery Fisher Hall stood as a stark reminder that Glenn Dicterow, the longest-serving concertmaster in the history of the New York Philharmonic, would retire after Saturday nights concert. It awaited the return of the 1727 Guarneri del Ges violin that the Philharmonic had lent him as its first among equals.

title: Improvising With Passion
description: Transformation: Rhythms Roots, a collaboration between the veteran jazz musician Owen Brown Jr. and the first-rate tap dancer Jason Samuels Smith, advertises itself as a musical response to the recent Oscar-winning film 12 Years a Slave. But its subject is actually much broader: the hundreds of years of African-American experience from enslavement to the present.

title: Arias in the Park on a Summers Eve
description: If youre an opera lover looking for a typical young-artist concert, there are four outdoor dates coming up in July to satisfy you, courtesy of the Metropolitan Operas annual Summer Recital Series. Three up-and-comers from the companys roster will be traveling through New York City parks with sunny standards, including the Barcarolle from Offenbachs Les Contes dHoffmann, and L ci darem la mano from Mozarts Don Giovanni.

title: Spoons for the Picky
description: In the beginning there was the Word, and the Word was naughty, and then Jonathan Adler put it on a throw pillow.

title: No Matter the Political Climate, the Conversation on Twitter Turns to the Weather
description: Voters headed back to polling places in Mississippi on Tuesday to cast ballots in the runoff between Senator Thad Cochran and his Tea Party-backed challenger, State Senator Chris McDaniel. In keeping with a race that has generated its share of political conflict, Mr. Cochrans and Mr. McDaniels partisans were active on Twitter describing Mississippis second day at the polls this month in a way that was helpful to their candidates. But it seemed like many voters on social media were more concerned with todays weather than with the states political climate.

title: World Cup Fashion
description: The World Cup  a.k.a. one of the largest sports fashion catwalks in the world.

title: The World Cup Winners
description: If you, like me, have walked down a city street sometime in the last two weeks  any city street, really, in any city  theres a good chance you passed someone (or, indeed, many someones) wearing, say, a lurid yellow shirt trimmed in green, or a slightly twee white polo-neck edged in blue, or a blood-red tee with black stripes. And then you, like me, may have scratched your head and thought, Where are they getting their fashion cues from?

title: Ford Reveals All-New 2015 Edge Crossover
description: Ford has announced its all-new 2015 Edge crossover. Using the same vehicle architecture as the Ford Fusion, the Edge features a front camera for better visibility, adaptive cruise control and inflatable seat belts, Ford said in a statement released Tuesday.

title: Mets Recall dArnaud From AAA
description: The Mets recalled the highly regarded catcher Travis dArnaud on Tuesday after a 15-game respite in Class AAA to help him retool his swing and rediscover his confidence at the plate.

title: Taking Effective Action Against the Unstoppable
description: Climate change is not an event in your childrens future. It is bearing down upon you now. And there is nothing you  or anyone else  can do to prevent the hit.
