title: A Selfless Man: David Peace Talks About Bill Shankly and Red or Dead
description: The British novelist David Peaces Red Riding quartet, which was turned into three films, followed the hunt for a serial killer in Yorkshire. His 2006 novel The Damned Utd, about the Leeds United soccer manager Brian Clough, was turned into a movie starring Michael Sheen.

title: Opening and Sales for the Week of June 26
description: Openings

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Welcome to NYT Now, the new app from The New York Times.

title: Threes a Trend | At the Spring/Summer 2015 Mens Wear Shows, Printed Shirts and Ties Get Matchy-Matchy
description: There are so many competing guides, tutorials and rules out there for creating the right shirt-and-tie combination that it all seems a bit arbitrary and overcomplicated. Judging from what weve seen at the spring/summer 2015 Milan and Pitti Uomo shows, there might a be a less confusing (and more cheeky) approach to try: shirts and ties that implement the same humorous print. Massimiliano Giornetti, the creative director of Salvatore Ferragamo, paired a tie with a matching shirt emblazoned with grazing giraffes. Marc Jacobs, whose collection featured cool interpretations of pastels and flamingo imagery, showed a shirt and tie, both in a pink fern print, under a dusty rose checked suit that somehow still maintained an edge. The Z Zegna show, which was at Pitti Uomo in Florence this season, displayed a smart balance of athletic wear and fine Italian tailoring. One example was a pentagonal polka dot shirt with an elasticated hem, worn with a matching tie and trainers.

title: Pictures of the Day: Iraq and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Iraq, England, the Philippines and Washington, D.C.

title: Talented Bulgarian Leads Youthful Assault on Big 4
description: WIMBLEDON, England  There is an unmistakable buzz around the hallowed Centre Court when Grigor Dimitrov, a 23-year-old Bulgarian, steps onto the manicured lawn. It is not merely in anticipation that his special lady friend, Maria Sharapova, might make an unscheduled appearance in the players box.

title: Longer Heart Monitoring Backed for Stroke Patients
description: More than a half-million Americans every year have an ischemic stroke, the most common form, which disrupts blood flow to the brain. And at least a quarter of these cases have no apparent underlying cause.

title: Newly Released Books
description: CLOSED DOORSBy Lisa ODonnell249 pages. Harper. $26.99.

title: In a Balancing Act, Carving Space From Ledge to Ledge With a Strut
description: On Tuesday afternoon in the courtyard next to the John Street United Methodist Church in Lower Manhattan, a striking man stood on a narrow concrete ledge and gazed at a small crowd gathered beneath him. The man was Souleymane Badolo, a dancer and choreographer from Burkina Faso who has lived and worked in New York since 2009. The crowd came to watch his Virgule de lhistoire (Comma of history), part of the River to River Festival.

title: Italy Gets Real
description: MILAN  Her face a mask of immobility, her skin spray-tanned to the color of bacon, Anna Dello Russo  camera-magnet and editor at large for Vogue Japan  grasped a hand-held clad in the seasons hot accessory, a phone case resembling a bottle of Chanel No. 5.

title: The Return of Real Blood and Other Medical Norms
description: Dr. Mehmet Oz, the cardiac surgeon and television personality, has been making headlines for all the wrong reasons lately, but when he turns up in the premiere of the new season of NY Med, ABCs documentary hospital series, hes not much of a distraction. Thats because his patient, a young man who turns out to have a tear in his aorta, is in such agony that he commands all your attention.

title: Another Spelling Production
description: Candy Spelling uses the Internet, but she cant bring herself to try dating sites. They scare me, she said.

title: A Mystical Offering of Grateful Devotion
description: With each passing summer Savion Glover slips into the Joyce Theater with a new show that strives to strip tap to its purest spirit. Theres always a mood to go with it. Will Mr. Glover be playful? Withdrawn? Bizarre? This season, hes intent on showing a more mystical side; OM  unsettling, yet hypnotic  falls under weird. Performed on Tuesday at the Joyce Theater, the work relies on a spiritual beat to sync the past with the present that begins with Mr. Glovers decisive feet and emanates through his body in waves of remembrance, homage, allegiance. This is worship.

title: Senior U.S. Prosecutor Who Fought Wall St. Is Departing
description: After five years of tussling with Goldman Sachs, JPMorgan Chase and the giant hedge fund SAC Capital Advisors, Lorin L. Reisner is ready for a change.

title: Wars Lingering Requiem in Vietnam
description: A museum in Vietnam memorialized the work of photographers who died covering the conflict. It includes indelible images by Western and North Vietnamese photographers.

title: Updating the Gold Standard to Platinum
description: For the last decade, Kaitlyn Cullinane has had her light-brown hair highlighted with golden tones in the winter and lighter ones during the warmer months. This year she decided to try something a little more dramatic.

title: Even Advice Isnt Free Anymore
description: Are your friends always coming to you for advice? Maybe you could start a business. Charging for what might once have been informal counsel is becoming more common  and the growing freelance economy may be behind the shift.

title: Deal to End Senate Rift May Give Democrats Full Control in Albany
description: A group of independent Democrats who share control of the New York State Senate with Republicans agreed on Wednesday to reunite with their fellow Democrats, a move that could shift the balance of power in Albany.

title: The Man Who Hated Gravity, Part 2
description: In my recent column about Roger Babson, the eccentric tycoon who tried to save humanity from the deadly force of gravity, I noted that for all its perils  death by avalanche, drowning and so forth  gravity is far from a complete villain. It sustains life on earth by holding in the atmosphere. But as you get higher above the planet, the air becomes steadily thinner until, in space, a person without a protective suit would die as surely as a swimmer pulled to the bottom of a lake. Danger lurks above and below.

title: Knicks Agree to Trade Chandler and Felton to Mavericks
description: Phil Jackson has been fairly methodical in his short tenure as the Knicks president.

title: At Google I/O Conference, Protesters Inside and Out
description: Inside the darkened auditorium of the Google I/O developer conference in San Francisco, 6,000 people cheered, yelled and clapped as Google executives showed off the companys latest wares.

title: Which Way Do the Sneaker Prints Lead?
description: Is the runway a two-way street? The thought occurred to one observer as he wended his way through the mens fashion weeks. One particular style of shoe  the white sneaker, low-topped, often in leather  recurred again and again, on the runway and in the front rows. It raised the question: Do trends trickle down, or do they trickle up?

title: A Provocateur Prepares to Show His Quiet Side
description: Two days before his mens wear presentation for Loewe, the first since his appointment as creative director last September, Jonathan Anderson was standing at the companys soon-to-be-former headquarters on the Rue Franois Ier in Paris. It would be a goodbye of sorts to the place where he has spent much of his time these last eight months. The presentation will be held at the new offices, on St.-Sulpice. The space will be not only an office and headquarters, but for the first time, the home of the design team, which Mr. Anderson has imported from the labels native Madrid.

title: United Church of Christ Joins Sponsors of Gay Games
description: A PROTESTANT denomination known for its longtime support of religious diversity and inclusion has agreed to become a sponsor of the 2014 edition of the Gay Games, to be held in northeast Ohio from Aug. 9 to 16.

title: Q. and A.: William C. Kirby on Can China Lead?
description: In the book Can China Lead?: Reaching the Limits of Power and Growth, William C. Kirby and F. Warren McFarlan of Harvard Business School and Regina M. Abrami of the Wharton School explore whether China will become the worlds leading power.

title: Summer With a Fringe Built In
description: Texture was big on the fall runways, which were a frenzy of fur and feathers in artful assemblages and rainbows of colors. No need, though, to wait to try out an artsy-craftsy look for yourself. For summer, think fur-like. Ryan Roche, who works in upstate New York, uses crocheted cashmere for her lovely furry fringe sweaters. Maria Cornejo used a synthetic feather effect for a shrug and as trim on a silk dress. Other labels, like Chlo and Samuji, a young Finnish line to watch, have affixed fringe all over lightweight sweaters and linen dresses. At a recent Acria event to raise money for H.I.V. research and education, the fashionable art director Sofa Sanchez Barrenechea wore an ostrich feather and faille tulip dress from Jason Wus spring 2010 collection, proving that not every soiree calls for a brand-new frock, just one you want to reach out and touch.

title: Little in Common, Save a Continent
description: The New York Asian Film Festival, whose 13th edition begins on Friday, can kindly be described as eclectic. Other festivals may stick to a theme or reflect a particular curatorial vision. The Asian Film Festival is all over the place. (And its a very big place.).

title: Shedding Light on Nazi-Occupied Paris
description: If Jean Guhenno had never existed, France would surely have had to invent him. A model writer and intellectual who neither collaborated nor accommodated the enemy, he refused to publish a single word as long as his country was under Nazi control. A leading essayist of the Popular Front, regularly skewered by the far right, he vowed, as of July 1940, to confine his thoughts and feelings to a private journal. It is a mystery why Diary of the Dark Years, 1940-1944, first published in 1947 and still a standard reference in France, is only now appearing in English in a fine translation by David Ball. Is there something about our own political climate that allows us finally to hear Guhennos voice clearly?

title: Classic Folk, Tested for Signs of Jazz
description: The West Coast singer Tierney Sutton would seem to be an ideal translator of Joni Mitchell songs into a jazz idiom because so many of them traverse traditional boundaries of pop, rock and folk to be their own thing, whatever you want to call it. Ms. Sutton, who does her own version of the same thing, recently released a mildly experimental Mitchell tribute album, After Blue (BFM Jazz), that plays with the songs rhythms, inserts improvisatory vocal passages and takes other liberties without bending them out of shape.

title: Team Player Is Honored With a Solo
description: A festival and a tribute are happily crossing paths in the last week of the New York Philharmonics subscription season at Avery Fisher Hall. This weeks program, first performed on Tuesday evening, is the third and last in the orchestras Beethoven festival built around the five piano concertos, with Yefim Bronfman as soloist and Alan Gilbert conducting.

title: Rare Stradivari Viola Fails to Attract Buyer
description: Maybe the rare-instruments market is showing signs of coming back to earth a bit, or maybe Sothebys and Ingles & Hayday simply asked for too much money for a fiddle.

title: More Calls to Fix Music Royalty Rules, but No Accord
description: Two weeks ago, a House Judiciary subcommittee heard from a group of music executives that the complex licensing system is broken, but no consensus emerged about how to fix it. On Wednesday, the same committee heard from a different group of executives that the licensing system is broken, and once again there was no agreement on how to fix it.

title: Kicking Up Their Heels in Tribute
description: Few shows inspire the same level of nostalgia as A Chorus Line does. It opened at the Public Theater in April 1975, moved to the Shubert Theater on Broadway three months later and went on to play 6,137 performances. In the process, it won the Pulitzer Prize, seven Drama Desk awards and nine Tony Awards.

title: Like Lunch With Monet
description: The garden that opened last month at Ladure, the restaurant and shop in SoHo, is a 2,600-square-foot oasis designed to evoke Paris. Elisabeth Holder, a president of Ladure in the United States, said that the green powder-coated metal chairs are airy interpretations of their counterparts at the Luxembourg Garden and the Tuileries, while the black metal trellises on arched windows were inspired by the Htel Plaza Athne. (Visitors will also note that an antique fountain burbles like a messenger from Proust.)

title: Furnishings Made of Rope: Knotty but No Problem
description: At Thom Filicias weekend house, bathroom mirrors are framed in rope, chairs are made out of it and a thick length serves as a stair rail.

title: Capturing Detroits Local Flavor
description: In 2010, Gregory Holm, a photographer and filmmaker, and Matthew Radune, an architect, soaked and froze an abandoned home in Detroit creating a luminous ice sculpture that made a ticklish point about the citys many foreclosures. The same year, Mr. Holm built a soundstage in an empty fire station and produced a concert with local composers, a youth choir and eccentric instruments like a fire-powered organ.

title: After the Cows Left Home
description: In the town of Moorenweis, in southern Germany, there are a number of imposing Alpine-style chalets. But the house that Michael Schnabl, 38, and his wife, Bernadette, a 35-year-old actress, chose to make their own was a 19th-century Bavarian farmhouse with a rundown barn.

title: Botanys New Boys
description: Des Moines  A medium-size state capital does not become a competitive global city without a public display of shrubbery. As theories of urban development go, thats a novel one. Yet nabobs in Iowa appear to believe in it so strongly that they are raising $18.2 million to close the dogwood gap.

title: Melissa Leos Theater in the Round
description: STONE RIDGE, N.Y.  From the road, Melissa Leos 200-year-old farmhouse would seem to be standard issue for Ulster County, with all the usual trappings: on the porch, a hammock, some wind chimes, a few directors chairs, an armless mannequin wearing a flowery dress and a baseball cap, her arms strewed about her feet; up above, an enormous peace sign (Woodstock is less than 20 miles away).

title: At World Cup, Two Unknowns Are Surprise Stars
description: If youve been watching ESPNs nightly World Cup wrap-up show, you have probably seen them  not beneath the swaying palm trees on the Rio de Janeiro beachfront set with the rest of the on-air talent, but squished together in an eight-by-five-foot room. Two scruffy, balding Britons, clutching a miniature banana as a make-believe microphone, riffing on the days games. Maybe youve even heard them describe the Brazilian star Neymar as a Japanese manga character come to life, or the Portuguese forward Cristiano Ronaldo as a petulant show pony.

title: Stretching to Infinity and Beyond
description: Since 1996, the New York designer David Weeks has been turning out furniture, lighting, toys and even wallpaper with gorilla heads. His latest project, the Infinity Screen, is a series of interlocking four-by-six-inch paper modules that can grow to any dimension. The piece came about when the W Hotel in Fort Lauderdale, Fla., commissioned Mr. Weeks to design a light installation that required no electricity. He used die-cut paper coated in shiny Mylar to create a fixture that resembled a chandelier. When the project was done, he decided to explore other uses for the technique. It was an exercise in form, he said. The panels ($250 a square yard) are made of card stock paper and can be used as a room divider or window covering. A stainless-steel mounting bracket is $150 per 36-inch length. Mr. Weeks will produce the screen in other materials or in printed versions for custom projects. Information: 212-966-3433 or davidweeksstudio.com.

title: Rustic, Raw and Thoroughly Modern
description: Cape Cod Modern: Midcentury Architecture and Community on the Outer Cape, by Peter McMahon and Christine Cipriani (Metropolis Books, $33), reveals one of the East Coasts best-kept architectural secrets: an enclave of disarmingly unpretentious houses, many inspired by chicken coops and oyster houses. Often made with scavenged wood mixed with raw lumber straight from the yard, the buildings were designed by Marcel Breuer, Eero Saarinen, Serge Chermayeff, Maurice Smith and serious amateurs. In this rich cultural setting, left-leaning figures including Mary McCarthy, Edmund Wilson, Dwight Macdonald and Noam Chomsky dined on plywood tables, bathed nude in brisk waters on principle and exercised elastic morals among the unpainted two-by-fours. It was a summer camp for consenting, distinctly un-Puritanical intellectuals. And the party neednt be over. Many of the houses are in the Cape Cod National Seashore conservation park, with some recently restored for summer rental and for artists in the off-season.

title: A Burst of Vivid Colors
description: Niche Moderns Crystalline Collection of blown-glass pendant lamps includes four shapes that vaguely allude to molecular structures. Deep down in the core of my being, I love order and mathematics, said Jeremy Pyles, who founded the company with his wife, Mary Welch. But the main reason that the group burst onto the scene in a flash of eight mostly vivid colors, including a blue inspired by the palette of the Hotel Condesa in Mexico City, had to do with their bulbs. Niche Moderns existing lamps offered few options for low-energy bulbs, or for the 240-volt varieties used overseas, where the company has been brightening a growing number of hotels and restaurants. The Crystalline series will accommodate both models of the stylish Plumen compact fluorescent light bulb, as well as Niche Moderns specialty incandescent bulb. The collection is available through July 15 at Lumens.com and following that through Niche Modern. From $550. Information: nichemodern.com.

title: Sales at Fishs Eddy, Ethan Allen, John Robshaw and DLV Designs
description: Fishs Eddy is discounting some tabletop, glassware and accessories by 50 percent, in-store only, while supplies last (the Dog Decal tray, originally about $23, is about $11); 889 Broadway (East 19th Street), 212-420-9020.

title: The Collections | The Top Five Spring/Summer 2015 Mens Wear Shows in Milan
description: In Milan, the best spring/summer 2015 mens shows were true to the names behind them. Fashion houses celebrated their signature style with throwbacks to archival silhouettes and prints, while newer creative directors seamlessly incorporated their own visions into the DNA of the iconic brands they design for. These five collections represent refreshing new directions anchored in timeless design.

title: Senior Teams at European Championships in Croatia
description: In the 1960s and 70s, the battle for the medals at the European Bridge Championship was among just a few countries. Back then, it was vital for the contenders to score as many victory points as possible against the weaker nations. In particular, the strong teams gained many points from superior declarer play and defense. Today, bidding has assumed a more important role. Also, competitive bidding has become much more aggressive.

title: Seeing Loneliness or Something Like It
description: The weather is always a collaborator in River to River, the Lower Manhattan Cultural Councils annual festival of site-specific performance, and last weekend it was in peak form. The festivals organizer, Sam Miller, deserved nothing less; his lineup this year is stellar. Lucid skies, light breezes and just-right temperatures made a dancegoer rejoice in the concept of piers, lawns and seaside cafes as theatrical spaces, as did the stealthy use of those spaces by the artists who occupied them.

title: Lending Mozart a Left Hand
description: In a time that has brought us renovations and revisions of Vivaldis Four Seasons, Beethovens Seventh Symphony and Stravinskys Rite of Spring, among other overhauls, do we really need a recomposition of Mozarts Coronation Concerto?

title: A Carbon Tax and Climate Change
Bidding Farewell to a Home of Visionary Art With Space Travel and a Vodka Shot
description: Welcome aboard Ozet, a colossal spacecraft launched from Moscow in 1929 carrying nearly 700 eager pioneers and a lake full of sturgeon.

title: Disney Hopes New (and Nostalgic) Formula Will Draw Tweens
description: LOS ANGELES  Disney Channel has a history of serving up programming that defines pop culture for pre-teenage girls: Lizzie McGuire, Hannah Montana, Wizards of Waverly Place, High School Musical. But that cable network has not found a new live-action juggernaut in years and its overall ratings are declining.

title: The Supreme Court Justices Have Cellphones, Too
description: Fourteen years ago, the Rehnquist court interrupted a string of law enforcement victories to rule that when looking for illegal drugs, the police couldnt simply walk down the aisle of an intercity bus and squeeze the bags and soft-sided luggage on the overhead rack.

title: The Mississippi Primary
description: To the Editor:

title: Limits of U.S. Influence
description: To the Editor:

title: Beyond the Central Park 5
description: To the Editor:

title: Empathy for Animals
description: To the Editor:

title: Putting Teeth in Her Look
description: The Haut Marais neighborhood in Paris is the epicenter of bohemian bourgeois French style. What I like about this neighborhood is that it is romantic and fashionable, said Johanna Lebrun, who was in the area riding her Peugeot bike from the 1950s. The idea is not necessarily to show off wealth, but to show a cool attitude. Wearing a floral, flowing Vanessa Bruno dress (which she said was like wearing a painting) and carrying a 50-year-old Herms bag, Ms. Lebrun was channeling just that attitude. This interview has been edited and condensed.

title: Navigating National Parks With Light and Rich Digital Guides
description: IT wasnt long ago that a trip to a national park meant packing books, paper maps, a guide to help identify plants and wildlife, and tools like a compass. Now apps can help with all these things.

title: World Cup 2014: A Tie Sends France Through and Ecuador Out
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  The goals came so easy, and so often, for France in its first two games at the World Cup that one could be forgiven for assuming it might never end. Three against Honduras. Five against Switzerland.

title: App Smart | Visiting National Parks
description: Kit Eaton explores three apps that will help you get the most out of your trip to Yellowstone, Yosemite or hundreds of other parks.

title: Night Sky and the Soul
description: To the Editor:

title: Human Rights in Morocco
description: To the Editor:

title: GoPros I.P.O. Prices at Top of Range, Leading a Wave of Newly Public Companies
description: Updated, 7:19 p.m. | Since its founding in 2004, GoPro has become the biggest name in action videos, its tiny cameras attached to hundreds of surfboards, sports bikes and skydiving helmets.

title: Michael Walrond on His Loss to Charles Rangel
description: The Rev. Michael A. Walrond, the senior minister at First Corinthian Baptist Church in Harlem, whom I wrote about in last Sundays magazine, drew about 8 percent of the vote in the Democratic primary for New Yorks 13th Congressional District. We are extremely proud of the campaign we have organized, and Mikes visionary leadership will continue to impact our community through his work at First Corinthian Baptist Church, his campaign said in a statement yesterday. Walrond called later and said he was relieved the campaign was over and talked about what it was like to run against and lose to Representative Charles Rangel.

title: League of Legends Sets Game Championship for Korean Stadium
description: Months after the FIFA World Cup in Brazil ends, another World Cup venue will host a very different kind of competition: a championship battle between players of one of the worlds most popular online games.

title: Egyptian Activists to Stand Trial for Protesting Ban on Protests
description: A prosecutor in Cairo plans to charge 23 opposition activists with violating a new law banning unsanctioned protests for attending a rally last Saturday against the ban.

title: Creativity Unleashed, With the Help of a Little Pi
description: Raspberry Pi, a tiny computer the size of a credit card, has captured the imaginations of students, educators and tinkerers around the world since it became available in 2012. Earlier this month, the organization behind the computer announced that it had sold its three millionth device.

title: Boehner to Seek Bill to Sue Obama
description: John A. Boehner, the House speaker, said he intended to file a lawsuit accusing President Obama of failing to carry out laws passed by Congress.

title: Boehner to Seek Bill to Sue Obama Over Executive Actions
description: WASHINGTON  Speaker John A. Boehner announced Wednesday that he would introduce legislation next month allowing the House to sue President Obama over his use of executive actions.

title: Grimms Threats May Have Broken House Rules, Ethics Report Says
description: WASHINGTON  Representative Michael G. Grimm of New York, who is already facing criminal charges, may also have violated House ethics rules in January when he threatened a reporter for the NY1 television station who was interviewing him in the Capitol, the Office of Congressional Ethics has concluded.

title: His Earlier Stints Ended by Felonies, Ex-Mayor of Providence Announces Hell Run Again
description: Ending months of self-generated suspense, Vincent A. Cianci Jr., the garrulous and polarizing former mayor of Providence, R.I., whose two stints in office collapsed in felony convictions, announced on his radio talk show Wednesday that he wanted his old job back.

title: Thad Cochrans Debt to Mississippi
description: The prospect of electing an intemperate Tea Party candidate who was openly nostalgic for Confederate days was so repellent to many black voters in Mississippi that they did a remarkable thing on Tuesday, crossing party lines to help give the Republican Senate nomination to Thad Cochran, in office for 36 years. Now its time for Mr. Cochran to return the favor by supporting a stronger Voting Rights Act and actively working to reduce his partys extreme antigovernment policies.

title: Paula Kent Meehan, Co-Founder of a Hair-Care Giant, Dies at 82
description: In the 1950s, Paula Jane Baer, an aspiring actress who had adopted the stage name Paula Kent, came to the realization that she would never match the success of her junior high friend Debbie Reynolds.

title: The Iraqi Friends We Abandoned
description: LOS ANGELES  LETS be perfectly coldblooded about it, President Richard M. Nixon mused to Henry A. Kissinger. South Vietnam is probably never gonna survive anyway. It was August 1972, and Nixon was worried about the inevitable collapse of South Vietnam after American forces withdrew. Mr. Kissinger concurred: Weve got to find some formula that holds the thing together a year or two. If we settle it, say, this October, by January 74 no one will give a damn.

title: Speaking to My Father in a Dead Dialect
description: The 18th-century Italian philosopher Giambattista Vico believed that as a civilization progressed, it lost touch with its creative origins. An ancient warrior would never declare Im angry; he would wax metaphorical with my blood boils. The Roman poet Horace went a step further, believing that when words died they took memories with them. Just as forests change their leaves each year, so, too, do words: new languages bloom and thrive but only after the old race dies.

title: World Cup 2014: Germany Players Cautious, Calling U.S. Very Dangerous
description: RECIFE, Brazil  Sunil Gulati, the president of U.S. Soccer, is aware of the narrative surrounding the team, of how perceptions of it have changed over the years, of how quickly those can flip.

title: Tense Vote Spares Polish Government After Recordings Scandal
description: WARSAW  The Polish Parliament voted Wednesday to retain the embattled government of Prime Minister Donald Tusk, despite an embarrassing scandal involving several top officials whose private, often profane conversations in upscale Warsaw restaurants had been bugged for more than a year.

title: God and Mammon
Snakes and Thorny Brush, and Children at the Border Alone
description: HIDALGO, Tex.  Border agents drove their patrol vehicles one recent day at dusk through this spit of land on the bank of the Rio Grande. Here, in a place known as the Devils Corner, smugglers on the Mexican side have chosen to bring thousands of women and children to American soil.

title: Michael Bradley, Motor in U.S. Midfield, Needs a Tuneup
description: RECIFE, Brazil  If Landon Donovan was the face of United States soccer, then Michael Bradley was  and is  its motor. Bradley is a mainstay in the American lineup, operating in the midfield and generally acting as a conduit between the teams defense and attack.

title: Judge Rejects Effort to Compel Christie to Keep Promise on New Jerseys Pension Fund
description: TRENTON  A judge on Wednesday denied a bid by public employee unions to force Gov. Chris Christie to make the pension payments he promised in signature legislation three years ago, ruling that the states staggering $1.7 billion budget deficit left him simply unable to meet that commitment.

title: S.E.C. Stops City in Illinois From Selling Municipal Bonds
description: Federal regulators went to court on Wednesday to keep a city in Illinois from bringing its bonds to market, an unprecedented step they called necessary to halt a widening securities fraud.

title: In Puerto Rico, a Proposal for Revamping Debt
description: Puerto Ricos governor, signaling worsening financial trouble for the island, on Wednesday proposed a legal means to revamp the debt of some its largest public corporations, which provide vital services like electricity.

title: His Back Mending, Tiger Woodss Shot Is Next
description: BETHESDA, Md.  After hitting the 10th tee shot of his comeback, Tiger Woods settled into a folding chair to the side of the first tee. The sign taped to the back of the reserved seat read, Wounded Warrior.

title: Facebook Mirrors Tech Industrys Lack of Diversity
description: When it comes to the gender and ethnic diversity of its work force, Facebooks record is on par with the rest of Silicon Valley. Its overwhelmingly male, white and Asian. And white men dominate the management ranks.

title: Sales of Hillary Clintons New Memoir Drop Sharply in 2nd Week
description: Sales of Hillary Rodham Clintons new memoir, Hard Choices, declined 43.5 percent to 48,000 copies in its second week on the shelves, according to Nielsen BookScan.

title: Larry Page on Googles Many Arms
description: SAN FRANCISCO  One way to think of Google is as an extremely helpful, all-knowing, hyper-intelligent executive assistant. Already, it can remind you about your flight, open up your boarding pass when you get to the airport and offer you driving directions to your hotel when you land.

title: Stalemate Over Garment Factory Safety in Bangladesh
description: Eight times now, the European-dominated Accord on Fire and Building Safety in Bangladesh  a group of more than 150 retailers and brands  has forced the temporary closing of garment factories after its inspectors found dangerous conditions.

title: Another of the Hollywood Sexual Abuse Suits Is Dropped
description: LOS ANGELES  Another of the sexual abuse lawsuits filed in Hawaii against various Hollywood executives and filmmakers by Michael Egan, this one against Garth Ancier, the longtime television executive, was voluntarily dismissed on Wednesday. Lawyers for Mr. Egan filed a brief notice of the dismissal with the United States District Court for the District of Hawaii. The dismissal was filed without prejudice, meaning that the claims of statutory rape and other abuse could be refiled.

title: G.M. Halts Sale of Cruze Sedan Over Takata Air Bags
description: General Motors ordered dealers to stop selling the 2013 and 2014 versions of its most popular car, the Chevrolet Cruze sedan, because of a problem with air bags made by the Japanese supplier Takata, whose products are already the subject of a large recall of other vehicles.

title: In a U.S. Court, Iraqis Accuse Blackwater of Killings in 2007
description: WASHINGTON  The witness wore a suit with no tie, the top button of his gray shirt undone. He had told this story many times, and now that he was in the United States, telling his story at last to a jury, he appeared neither hurried nor anxious.

title: Obamas Weakness, or Ours?
description: The odds are that you think President Obamas foreign policy is a failure.

title: In Ghanas Bags: Gear and $3 Million in Cash
description: BRASLIA  An airplane laden with cash descended into Brazilian airspace, or so Ghanas national soccer team was told on Wednesday, and the question for each player shifted away from the topics of how to stop Portugals Cristiano Ronaldo or whether Ghana had a realistic chance to advance to the second round of the World Cup.

title: Mississippi Goes for the Money
description: Mississippi has sent us a message. I believe it boils down to: We Want Our Stuff.

title: Russia and Others Seek Extended Ukraine Truce, but Separatists Balk
description: DONETSK, Ukraine  The leaders of Russia, Ukraine, France and Germany on Wednesday called for extending the truce between government and rebel troops in eastern Ukraine, even as separatist leaders said that the peace process had collapsed.

title: Cellphone Ruling Could Alter Police Methods, Experts Say
description: The Supreme Court decision making it harder for the police to search cellphones without a warrant could change procedures around the country, police officials and legal experts said Wednesday.

title: U.S. Chided for Delays Over Treaty on Weapons
description: The American peace activist who pioneered a treaty that bans antipersonnel land mines chided the Obama administration on Wednesday for not yet having signed it after five years of review. The activist, Jody Williams, said that China  which also has not signed  now appears to have far fewer of these weapons than the United States.

title: Bergdahl to Be Questioned About Leaving Army Post
description: WASHINGTON  Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl will face investigators seeking to determine his legal future in about two weeks, Army officials said Wednesday, as they described the parameters of an inquiry to decide whether the onetime prisoner of war in Afghanistan intended to desert when he walked away from his combat outpost in 2009.

title: Beating of Roma Boy Exposes Tensions in Frances Underclass
description: PIERREFITTE-SUR-SEINE, France  With its bleak concrete apartment blocks and clutches of bored, jobless young men, the Cit des Potes housing project defies its idyllic name.

title: Blacks Regain Sway at Polls in Mississippi
description: JACKSON, Miss.  For the first time since President Richard M. Nixons divisive Southern strategy that sent whites to the Republican Party and blacks to the Democrats, African-American voters have come out in force for a Republican in the Deep South.

title: How Breakfast May Be Served
description: THURSDAYS PUZZLE  O.K., the truth here: How many of you were honestly able to solve the entire puzzle without once thinking of the fortune cookie game where people read their fortunes out loud and add  IN BED at the end? No? Just me?

title: World Cup 2014: Germany Defeats United States, 1-0
description: Germany won, 1-0, but the United States still advanced out of Group G, thanks to Portugals 2-1 victory over Ghana.

title: Questions Raised Over Trial for Ahmed Abu Khattala in Benghazi Case
description: WASHINGTON  For the past five days or so, the Libyan suspected of being the ringleader in the 2012 attacks that killed four Americans in Benghazi, Libya, has been steaming across the Atlantic Ocean to the United States aboard a hulking Navy ship.

title: Violence and Uncertainty Mar Libyan Election for a New Parliament
description: TRIPOLI, Libya  With their expectations battered, Libyans headed to the polls on Wednesday to elect members of a new Parliament, in a vote seen as a critical step in a democratic transition that was overshadowed by an intensifying civil conflict in the eastern part of the country.

title: On the Ethnic and Racial Paths to Political Power, Nothing Is Inevitable
description: So sue me and revoke my good-government papers. The performance artist known as Charlie Rangel may have a tattered ethics portfolio. But he does a most entertaining election night throwdown.

title: Shiite Violence Traps Baghdads Sunnis, Haunted by a Grim Past
description: BAGHDAD  The bodies arrive in twos and threes most every day in the Baghdad morgue now, a grim barometer of the citys sectarian tensions. Most have gunshot wounds to the head, some have signs of torture, and most of them are Sunnis.

title: U.S. Imposes Sanctions on Pakistani Militants
description: LONDON  The United States imposed economic sanctions on Wednesday against two senior members of the Pakistani militant group Lashkar-e-Taiba and designated its charity wing, Jamaat-ud-Dawa, as a front organization.

title: Derek Jeters Birthday Scorecard
description: Derek Jeter of the Yankees was born on June 26, 1974, in Pequannock, N.J. On his 40th birthday, in his final season, here is a look at how he has fared each June 26 during his career. BY ELENA GUSTINES

title: Man Kills Himself at Beirut Hotel as Security Closes In
description: BEIRUT  A Saudi man blew himself up in a Beirut hotel on Wednesday as security forces stormed it in what Lebanons interior minister called a pre-emptive strike against a terrorist cell preparing to strike elsewhere, Lebanons national news service said.

title: Sri Lanka: Advisers Set for Inquiry
description: The United Nations named three international experts on Wednesday to be advisers on an inquiry into human rights abuses in the final months of Sri Lankas war against ethnic Tamil insurgents in 2009. The three are Martti Ahtisaari, a former president of Finland and Nobel Peace Prize-winning diplomat; Silvia Cartwright, who served as a judge on the war crimes tribunal in Cambodia; and Asma Jahangir, a veteran human rights defender from Pakistan. The United Nations Human Rights Council voted in March to authorize the inquiry. Its 12-member team of investigators is supposed to present preliminary findings as early as September. Whether the experts will be allowed entry into Sri Lanka, which has resisted such an inquiry, remains unclear.

title: Gifts for Jeter Before 40th Birthday: A Victory Followed by a Day Off
description: TORONTO  Derek Jeter turns 40 years old Thursday, and he is delighted the Yankees will not be playing a game. Not because it gives him more time to celebrate and not because he needs an extra days rest.

title: After Raising Bar, Wheeler Crashes Out in 2 Innings
description: The perplexing sophomore season of Zack Wheeler took another abrupt and wild turn on Wednesday, his first appearance since he pitched a shutout against the Miami Marlins.

title: World Cup 2014: Portugal Defeats Ghana, 2-1
description: This was a Portugal campaign that never got going. Ghana were pretty punchless today  who knows how much the off-field problems affected them.

title: Teenie Hodges, Soul Guitarist and Songwriter, Dies at 68
description: Teenie Hodges, a guitarist and songwriter whose lithe touch on songs by Al Green and others helped shape the sound of Memphis soul in the 1970s, died on Sunday in Dallas. He was 68.

title: Port Authoritys Airports to Get Free Wi-Fi
description: The regions major airports will finally offer free Wi-Fi to travelers, but the generosity has a time limit: 30 minutes.

title: Loan Sought for Tappan Zee Work Is Faulted
description: A plan by Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and the agency building a new Tappan Zee Bridge to borrow a half-billion dollars provided under the federal Clean Water Act has come under fire from nine environmental and transportation groups that argue the money would be improperly spent on basic construction, not enhancing water quality.

title: Gifts of $300 to Homeless Are Reduced to a Lunch
description: The Tour of Love and Gratitude luncheon at the Loeb Boathouse in Central Park took a decisive turn for the worse on Wednesday soon after the 200 or so guests had finished their filet of beef with horseradish and were just about to tuck into their seasonal berries in phyllo cups.

title: Developer Reaches Deal to Finish 80-Story Tower
description: The developer Larry A. Silverstein plans to resume construction of a long-stalled 80-story building at the World Trade Center site immediately, under an agreement the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey approved on Wednesday.

title: 984 Ways the United States Can Advance to the Next Round of the World Cup
description: An interactive matrix of game scenarios based on the outcomes of the U.S. vs. Germany and Portugal vs. Ghana matches.

title: World Cup 2014: Belgium Defeats South Korea, 1-0
description: The Belgians, picked by some as outside threats to win the tournament, won all three of their games in Group H, with decisive late goals against Algeria, Russia and South Korea.

title: World Cup 2014: Algeria and Russia Play to a 1-1 Draw
description: Algeria didnt make it easy for themselves, but advanced to the knockout rounds of the World Cup for the first time with a 1-1 tie against Russia.

title: Japanese Artists Respond to Fukushima
description: More than three years after a 9.0 magnitude earthquake struck the northern region of Japan, causing a tsunami that killed more than 15,000 people, its effects are still being felt. The impact of the tsunami and earthquake damaged some of the reactors in one nuclear plant in the city of Fukushima, causing radiation to escape into the area  and scarring the national psyche.

title: A Photographic Memory, Skewed
description: In this weekly series, Ts photo editors share the most compelling visual projects theyve discovered.

title: Ikea to Increase Minimum Hourly Pay
description: Ikea plans to adopt a wage structure that it says will raise the average hourly minimum wage at its 38 stores in the United States to $10.76 an hour  a 17 percent increase.

title: Use of Drones for Killings Risks a War Without End, Panel Concludes in Report
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administrations embrace of targeted killings using armed drones risks putting the United States on a slippery slope into perpetual war and sets a dangerous precedent for lethal operations that other countries might adopt in the future, according to a report by a bipartisan panel that includes several former senior intelligence and military officials.

title: Putting Us All at Risk for Measles
description: One of my 11-year-old twin daughters recently came home from school distraught. When I asked why, she lifted her foot.

description: malicious \m-li-shs\ adjective

title: Aspirin May Cut Pancreatic Cancer Risk
description: A new study adds to the evidence that low-dose aspirin, known to reduce the risk for heart disease, may also reduce the risk for pancreatic cancer.

title: Purses Vanish, and a 68-Year-Old Is Blamed
description: One purse dangled casually from the back of a restaurant chair, its unsuspecting owners attention focused elsewhere. Another sat unattended on a table in a crowded Brooklyn bar.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for June 25, 2014
Potential No. 1 Pick in N.H.L. Draft Is Only No. 3 Among His Brothers
description: Like many Canadians, the brothers Max, Griffin and Sam Reinhart grew up playing hockey.

title: Johnnie M. Walters, I.R.S. Chief Who Resisted Nixons Pressure, Dies at 94
description: Johnnie M. Walters, a commissioner of the Internal Revenue Service under President Richard M. Nixon who left office after refusing to prosecute people on Nixons notorious enemies list, died on Tuesday at his home in Greenville, S.C. He was 94.

title: Quotation of the Day for Thursday, June 26, 2014
description: It is fair to say that nowadays there is only fear in us.

title: South Korea: A Familiar Premier
description: President Park Geun-hye reversed her decision to replace her current prime minister, after two successive appointees stepped aside amid controversies over their qualifications. Prime Minister Chung Hong-won had offered to resign in late April, as the government came under fire for failing to prevent the sinking of a ferry on April 16 that left more than 300 people dead. Ms. Park accepted his resignation but asked him to stay in office while she looked for a replacement. But her first choice, a former Supreme Court justice named Ahn Dae-hee, was forced to withdraw his name amid questions over his earnings. Her second choice, Moon Chang-keuk, a retired conservative newspaper columnist, bowed out on Tuesday. Critics accused him of being unpatriotic after it was revealed that he said during a church lecture in 2011 that Koreas colonization by Japan in the early 20th century was Gods will. This was the first time in South Korean history that a president retained a prime minister who had resigned.

title: Corrections: June 26, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Whats on Thursday
description: 9 P.M. (Logo) TRAILBLAZERS On the anniversary of the striking down of the Defense of Marriage Act, this special honors Edie Windsor, who challenged the acts constitutionality, and the lawyer Roberta Kaplan, who took the case to the Supreme Court. Other honorees include the basketball player Jason Collins, the first openly gay male athlete in a major American sport; Netflixs Orange Is the New Black, for its portrayal of rarely seen television characters; and John Abdallah Wambere, the Ugandan gay rights advocate and refugee. Former President Bill Clinton talks about Ms. Windsor and Ms. Kaplan in a taped message. Daniel Radcliffe, Adam Levine, Jared Leto, Macklemore & Ryan Lewis, Ed Sheeran, Nate Ruess, Demi Lovato and Iggy Azalea appear at this event, filmed on Monday at the Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine in New York. A Great Big World and Sia, with the New York City Gay Mens Chorus, perform.

title: Report of the Task Force on United States Drone Policy
description: This report raises warnings that other countries might adopt the same rationale as the United States has for carrying out lethal drone strikes outside of declared war zones.

title: Climate Campaign Cant Be Deaf to Economic Worries, Obama Warns
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama acknowledged Wednesday that his efforts to combat climate change  in particular, Environmental Protection Agency regulations to slash carbon pollution from cars and coal-fired power plants  could raise fuel and electricity prices. And he told environmental advocates that in order to make a credible case for such climate policies, officials would need to acknowledge Americans worries about the economic effects.

title: Issue of Pay for 2 Sets of Workers Tugs at Palestinian Pact
description: GAZA CITY  Abu Raid al-Samouni, 46, a driver and office cleaner in the Foreign Ministry headquarters here, leaves for work before his 14 children wake up each morning, to avoid their pleas for spare change to buy candy. Like the other 42,000 workers hired while the militant Islamic group Hamas ran the Gaza government over the past seven years, Mr. Samouni has received only part of his $350 monthly salary since October; in April and May, there was no paycheck at all.

title: Chinese Cyclist on Course to Be Countrys First Tour de France Rider
description: A 26-year-old Chinese cyclist is set to be the first person from his country to participate in the Tour de France when the sports biggest race begins next week.

title: Salesforce Takes Its Cloud Model to Health Care
description: Salesforce, the cloud pioneer known for customer management software, is going into health care.

title: Antarctica via France, and Other Tales of Official Expense-Padding
description: Chinese officials suffer from a reputation for dreary rigidity, but it must have taken ingenuity and stamina to spin an inspection tour to Antarctica into a boondoggle that took in visits to Chile and France.

description: Test your knowledge of terms that are key to good health by playing our crossword (PDF). You can find the answers here.

description: This feature looks at the first time famous names or terms appeared in The Times. Have an idea for someone or something you would like to read about? Send a suggestion in the comments section.

title: Opium Production on the Rise Worldwide, U.N. Reports
description: UNITED NATIONS  Illegal opium cultivation occupies more land worldwide than ever before, according to the United Nations, largely because of a surge over the last year in Afghanistan, the dominant opium producer.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Major Ruling Shields Privacy of Cellphones
description: In Major Ruling Shields Privacy of Cellphones, Adam Liptak reports on the Supreme Courts decision about warrantless cellphone searches.

title: Flashy Stock Debuts Help Lift Wilting Chinese Markets
description: HONG KONG  Chinas on-again, off-again market for new domestic share sales returned to action in dramatic fashion Thursday, after shares in three companies that made their trading debut all rose by the maximum 44 percent.

title: A Graduating Kindergarten Class
description: At P.S. 130 in Manhattan, Lily Woo, the school principal, filmed a graduating kindergarten class.

title: Pressure Loss Is Explored in Vanishing of Jetliner
description: CANBERRA, Australia  Nearly four months after Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 vanished into the night, Australian transportation officials said in a report on Thursday that the plane kept flying until it ran out of fuel, most likely because the cockpit crew had become unresponsive, perhaps because of oxygen deprivation.

title: U.K. Inquiry Finds Truly Awful Sexual Abuse by TV Host at Medical Facilities
description: LONDON  The British health authorities said on Thursday that inquiries into sexual abuse by the disgraced television host Jimmy Savile at state-funded medical facilities had revealed truly awful episodes involving patients ages 5 to 75.

title: Semiconductor Makers AMS and Dialog in Early Talks
description: LONDON  The Austrian semiconductor company AMS confirmed on Thursday that it was in preliminary talks about a possible merger of equals with the London-based Dialog Semiconductor.

title: London Stock Exchange to Buy Russell Investments for $2.7 Billion
description: LONDON  The London Stock Exchange said on Thursday that it had agreed to pay $2.7 billion in cash for Russell Investments, the owner of the Russell 2000 stock market index.

title: Mark Sanfords Path of Most Resistance
description: It had been a 14-hour day of campaign-style barnstorming, but at nearly 11 p.m. there was something Mark Sanford felt compelled to show me. We were hiking across the Coosaw Plantation, an enviable slice of Southern landscape that Sanfords family owns. Nestled in the marshy South Carolina coastline, it has ancient live oaks and twisting palmettos, cascading Spanish moss and views of the Coosaw River and the Atlantic beyond. But I could see none of it as we walked in the pitch black.

title: Whats the Matter With Eastern Kentucky?
description: There are many tough places in this country: the ghost cities of Detroit, Camden and Gary, the sunbaked misery of inland California and the isolated reservations where Native American communities were left to struggle. But in its persistent poverty, Eastern Kentucky  land of storybook hills and drawls   just might be the hardest place to live in the United States. Statistically speaking.

title: Support for Maliki Slips Within His Own Party as Armed U.S. Drones Start Flights
description: BAGHDAD  As the first armed American drones began flying over Iraq on Thursday, Shiite political leaders were locked in meetings to try to decide who should be the countrys next prime minister. For the first time, some of Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Malikis own party members expressed doubt that he would be a viable candidate.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Welcome to the Morning Briefing on NYT Now.

title: Jordanian Court Acquits Islamic Cleric in Terrorism Case
description: LONDON  A military court in the Jordanian capital, Amman, on Thursday acquitted a militant Islamic cleric known as Abu Qatada on charges of planning a terrorist attack on an American school there in the late 1990s, the latest chapter in a longstanding legal fight that included a death sentence in absentia, a 10-year court battle in Britain and his deportation a year ago.

title: A More Nuanced Breakdown of the Supreme Court
description: This is the time of year that the news media rolls out a familiar graphic: nine head shots of Supreme Court justices, arrayed from most liberal to most conservative.

title: Todays World Cup Matches: June 26, 2014
description: What to watch for in Thursdays games as teams from Groups G and H battle to advance in the World Cup. For the complete rundown of advancing scenarios, visit The Upshot.

title: Pirates Gamble Produces a Star
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla.  The latest Pittsburgh Pirates phenom is 6 feet 4 inches, strong but rangy, with a left arm that could throw baseballs 87 miles an hour at age 17. He looks more like a pitcher than a speedy outfielder with power and uncanny plate discipline, which is what he is and what Rene Gayo thought he could be.

title: Ramadan Poses Test to Muslim Players at World Cup
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Down the quiet, tree-lined Rua Gonzaga Bastos, less than half a mile from Estdio do Maracan, the custodian of this citys only mosque was preparing for the busiest time of the year.

title: New York Today: Last Day of School
description: Good Thursday morning to you.

title: Teabox Seeks to Bring Indias Teas Into Modern Era
description: DARJEELING, India  The tea plantations here in the shadow of the cloud-shrouded valleys of the Himalayan mountains may be the last place to find technological innovation. Many of the colonial-era practices involved in tea-growing and processing still follow the time-honored manual labor and handwritten bookkeeping.

title: Carney Details New Weapons to Cool British Housing Market
description: LONDON  Mark J. Carney, the governor of the Bank of England, announced measures on Thursday to try to cool Englands blistering housing market, a sector that he and other policy makers have identified as the greatest potential threat to Britains economic recovery.

title: Graduates Red Guard Photos Cast Doubt on What They Learned
description: The photographs show a young man, held down in a bowing position by what appear to be five Red Guards, the youthful fanatics who terrorized China in the name of Chairman Mao Zedong during the Cultural Revolution. A conical hat sits on his head, a leather belt chokes his throat, and a sign denouncing him as a traitor hangs from his neck with a nylon cord. But the young man is barely suppressing a grin, and the tableau was staged as part of a university graduation celebration.

title: Morning Views
description: The nine justices of the Supreme Court  whose average age is 68  often admit to being unfamiliar with modern technology, if not befuddled by it, writes The New York Times editorial board. Yet in a gratifyingly sweeping ruling on Wednesday, the courtembraceda central reality of the digital age and protected cellphones from being searched without a warrant during an arrest, except in rare circumstances. The board is wholly supportive of the ruling. Despite government arguments to the contrary, the expectation of privacy in a phones contentsoutweighsthe immediate needs of law enforcement.

title: Daily Report: Googles Far-Reaching Agenda
description: One way to think of Google is as an extremely helpful, all-knowing, hyper-intelligent executive assistant. Already, it can remind you about your flight, open up your boarding pass when you get to the airport and offer you driving directions to your hotel when you land.

title: No Order in the Court Without Yiddish
description: Once the sounds of Yiddish filled the streets of New York. Not so much anymore. But a Times reporter, Joseph Berger, grew up with Yiddish. His knowledge of the language helped him cover a recent corruption trial in which a key government informer was a Hasidic developer who employed Yiddish in many of his recorded conversations.

title: In Our Second Round of Employee Reviews, a Problem Emerges
description: This series of posts started with an explanation of why I decided to re-institute employee reviews.

title: Challenges Are Many in Predicting House Races
description: In the months leading up to midterm elections, pollsters have a limited number of tools to explain what could happen to the composition of the House of Representatives. And this year, their tools may be more blunt than usual.

title: North Korea Fires 3 Short-Range Projectiles
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea fired three short-range projectiles off its east coast on Thursday, a day after it warned of retaliation against the release of an American comedy film involving a plot to kill its leader, Kim Jong-un.

title: Morning Agenda: A Senior Prosecutors Departure
description: Lorin L. Reisner, who helped overhaul the enforcement unit of the Securities and Exchange Commission before heading the criminal division of the United States attorneys office in Manhattan, is leaving government for the private sector, Ben Protess writes in DealBook. He is expected to join a law firm, though it is not clear which one. Mr. Reisner announced his decision on Wednesday afternoon in an email to the United States attorneys office, where he has been the criminal division chief since January 2012.

title: Singular Collection, Multiple Mysteries
description: AFTER my Irish mother died, 15 years ago now, my siblings and I took eons to shake our paralysis of grief and deal with the physical things she left behind. When finally I mustered the energy, or courage, I found, to my surprise, a 1958 paperback edition of Dubliners in her night stand.

title: In Our Pages: June 27
Conventional Steps in a New Frame
description: AMSTERDAM  When a ballet offers you video on stage, a stark set and imaginative lighting, you probably have the strong impression that you are seeing an innovative work. When that work is new, and boasts a collaboration with a famous artist, and is promoted by attractive posters showing a naked body, you are likely to be even more certain.

description: The latest mens collection from Louis Vuitton at Paris Fashion Week.

description: Alcoa, seeking to build out its aerospace division, agreed on Thursday to buy Firth Rixson, a maker of jet engine parts, for at least $2.85 billion in cash and stock.

description: GoodThursdaymorning from a sunny Washington.

description: This interview with Bob Farrell, chief executive of Kewill, a transportation software company, was conducted and condensed by Adam Bryant.

title: Reviewing Googles Smartwatches   the LG G and the Samsung Gear Live
description: Google stole a wearables beat on Apple Wednesday at its developers conference in San Francisco by announcing that two watches that use the Android operating system (and can be paired with phones)  one from LG and one from Samsung  would go on sale immediately afterward in the United States. So immediately afterward, I went online to check out Android Wear. And my heart sank.

title: Uighur Scholar Will Fight Charges of Separatism in China, Lawyer Says
description: HONG KONG  Ilham Tohti, a prominent Uighur scholar charged with separatism after he repeatedly criticized Chinas increasingly uncompromising policies in Xinjiang, his ethnically divided homeland, told his lawyers on Thursday that he would fight the charges, one of the lawyers said.

title: Job Growth Is Up, Production Down
description: The most important indicators of our economic health are telling very different stories. On Wednesday, news reports made much of the fact that gross domestic product fell at an annual rate of 2.9 percent in the first quarter of this year, a decline largely attributable to bad weather. That brings growth over the past year to a disappointing 1.5 percent. Yet the labor market continues to deliver good news, and over the same period, the unemployment rate fell by more than a full percentage point.

title: David Leavitt: By the Book
description: The author of The Two Hotel Francforts was struck reading Middlemarch in Rome at age 20. That feeling of being unequal to antiquity  no one has ever described it so well as Eliot.

title: The Ringtone Thats Driving You Mad
description: Send your workplace conundrums to workologist@nytimes.com including your name and contact information (even if you want it withheld for publication). The Workologist is a guy with well-intentioned opinions, not a professional career adviser. Letters may be edited.

title: A Man in Constant Motion
description: BOSTON  The dancer known as Lil Buck was walking across a stage in slow motion, four beautifully exaggerated steps, like a moment out of The Matrix. It was the springtime benefit for the Institute of Contemporary Art here, and he was improvising to a string quartet.

title: Turmoil for Ghana, and Fruitless Win for Portugal
description: BRASLIA  The fact that 11 players from Ghana stepped onto the field to face Portugal at the appointed time was a victory in itself. After a week of infighting and boycott threats by its players, the Ghana Football Association on Thursday suspended two of its stars heading into the match, raising doubts about whether the team was equipped to play amid the turmoil.

title: Paris Mens Fashion Week: Raf Simons Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the mens fashion week photo diary of Alfredo Piola.

title: You Can Skip the Lines at the Theme Park, But You Cant Skip the Lesson
description: Theme parks, smelling money, now make it easy for parents to pay more to avoid the sweaty lines that can bring out the worst in children. But what lessons do kids learn when some of them march past the others to board the rides without waiting?

title: Living With Cancer: The New Medicine
description: In his 2010 book The Emperor of All Maladies, Dr. Siddhartha Mukherjee lamented the gap between the new science going on in research laboratories and the old medicine most cancer patients receive. Yet for almost two years, I have benefited from the new medicine derived from the new science, much to my surprise.

title: What Not to Pack
description: If you want to travel light, its not merely what you pack that matters  its what you dont pack.

title: Uruguay Star Barred 9 Games and 4 Months in Biting Incident
description: RECIFE, Brazil  Luis Surez, the enigmatic striker from Uruguay who has starred for Liverpool in Englands Premier League, was suspended for nine games and barred from all soccer-related activities for four months Thursday after FIFAs disciplinary committee determined that he bit an opponent during Uruguays 1-0 World Cup victory over Italy.

title: Julius Rudel, Longtime Impresario and Conductor of City Opera, Dies at 93
description: Julius Rudel, the Austrian-born conductor who raised the New York City Opera to a venturous golden age with highbrow music for the masses and a repertory that, like him, bridged the Old and New Worlds, died on Thursday at his home in Manhattan. He was 93.

title: U.S. Phasing Out Its Counterterrorism Unit in Philippines
description: MANILA  An elite American military counterterrorism unit that has been operating in the southern Philippines for more than a decade is being phased out, the Pentagons Pacific Command said Thursday.

title: U.S. vs. Germany: World Cup 2014 Live Blog
description: Although Germany has scored six goals in two games, it has done so with a deliberate passing style, rather than a frenzied attack. Look for more of the same, especially since a draw is good enough for Germany to win the group. The United States may look for a slow pace too, especially after having played its previous game in the steamy rain forest. The U.S. tops the group with a win, but candidly will be happy with a draw and advancement.

title: Court Rejects Zone to Buffer Abortion Clinic
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Thursday unanimously  struck down a Massachusetts law that barred protests, counseling and other speech near abortion clinics.

title: Imperial Tobacco Sets Price Range for Logista I.P.O.
description: LONDON  The Imperial Tobacco Group of Britain said on Thursday that the initial public offering of its Compaa de Distribucin Integral Logista Holdings unit could value the company at 1.86 billion euros, or about $2.53 billion.

title: Supreme Court Rebukes Obama on Right of Appointment
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court issued a unanimous rebuke to President Obama on Thursday, saying he had overreached in issuing recess appointments during brief breaks in the Senates work.

title: G.M. to Resume Selling Chevrolet Cruzes
description: General Motors dealers across the country can begin selling the popular Chevrolet Cruze sedans again after the Detroit automaker lifted an order to freeze sales because of a problem with some of the cars air bags.

title: NEA Names 4 New Jazz Masters
description: Three veteran musicians and a longtime Chicago nightclub owner have been awarded the 2015 National Endowment for the Arts Jazz Masters Fellowship, a high honor for jazz musicians in the United States. They are Carla Bley, the keyboardist, bandleader and composer, known for her big and small bands and ambitious collaborations with Charlie Haden and Gary Burton, among others; George Coleman, the saxophonist and bandleader, who first became a standard-bearer through his work with Miles Davis and Herbie Hancock in the mid-60s; Charles Lloyd, the saxophonist, flutist and bandleader, who made popular jazz records in the late 1960s, largely dropped out of jazz for a decade afterward, and has been on a consistent climb since; and Joe Segal, owner of the Jazz Showcase in Chicago since 1947. Each of the recipients, announced on Wednesday, will receive $25,000. They will be honored at an awards ceremony and concert at Jazz at Lincoln Center on April 20, 2015.

title: Ghana vs. Portugal: World Cup 2014 Live Blog
description: Both of these teams must win to hope to advance and both will be dealing with injuries or suspensions.

title: Where Are the Hardest Places to Live in the U.S.?
description: Annie Lowrey writes in the Times Magazine this week about the troubles of Clay County, Ky., which by several measures is the hardest place in America to live.

title: U.S. Moves On With Assist From Portugal
description: RECIFE, Brazil  This time, there was no moment. No tingle in the spine, no shiver in the neck, no blood rush to the ears. There was no memory that will live on in hearts and minds and YouTube videos forever.

title: Today in Small Business: Seniorpreneurs
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: For Gene Melchiorre, a Regretful Turn Brought a Unique N.B.A. Distinction
description: At the dead end of a private, wooded road about 20 miles north of Chicago sits a two-story house belonging to Gene Melchiorre, a short, pigeon-toed grandfather of 15 known by his many friends as Squeaky. Family photos decorate his office, but one artifact is unlike the others: a 63-year-old comic book drawing of a giant, youthful Melchiorre wearing a No. 23 basketball jersey, a superhero in short shorts.

title: Paris Mens Fashion Week: Rick Owens Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the mens fashion week photo diary of Valerio Mezzanotti.

title: Gluten-Free Dining in Italy
description: My wife is gluten-intolerant, and hasnt eaten wheat in three years. And so, at first thought, my plan for an Italian vacation bordered on insanity. While Im a huge fan of Italian food, for Jen a week and a half of pasta, pizza and bread  the holy trinity of the Italian table  sounded like a nightmare. As far as she was concerned, 10 days in Italy meant 10 days condemned to salads dressed with oil and vinegar. Even dessert wouldnt be safe: gelato and tiramis typically contain wheat.

title: New Groups New Season Will Be Star-Studded
description: Off Broadways New Group theater company will mount three plays during its 2014-15 season featuring Academy Award winner Holly Hunter and Bill Pullman as a married couple; Oscar winner Dianne Wiest and Tony Award winner Tonya Pinkins as rival secretaries; and Jesse Eisenberg as a destructive wastrel, the troupe announced on Thursday.

title: New York Schools Chief Advocates More Balanced Literacy
description: The reading lesson began like any other. Tara Bauer, a teacher at Public School 158 on the Upper East Side of Manhattan, took her perch in front of a class of restless fourth graders and began reciting the beginning of a book about sharks.

title: Flight 370 Believed to Be on Autopilot
description: Australian authorities have shifted the search for Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 further south in the Indian Ocean and said they believed that the plane was on autopilot.

title: Kerry Turns Up Pressure on Russia Over Ukraine, Warning of New Sanctions

description: Secretary of State John Kerry and Frances foreign minister, Laurent Fabius, discussed tensions between Ukraine and Russia.

title: Mota-Engil Africa Sets Price Range For London I.P.O.
description: LONDON  Mota-Engil Africa, a subsidiary of the Portuguese conglomerate Mota-Engil, said on Thursday that its initial public offering could value the company as much as 1.33 billion pounds, or about $2.26 billion.

title: A Mobile Developer Looks To Indian Languages
description: MUMBAI  A call center worker far from his native Hyderabad; a Chennai-based developer checking out e-books in Tamil; and a young, homesick cab driver in Mumbai who keeps track of comings and goings in his village in Uttar Pradesh  all are customers of a mobile news application trying to tap into a growing market of online Indian-language readers.

title: John Harney, Missionary Who Spread the Gospel of Tea, Dies at 83

description: BOWLING GREEN, Ky.  When the earth opened under the National Corvette Museum in early February, creating a 60-foot-deep sinkhole that devoured eight landmark Corvettes, museum officials, Bowling Green residents, and Vette lovers everywhere reacted in stunned disbelief.

title: Auxilium, a Small Player, Buys QLT and Does an Inversion, Too
description: Most of the corporate inversions that have grabbed headlines recently have been attempted by multibillion-dollar stalwarts of United States industry like Pfizer, Chiquita and Medtronic. But smaller companies can benefit from striking deals to move abroad, too.

description: In a letter this week, Rep. Tony Crdenas of California urged the Congressional Animal Protection Caucus to observe Meatless Mondays.

title: NeonGrid Wants to Be the IMDb for Online Videos
description: LOS ANGELES  To find credit information for Hollywoods various disciplines, from acting to hair styling to casting, the go-to source is the Internet Movie Database, or IMDb. Broadway has its own version. Looking to track appearances by vehicles in films? Click over to the Internet Movie Cars Database.

title: Project Night Night: Bedtime Treasures for Kids with Little of Their Own
description: When Josephine Ambrose, 22, escaped domestic violence a year ago, she left everything behind except her now 1-year-old son and 3-year-old daughter. The family has been living in shelters ever since, and the transition has been hard on the two children. However, their new friends might just make it a bit easier.

title: Facing an Unseeded Opponent, Nadal Gains a Win and Relief
description: WIMBLEDON, England  It was the luck of the draw that brought Rafael Nadal and Lukas Rosol together in the second round at Wimbledon for the second time in three years. The first time still stands as Rosols greatest victory and, perhaps, Nadals worst defeat.

title: From the Archives: Amex Marines Hurl Back Foe in Fierce Hand Fighting
description: U.S. Marines played a key role in reversing a German advance at Belleau Wood, during the Second Battle of the Marne, and built a reputation for ferocity in one of the bloodiest fights American troops faced during World War I.

Labor Conditions at N.Y.U.s Abu Dhabi Campus to Be Investigated by U.S. Firm
description: New York University and the government of Abu Dhabi said this week that an investigative firm headed by a former federal prosecutor had been hired to conduct an inquiry into labor conditions at the universitys new Middle East campus.

title: Opposites Attracting (and Complementing)
description: MIAMI GARDENS, Fla.  For almost as long as Jay Z and Beyonc have been a couple, they have been collaborators, one artist enhancing the other by bringing things the other doesnt have. Beyonc is regal, Jay Z brash. Beyonc, a picture of steely intensity; Jay Z, a paragon of casual cool. Beyonc, a gut puncher fluent in devastation; Jay Z, happy to devastate.

title: Impact of the Courts Ruling on Recess Appointments
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Courts decision in N.L.R.B. v. Noel Canning invalidated the appointments of three officials to the National Labor Relations Board and curbed the presidents ability to make recess appointments. Below is a summary of the decisions practical significance.

description: Shortly after Googles keynote presentation at the companys developer conference on Wednesday, I was ushered into a green room backstage at the Moscone Center in San Francisco.

title: Marco Rubio Raises the Bar
description: Before I continue with my string of posts on the theme of reform conservatisms correct views on everything, let me make a brief foray into real-world politics: Yesterday Senator Marco Rubio gave a domestic policy speech, co-hosted by Hillsdale College and the YG Network, thats worth reading if youre interested in what a reformist vision looks like when its an actual Republican politician (rather than a tribe of conservative scribblers) giving it form and substance. Naturally, it strikes me as a very impressive and encouraging speech. But I think I would say that even if I were less inclined to agree with its policy specifics, because purely as a rhetorical matter, it does something that Mitt Romney didnt manage to do in 2012 until, well, basically the first presidential debate: That is, ittries to meet non-conservative voters where they are and talk about the issues that they say they care about, rather than lecturing them on what they should be concerned about (too few people are paying income tax! Obama doesnt like entrepreneurs!) and assuming that theyre already persuaded.Its a speechrooted in conservative principle without being trapped by the conservative talking points, in other words, and thats something we saw very little of in the 2012 campaign.

title: Anatomy of a Broadway Song
description: The Broadway musical arranger Glen Kelly demonstrated how he adapted Fats Wallers song The Panic Is On for Bullets Over Broadway.

title: A Tailor of Music, Skilled in Alterations
description: Glen Kelly has no shortage of analogies to explain what he does as an arranger for such Broadway musicals as Aladdin, Bullets Over Broadway and The Book of Mormon.

Polling will increase as the midterm elections draw near. Marjorie Connelly, editor of news surveys, shared some of the history of the Times polling department.

description: Calcium and vitamin D supplementation can reduce blood sugar levels in women with gestational diabetes and improve other measures of metabolic health, a small randomized trial has found.

Then came the designers, cults of personality with fervent followings. More recently, its been the street-style icons, people who invent themselves in front of the mirror every morning in hopes of being captured by a camera.

description: A roundup of motoring news from the web:

title: Cleveland, a City Repurposed
description: If there had to be a slogan to describe Cleveland as it is today, whats old is new again would undoubtedly be it. In the last few years, locals and businesses in this Midwest metropolis have been repurposing historic buildings from its heyday in the late 19th and early 20th centuries and turning them into restaurants, stores and draws for both residents and tourists. Many of these structures had sat empty for a decade or more before restoration efforts began infusing a vibrancy into this once-somewhat-downtrodden city.

title: Tying Up a Deal on the Proverbial Shoestring
description: After two years of touring the country with traveling shows and making $200 or $300 a week, plus free housing, Matt Payne had had enough.

description: Updated, 7:55 p.m. | In the battle to be the market home for the Alibaba Group, the winner is the New York Stock Exchange.

description: After more than 50 years, Hindustan Motors ended production of the iconic Ambassador, the first car solely sourced and produced in India.

title: An Icon of Indian Roads Is Set Out to Pasture
description: DELHI, India  When the Ambassador car was born in 1957 to a newly independent India, it was the height of style and status. It was standard issue to senior civil servants and government officials; its possession implied status, and its ubiquity was a sign of an earlier, seemingly simpler India.

description: Fox Broadcasting has pretty much finished its sales of commercial time before the start of the 2014-15 television season, meaning that all five big English-language broadcasters have completed, or are winding up, their negotiations in what is called the upfront market.

description: Bell Telephones Picturephone went on display at the 1964 Worlds Fair, but it went into actual commercial use on June 24, 50 years ago.

title: Howard H. Baker Jr., Great Conciliator of the Senate, Dies at 88
description: Howard H. Baker Jr., a soft-spoken Tennessee lawyer who served three terms in the Senate and became known as the great conciliator in his eight years as the chambers Republican leader, died on Thursday at his home in Huntsville, Tenn. He was 88.
