description: After months of outrage over a publication that critics say denigrates Israel, the Presbyterian Church (U.S.A.) announced Friday that it was no longer selling the study guide Zionism Unsettled on the churchs website.

title: Shoulder Injury Sends Mets Wright Back to New York
description: PITTSBURGH  Mets third baseman David Wright stood outside the visitors clubhouse Friday afternoon and explained why he had been scratched from the lineup with a sore left shoulder.

title: Seaside With Kindred Spirits of Cookery
description: Epic picnics on the beach and fancy dinners prepared in well-equipped and abundantly stocked East Hampton kitchens are among the delectable events evoked by photographs and artifacts in Craig Claiborne and Pierre Franey: Cookbook Revolutionaries in East Hampton. The exhibition, at the East Hampton Historical Societys Clinton Academy Museum, includes more than 70 images, an Al Hirschfeld caricature of both men, several hand-drawn menus and various cookware used by the duo, including a fish steamer, a duck press and a bouillabaisse pot.

title: Afrezza, a New Inhaled Insulin, Is Approved by the F.D.A.
description: The Food and Drug Administration on Friday approved a form of insulin that is inhaled rather than injected, providing a new option for millions of Americans with diabetes.

title: Texas: Booking of Migrants to Take Place at 4 Sites
description: Adults with children caught crossing the border illegally in the Rio Grande Valley will be sent initially to Customs and Border Protection stations in Laredo and El Paso, and also to San Diego and El Centro in California, border officials said Friday. Families will be booked for deportation at those sites, and some will remain in detention. Facing a surge of Central American migrants in South Texas, border authorities have been releasing most families with children there. They will soon open a 700-bed detention center for families at a law enforcement training center in Artesia, N.M.

title: Woods Misses Cut in His Return But Finds a Lot of Positives
description: BETHESDA, Md.  A major winner rebounded from an opening 74 to make the cut at the Quicken Loans National, but his name was not Tiger Woods. Justin Rose, the 2013 United States Open winner, pieced together a six-birdie, no-bogey round of six-under 65 on Friday at Congressional Country Club to vault from a tie for 83rd into a tie for 11th, three strokes off the lead shared by four players.

title: Border Patrol Scrutiny Stirs Anger in Arizona Town
description: ARIVACA, Ariz.  Every time Jack Driscoll drives the 32 miles from this remote outpost in southeastern Arizona to the closest supermarket, or to doctors appointments, or to a pharmacy to fill his prescriptions, he must stop at a Border Patrol checkpoint and answer the same question: Are you a U.S. citizen?

title: World Cup 2014: Brazil Defeats Chile on Penalty Kicks, 1-1
description: Brazil, the tournament favorite and host, narrowly escaped defeat after Chiles Gonzalo Jara hit the post with his final penalty kick. Brazil advances to the quarterfinals.

title: World Cup 2014: Colombia Defeats Uruguay, 2-0
description: Colombia continued its impressive run after finishing its group 3-0 with a 2-0 victory, led by James Rodriguez and his two goals.

title: If Franz Ferdinand Had Lived
description: FOR over 25 years, Archduke Franz Ferdinand paced up and down in his palaces and castles waiting impatiently for the death of the ever more ancient emperor, his hated uncle Franz Joseph I. As we all know, his wait was in vain.

title: A Place to Pull Over
description: Have you ever dined in a garage? Joes Garage and Grill, a three-month-old restaurant in Riverhead, comes close to providing that experience. The floor is concrete and the rows of windows roll up like garage doors. The automotive theme continues on the menu, where appetizers are listed under Start Your Engines and sandwiches are referred to as The Pile Up.

title: Friday Night Music: Attack of the Brooklyn Hipsters (Sylvan Esso)
description: OK, at one level this is almost a caricature of hipsterdom. But at the same time Sylvan Esso is really, really good

title: Tensions Continue to Simmer as Attacks in Gaza Escalate
description: JERUSALEM  Two Palestinian men suspected of being militants were killed in an Israeli missile strike in Gaza on Friday, according to the military and witnesses, and Israels minister of defense warned that he would not tolerate rocket fire from Gaza against Israel or any other attempt to harm Israeli civilians and soldiers.

title: On Air Force One, No Lightening Up on Burgers and Cake
description: WASHINGTON  A blue-cheese burger with lettuce, tomato and garlic aioli, accompanied by Parmesan-sprinkled fries. Chocolate fudge cake. Pasta shells stuffed with four cheeses, topped with meat sauce and shredded mozzarella, and served with a garlic breadstick. Cake infused with limoncello. Buffalo wings with celery, carrots and homemade ranch dip.

title: At Wimbledon, Ana Konjuh Spun Her Tale of Faith
description: WIMBLEDON, England  Ana Konjuh has a tattoo on her left wrist that reads, Faith. Faith in her prodigious ability, which has helped her become one of the most promising women in the game. Faith in the continuing twists and turns of fate that played an integral role in her move from her quiet hometown, Dubrovnik, Croatia, to Zagreb at 10, leading her to her mentor, the former French Open champion Iva Majoli.

title: Hong Kongs Democracy Supporters Chafe at Inequality and Beijings Sway
description: HONG KONG  On a recent morning, Agnes Chow, 17, and another teenage activist rode a van through the streets of Hong Kong, urging people through a loudspeaker to vote in an informal referendum for a more democratic way to pick the citys top leader. But the vote, which has been condemned as illegal by the Chinese government, was about much more than the citys leadership, she said.

title: Key Piece in Limbo, Knicks President Forges Foundation
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  Phil Jackson made clear that he was finished with the formal recruiting process, if it was even fair to describe it that way in the first place. There would be no genuflecting at the altar of Carmelo Anthony, no passionate overtures, no grand promises  other than a well-formulated plan to (eventually) turn the Knicks into a contender.

title: Airlines Rivalry Amplifies Fight Over Bank Guarantees
description: The rise of Persian Gulf airlines has been a boon to Boeing as they snap up its large jets, sometimes with the help of loan guarantees from Washington.

title: The Accidental Escapee, or the Eyewitness in the Back Seat
description: Bryan McMenamin was all over the news last week when, hands cuffed behind his back after being arrested in a drug bust, he jumped from the back of a police S.U.V. into the drivers seat and, cuffed hands somehow in front, drove off.

title: Three Homers by Yankees Compound the Red Sox Struggles
description: In the off-season, as the Boston Red Sox were basking in the glow of their World Series victory and the Yankees were retooling, and the teams front-office executives were again lobbing insults at each other, the rivalry seemed to have regained some of its acerbity.

title: While Iraq Burns
description: In the face of a violent offensive by Sunni militants, Iraqs future as a unified state is becoming less and less likely. As the Sunni militants take hold of a large swath of northwest Iraq, the Kurds, who operate a semiautonomous province in northeast Iraq, are edging toward independence, leaving Shiites controlling Baghdad and regions in the south. Yet Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki seems to have no interest in finding a new way forward from a catastrophe his policies ignited.

title: The Second Chance Act Proves Its Worth
description: With corrections costs exceeding $60 billion a year, state and local governments are rightly focused on making sure that newly released prisoners stay out of jail instead of coming back in through a revolving door.

title: New General Motors Recall Includes Best Sellers
description: Adding to the mounting toll of its safety crisis, General Motors said on Friday that it was recalling more than half a million more vehicles, including full-size pickup trucks and sport utility vehicles that can suddenly switch into neutral.

title: Bobby Womack, Royalty of the Soul Era, Dies at 70
description: Bobby Womack, who spanned the American soul music era, touring as a gospel singer in the 1950s, playing guitar in Sam Cookes backup band in the early 60s, writing hit songs recorded by Wilson Pickett and the Rolling Stones and composing music that broke onto the pop charts, died on June 27 at his home in Tarzana, Calif. He was 70.

title: World Cup 2014: A Defiant Chile Seeks to Ruin a Tournament for Its Hosts
description: BELO HORIZONTE, Brazil  Groups of Chilean fans moved about the streets here on the eve of their teams game against Brazil. Some were on foot, some rode in packed cars with the red, white and blue flag of Chile fluttering from windows, and many yelled their familiar chant, Chi Chi Chi, Le Le Le, while locals looked on, distinctly unamused.

title: Reporters Case Poses Dilemma for Justice Dept.
description: On Dec. 31, 2005, the C.I.A.s acting general counsel, John A. Rizzo, received an urgent phone call from the White House about a chapter in James Risens coming book, State of War, detailing a botched C.I.A. operation in Iran.

title: 100 Years Ago Tonight
description: George Dangerfield, The Strange Death of Liberal England

title: Report Finds Health Unit of V.A. Needs Overhaul
description: WASHINGTON  The Veterans Health Administration has a corrosive culture that has led to poor management, a history of retaliation toward employees, cumbersome and outdated technology, and a shortage of doctors, nurses and physical space to treat its patients, according to a review presented to President Obama on Friday by one of his top advisers on veterans issues.

title: Taliban Mount Major Assault in Afghanistan
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  In one of the most significant coordinated assaults on the government in years, the Taliban have attacked police outposts and government facilities across several districts in northern Helmand Province, sending police and military officials scrambling to shore up defenses and heralding a troubling new chapter as coalition forces prepare to depart.

title: Upon Return to Uruguay, Luis Surez Is Met With Support
description: PORTO ALEGRE, Brazil  Barred from soccer for the next four months for biting an opponent and obliged to leave his team in the midst of the World Cup, Luis Surez arrived home in Uruguay before sunrise Friday and was met with cheers and a presidential hug on the tarmac.

title: Like a Domino, Another Atlantic City Casino Falls
description: The Atlantic Club casino closed in January. Last week, Atlantic Citys newest casino, Revel, filed for bankruptcy protection for the second time in two years.

title: Here Comes the Judge, in Cuffs
description: MIAMI  Lawyers gawked from office windows last month when a BMW S.U.V. swiped a parked police cruiser in the parking lot of a courthouse in Fort Lauderdale, then slammed into a gate over and over again.

title: An Orchestra of Little Hands and Big Dreams
description: Paul Kirby waved his baton at the group of musicians gathered in the cavernous United Palace Theater in Manhattan on a recent Saturday. Sweat cascaded down his brow as the string orchestra played in front of him.

title: Syria: Dispute Unsettles Rebel Coalition
description: As President Obama asks Congress for $500 million to help Syrias rebels, the dysfunction and infighting that have long undermined their fight against the Syrian government spilled into the open again on Friday. The leader of the interim government established by the exile opposition, the Syrian National Coalition, said in a statement that he was firing the head of the Supreme Military Council of the Free Syrian Army and referring its members to a commission to investigate accusations of corruption. The military council responded that the interim government had made a grave legal error and did not have any power over it  a position that was supported by the leader of the Syrian National Coalition, Ahmad Assi al-Jarba. Despite being endorsed by the West as the leaders of the struggle against President Bashar al-Assad of Syria, none of the bodies involved in the dispute are currently playing a significant role in the civil war. The coalition is widely seen as ineffective, its interim government is little more than a list of names, and the military council has been overshadowed on the ground by rebel formations and extremist groups that have been more active.

title: Rations Reduced as Demand Grows for Soup Kitchens
description: Old Cantonese women lined up behind a white van, clutching plastic bags to carry away their meals for the night. Behind them came young children clamoring for milk, homeless men in tattered shirts and Mexican immigrants who spoke only Spanish.

title: For Women Who Saw Combat, a Place to Find Inner Peace
description: JAMESBURG, Calif.  As Melannie Lovercheck was packing last Saturday for her week away from home, she reached into a closet, knelt beneath her Navy lieutenants uniform on its hanger and grabbed a pair of black Crocs. The choice seemed logical enough. Where she was going, she would need some kind of waterproof footwear to get from her cabin to the shower room.

title: Altidore May Return for U.S. in Match Against Belgium
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  Forward Jozy Altidore, who left early in the United States opening match of the World Cup with a strained hamstring, should be available to face Belgium in the second round, Coach Jurgen Klinsmann said Friday.

title: G.M.s Rival Could Teach It a Lesson
description: How do you change the culture? the Today shows Matt Lauer asked Mary Barra, the chief executive of General Motors, earlier this week. How do you go about communicating to the people who have been part of the history of this company for years that things must change?

title: The Eggs and Us
description: Lets talk personhood, people.

title: A Milestone for Same-Sex Marriage
description: The battle to legalize same-sex marriage saw a historic victory this week when the United States Court of Appeals for the 10th Circuit in Denver became the first federal appeals court in the nation to declare that same-sex couples have a fundamental right to wed.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for June 27, 2014
Growth and Breadth in U.S. Interest in World Cup
description: If you walked past a sports bar or the office TV on Thursday when the United States soccer team was playing Germany, you already know the World Cup is gaining popularity.

title: Love at the French Open
description: SATURDAYS PUZZLE  This was an odd solve for me. I started off in the northwest, pleased to partake of the APRICOT JAM and the TSINGTAO. I enjoyed the GUITAR SOLO and attempted to move into the southwestern portion of the grid. Thats where time stopped for me.

title: Ellis Island Artifacts Still in Protective Custody After Storm
description: What if a museum had to place more than half its collection in storage?

title: Basking, Not Baking
To Answer Disasters, de Blasio Picks a Calm Hand
description: Filling one of the last vacancies in key positions in his administration, Mayor Bill de Blasio on Friday appointed Joseph J. Esposito, who retired last year as the New York City Police Departments highest-ranking uniformed member, as commissioner of the Office of Emergency Management.

title: ISIS Storms the Barricades, Justices Unite, and Republicans Sing
description: ISIS? What is ISIS? Much of the world labored to answer this question as the Iraqi Army and government continued to reel backward from the scorched earth assault of Sunni Arab militant extremists marching under the banner of the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria.

title: World Cup 2014: Colombia Looks to Break With Its Past
description: NATAL, Brazil  On September 5, 1993, a date etched in the memory of all Colombians, the Colombian soccer team upset the order of things.

title: Leslie Manigat, Overthrown in a Coup in Haiti, Dies at 83
description: Leslie F. Manigat, a prominent political figure in Haiti who as its president in 1988 was overthrown in a bloodless military coup after serving in office for less than six months, died Friday at his home in Port-au-Prince, Haiti. He was 83.

title: Robert Gardner Dies at 88; Filmed Cultural Practices
description: Robert Gardner, an intrepid filmmaker who specialized in anthropological documentaries, examining lives in remote societies around the globe, died on June 21 in Boston. He was 88.

title: Boy, 3, Found Safe After Grandfather Falls Asleep on Subway
description: Kah-yon Reynolds, a 3-year-old boy from Newark, was missing for several hours on Friday after his grandfather took him on the subway and fell asleep.

title: Rollin King, Texas Pilot Who Helped Start Southwest, Dies at 83
description: Rollin W. King, a co-founder of Southwest Airlines, the low-cost carrier that helped to change the way Americans travel, died Thursday in Dallas. He was 83. The cause was complications from a stroke he had a year ago, his son Edward King of Dallas said.

title: Whats on Saturday
description: 8 P.M. (HBO) THE COUNSELOR (2013) Michael Fassbender (above right, with Brad Pitt) portrays the title character  a corrupt, high-flying Texas lawyer who gets in over his head in a drug deal with Reiner (Javier Bardem), a nightclub owner involved with a Mexican cartel promising a 4,000 percent return  in this thriller directed by Ridley Scott from a screenplay by Cormac McCarthy. Mr. Pitt is the Counselors wary business associate, Cameron Diaz is Reiners predatory girlfriend and Penlope Cruz is the woman the Counselor intends to marry. From all the ellipses, as well as the eccentric, mesmerizing poetry of his dialogue, Mr. McCarthy appears to have never read a screenwriting manual in his life. (Thats a compliment; this is his first produced film script.), Manohla Dargis wrote in The New York Times about what she called a terrifying, implacable new movie. In Mr. McCarthy, she added, Mr. Scott has found a partner with convictions about good and evil rather than canned formula.

title: Corrections: June 28, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Quotation of the Day for Saturday, June 28, 2014
description: The supreme irony of 1914 is how many of the rulers of Europe grossly overestimated military power and grossly underestimated economic power.

title: Analytics: Crime and Punishment
description: The following Analytics appears on the letters page in the June 29 issue of the magazine.

title: Americans Think We Have the Worlds Best Colleges. We Dont.
description: Americans have a split vision of education. Conventional wisdom has long held that our K-12 schools are mediocre or worse, while our colleges and universities are world class. While policy wonks hotly debate K-12 reform ideas like vouchers and the Common Core state standards, higher education is largely left to its own devices. Many families are worried about how to get into and pay for increasingly expensive colleges. But the stellar quality of those institutions is assumed.

title: Todays World Cup Matches: June 28, 2014
description: What to watch for in todays World Cup matches, the first of the elimination games in the knockout phase of the tournament. Both are clashes between strong South American teams. (Times are Eastern):

title: 1914: Archduke Francis Ferdinand Fatally Shot in Sarajevo
description: From The New York Herald, European Edition, June 29, 1914:

title: Why World War I Matters to Todays Economy
description: It is easy, as an American living in the 21st century, not to care that 100 years ago today, a 19-year-old Serb named Gavrilo Princip shot and killed Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria and his wife, setting in motion the catastrophe that was the First World War.

title: Goodbye, for Now, San Francisco
description: Living in San Francisco is a predictable affair. Each day you awake to layers of fog, the temperature is always the same, and as you travel the city, you bump into one tech-related thing after another.

title: The Chatter for Sunday, June 29
description: It is the first computer-search case, and it says we are in a new digital age. Orin S. Kerr, a law professor at George Washington University, after the Supreme Court ruled unanimously that the police need warrants to search the cellphones of people they arrest.

title: The Path of Inherited Wealth
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Giving Back to Teenagers
Sports Talk at the Water Cooler
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Suspect in Benghazi Attack Is Arraigned in U.S.
description: WASHINGTON  The Libyan militia leader charged in connection with the 2012 attacks in Benghazi that killed the United States ambassador and three others was brought to Washington early Saturday, where he entered a not guilty plea at the federal courthouse, formally opening one of the most complicated terrorism cases the Justice Department has mounted in recent years.

title: Cupids Arrows Fly on Social Media, Too
description: My friend Steven gushed the other evening about a dreamy first date hed just gone on. The guy he went out with was great, he said: smart, charming and a total gentleman.

title: Are Markets Efficient? Even the Supreme Court Is Weighing In
description: A fierce debate about an academic theory loomed over the Nobel in economic science for 2013. Last week, the Supreme Court enshrined that argument in jurisprudence, issuing a ruling that is likely to make it harder for investors to prevail in some big class-action lawsuits.

title: Brazil vs. Chile: World Cup 2014 Live Blog
description: A clash of titans. Brazil is the tournament favorite and host, but Chile is a tough opponent that plays energetic, attacking soccer. Brazils sometimes-shaky defense and keeping will have to be up to snuff.

title: When a Health Plan Knows How You Shop
description: There may be a link between your Internet use and how often you end up in the emergency room.

title: Lucy Lius Directorial Debut on Human Trafficking
description: I traveled to Mumbai in 2010 to direct my first film MEENA, based on the first chapter of Nick and Sheryls book Half The Sky: Turning Oppression Into Opportunity for Women Worldwide. Even though MEENA is only a 20 minute film and took 5 days to shoot, it has taken nearly four years for it to finally be seen by an audience. The earlier feedback we received was that the content was too strong and that viewers would feel uncomfortable with the aggressive nature of violence in conjunction with children. The premiere of Meena this week was truly transformative. I felt excited and reinvigorated to be surrounded by an audience who were not only engaged by the films message, but also curious about how they can become more actively involved in learning about child protection.

title: Joanne Rohde, on Knowing When to Get In, and to Get Out
description: This interview with  Joanne Rohde, C.E.O. of Axial Exchange, a developer of mobile health care applications, was conducted and condensed by  Adam Bryant.

title: The C.E.O. Is My Friend. So Back Off.
description: It was probably a coincidence, but then again maybe not.

title: A New York Odyssey Through World Cup Fandom
description: Interest in the World Cup is surging in the United States, with record television ratings, outdoor viewing parties and midday breaks for workers to watch the United States battle its way into the second round.

title: James Gorman of Morgan Stanley, Going Against Type
description: It was a stickup, Wall Street style.

title: Red Bulls Rewind: That Cahill Guy Again
description: Tim Cahill proved, again, that he is a global ironman.

title: Neighbors Acting Like Frat Brothers
description: Ask Real Estate is a weekly online column that answers questions from across the New York region. Submit yours to realestateqa@nytimes.com.

title: Dior Homme: Spring 2015 Menswear
description: Paris

title: Iraqi Army, in New Show of Force, Drives Back Insurgents in Major City
description: BAGHDAD  The Iraqi Army on Saturday drove Islamic extremists from the center of a major city in central Iraq, for the first time mounting a concerted assault against insurgents who had charged to within 50 miles of Baghdad.

title: The Dark Pool Iceberg
description: Shareholders and brokerage houses ditched Barclays at the end of last week, and who could blame them? In addition to its involvement in serial financial scandals  including the manipulation of interest rates and gold prices  the bank now stands accused of fraud related to its dark pool, essentially a private stock exchange.

title: Rape Evidence Backlog
description: The failure of police departments around the country to test and analyze evidence connected to sexual assaults shows contempt for victims, public safety and justice. Medical personnel collect saliva, semen, blood, hair and other DNA evidence from victims after an attack in so-called rape kits. These kits, however, often sit unopened for years in police evidence rooms or public crime labs.

title: Stung by Supreme Court, Aereo Suspends Service
description: Aereo, the start-up firm that threatened to upend the television industry, has hit the pause button.

title: Variety: A Cheerful Acrostic
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  In the same way many people are divided on whether Leo Tolstoys opening observation in Anna Karenina  that happy families are all alike; every unhappy family is unhappy in its own way  is true, Ill wager that there will be a divide on whether todays acrostic by Emily Cox and Henry Rathvon was easy or difficult. I probably fell somewhere in the middle.

title: Letters to the Sports Editor
description: To the Sports Editor:

title: On the Prowl for the Red Sox in Left, Center, Right and Elsewhere
description: There was the four-hit game against the Tigers, and the four-double game against the Rays.

title: Argentinas Vice President Charged in Corruption Case
description: BUENOS AIRES  Vice President Amado Boudou of Argentina has been charged in a corruption case in which he is accused of abusing his power to gain control of a company that has printed the nations currency, a development that has shaken the government here.

title: Tiger Woods Hopes to Erase the Supplements Stigma
description: BETHESDA, Md.  Tiger Woodss new golf bag, with the neon green MP on the front panel, a pocket and the base, is an attention grabber. The initials stand for MusclePharm, a Denver dietary supplement company that recently signed Woods to a multiyear endorsement deal.

title: Iraqs Sunni Militants Take to Social Media to Advance Their Cause and Intimidate
description: BAGHDAD  The extremist group battling the Iraqi government, the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, may practice a seventh-century version of fundamentalist Islam, but it has demonstrated modern sophistication when it comes to using social media, particularly Twitter and other sites like WordPress and Tumblr.

title: Paris Mens Fashion Week: Givenchy Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the mens fashion week photo diary of Schohaja.

title: The Dazzle and the Desolation of Stadiums in World Cup Host Cities
description: NATAL, Brazil  From her crumbling house with the leaky roof, across a new highway from a new World Cup stadium, Maria Ivanilde Oliveira heard everything.

title: Outside the Arena das Dunas
description: A panoramic view from outside the Arena das Dunas, one of 12 stadiums hosting the World Cup in Brazil.

title: Brazils Soccer Slums
description: In Rocinha, a small urban slum that overlooks Rio de Janeiro, soccer unites the community.

title: Paris Mens Fashion Week: Sacai Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the mens fashion week photo diary of Louise Damgaard.

title: When Civil-Rights Unity Fractured
description: FIFTY years ago this month, more than a thousand predominantly young, predominantly white volunteers arrived in Mississippi to help local blacks register to vote. Freedom Summer is remembered as both a high point of interracial democratic activism and a low point in racial violence, most notably in the brutal murder of three civil rights workers, two of whom were white.

title: Bolshoi Director Attacked With Acid Returns to Hospital
description: Sergei Filin, the artistic director of the Bolshoi Ballet who was nearly blinded in an acid attack in January 2013, is in intensive care at the Sklifosovsky Research Institute in Moscow, the Russian news agencies Interfax and RIA Novosti reported on Saturday.

title: McEnroes Call for Tournament Line Judges: Out!
description: WIMBLEDON, England  At every match at Wimbledon, a team of line judges, dressed in matching white pants, striped shirts and blue jackets, stand stoically in formation around the court. Shot by shot, they decide whether balls, some of them moving more than 100 miles per hour, are in or out.

title: Chinas Threat to Wild Tigers
description: EARLIER this year, a police raid on a house party in Leizhou, Guangdong Province, in southern China, revealed a decadent diversion apparently popular among some of Chinas elite: watching a tiger being slaughtered and butchered, then gorging on meat thats considered an exotic delicacy.

title: A Child of Grass Courts Dreams Anew
description: WIMBLEDON, England  A long Wimbledon day had stretched into evening, and finally darkness, by the time Cara Black settled into a chair, with another victory registered in an illustrious doubles career that has brought her 10 Grand Slam titles with partners female and male. She was tired, expressionless, but only until a question was asked about her beloved grass courts.

title: The Power of a Deed
description: TUESDAY is the observance of the 20th anniversary of the death of Rabbi Menachem Mendel Schneerson  universally known as the Rebbe  who for decades was the charismatic leader of millions of Jews. Commemorations are planned; several biographies have just been released.

title: Covering New War, in Shadow of Old One
description: THE lead-up to the war in Iraq in 2003 was not The Timess finest hour. Some of the news reporting was flawed, driven by outside agendas and lacking in needed skepticism. Many Op-Ed columns promoted the idea of a war that turned out to be both unfounded and disastrous.

title: Britains Strange Identity Crisis
description: LONDON  THE United Kingdom is lying on the psychiatrists couch. Suddenly the country seems uncertain of its identity, its place in the world, its relationships with its closest family members and its neighbors.

title: Is Obesity O.K.?
description: Readers discuss an advice columnists assertion that pretending that obesity is not a problem may prevent hurt feelings but compromise health.

title: Jane Didnt Get the Help She Needed
description: IF you want to understand just how miserable a childhood can be, 16-year-old Jane Doe is a good place to start.

title: Life in Iraq Grinds On, Whoever Is in Charge
description: HIS name was Thamir, and he was a pool hustler. He was good enough that when a translator shouted in the pool hall that I wanted to meet the best player in Husayba, the gaggle of men parted, opening the way to him. Thamir grinned wryly, pressed an index finger against his chest and lifted his chin in that universal gesture: You want to talk to me?

title: They Said It Couldnt Be Done
description: Less than a year ago, President Bashar al-Assad of Syria and his forces were sporadically using chemical weapons on rebels and civilians in the civil war. Today, the stockpile that he grudgingly admitted to under international pressure is gone.

title: How the Terrorists Got Rich
description: A FEW feet from the Bab al-Salam border crossing near the Turkish town of Kilis, there is a shabby cafe where the most interesting items for sale are not found on the menu. The cafe is the final stop for young radicalized men from Europe or North Africa who are planning to slip past the lax Turkish border officers and into Syrian territory. This is where they exchange their passports for cash. When one of us visited the cafe in January, a Belgian passport was for sale for $8,000. A buyer could have it altered for movement to Europe or visa-free travel to the United States. New passport photos were being snapped in the parking lot.

title: Dale Chihuly
description: Dale Chihuly is a widely collected glass sculptor whose work has been installed in venues as varied as the Victoria and Albert Museum in London and the Bellagio Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas.

title: Arsonists and Firefighters
description: WHATS the real fight in the Middle East today? Is it just sectarian (Sunnis versus Shiites) and national (Israelis versus Palestinians and Arabs versus Persians)? Or is it something deeper? I was discussing this core question with Nader Mousavizadeh, a former senior United Nations official and the co-founder of Macro Advisory Partners, a geopolitical advisory firm, and he offered another framework: The real struggle in the region, he said, is between arsonists and firefighters.

title: Stopping Campus Rape
description: IN the debate over sexual violence on college campuses, two things are reasonably clear. First, campus rape is a grave, persistent problem, shadowing rowdy state schools and cozy liberal-arts campuses alike.

title: Why Teenagers Act Crazy
description: ADOLESCENCE is practically synonymous in our culture with risk taking, emotional drama and all forms of outlandish behavior. Until very recently, the widely accepted explanation for adolescent angst has been psychological. Developmentally, teenagers face a number of social and emotional challenges, like starting to separate from their parents, getting accepted into a peer group and figuring out who they really are. It doesnt take a psychoanalyst to realize that these are anxiety-provoking transitions.

title: What Nurse Jackie Gets Right About the E.R.
description: A lot of nurses hate the Showtime series Nurse Jackie, which will wrap up its sixth season on Sunday evening. Actually, to be precise, they hate the shows lead character, the emergency department nurse Jackie Peyton. Theres much to dislike: She is an adulterer, a liar, an unreliable mother and, most significantly, addicted to prescription painkillers. (Thats hardly giving anything away, but be warned: spoilers ahead.)

title: Once a Militant Stronghold in Iraq, Now a Battleground Again
description: AL-DAIRA, Iraq  At one house, Iraqs national flag fluttered atop a building that Iraqi soldiers had captured from militants two days before.

title: Sunday Breakfast Menu, June 29
description: President Obama asked Congress for $500 million to train and equip appropriately vetted members of the Syrian opposition on Thursday as concerns rise about the conflict spilling into Iraq. Ten days ago, Mr. Obama said he would send 300 American military advisers to assess Iraqs military as it faces Sunni militants.

title: Be Not Afraid of My Body
description: MY first encounter with Walt Whitman was complicated.

title: The Right to Write
description: I sat on a panel once with another novelist and a distinguished African-American critic, to discuss Harriet Beecher Stowes novel Uncle Toms Cabin. The critic said, Of course, as a white woman, Stowe had no right to write the black experience. The other novelist said lightly, No, of course not. And I had no right to write about 14th-century Scandinavians. Which I did.

title: After the Game, Reality Sinks In for a Lineman
description: BERKELEY, Calif.  Kendrick Payne picked up a passenger in his silver Nissan Altima one afternoon last week in downtown Oakland, across the street from the federal courthouse. Payne, a former defensive lineman at the University of California, wore an old Bears workout shirt with his No. 96 printed on the back. His N.F.L. dreams all but gone, he works as a driver for Lyft, a ride-sharing company.

title: What Is Your Experience in the American Militarys Health Care System?
description: If you have had a first-hand experience with the nations militarys health care system, as a patient, family member or worker, please tell us your story.

title: Struggling Met Contributes By Controlling the Playlist
description: PITTSBURGH  After every Mets home win, the players pour into the clubhouse, bobbing their heads as the hip-hop song Get Like Me, by David Banner, thumps through the speakers. For 15 minutes, music blares and the mood is light. Then the clubhouse is opened to the news media, and the players go their separate ways.

title: With Surge of Chaos in Iraq, a Familiar Problem Knocks on Bidens Door
description: WASHINGTON  From the first summer of the Obama administration, Iraq has been considered Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr.s account. But when President Obama called a critical meeting on June 16 to confront the crisis that had suddenly erupted there, Mr. Biden was landing in Brazil to go to a World Cup soccer game.

title: In Military Care, a Pattern of Errors but Not Scrutiny
description: FORT SILL, Okla.  Jessica Zeppa, five months pregnant, the wife of a soldier, showed up four times at Reynolds Army Community Hospital here in pain, weak, barely able to swallow and fighting a fever. The last time, she declared that she was not leaving until she could get warm.

title: Rays Cast Aside Emotions as Reality Derails Plans
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla.  The secret to the success of the Tampa Bay Rays, before this seasons startling and spectacular collapse, has been that there are no hard decisions, only necessary ones. A move that may seem wrenching to an outsider is not that way to the Rays.

title: Stagflation and the Fall of Macroeconomics
description: Simon Wren-Lewis and Mark Thoma write about the rise of New Classical Macroeconomics  basically the rejection of Keynes and the attempted assimilation of macro into micro. Unusually, I have some bones to pick with both, although we clearly agree on the big stuff.

title: Paris Mens Fashion Week: Berluti Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the mens fashion week photo diary of Sarah Aubel.

title: Displaced in Iraq
description: The situation is reaching a critical point as refugees flee the violence.

title: Colombia vs. Uruguay: World Cup 2014 Live Blog
description: Colombia has been hugely impressive, finishing its group 3-0 and even scoring four goals with its reserves in its final game against Japan. Uruguay had a less auspicious campaign, beating England through Luis Suarez magic, then scrapping a win over Italy that included several disputed calls.

title: A Reignited War Drives Iraqis Out in Huge Numbers
description: DARBANDIKHAN, Iraq  As Sunni rebels advanced across Iraq in recent weeks, hundreds of thousands of Iraqis were driven from their homes. For many, it was not the first time.

title: Underdog Stuns Serena Williams, and Herself, at Wimbledon
description: WIMBLEDON, England  Top-seeded Serena Williams was cruising toward the second week of Wimbledon, breezing through two rounds and the first set of the third, before Aliz Cornet of France turned the match, and the womens side of the tournament, inside out.

title: Kicker vs. Keeper
description: Kasey Keller, a former U.S. national team goalkeeper, walks us through the psychology of four memorable World Cup standoffs.

title: World Cup 2014: Brazil Survives Shootout Against Chile
description: BELO HORIZONTE, Brazil  With the pressure of an anxious nation bearing down on them with each passing minute, the Brazilian players teetered on the brink of a defeat that would have wounded a countrys soul.

title: Paris Mens Fashion Week: Dior Homme Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the mens fashion week photo diary of Schohoaja.

title: Cuomo Plan Seeks to End New Yorks AIDS Epidemic
description: Borrowing an idea from leading AIDS researchers, the Cuomo administration said on Friday that it had developed a plan to aggressively identify, track and treat people with H.I.V. infection with the aim of reducing new infection to the point that by 2020, AIDS would no longer reach epidemic levels in New York State.

title: Islanders Take Brash Player, Ignoring Doubts of Other Teams
description: PHILADELPHIA  The Islanders could be a little more intriguing in the near future, and not just because of the teams move to Brooklyn a year from now.

title: Offering to Disarm in Congo, After 20 Years of War
description: KIGOGO, Democratic Republic of Congo  Shortly after midday in this village nestled in clouds, the progenitors of the long, dirty war across Central Africa came out of the jungle and laid down their guns.

title: Uruguay to Appeal Surezs Suspension, Though His Return Is Unlikely
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Uruguays soccer federation informed FIFA on Friday night that it would file an appeal to the suspension that ousted its best player from the World Cup for biting an opponent.

title: Kids Behind Bars
description: My Sunday column is about the failure of our criminal justice system for kids, including the way we vastly over-rely on the juvenile detention toolbox and under-rely on the education, economic opportunity and early intervention toolboxes. As my column notes, the United States incarcerates kids at a rate 10 to 20 times higher than in some other industrialized countries; I should have added that its 100 times the rate of a few countries.

title: Herms: Spring 2015 Menswear
description: Paris

title: 11 Die in India as Buildings Collapse
description: NEW DELHI  Two buildings more than 1,000 miles apart in India collapsed within hours of each other on Saturday, killing 11 people and trapping dozens of others in the rubble.

title: Despite High Unemployment, Portugal Looks Far Afield for Workers
description: ODEMIRA, Portugal  Portugal may have 15 percent unemployment, but that does not mean that Reiter Affiliated Companies, an American fruit producer, can find local people to pick berries on its 76-hectare farm here.

title: As OBannon Trial Ends, N.C.A.A. Portrays Itself as Benevolent Cartel
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  Outside the federal courthouse after the penultimate day of the Ed OBannon trial, an N.C.A.A. lawyer, Greg Curtner, met a few reporters to discuss the days events.

title: A Squad as Intense as Its Enchiladas
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  It is difficult to cook for any crowd, but when that crowd is a couple of dozen lean and lithe professional soccer players who are seeking proper nutrition and recovery-enhancing properties, along with excellent flavor, for three meals a day over several weeks, the challenge becomes more complex.

title: U.S. Mens National Team Breakfast Chicken Enchiladas
description: Time: 1 hour 45 minutes

title: New Fight on an Old Battleground
description: A region of Iraq that the American military called the Triangle of Death is now being fought over by Iraqi forces and militant ISIS fighters.

title: Downright Tricky!
description: SUNDAYS PUZZLE  Downright tricky, indeed. This puzzle by Byron Walden is not that difficult to solve, but have you figured out the theme? Thats the real forehead-slapper in this Sundays cruciverbal adventure.

title: In Home Loans, Subprime Fades as a Dirty Word
description: CALABASAS, Calif.  Martin and Cindy Arroyo knew they were not ideal candidates for a home loan.

title: AMI Alexandre Mattiussi: Spring 2015 Menswear
description: Paris

title: Ahmed Abu Khattala Charged
description: The Justice Department has charged Mr. Abu Khattala with three counts in connection with the attacks on the United States Mission in Benghazi and a nearby C.I.A. facility on Sept. 11, 2012.

title: Creeping Up on Unsuspecting Shores: The Great Lakes, in a Welcome Turnaround
description: EPHRAIM, Wis.  Like a slowly draining bathtub, this sparkling inlet of Lake Michigan had seen its clear, cool waters recede for years.

title: World Cup 2014: James Rodrguez Leads Colombia Over Uruguay
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  His name is James, but he pronounces it Hahm-ez, and that was the way the Colombian fans shouted iton Saturdaynight. They have been singing James Rodrguezs praises all along, in fact, but in the flurry of goals and teams and story lines in this World Cup, there was a chance a few people had not yet noticed Rodrguez. Everyone knows him now.

title: Department of Justice News Release
description: Ahmed Abu Khatallah, made his first appearance today in the U.S. District Court for the District of Columbia on a federal terrorism offense arising from his alleged participation in the September 11-12, 2012, terrorist attacks in Benghazi, Libya.

title: Past Roads End, Democrats Dig for Native Votes
description: NAPASKIAK, Alaska  No roads go this deep into the tundra, especially not for Democrats.

title: Obama to Seek Funds to Stem Border Crossings and Speed Deportations
description: President Obama will ask Congress to provide more than $2 billion in new funds to control the surge of illegal Central American migrants at the South Texas border, and to grant broader powers for immigration officials to speed deportations of children caught crossing without their parents, White House officials said on Saturday.

title: Revelry in Sarajevo, Where Shots Started a World War
description: SARAJEVO, Bosnia and Herzegovina  The Austrian colonel, in the field-green uniform worn for formal occasions, was not amused, and had no hesitation in saying so.

title: A World Cup Juggling Act in the Wimbledon Schedule
description: LONDON  The way the Wimbledon referee Andrew Jarrett remembered it, his conversation with David Nalbandian was quick, funny and to the point.

title: Vows | A Catch of the Hand
description: Both stars of the New York City Ballet, Tiler Peck and Robert Fairchild have been dancing together since they were young.

title: Cup Overflows: You Wont See Joy Like This in the End Zone
description: RECIFE, Brazil  After Pablo Armero of Colombia scored against Greece, he and his teammates broke into a raucous dance routine that evoked the Shout scene from the film Animal House.

title: For Wendy Davis, Filibuster Goes Only So Far in Race to Be Governor of Texas
description: DALLAS  She is in sneakers again.

title: At 40, Austin Rock Club Celebrates Rare Longevity
description: AUSTIN  The band Fastball is best known for The Way, one of its mid-tempo 1998 hits, but this month in Austin, to celebrate the 40th anniversary of the opening of Hole in the Wall, it slammed through several frenzied rock songs from its 1996 debut, Make Your Mama Proud, which the group had not played in 15 years. No wonder we were so skinny back then, the frontman Miles Zuniga joked.

title: Niese Stops Pirates as Mets Get Good News on Wright
description: Before Saturday, the first half of the Mets season had been, in a word, forgettable.

title: In a Surprise, Carlsen Shows Hes a Three-Speed Champ
description: Magnus Carlsen is now the world champion of chess at all speeds.

title: Fund-Raising as a Barometer of a Statewide Campaigns Success
description: It is somewhat crass to talk about money when you are supposed to be talking about good old American democracy, but the list of statewide campaigns that have succeeded without cash is short.

title: Best Insurance for Texas Workers? Dont Get Injured
description: AUSTIN  Almost anywhere in the vast Lone Star State, one can find evidence of the Texas miracle economy that policy makers like Gov. Rick Perry have talked about in their political speeches.

title: Turn One-and-Done Into None-and-Done
description: One of Adam Silvers top priorities since he became the N.B.A. commissioner this year has been to raise the draft eligibility age. The current minimum, 19 or one year removed from high school graduation, was established in the 2005 collective bargaining agreement.

title: Yankees Looking for Additions, Possibly a Pitcher
description: With his team in third place in the American League East before Saturdays game against the Boston Red Sox, Yankees General Manager Brian Cashman said he had been actively engaging with other teams about trade options ahead of the nonwaiver trade deadline July 31.

title: Brooklyn Man, 32, Is Killed in Hit and Run
description: A 32-year-old man died on Saturday after he was hit by a driver who fled the scene in Brooklyn, the police said.

title: World Cup 2014: Netherlands Defeats Mexico, 2-1
description: Mexico took a lead into the 88th minute, but fell behind six minutes later, en route to a defeat and another elimination in the Round of 16.

title: World Cup 2014: Costa Rica Defeats Greece on Penalty Kicks, 1-1
description: The surprising Costa Rican squad scored an upset for Central America over Europe in its Round of 16 clash with Greece, winning the match, 1-1, on penalty shots.

title: Quotation of the Day for Sunday, June 29, 2014
description: Its really hard to describe to people how we live here; we dont even have cement. When I went to school on the East Coast, it was like describing living on the moon.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for June 28, 2014
Opting Out, Dwyane Wade Enables Heat to Increase Roster Flexibility
description: The likelihood that LeBron James, Dwyane Wade and Chris Bosh would stay with the Miami Heat for another run at an N.B.A. title with a retooled roster increased Saturday when Wade informed the team that he, like James earlier in the week, would opt out of his contract.

title: On One Pitch, a Scintillating Outing Turns Sour for Tanaka
description: There is no wrong pitch with Masahiro Tanaka, catcher Brian McCann said. McCann just wanted a different one.

title: Mira Slovak, a Daring Pilot Who Won Freedom, Then Races, Dies at 84
description: Mira Slovak, who as a young airline pilot in 1953 fled Communist Czechoslovakia by hijacking his own commercial flight to West Germany, died on June 16 at his home in Fallbrook, Calif. Mr. Slovak, who went on to become a hydroplane racing champion, a stunt flyer and an airline pilot, was 84.

title: Corrections: June 29, 2014
description: NEW YORK

title: Lester Stymies Jeter to Preserve Red Sox Win
description: All night, Jon Lester felt comfortable throwing his sinker away from hitters, so in the eighth inning Saturday at Yankee Stadium, nothing else mattered. Not the unfavorable count, or the tie score, or the runner on first with no outs, or the success enjoyed against him by the man standing in the batters box, Derek Jeter.

title: North Korea Plans to Indict Two Americans; Defies U.N. by Firing Ballistic Missiles
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea said Monday that it planned to indict and try two Americans it has held on charges of committing hostile acts against the country, just a day after it fired two ballistic missiles off its east coast, flouting a United Nations ban on the countrys testing of such missiles.

title: Todays World Cup Matches: June 29, 2014
description: What to watch for in todays World Cup matches, two elimination games in the knockout phase of the tournament. (Times are Eastern.)

title: 1914: Assassination of the Archduke Francis Ferdinand was a conspiracy
description: VIENNA That the assassination of Archduke Francis Ferdinand, the heir to the thrones of Austria and Hungary, and of the Duchess of Hohenberg, his consort, was the result of a widespread plot, the extent of which the actual actors were perhaps unaware of, now appears to be beyond doubt.In case the attempt on the Archdukes life in Sarajevo failed, other bombs, it is stated, were to have been exploded on the railway as the Royal train was on its return journey from the Bosnian capital. Serious disturbances have taken place in Sarajevo and other towns in Bosnia and Herzegovina. Yesterday, another bomb was thrown at a street corner in Sarajevo by a young man, a Mussulman being wounded by the explosion. Martial law has been proclaimed in the town.The bodies of Archduke Francis Ferdinand and the Duchess of Hohenberg were embalmed during Sunday night, and were removed yesterday by special train to Metkovich, Dalmatia, on their way to Vienna. The funeral will take place on Friday, the interment being in the mausoleum on the Archdukes estate at Artstetten. Emperor Francis Joseph will not be present at this ceremony, but will attend a requiem mass on the following day.A representative of a Prague bank in which Archduke Francis Ferdinands will had been deposited has arrived in Vienna with the document. It is stated that certain questions of State in which the Archduke was interested will be confided by the Emperor to the new heir to the throne.  From The New York Herald, European Edition, June 30, 1914.

title: Hong Kong Poll Turnout Buoys Democracy Activists
description: HONG KONG  An unofficial referendum on making the selection of Hong Kongs chief executive more democratic has attracted votes equal to more than a fifth of the citys electorate, organizers said Sunday, the referendums final day. They voiced hopes that the higher-than-anticipated participation would, along with a protest march scheduled for Tuesday, increase the pressure on the mainland Chinese government to give ground on the issue.

title: Russian Jets and Experts Sent to Iraq to Aid Army
description: BAGHDAD  Iraqi government officials said Sunday that Russian experts had arrived in Iraq to help the army get 12 new Russian warplanes into the fight against Sunni extremists, while the extremists declared their leader the caliph, or absolute ruler, of all jihadi organizations worldwide.

title: The Battle Over Vaccinating Grandparents
description: I dont understand why I need the whooping cough vaccine. Ive raised kids. We have friends whose kids have raised kids. Our nieces and nephews have kids. Why is this the first time were hearing about grandparents getting vaccinated?

title: Lanvin: Spring 2015 Menswear
description: Paris

title: Jason Kidd Is Expected to Leave as Nets Head Coach
description: Jason Kidds tenure as head coach of the Nets appears all but over just one year after it began, leaving the franchise in flux at a particularly crucial moment, with the free-agency market about to open throughout the N.B.A.

title: Central Bankers, Worried About Bubbles, Rebuke Markets
description: FRANKFURT  An organization representing the worlds main central banks warned on Sunday that dangerous new asset bubbles were forming even before the global economy has finished recovering from the last round of financial excess.

title: A Matchup to Recall a 32-Year-Old Injustice
description: PORTO ALEGRE, Brazil  Soccer and fairness are hardly constant companions. Dominate play, create chance after chance, and your team can still lose on a lucky bounce, on a referees judgment call or on the roulette wheel of a shootout.

title: Mexico vs. Netherlands: World Cup 2014 Live Blog
description: The Netherlands scored 10 goals in its first three games, and Robin van Persie and Arjen Robben have looked like world-beaters. Mexico, which barely scraped into the Cup, has restored some national pride with two good wins and a game draw against Brazil.

title: After a Fast Start, a Fading Path Looks to Reinvent Itself, Again
description: In 2012, Dave Morin was a tech industry celebrity.

title: Assisting in Life and Death
description: Saturday was a watershed moment for the American suicide-prevention effort. In response to decades of public advocacy, San Francisco transit authorities unanimously approved a $76 million plan to construct suicide barriers on the Golden Gate Bridge  where 46 people jumped to their death last year alone. The time of healing can only begin when the drip-drip-drip of bodies into the raging waters has stopped, a mother of one jumper toldMichael Cabanatuan of The San Francisco Chronicle.

title: Japanese Protester Sets Himself on Fire at Train Station in Tokyo
description: TOKYO  In a ghastly spectacle of a sort rarely seen in this orderly city, a man set himself on fire in front of horrified crowds at Tokyos busiest train station on Sunday in what appeared to be a lone protest against efforts to weaken Japans antiwar Constitution.

title: Meshach Taylor, an Actor on TVs Designing Women, Dies at 67
description: Meshach Taylor, the actor best known as the friendly colleague of four Southern women on the popular sitcom Designing Women, died on Saturday at his home near Los Angeles. He was 67.

title: Whats On Sunday
description: 10 P.M. (HBO) THE LEFTOVERS Three years after 2 percent of the worlds population suddenly disappeared on Oct. 14, for no discernible reason  Was it an act of God? A natural phenomenon?  the residents of the fictional Mapleton, N.Y., are still searching for answers in this dystopian series created by Tom Perrotta, adapted from his novel, and Damon Lindelof, a mastermind behind ABCs Lost. Churches have closed while cults have formed, including the Guilty Remnant, whose followers wear white, take a vow of silence and chain smoke. One member is Laurie (Amy Brenneman), the mother of Jill (Margaret Qualley), a high schooler, and Tom (Chris Zylka), who has joined another cult led by a man who claims that he can hug the pain out of people. Laurie is also the wife of Kevin Garvey (Justin Theroux, the towns chief of police, above, speaking with Amanda Warren), whose colleagues worry that he may be losing his mind as he tries to maintain order. The show may never explain what happened to the people who disappeared, but the measure of its worth is that it may not have to, Alessandra Stanley wrote in The New York Times. As with any good drama, the mystery lies in human nature more than in the supernatural. Once the show gets going, and it takes more than one episode to do so, The Leftovers bores into the characters and the fissures that crack their community so astutely that the cause is almost secondary.

title: Paris Mens Fashion Week: Lanvin Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the mens fashion week photo diary of Kevin Tachman.

title: Umit Benan: Spring 2015 Menswear
description: Paris

title: Transformers: Age of Extinction Has Big Opening Weekend
description: As expected, Transformers: Age of Extinction was a huge No. 1 at North American theaters over the weekend, taking in an estimated $100 million and prompting Rockette kicks from Paramount Pictures. The movie industrys broader reaction was more muted pending a final box-office tally; Sunday estimates have a way of declining a bit on Monday, when actual grosses are reported and headline writers have moved on.

title: Amid Claims of Fraud, Afghan Presidential Candidate Vows More Deadlock
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  After a potential opening last week to ease Afghanistans political crisis, the presidential candidate Abdullah Abdullah signaled on Sunday that more deadlock was ahead, promising again that he would not accept any decisions made by the countrys election commission after the panel rejected a list of his demands.

title: Thom Browne: Spring 2015 Menswear
description: Paris

title: Costa Rica vs. Greece: World Cup 2014 Live Blog
description: Costa Rica is seen as a joyous, entertaining team that has enchanted crowds by winning the Group of Death over Uruguay, Italy and England. Greece is seen as a dour defensive team that scored just two goals in the group stage and spoiled the Ivory Coasts dream with a marginal last-minute penalty.

title: Paris Mens Fashion Week: Herms Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the mens fashion week photo diary of Valerio Mezzanotti.

title: The Great War Still Echoes
description: To many in the United States and, indeed, around the globe, World War I is a historical afterthought, a foggy precursor to World War II.

title: Dutch Mount Dramatic Rally With Theatrical Fall
description: FORTALEZA, Brazil  Mexicos coach, Miguel Herrera, has become an icon during this World Cup for his impassioned exhortations in front of the team bench. Herrera has stomped and stamped, whirled and whipped, flailed and frothed over everything from referee decisions to near misses to, most notably, goals scored by his players.

title: Paris Mens Fashion Week: Paul Smith Spring/Summer 2015
description: Scenes from the mens fashion week photo diary of Barbara Anastacio.

title: Russia and Others Confer on Halting Ukraine Fighting, Which Goes on Despite Cease-Fire
description: MOSCOW  The leaders of Russia, Ukraine, Germany and France spoke by telephone on Sunday about how to stop the fighting in eastern Ukraine, which has continued despite a cease-fire called by the government that insurgent leaders said they would join.

title: Pick for V.A. Is Former Corporate Chief
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama on Monday intends to nominate Robert A. McDonald, a former chief executive of Procter & Gamble, to be the next secretary of Veterans Affairs, a White House official said Sunday, betting that a global corporate officer can turn around a government health system that has been rocked by allegations of mismanagement and cover-ups of long patient waiting times.

title: Saint Laurent: Spring 2015 Menswear
description: Paris

title: Parking Dance in New York City
description: Every day, drivers across New York double-park their cars as street sweepers pass by, a practice known as alternate-side parking. A new bill before the City Council could change the dance.

title: New York Council Bill Aims to Ease a Parking Burden
description: It is the New York City drivers public shame  a sentence of solitary front-seat confinement levied against those for whom subways, buses and taxis are insufficient.

title: With This Video Camera, I Thee Shoot
description: Ever wonder whats running through the mind of the person shooting your wedding video as he eats your hors doeuvres and walks backward down the aisle? If you hired Doug Block, theres no need to wonder. Hes thinking, You know what, this would make a pretty good documentary!

title: Mets Are Hurt, for a Day, by a Trade Thats Working for 2 Teams
description: PITTSBURGH  Two months had passed since the Mets had traded Ike Davis, and the drama was gone. The team and the player had moved on; both seemed content. They had history  injuries, trade rumors, a competition with Lucas Duda, all of which had seemed so serious at the time  but time had smoothed the rough edges.

title: After Supreme Court Ruling, Aereos Rivals in TV Streaming Seize Opening
description: Mark Ely saw an opportunity, and he took it.

title: Where Passion Rules, Morality Stands Little Chance
description: PARIS  Nero and Poppea never touch in Robert Wilsons new production of Monteverdis LIncoronazione di Poppea for the Paris Opera, which ends its run at the Palais Garnier on Monday. Their love affair, which drives anyone who gets in its way to death or exile, is one of the most violent portrayed in opera. Yet even during their final, rapturous duet, Pur ti miro, on Saturday, the tenor Jeremy Ovenden and the mezzo-soprano Karine Deshayes maintained a sliver of space between their outstretched hands.

title: On the Legal Front Lines of Same-Sex Marriage
description: For more than four years a group of prominent lawyers led by Theodore B. Olson and David Boies, along with political consultants and Hollywood celebrities, campaigned against Proposition 8, the ban on same-sex marriages approved by California voters in 2008. The group, the American Foundation for Equal Rights, had two primary goals: to secure a judicial victory in the Supreme Court extending marriage to gay couples nationwide and to increase support for the cause through a public-relations blitz.

title: Ooh, a Maypole! And Love Interests, With Feathers
description: Siegfried, the prince in Swan Lake, spends a lot of time surrounded by women who dont seem to interest him. In American Ballet Theaters production, he invariably appears more excited by the arrival of a maypole at his birthday party (Act I) than by the young ladies lining up to dance with him. In Act III, when princesses of the world parade through his court, enticing him with their national dances  Hungarian, Spanish, Italian, Polish  he wants none of them for his bride. No, he mimes to the Queen Mother, who has urged him to choose one, causing a flurry of disbelief among his courtiers.

title: Despite Legal Challenges, Sale of Hopi Religious Artifacts Continues in France
description: The thought of Americans lecturing the French about cultural sensibilities seems like a hard sell in a country still shielding its language from idiomatic blasphemies like le weekend and hashtag. But the United States Embassy in Paris spent several days last week educating French officials about the strong emotions that have led Native American tribes like the Hopi and Navajo to sue Parisian auction houses  unsuccessfully, time and again  over the sale of sacred objects.

title: One Who Plays For Pay
description: MONDAYS PUZZLE  Happy Monday, everyone! Its a vowel run.

title: Gilbert & Sullivan Announces Season
description: A witchs curse, embattled lovers and a gondolier with royal blood will be part of the 2014-15 lineup for the New York Gilbert & Sullivan Players, the organizers have announced. The season, which will take place at New York Universitys Skirball Center for the Performing Arts, is to begin on Oct. 12 with a benefit gala celebrating the groups 40th anniversary. That will be followed on Nov. 1 and 2 by Ruddigore, in which the Baronet of Ruddigore tries to escape a curse that forces him to commit a daily crime. H.M.S. Pinafore, Dec. 26-31, tells the comedic story of a lowly sailors plan to elope with the captains daughter before finding out that he isnt as lowly as everyone  including himself  thinks he is. The theme of mistaken identity continues with the seasons final production, The Gondoliers, May 15-17. More information is at nygasp.org.

title: 1939: First Woman Elected Mayor of Dublin
description: DUBLIN  The first woman Lord Mayor of Dublin in history was elected last night. She was Mrs. Tom Clarkes, widow of Fenian leader executed after the 1916 Easter uprising, who herself has been an active Nationalist. The decisive vote which put her into office was cast by the outgoing Lord Mayor, Alderman Alfred Byrne, whom she has previously tried to oust from office on six different occasions. Byrne had been Lord Mayor for nine years.  From The New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, June 30, 1939.

title: Remembering World War I in the Conflicts Flash Point
description: SARAJEVO, Bosnia and Herzegovina  If there was a moment that captured better than any other the light and the dark in Sarajevos centenary weekend, marking 100 years since the events here that unleashed the demons of World War I, it came with the opening bars of Beethovens Ode to Joy.

title: All Jooked Up With Everywhere to Go
description: MEMPHIS  Breakthroughs in an art form happen rarely. Yet on Saturday night in this city, at an event advertised as launching the World Jookin Federation, breakthroughs seemed to keep happening all evening long.

title: Hot Spots, Anyone? Racy Preferred
description: The website is called Vice News, so its fair to expect racy images in a film titled Posing as a Prostitute in a Turkish Brothel: Correspondent Confidential.

title: Boxed In, With Room for Creativity
description: For the first show he conceived as director of the Museum of Arts and Design, Glenn Adamson is thinking inside the box.

title: England Beats Poland at European Championships
description: The European Championships are continuing in Opatija, Croatia. Teams are vying for medals and to qualify for next years world championships: the Bermuda Bowl, Venice Cup and dOrsi Senior Bowl.

title: News Corp. Slowly Putting Phone-Hacking Scandal Behind It
description: Less than three years ago, a phone-hacking scandal at Rupert Murdochs British newspapers was seen by some as the beginning of the end of his media empire.

title: Little Lambs: A Pastoral
description: The local butchers own a farm near the English village where I live and staged a lambing event there this spring. They put up a plywood sign cut in the shape of a curly-fleeced lamb on the lane that ran past their drive, which promised fun for all ages and a taste of the countryside. I saw it on the way home from work and decided to take my 4-year-old daughter, Rosy, along as a treat on the weekend. Rosy loves animals and the chance of letting her get close to some of the stars of her nursery rhymes was unmissable.

title: Blame War, Not Safaris
description: Safari hunting strikes many people as distasteful in the best of times, and during a conflict, as morally outrageous. The Central African Republic is at war again, and two loose-knit coalitions  one mostly Muslim, the other mostly Christian  are massacring each other. Yet the trophy hunting goes on. A few intrepid foreigners are traveling to the eastern parts of the republic to kill Lord Derby Eland, the largest antelope in Africa, and its shy forest cousin, the bongo.

title: Japans Foundering Finances
description: The Abe administration is still waiting for its economic reforms to take off.

title: Why Not Just Weigh the Fish?
description: Morale these days has fallen pretty low along the corridors of philosophy departments. From one side, we get the mockery of the scientists. Freeman Dyson calls philosophy today a toothless relic of past glories. According to Neil deGrasse Tyson, majoring in philosophy can really mess you up. Stephen Hawking declares that philosophy is dead. From another side, we have to cope with the apostasy of our own leading figures. John Searle describes the field as being in terrible shape. Peter Unger says that philosophers are under the impression that theyre saying something new and interesting about how it is about the world, when in fact this is all an illusion. Whats going on? Has philosophy gone horribly amiss? Or are there broader cultural factors at work, perhaps something to do with a general decline in respect for the humanities?

title: New NPR Chief, Jarl Mohn, Vows to Foster Diversity
description: When Jarl Mohn takes the helm as NPRs chief executive on Tuesday, he will call on lessons learned from public radio in Los Angeles to address what he says is one of NPRs most pressing priorities: increasing its reach into communities of color.

title: Let Them Eat Cash
description: A CHINESE millionaire tried to give $300 (and lunch) to homeless men and women in New York last week. This didnt sit well with the nonprofit New York City Rescue Mission. The Rescue Missionoffered to help with lunch, but wouldnt cooperate in handing out cash. So midway through a meal of sesame-crusted tuna and filet of beef, some 200 homeless people discovered that they would not be getting money. Instead, the Rescue Mission would accept $90,000 on their behalf. You can imagine the anger and humiliation.

title: Anthrax? Thats Not the Real Worry
description: OFFICIALS at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention recently discovered that at least 75 workers there had been exposed to possible anthrax infection.

title: Rubble in India Is Combed, and Builders Arrested
description: NEW DELHI  Rescuers digging through the rubble of a 12-story building that collapsed on Saturday in heavy rains in the southern city of Chennai had by Sunday evening recovered the bodies of 11 people and rescued 21 survivors, with possibly many more people still trapped under the rubble, officials said.

title: Admissions Criteria at Top City Schools
description: To the Editor:

title: A Rising Toll of Forest Fires: Will Congress Act?
description: To the Editor:

title: Bar the Unvaccinated
description: To the Editor:

title: My Daughter, My Teacher
description: To the Editor:

title: Baltimores Unfair Curfew
description: To the Editor:

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of June 30
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Bruised Captain Inspires Belgians
description: MOGI DAS CRUZES, Brazil  Vincent Kompany, Belgiums captain, jumped to head a corner kick during a World Cup qualifying match against Serbia last June. He hoped to land with a goal. Instead, he fell to the ground with a bloodied face, a broken nose, a fractured eye socket and a concussion.

title: The Water Crisis in the West
Tribune Company Hopes to Turn WGN America Into Cable Network
description: Every cable TV network needs one thing to thrust itself into the consciousness of viewers: a signature show that attracts ratings and passionate advocates.

title: Awakening the Dutch Gene of Water Survival
description: NOORDWIJK, the Netherlands  Along a rugged, wide North Sea beach here on a recent day, children formed teams of eight to 10, taking their places beside mounds of sand carefully cordoned by candy-cane striped tape. They had one hour for their sand castle competition. Some built fishlike structures, complete with scales. Others spent their time on elaborate ditch and dike labyrinths. Each castle was adorned on top with a white flag.

title: For Women, a Bigger Share of the Brightest Stages at Wimbledon
description: WIMBLEDON, England  Lindsay Davenport has been coming to Wimbledon, the worlds most prestigious tennis championship, for more than 20 years, but she had never seen anything quite like the second day of this years tournament.

title: Long List of Contenders After Serena Williamss Defeat
description: WIMBLEDON, England  Three times this year, Serena Williams has arrived at a Grand Slam event as the top seed and heavy favorite, and three times she has lost before the business end of the tournament.

title: For Email Newsletters, a Death Greatly Exaggerated
description: Here at the Media Equation, we pride ourselves on keeping our readers abreast of the newest technologies and approaches in reaching audiences. So it gives us great pleasure to reveal a radical publishing technology that is catching on in news media companies big and small. Ladies and gentlemen, behold: email.

title: Newsletters You Might Actually Be Happy to Find in Your Inbox
description: Like most people, Im careful about handing my email address to anyone, much less somebody who promises to send me messages every working day. But because they sit in my inbox and can be opened (or ignored) at a time of my choosing, Ive found newsletters keep me in the know about specific topics  which in my case includes media comings and goings. Here are a few newsletters that I follow and others that I hear great things about.

title: Verizon to Return to Its Former Midtown Tower, but on a Smaller Scale
description: When New York Telephone first moved into its headquarters near Times Square, the company was a monolith that controlled virtually all telecommunications in New York City through a network of wires that snaked into nearly every building. The equipment that connected all those phone lines filled half of the headquarters tower and dozens of other buildings scattered throughout the city.

title: Kidds Power Play Is Bold, if Not Out of Character
description: The lead-in to free agency tends to be a tumultuous time in the N.B.A. Players are weighing their options. Front offices are deciding whom to retain and recruit. Through it all, however, each coach usually has a sense of his teams direction amid the long off-season.

title: With Two Victories as a Rookie, the Son of a Nascar Great Roars on His Own
description: MOORESVILLE, N.C.  The next great Nascar driver has the deep Southern twang of a country singer, a poise that belies his age and a name that was born for this sport.

title: Live in Levis Campaign Reunites Levi Strauss With Its Old Agency, FCB
description: WHEN the duo Peaches and Herb, known as the sweethearts of soul, got back together, they sang, Reunited and it feels so good. Now, an apparel brand reuniting after 16 years with an agency that was its soul mate for almost seven decades is declaring that its clothing feels good enough to live in.

title: Math Under Common Core Has Even Parents Stumbling
description: GREENWELL SPRINGS, La.  Rebekah and Kevin Nelams moved to their modest brick home in this suburb of Baton Rouge seven years ago because it has one of the top-performing public school districts in the state. But starting this fall, Ms. Nelams plans to home-school the couples four elementary-age children.

title: News From the Advertising Industry
description: Accounts

title: Charlatans, Cranks and Kansas
description: Two years ago Kansas embarked on a remarkable fiscal experiment: It sharply slashed income taxes without any clear idea of what would replace the lost revenue. Sam Brownback, the governor, proposed the legislation  in percentage terms, the largest tax cut in one year any state has ever enacted  in close consultation with the economist Arthur Laffer. And Mr. Brownback predicted that the cuts would jump-start an economic boom  Look out, Texas, he proclaimed.

title: A Disregarded Request From a Beloved Senator Shakes Up Hawaiis Primary
description: WAIANAE, Hawaii  For over 50 years, Senator Daniel K. Inouye, a Democrat, was the closest thing modern-day Hawaii had to political royalty: He began representing the state in Washington two years before its most famous citizen was even born. As he lay dying in 2012, Mr. Inouye asked the governor, Neil Abercrombie, to appoint Representative Colleen Hanabusa, a protge and the daughter of a gas station owner here, to fill his seat.

title: Online Museum for Springsteen
description: An online museum displaying more than 300 pieces of Bruce Springsteen memorabilia is to officially open its figurative doors on Monday. The virtual museum, blindedbythelight.com, is the product of five years of planning, eight years of amassing a collection of thousands of items and more than three decades of adoration for the Boss by the sites founder, Michael Crane. Plans are to add 30 to 50 items a month to the site, where they will tell a story that fans might not otherwise see, Mr. Crane said by phone on Sunday from Israel. For a Bruce fan, this gives you insight into your hero and the way he grew up, he said. Among the items is an eighth-grade report card, above right, featuring mostly low grades, including Ds in composition, physical education and music. The young Springsteen didnt have a great time in Catholic school, Mr. Crane said. He wasnt allowed to be who he wanted to be and to express himself. Mr. Crane said his favorite item is a photo of Mr. Springsteen and his father on a 1972 visit to Mexico. Bruce has described their relationship as tumultuous, Mr. Crane said, so its cool to see Bruce as just a kid laughing with his dad. Admission is $9.99, which allows a month of access to the site, the ability to download a font that replicates Mr. Springsteens handwriting style, the use of a ticket and memorabilia exchange, and entry to a monthly raffle. Mr. Springsteen has no formal involvement with the site.

title: House Hypocrisy on Insider Trading
description: It was quite the ballyhooed reform of Capitol Hill ethics  an explicit ban on insider trading by members of Congress and their aides enacted two years ago in a bipartisan wave of approval by the Senate and House.

title: Medical Boards Draft Plan to Ease Path to Out-of-State and Online Treatment
